reviews.review: My first real look at the Seine.. Wandered this way from The Invalides. My first trip to Paris. This was my first real look at the Seine River. Very scenic.
Pont Alexandre III. A architecturally beautiful bridge most appreciated by going under it in a boat. Walking past it does not capture it's beauty.
A lovely walk!. We walked along Pont Alexandre III - it was so nice. Again, we lucked out with the weather, it was fantastic!!

Stroll across this bridge at night!. This was, by far, our most favorite bridge on our recent trip to Paris. It's simply beautiful during the day, but really comes alive at night when the lights come on!
Great place for a romantic walk with your special someone!

How couldn't I say something about this bridge.... This bridge which is a gift from czar Alexander to France is certainly the most beautiful in Paris . The bridge by itself, the view from the bridge to the rest of the city along the river, the perspective with Grand palais/ Champs Elysées and the invalide with its golden coupole...Even history joining beautiful Russian bridge to grave of Napoleon ...The return bridge from France to Russia in Saint Petersburg is by far not as much as beautiful ... to be fair Neva is far larger than Seine
Take a bridge, any bridge over the Seine. Wandering the bridges of central Paris, on and off the islands, could be the focus of a well spent week.

Impressive Bridge!. Noted as the most beautiful bridge in Paris. This bridge has a long sight line from the Musee L'Armee to the Grand Palais and Petit Palace. Built in 1900 for the Universal Exhibit, this bridge had four large golden topped entrances at both sides of the Seine river. Fascinating Art Nouveau sculptures along the whole bridge span.

Beautiful. . Best with an understanding of the history though. Read Wikipedia while standing on it :)I recommend going at sunset for an incredible view of the Eiffel Tower. I walked from the tower to the bridge at this time and it was amazing. Watch out for pickpockets though - saw one tourist crying after realising she was targetted.
Great!. The bridge is stunning! The architecture is amazing really. Nice view and we made great pictures. Definitely a good spot for sightseeing. We also had a nice sunny day. Was really nice.
Nice little bridge. Attractive bridge to walk or see by the Seine in a boat [great little ride] for some great photos. the road leads up to the Army museum /Napoleons tomb

A beautiful bridge more beautiful during night. If one travels river Seine during night one has to appreciate the marvelous bridges of Paris. They are too beautiful and during night the lights add more beauty to them.

This location is fantastic and lovely to look at.... A trip over this bridge is a must factor on your was to the Eiffel tower. I stumbled upon it while leaving the corridor and wow...Very cool..Lots of towering gold statues and beauty in the Victorian style (or earlier) design. Just in awe at the size of the candle ob era's done with angels and they stand out with a contrast of gold and black... So much to see here...
Wonderful. We saw this by boat several times. It is wonderfully ornate with sculpture and lamps along the course.

Beautiful!!!. Take a picture by sunset with the Eifel tower on the background. It is a memory for life. The bridge is the most beautiful one we ever saw and we always go there before we leaving Paris. This is a nice spot to take a romantic picture.
Majestic. Historical bridge with majestic architecture and magnificent view of the river Seine and the surroundings.

Beautiful walk . A lovely romantic stroll over the bridge is well worth it. Listen to the locals singing and playing instruments and take in the wonderful view across the river. Really worth the visit
Great place to spot Eiffel Tower!. If you feel like Adelle in one of her video clip maybe you shouldtry to shoot video from this bridge. It also has a nice spot to take a pic of Eiffel Tower!
Great Walk. A great stroll along the Seine. This walk is beautiful and the bridge is impressive. It's a great walk from Notre Dame down the river.

Great for a walk to explore Paris. A good way to experience the local feel and culture of Paris and to see some of the beautiful architecure. Look below at the river Seine and you will see Parisienne life especially aound dusk.
Prelepo. Prelep most, možda i najlepši na Seni. Obavezno posetite. Beautiful Bridge. Maybe the most beautiful on river Seine. Be sure to visit.

Wonderful area. This is a wonderful area with a good atmosphere. I recently had a meal by the bridge along the river. It happen to be sleepless in Paris night so I was in this area all night. Sleepless in Paris in celebrated each year on the first Saturday in October.......I can recommend it.

Magnificent bridge. The bridge is massive. It is probably one of nicest bridges that I have seen in Paris. It is also near Les invalides and Champs - Elysees so it is on the popular tourist route. Worth seeing.

Part of what makes Paris feel like Paris. Everywhere one turns in (historic) Paris you are taken by how everything was constructed with Disney-like attention to detail. A building is more than just a building. A church more than just a church. A park more than a park. In this case, a bridge more than just a bridge. Knowing the history particular to any building, church, park or bridge is always helpful, but seldom necessary. They are each works of art unto themselves, speaking of the artistry of an era gone bye, but present in their labors.

Very Romantic place. Must visit place.You must take a walking tour or walk at your own if you want to experience the beauty of this bridge.Now I don't remember the history of this Bridge but it's amazing.Illuminious tour in Paris is highly recommended.Regards ,Sunil
A really lovely bridge in great location. It has great architecture .. central location and great views of the river and other historic buildings.

A Must Do. Pont Alexandre is one of the most ornate bridges across the Seine river in Paris. The details on this bridge are beautiful to admire, and the sight lines as you look both ways across the bridge are incredible.

Lovely. Beautiful bridge with lovely views of the seine. The bridge its self is a work of art. Definitely cant be missed, but really no matter where you go in paris you will eventually drive by or see this gorgeous site.

Very nice . Have to say we where amazed by the detail of workmanship on all the figures on this bridge. We where really taken back and we are not into art and craft. Underneath the bridge it's a little dirty. The whole construction is a masterpiece.
Spectacular Bridge. Go here at night as this is magical. Also impressive during the day. Walking back and forth over the Seine on this Brodie gives you a true picture of the beauty of Paris

A Beautiful City Bridge for Pictures. This spot in Paris may well be overlooked. As a tourist it is a beautiful bridge worth walking over since it provides pictures with the Eiffel Tower as a background as well as other worthwhile views of Paris. Easy to get to from numerous Metro or bus stops.
glorious site at night. Worth the walk, essential Paris! Not too busy and the view is worthy of photos, memory making. Go for it!

A must see in Paris. This bridge is one of the more ornate bridges in Paris. It is beautiful and a must see. You will cross this bridge if heading to the Petite Palace or Grand Palace from the other side of the river. There is always a lot of traffic on this bridge. If riding a bike, I suggest using the sidewalks!
Beautiful. Beautiful bridge to just wait and ponder. The architecture is just stunning. Great on a warm day....
Lovely architecture. Amazing architure, lovely looking bridge over the Seine near the Palais de Congress. Great views from the middle of the bridge, well worth seeing during a stroll along the Seine.
Very beautiful. Its a very beautiful bridge. Take the stunning walk from Alexander bridge to La Louvre. I took a bicycle ride till the bridge and started walk from there.

Ornate, opulent, elegant; an 'eye-candy' bridge of historical significance. This glorious work of 19th century visionary architects, skilled engineers and gifted 'Art Nouveau' sculptors, bridges the Left Bank 7th Arrondissement with the Right Bank 8th Arrondisement in stunning elegance. Embellished with gleaming gold, bronze and copper statues of nymphs, cherubs, winged horses and angels with ornate candelabras and vintage lamps running along the parapet of the bridge, we have before us a beautiful 'eye-candy' ensemble. It is named after Alexander the 3rd, Emperor of Russia, to honor the 1894 Franco-Russian alliance and has been classified as an historical monument since 1975. Two sets of large Nymph reliefs at the centres of the bridge arches overlooking the Seine serve as memorials to this alliance - "Nymphs of the Seine" has a relief of the arms of France, while the "Nymphs of the Neva" bears the arms of Imperial Russia. I would recommend every first-time visitor to Paris to add this to their 'must see' list. The bridge not only straddles the beautiful River Seine but is a magical focal point with views of the Esplanade des Invalides and the recognizable golden Dôme des Invalides in the 7th Arrondissement, and the Grand Palais and Petit Palais in the 8th Arrondisement leading on to Avenue des Champs-Elysees. If I get the chance to visit Paris again, I will try to book a hotel within walking distance of Pont Alexandre III so that I can have more leisurely time to enjoy it along with the Seine on a sunny day and at night as well. It is truly a romantic spot too with dreamy-eyed young nymphs and cute cherubs!
THE BRIDGE. The most beautiful and elegant bridge in Paris and maybe in the world. Statuary and gold leaf suggests an earlier age. Stunning at night.

Beautiful bridge capped with amazing gold works of art. This bridge in itself is a work of art, however the 4 gold sculptures that cap the columns at the 4 points are magnificent. What is really nice about this bridge is that in pictures you are sometimes able to get the Eiffel Tower in the background.

Nice bridge with history and lots of ornate touches. This attractive bridge was a gift from Russia to France in the early 1900's and crosses the river in one span. It has some ornate features, including statues at each 'corner' of the bridge. It was nice to cross the bridge slowly and enjoy the sites both along the shore, as well as along the river.

Good Photostop. You can actually visit the Alexander bridge but you will get lot of photo ops during the city tour and the Seine river cruise. Do take lots of pictures though as it definitely needs to be captured in your camera.
One of Paris' landmarks. The most beautiful bridge in the world with compelling views in all directions and perfect for that "Look at me I'm in Paris" pic!
Amazing bridge. The detail is incredible. You must see this--really can’t miss it as it is in the center of all the action. See it from the river on a cruise also while there.
Attractive bridge. Leads over to the Champs Elysee. Nice wide pavements for you to stop and enjoy the views without holding up other people

Nice bridge - worth seeing if you are in the area.. We didn't go to see the bridge especially - we were wondering by on foot and on boat and saw it. It is very ornate and beautiful. The pillars at either end are huge. Definitely worth seeing. There are lots of places to walk near by so just include this in your path!

Impressive even from below. We walked over several bridges during our stay, but this visit we saw from a bus and from below on our river cruise. The detail and beauty sets it apart from the other bridges. I can see why it is a favorite.

Tres Incroiable.. The bridge is the symbol of the relationship between Russia and France. It has large statuary covered in gold leaf that glisten when the sun hits them and beautifully ornate lanterns that bathe the entire bridge in a warm golden glow at night. The bridge is the backdrop for just about every movie scene set in Paris, because you'd be hard pressed NOT to want it as your backdrop for...everything if you could. If you're planning on proposing to the girl of your dreams THIS is the spot.

Lovely to Look At. This is the prettiest bridge in Paris. It has several restuarants and bars on the riverwalk and is a good place to hang out and have cheese and wine and watch the boats cruising on the river; or just to soak up some sun.
Beautiful Bridge. The bridge is magnificent, and very impressive. The view from the bridge is also amazing: Eiffel tower can be seen in the distance, great view of Seine river as well.

Crossed this bridge multiple times every day and was awestruck each time. This bridge is beautiful at all times of day. It was the first thing I saw when I walked out of my hotel the first morning in Paris. I realized I was actually "here". It's a great demonstration of Parisian architecture and you'll see locals and tourists alike at all hours of the day. Wildly romantic at dusk. Bonus: If you want to actually feel blissfully alive, awestruck and experience the ecstasy of the present moment, here are your instructions: 1) Go to the grocery store with your travel companion(s), stock up on wine, cheese, fruit, croissants, snacks, etc. 2) Grab a blanket then head over to the banks of the River Seine next to the Pont Alexandre bridge to watch the sunset and the world go by 3) Take lots of photos 4) Pinch yourself that this is actually happening and this is indeed your life experience right now

Glittering Landmark. This bridge is a gem among all the other bridges. Walk across the bridge by day to catch the sun lighting up the columns on each end. Then take a walk along the Seine River at night to see the lights on the bridge. It is truly unforgettable.

Beautiful bridge comemorating french & russian conection . A bridge of friendship we was told and most beautiful after a weekend of many ups and downs this was a beautiful site to see and a most splendid bridge so happy to give top marks here especialy with the design and nice statues
The Goldy Bridge. It was really beautiful to walk on such beautiful bridge , nice historic place that you shouldn't miss if you are in pairs.

Scenic From Every Angle. Freshly painted. Very golden. Richly embellished with statures & sculptures. River Seine flowing right underneath; tourist boats passing through its arch. Tour Eiffel in near sight. No matter where you stand, the view is great on and around this bridge.Take a detour from the Champs-elysee. It’s just 3 min from the Petit Palais. After that, you can continue the stroll along the riverbank to see the Obelisk and the fountain at Place de la Concorde (~10 min). Further on through the relaxing Jardin des Tuilleries is Louvre. I may not have gone there just for this bridge alone but it’s a great stop in my afternoon walk.

Magnificent bridge.. Historic Sites: Often considered Paris's most beautiful bridge, Pont Alexandre III was built in 1900 for the Universal Exhibition. It links the 7th and 8th arrondissements across the Seine, and its graceful arch bears the arms of both Russia and France.

beautiful in the Spring time. paris is such a wonderful city and the vast majority of Parisians are friendly and helpful. the Pont Alexander is a worthwhile list as are the shops and streets that surround the area.

Pure gold. Small bridge in historical area... You can see while passing in city tour bus or take a stopover for taking pictures... Guess the statue made of gold... No entertainment but just good for taking few clicks...

The most beautiful bridge in Paris!. Newly refreshed with gold over the last few years the bridge is certainly the finest and most ornate that I've seen in Paris. Also a great place to gaze onto the Seine.
Magnificent. I almost had a mini heart attack when saw the view especially when looking at the same time at the military museum an Napoleon tomb.
Beautiful bridge. We took many photos on this bridge that crosses the Seine. There are lots of Gold colored statues and trim on the bridge.

A Grandeur Bridge. As most of the city's architecture styles, this bridge was built in an impressive style. Very grand. With rich details and ornaments. It's recommended if you visit with walking by the bridge on the way to the Grand Palais. You can see some tourists boat sailing under the bridge.
Nice brdige. A beautiful bridge you can be there and have it with a view of eiffel tiwer in your photo.is a place that you can walk from army museum to reach there.
beautiful bridge with nice statues. this very refreshing sight with river bridge , nice statues on both sides, great buildings, nice flower plants etc
Freshly restored/painted. We were in Paris last October when they were working on painting the bridge sculptures. they seem to be all finished now and the bridge is more stunning then ever!
Impressive. I believe this is one of the nicest bridges in Paris. Not my favorite but definitely on the top of my list.

Nicest Bridge in Paris. Very nice bridge to walk across, and worth the time. As well, a nice little bistro along the Seine river directly below. Great for photo taking or people watching. If you're going to walk across any bridge in Paris, let it be this one!
The view!. Loved this view from our dinner cruise. You just cant beat seeing this as your cruising by. Loved the look!

Very beautiful Bridge. This is one off the most beautiful bridge in Paris.
river side walk is very nice, if you are going with your partner, Please don't take taxi, bus etc. just walk to the river side, you are going to enjoy.

A legjobban túlértékelt híd Párizsban - The most overhype bridge in Paris. Véleményem szerint Párizs történelmi képébe egyáltalán nem illik ilyen túldíszített híd. Mindenhol azt hallottunk, hogy Párizs legszebb hídja, viszont szerintünk a legrondább.
In our opinion It is not fit to Paris historical image with this flaming appearance. Everybody says It is the most beautiful bridge of Paris, but we believe It is the ugliest.

More than a bridge.. Of course the bridge does what a bridge is supposed to do: connect two river banks and allow you safe passage from one bank to the other. But this is one of the most ornamented bridges in the world. And it gives you a beautiful view over the Seine and a chance to look at the dinners the poor tourists who booked one one of those dinner cruises get (stay away from those!). The bridge also figures in many movies - one of them Ronin (with Robert de Niro). The criminals meet under the bridge, probably to make sure their illegal actions can be seen by as many tourists as possible.

A most beautiful bridge.... What's to say? It's a bridge over the river Seine But it really is the most spectacular looking one. It has an elegance the others lack with its ornate lights. It almost demands that you take time and Stroll across it. The film industry loves shooting scenes on it. Pont Alexandre is definitely for couples!
Lovely bridge . Beautiful bridge with the golden sculptures on top. Excellent views of the Eiffel Tower and river. It's near the Louvre and Plais de la Concorde
Beautiful bridge!. What a very beautiful and ornately designed bridge. This was also the bridge I was standing on when I first saw the Eiffel Tower.
Best view area. The bridge area was so good were there was the nice view of the river and near for the eiffel tower to have nice pics.
The most ornate of bridges. The Seine can be crossed using many bridges (ponts) but this one is the most magnificent of them all. Two imposing sculptures at each end usher you in and out.

Pretty view of the Seine. This bridge offers a great view of the seine, and one can spend hours (unless you get tired of standing) gazing at the view of the Eiffel Tower. It isn't inundated with tourists which is great, yet it is still one of the most beautiful landmarks in Paris.

The Movie Bridge . This is one for the chicks wanting a romantic stroll across at night. My better half had this as a must do & it also happened to be drizzling rain at time to make it even more romantic. It's a lovely bridge lit up at night & you can get some great photos with the Eiffel Tower all lit up in the background as well. Just do it
A true Yorkshire review. We hired bicycles for the day and both cycled passed then returned to take photos and walk across. Very ornate and impressive

Best shady place to sit after lunch! (or hide on a rainy day). We've been going for years, but stumbled across this on a hot August afternoon..there are shallow steps going down to the river, people just sat under the shade of the bridge on the left bank (south) reading, chatting, drinking and watching the world, people, boats and Paris flowing past. The bridge itself is might fine and the views splendid. I sat and sketched this for a couple of hours ... lots of nearby facilities nearby toilets / drinks eats etc.
beautiful design bridge. ornate lamps and sculptures adorn the span of the bridge. enjoy walking by day or night and view the splendor of Pont Alexandre III in all it's glory.
Very cool ornate bridge. Very cool ornate bridge with cool picture opportunities. There were always a few couples here is wedding garb getting pictures taken in the afternoon.

Stunning Parisian Bridge!. The Parisian bridges that span the Seine River have varied architecture and appeal. The Pont Alexandre III is the most ornate and noteworthy. The bridge connects the Champs-Elysees quarter of Paris to the Eiffel Tower area. Four gilt bronzed statues of 'Fames' perch on tall pedestals on each end of the bridge. Many other sculptures are also featured prominently on the bridge. It is especially beautiful when lit up at night. The extravagant Pont Alexandre III is a Parisian treasure and not to be missed when on holiday!
The later the better.. Located on a stationary boat on the Seine. This was a perfect place to feel the city. The food was good. The staff was friendly.

Dream come true . I've seen this bridge in many a movie and now to have seen it myself and to have walked it, was a dream come true. It's the most stunning of all the bridges - a must see of an evening!
Amazing!. beautiful bridge, we walked it, drove over it on the hop on hop off bus, sailed under it fab ! great history too, get a guide book!

Bridges of Paris. Just one of the many beautiful bridges across the Seine, all leading to somewhere marvellous to see. Great views upstream and downstream, to the Right Bank or Left Bank, decisions, decisions! The Pont Alexandre is very ornate and worth a visit
Wow. The movies, videos and pictures do the physical bridge no justice. It's a work of art itself. The bridge is stunning, a must see in Paris.
Worth a look. Such a special and ornate bridge. I found myself taking heaps of photo's due to the amazing detail. Awesome
Beautiful . This is such a magnificent place, great views of Paris and just amazing things to look at and to take pictures of.
Possibly the most impressing bridge in Paris. Crossing the Seine River and leading to the Invalides , this bridge built in honor of the Tsar Alexander III is a magnificent work of art!
its a bridge. Its a bridge, a pretty one with history but its a bridge. You're going to pass over it a bunch of times.

The most beautifull bridge in Paris. Absolutely gorgeous, great views and nice floating restaurants to grab a bite nearby, the most " luxurious " bridge off all the ones that go accross the river Seine in Paris.

A beautiful location . I cannot remember ever taking more photographs of a bridge before. The stone work is stunning you must see it both in daylight and at night. It is a very romantic place. A lovely place to stand and watch the world go by.

beautiful. by far thee most beautiful bridge in the whole city, right down the to finest detail its just amazing. the photos that you can take from this bridge are just amazing, the only annoying this is the traffic is abit hectic and the constant pursue of men trying to sell you glow in the dark eiffel towers is annoying.

Beautiful bridge exactly in front of Invalides. This is one of the most beautiful bridges across Sena river, connecting Invalides with Champ Elysees.
It has magnificent statues and allegorical designs.
It is also ideal to have a look at Ile de la Cite and start a walk towards Louvre and Notre Dame.
Timeless beauty. I walk this bridge every time I'm in Paris. It never changes, it's a classic! A must see from a river cruise!

Nice!!!!!!!. A good promenade from the Grand Palais to the Army museum/ invalides. Enjoy the statues, the view, the river, the atmosphere of Paris. Take your time! Have a drink from the nearby bars and kantines. Just a small Must that you will remember for a long time. :)
Beautiful!. Walk over it. Walk near it. It's beautiful! The boats travel under it so worth taking a boat ride to see it from another aspect.
rivers. just going by the riverside in paris is so relaxing and a romantic walk for a couple would never be lost. along way you will see different kind of bridges to delight the eyes

Pretty to walk by, but beautiful at night. Really take a moment to just admire the bridge and decorations. It is beautiful from the waterway as well and once the lights come on, romance is in the air.
Incredible. Beautiful, ornate bridge within walking distance of the Louvre. Worth a visit to see the detail and art of a bridge.
A beautiful bridge. This is a must to walk over, just think of the history. There is a view for so many photo opportunities & to be able to see the workmanship of a such history close up.
Great end to an evening in Paris. I took a boat trip on a lovely warm evening and passing through Paris was so relaxing, a vibrant, warm atmosphere. This bridge though...

beautiful and romantic bridge. The prettiest, most beautiful, romantic bridge in all of paris. Gorgeous at night!
Beautiful when seen from the Bateaux Mouches river cruise!
great photo op!

Really impressive, save it from a boat. This bridge is so intricate and lovely. I saw it from the below on a boat, love all the ornate carvings and the beautiful lamps. You really must either walk on this bridge or take the boat tour.
French beauty. Honestly, it is the nicest and the most photogenic bridge in Paris. Something like the Charles Bridge in Prague :)
Like a painting... That great bridge completes pergectly the photo collectiob that obe should have after visiting paris..

Great views all around. One of the coolest bridges in Paris. Well worth a visit and has many incredible features as well. Close to other tourist attractions so great to stop by for like 30 minutes to take photos.
Beautiful at night....go after dark. It is one of the most romantic bridges in all of Paris. No love locks...just beauty over the night water....
Magnificent . The best way to see this magnificent bridge is from the Seine. It was the best bridge in Paris. Very elaborate. A must see.
Romantic and and iconic view. Who hasn't seen a photo or movie shot of this bridge. Wonderful to see it for real. A great place to walk and take photos of everything around it.

IMPRESSIVE. prettiest bridge in paris, watch the gold on sunset...set for many pictures, weddings sometimes, picnics... there is a night club underneat;h and many great restaurants floating on the seine next to it must go place
What an amazing bridge. A must see and beautiful bridge! The gold statues and trimming on the bridge really makes the bridge stand out from the rest.

A magnificent piece of history. sitting in the barge cafe alongside the walkway near this bridge having an afternoon coffee I was overtaken by the design and finish of this magnificent structure. I note on the other side of the river a wedding party using the bridge as a back drop for the photos.
SPECTACULAR. This is one of the best bridges in Paris, (and there are a lot). Even better, take the bateaux (boats) and cruise up and down the Seine, from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame.
Nice but small bridge. Nice bridge with pretty ornaments. Quite short so you can walk across it very easily. You also get a view of the eiffel tower in the distance from one side.
Pretty bridge. This is the prettiest and most decorative bridge in Paris. It offers great views of the Invalidies and Militaire Ecole.
Best way to see this | Cruise along the Seine. Take a cruise along the Seine to get a really close view of this magnificent bridge. The detail is amazing and must be admired from below.
A great looking bridge. We crossed the bridge once by foot (over) and twice by boat (Under). Its one of the best bridges in Paris. Day and night this bridge is perfect for photos!
Stunning. A stunning price of French architecture... They really didn't know how to do anything simple. If it was worth doing they were going to make a show of doing it.

Very beautiful bridge. Saw it during the day, saw it at night and walked across it. It's very beautiful and very fancy but I feel like almost all things in France are fancy! Highly recommend you stop and admire if walking along the Seine.

Such a beautiful bridge. This bridge is so beautiful that I am amazed there are not more accidents with people admiring it as they cross. I was glad to be a passenger so I could take pictures while crossing and hop out of the car for a quick selfie.

Ornate gateway to the Palais. Crossed over the bridge, considered to be the most ornate, walking to the Grand and Petit Palais. It's a beautiful gateway to that side of the Seine. Musee de L'armee behind it. Must cross over.
Ornate Bridge. This is an amazing ornate bridge! Nice to walk across to get from one side to the other and to be able to see all the detail up close.

Pass-by and some photo opportunities. We walked along the Seine from Musee d'Orsay to Eiffel Tower, came across this unique bridge with golden gilded statues. Took some photos and discovered a station below the bridge, fun entrance and felt like entering to another world (= Narnia). Very near to museums.

Beautiful Bridge. A beautiful bridge with fantastic sculptures.
Well worth a visit & for photographs,
If you have the time just to take a long walk would be ideal.
Always be aware of "PICKPOCKETS"
Warning given by our tour guide.
Beautiful bridge. This is a beautiful stunning bridge! My favourite one in Paris. It is well worth seeing in person and good for photos!

lovely in the sun. Nice stroll over the Seine on an interesting bridge, great architecture, well worth a visit to see it. Can get busy though. Nice to sit in the bars and gaze at it and the world going by.
The Most Ornate and Interesting Bridge. It is the most ornate of Paris' bridges, gorgeous in sunlight or lit up at night. Stroll across to enjoy the detail and the beautiful views.
Nice walk. Very nice walk coming from Eiffel Tower beside Seine river, especially after night. Lights along bridge look beautiful.

Picturesque and perfect for pictures.. The bridge is adorned with sculptures, the Seine flows quickly beneath it, making it a great place to photograph. I took a walk from the metro and took pictures of the museums and statues and detailed architecture. I would recommend photographers visit on a clear day to capture the best images. I also passed under the bridge by boat, which gives you a different view of the ornateness of the bridge.

Pont Alexandre bridge. City of Paris is othe banks of river Seine. It flows beautifully making its shores more beautiful. There are many bridges on seine. This one is one of them . Easily accessible by metro, hop-onbuses. Walking on the banks is very romantic .

A leisure walk. Perfect place for a leisure walk during sunset and evenings of the summer. The sculptures on this bridge are magnificent. Many entertaining activities take place here, I would like to mention the living "statue" of Napoleon which was a sheer amusement for us.The view from the middle of the bridge is spectacular. If you love solitude and silence,take the stairs and stand on the walking route under the bridge.The feeling is lovely. A shutterbug's paradise in every sense.

Take to boat tour to see underneath!. My husband and I got to see this by riding over it on the bus, and taking the boat cruise. The boat cruise gives you a great view, and is more relaxed. The art on this bridge was amazing!
Beautiful Paris . Paris is always be Paris, stunning day and night. It's completely different view in pont Alexandre III during the day and during the night all was so beautiful..

Beautiful. The beauty of this bridge makes it a must see while you're in Paris. It isn't very far from other sites and definitely worth the time to visit - with a camera. Walking is best but a slow ride will also show its' beauty.

Best to come during the day and night. We had completely different views and experienced a different atmosphere at night vs. the day. Both are amazing for different reasons. And you will want photos at both times.

Walking tour around Paris . Booked a walking tour to see the various sights in Paris. Came across this bridge and was told this bridge was the most beautifully decorated bridge in Paris.A commemoration of ties between France and Russia, this bridge is symbolic of the alliance between the 2 countries in the past
Paris classic. This is one of my favourite spots to enjoy the calm siene river. There are several bars and restrains along the seine near the pont that will allow you to appreciate it much better.
Amazing. Lovely to walk through. just fab all the gold is brill to look at. taking a trip over and such nice sites once there

A dream of a bridge. This bridge is on of the most wonderful and romantic bridge of all the Seine bridges.As it were this bridge is the connection between the museum of Orsay and the Orangerie and between of them flows the river Seine. You should take your time by crossing it,enjoythe view on the quay, the boats and the Eifel tower. The bridge itself gives you a lotof magnificent details to look and discover and you will be surprised that you are stayingthere more time that you thought. But you should go only on a sunny day, this makes the difference. Its magic.

Beautiful architecture and magnificent golden statues glitter in the Paris sun shine. We opted to walk and not do the boat ride-saw all the statues and majestic views from both sides of the great bridge-this one being my favorite. The restaurant/cafe/bar close by where you can sit and enjoy a glass of wine while staring at the beautiful views and holiday people passing by. An excellent opportunity for taking beautiful photos.There are magnificent views of the river Seine-Various boats and restaurant type boats chugging up and down the river-on and off stops for tourists to experience all the wonders of the area.
Stunning Bridge. This must be one of the most impressive bridges in Paris, We came across it during one of our histort walks across the city and were very impressed
The Seine boat ride. One of the several beautiful Paris 'ponts ' wepassed under on our boatride on the Seine . Loved those bridges , and this one particularly !
A beautiful place. On a sunny day, the golden statues at both ends glitter; the bridge itself is a beautiful piece of architecture and commands magnificient views of the river Seine.

great for photos. We always visit this bridge on my wifes birthday so we call it Marions bridge it holds wonderful memories for us as we are lucky her birthday is in July and we can enjoy the stroll to the bridge in the sunshine.There is alsu a café/bar on the banks of the Seine at the side of the bridge we comfortable seats and parasols to enjoy a glass of Rose

Accidental surprise. We were walking along the Seine and enjoying all the bridges when we came upon Point Alexandre III. We didn't know what we found at the time but we were blown away by the beauty and how ornate this bridge was.
Impressive Bridge. It is a not so old, but it became a symbol of Paris. The statues an intrinsic art of the city. It is making connection between the Army museum and the Grand and Pettite Palais.
Beautiful Bridge. This is a beautiful bridge to visit and take photo. The design is unique and if you visit at night it is very artistic with gas lamps on the sides.

My favourite bridge. Have to say this is my favourite bridge, brilliant and ornate for photos galore, a credit to Paris and always clean and looked after, wether looking from above or below, a true tourist attraction in its own
Beautiful bridge to look at and take photos from. This is a gorgeous old bridge to stand on and take photos from. It's well worth a visit and you see something different from every angle.
good place to take pics. this is a nice point to take a picture over the seine with a view of Paris. not a must but if you passing by take a look.
Beautiful. You must stroll across this bridge at night with the beautiful gas lamps all alight. The sculptures that adorn it are magnificent.

Favorite . My favorite bridge in the whole city. Views of the river and the Eiffel Tower. It's a must to grab a photo at. We did our wedding portraits there! Stroll across you won't regret it!
Photography by French Grey!

Alexander the 3rd Bridge build in commemoration of the then Russian Emperor aad his wife!. What a magnificent bridge! it is truly a work of art. One of my most favorite sites in Paris! I loved passing under it while on the Bateau Muches boat ride on the Seine River.

I think. Point of interest and beauty. A connection to the champs leading to the Invaldes/Napoleon's Tomb/Eiffel. I continue because I'm closer to the finish than the beginning. It's worth the look even if you don't cross it.

Lovely. Lovely beautiful and nicest bridge in Paris with a view of the Eiffel Tower. If your good at photography you can take a picture yourself touching the Eiffel Tower. Take it by the steps leading down to the river.
Beautiful. Most beautiful bridge in Paris, and a good place to get engaged! Nice bar on the quayside nearby too :-)

Important landmark in Paris!. Awesome view while taking Seine river tour.. Very pretty bridge.. Important bridge in French history.. There are Art Nouveau nymphs, winged horses and cherubs which are also found at both ends of the bridge..
Nice Bridge to stroll around. This is a very nice bridge to stroll around and relax. It gives you a nice view of the city and the river.

A simply beautiful bridge, day or night!. We visited this classic bridge both during the day and the evening hours so we could enjoy its beautiful lights. The bridge is an iconic Paris landmark and has been featured in many films and photographs shot in this wonderful city. It is a romantic place to visit, especially at night, the Seine River comes alive with river bars, cruise and party boats moored right next to the bridge. Worth a visit, and it's free!
Really cool bridge. This bridge looks awesome and at night there's a nightclub situated underneath it and some pubs outside.

I really love this bridge. This is my favourite bridge in Paris and always make a point of crossing it when I visit Paris.It is very grand and I have a favourite statue of a young nymph with a seashell held to its ear.
The bridge leads one from the Grand and Petit Palais to the grand esplanade of Les Invalides
Beautiful Bridge. This is a lovely bridge with great photo opportunity with Eiffel Tower in the background. It's very ornate and decorative.
A Paris staple. You cant go to visit and not get pics on or of this bridge. Quintessential Paris in good or bad weather.

Bustling with activity all the time!. We stayed in a Peniche boat which was docked right next to and below Pont Alexandre III and it was the most fantastic experience! The Pont is always busy with people! Engagement photos, wedding photos, friends, tourists, restaurants, crepe stands, bicycles etc. The Bateaux Mouches and other tourist boats pass underneath the bridge regularly and it appears that the tradition is to scream as you go beneath the bridge. On one side of the bridge is the Grand Palais and Petit Palais and on the other side is Les Invalides. There is a large greenspace in front of Les Invalides where people hang out for a picnic - especially on Friday and Saturday nights. Every night, there was a crowd below the bridge dining on the edge of the Seine with food they had brought or enjoying drinks at Flow or Rosa Bonheur. If you like to people watch - this is the place to be!
Impressive bridge. Both the actual bridge and the surroundings are very beautiful. Nice area for pictures, especially when it is warm.

One of the most Romantic Bridges in the world for me. A walk over this Romantic bridge at night is a must, my wife and I often park our car and cross this beautiful and romantic bridge whenever we can, often when coming home from a dinner, need good weather.

Great spot for picture. we passed the bridge on the way walking to Eiffel tower. the walk along Seine river is very pleasant. There r running track, leisure exercises facilities and cafe around. It is great to just stop, or slow down, people watching, or simply relax a little bit.

Ornate beautiful bridge. This has got to be one of the most beautiful ornate bridge in all of Paris. Such a great sight to see. I wasn't able to walk across it , but was able to drive on it which was just as great!
WORLD'S MOST BEAUTIFUL BRIDGE. Great for strolling and taking photographs. ExtremeYmelaborate and beautiful day or night. Must see.

Amazing . It is not the only bridge, but a must to walk and cross slowly if you are near Invalides. Starting from Pont de Bir-Hakeim, moving towards Pont d'Iéna, and all the way to Pont de la Tournelle, zig zag all the bridges in between and you have an amazing walk in Paris.

The Bridge is BEatiful. The Bridge is something to see, BUT the main reason for going there is down by the river below is a fantastic bar called Faust . It's lively, friendly, greta music, all outdoors and loads of fun !!
Beautiful Bridge!. This is a must see point in Paris! I would actually recommend to take a boat ride on the scene to see this bridge as it passes directly under it and has beautiful views!

Pont du arcs!. Pont Alexandre is a wonderful bridge built on the lovely river Seine.
This bridge is used as a Love-lovk bridge and has become a famous tourist site.

Glorious Bridge. I love bridges and this was one was not disappointing. It was so beautiful! It was clean, and the details were so intricate and precise! If you walk down the stairs you can get a nice standing picture from the side at the level of the River Seine showing the true beauty of it! I only stayed for a quick weekend but next time I hope to take a boat ride so I can see the bridge from the river!

Beautiful Bridge. The most beautiful bridge in Paris, which is just a short walk from the Invalides, also, right across by Petit Palais, Grand Palais, and Champ Elysees area. With view of The Eiffel Tower, this bridge is perfect for spending an evening with a loved one, or maybe just a morning walk/jog.

Best bridge in Paris . I love this bridge so much. It's very beautiful cross Seine river. Numerous sculptors provided the sculptures that feature prominently on the bridge.From this bridge we also see Eiffel Tower far away and direct to Musée de l'Armée
Great views! . Great view of the Eiffel Tower and the Seine from this bridge! It is very grand and a great a photo spot. Lots of great restaurants and street vendors either side of the bridge.

Another bridge, this time a bit more ornate.. We fail to see anything special about this bridge except that it is dedicated to Tsar Alexander III who broke Frances diplomatic isolation after the Franco-Prussian War and help lay the foundation of the Triple Alliance who final outcome was World War I with its slaughter millions and the ruin of the West.
Majestic Bridge. A majestic bridge near the grand and petit palais and champs elysees. A great place to take photos. Definitely worth visiting and enjoying the design and architecture of the bridge.
Gorgeous. One of the finest bridges in Paris. It is so beautiful that it deserves a visit. If you are in that city, don¡t miss it. You will complaint when you are back home.
Alexandra Bridge.. Fascinating bridge with gold colour symbolic pictures of saints, angels, heroes. While you travel by ship a marvelous look under the bridge.

One to tick off the sightseeing trip!. One of the main bridges in Paris over the Seine - worth a cruise along the Seine to see all the main sights.
We went on a dinner cruise which was well worth it and a great end to the day of exploring this city.
Lalique Crystal lanterns. Cool, historic bridge. Watch for the details of statues and the Lalique Crystal street lights. Great views of the Seine.
You will not miss this. A great spot for crossing the Siene and watching the river traffic. There are little book stalls along the river edge which are also worth a look.

Photogenic spot. A must visit during your trip to France with a spectacular view and opportunity to take plenty of nice pictures. You can easily find someone to draw to you a portray picture or sip a cup of tea in the nearby cafes. Beware of pick pockets.
Midnight In Paris Film Location. Omg so glad I saw this attraction on a hop-on hop-off bus stunning bridge and stunning film location for Woody Allen's Midnight In Paris film!

Make time for this bridge when visiting Paris!. This bridge is amazing itself, but the views make it spectacular. Many reviewers point out the details of what can be seen from it (and history, etc). I will add by saying the best method seeing and taking pictures is to be on this bridge just after daybreak. It is quite empty at that time and you can take some amazing family photos on it. I added a photo so you can see the results without the crowds.
Photogenic. Absolutely stunning view of photogenic Paris for the photo buff, view of Hotel les invalides from the bridge

Majestic views over the bridge. Paris is rich in views from many places, but standing on Pont Alexandre III any time, is spectacular: you are able to see the Seine river, with the Haussemann buildings along the sides, Les Invalides, Grand Palais and Petite Palais, The Eiffel Tower, among the well known sites. The bridge itself is magnificent with its golden sculptures, on four granite pillars, as well as statues at the foot of each. The golden garlands decorate the sides of the bridge. Watch the river boats glide under, in a quiet peaceful movement.
A wedding romantic place. All Chineese bride dream about this bridge... Every time I bike by this bridge I see young new couples for their official wedding picture there...

Great views of the Grand Palais, lovely walk along the river. I love this bridge and this part of the river which is really busy with all the pop up bars, restaurants and floating bar nearby. It's really nice to watch all the locals wander along after work with a bottle of wine and a baguette and just sit next to the river. So nice, that we decided to have our own picnic! As it was Paris Plage when we went, which basically is loads of pop up beaches along the river, there are tables and chairs where families and locals gather to eat and drink on the hot summer nights. So, off we pop to the supermarket and pack our basket with everything from french sticks, cheese, pate, olives, ham, salami and 2 bottles of red wine for the grand total of 40 euros! The wine is only 3 euros in the supermarkets!! Off we went and found a little table right by the bridge and set up. We sat there for nearly 4 hours until we could see the Eiffel twinkling at 10pm, then we had a lovely walk upto the tower which was about 10 minutes walk. Perfect evening! During the day we spent time on the bridge whilst walking from Les Invalides which is also worth a visit.
August 2016. Beautiful! The only bridge I wanted to see in Paris. It is used in so many movies and does not disappoint. Unfortunately I did not get to see it at night. Maybe next trip.
Beautiful bridge. This is a beautiful bridge. We enjoyed a bottle of rose along the Seine with this bridge as our backdrop.

Indeed the world's most ornate bridge!. Truly the world's most ornate bridge! Even along the beautiful Siene coastline, Pont Alexandre III still stands out as an unparalleled beauty with literally every inch is adorned with art. As the link between the Grand+Petit Palais and Les Invalides, the bridge is hard to miss on your sightseeing journey, but nonetheless, Pont Alexandre III alone is definitely worth going out of your way to see!While Pont Neuf is a timeless beauty as Paris's oldest bridge, Pont Alexandre III exemplified Paris's neoclassic beauty. Both are certainly the bridges that are must-see within the City of Lights!

Most wonderful bridge in Paris. Offered by Nicolas the 2nd, Tsar of Russia to thank the french for their famous loan... a wonderfully restaured bridge thanks to Yves Saint Laurent and his partner Pierre Bergé... Just cross the bridge and go for shopping avenue Montaigne... if you dare ;-)
Greatest picture spot.. This is a beautiful bridge, and without a doubt, a great place to take a family picture. The Eiffel Tower is in the background and the Seine flows through it.
a must see. A beautiful piece of architecture that's has been well maintained. A definite must see if you're in paris.
beautiful . Tis is a totally Beautiful bridge, well worth the short walk and if you can wait a little so there is a moment without a big crowd, it is great place for pictures, lovely sight too.

Dreamiest Bridge in Paris. For me, this is the dreamiest, most romantic bridge in all of Paris. One cannot go wrong with this spot. I highly recommend going down the metro station and leisurely walking down Ave. Winston Churchill, and appreciating the beautiful buildings Palais Royal and Petit Palais, including the garden. It's beautifully preserved and extremely photogenic. Since I was exploring alone, I took an insane amount of selfies here. Great for photography.
Bridge. A lovely bridge nicely crafted by the makers with some cool breeze and a view of Eiffel Tower and the ice cream on the bridge is a must try

good for a water tour. Nice Location for beginning the journey and expolerer the City of paris with a boat ,clean and safe !
with sunny weather the best to have brilliant Picture
Beautiful Bridge !. The bridge is stunning, all the gold and lanterns across the bridge are just beautiful ! Very ornate ! It does look pretty across the river! Worth a visit !
Beautiful bridge. Our first visit to Paris...this was the first bridge we crossed over the Seine. Great photo spot to take your selfie with the Eiffel Tower 🗼 very ornate

Must!. for all U.S visitors, should be a must. You feel transported to another time, more civilized maybe. Things were made with more love, or maybe not, just these iconic points.
John and Elyssbateh
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. The most magnifique bridge over The Seine River in Paris. Name of the bridge is for memories of name of Emperor of Russian - Alexander.
The loveliest bridge in Paris!. One of the best activities while in Paris is to determine which bridge over the Sienne you love the most... This is one of my favorites!!!

Beautiful. We were walking from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower and stopped at the Pont Alexandre III Bridge. What beautiful French architecture. The French are so proud they keep it in immaculate condition as well.
worth a visit...
Awesome bridge. It feels good just to walk in the bridge and look the surroundings, the lights in the side of the bridge also feels nice

Beautiful. I love walking along the Seine when in Paris and I love the bridges that cross it but of all of them this would have to be my favourite. It is simply beautiful especially when they light it up at night. This is one place we always end up each time we are in Paris and it doesn't matter how many times you see it, it never loses its beauty and becomes just another bridge.
Wow. One of the best views ever. Was walking there with my girlfriend at sunset and it was really one of the best things in paris

Magnificent achievement. This is a truly magnificent bridge. It is elegant, beautiful, attractive, practical and has everything one could wish for in a bridge. And it has the people as well as the traffic to prove it. Whenever we have been there it was never congested. Tourist line up the bridge for photos; what else! The views are absolutely magnificent. It was built between 1896-1900. Apparently Czar Nicholas laid the foundation stone as a gesture of good will between France and Russia. The bridge allowed visitors to cross both sides of the river Seine in order to see the exhibits of the Universal Exhibition which took place in Paris in 1900.

Nighttime Lights. We had walked over the bridge during the evening. It was so pretty with the bridge lit up and highlighted by the lights. The ornate details and the gilded statues on all sides of the bridge were so beautiful, defintely a magestic feel and a great way to walk back to our hotel. This bridge connects the Invalides neighbourhood to the Champs- Élysées area. The views from the bridge during the day and evening are lovely, including that of the magnificent dome of the Military Museum and Napoleon's Tomb (Invalides).

Mot beautiful part of Paris. When I was in Paris no one highlighted the Alexander bridge and it was like casual to them...but the view of the bridge from both sides: (des invalides) and (petit palais and grand palais) is just amazing...however the architecture of the bridge with the golden status at each side is astonishing. That's the place we spent most of our time getting photographs while enjoy resting in the plains near the air-france airline office.

Have to see in person to appreciate. If you happen to take the Batobus, the stop is the one you would take to Champs De Elysees. The bridge is so enormous and a great place for photos. One of my favorites in Paris

Magnificent bridge. A magnificent bridge across the River Seine in Paris which is twice on the route of the hop on hop off buses which is actually quite a nice way of seeing it. It has fantastic gold statues in the corners and leads across the river to the marvellous Hotel des Invalides.
bridge experience. one of the nicest bridges in Parisnice to admire structurerelaxed watching the barges and tour boatscross over bridge to the grand and petite palacesentry to petite palace is free
Fantastic Bridge in Paris. Next Invalides Station RER C you are the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It's my opinion ! Go go, it's fantastic view
Romantic place and bridge. Bridge with a many old city lamps and historical statues. Nice view of the Eiffel Tower and river. Place for your beauty photo.
Walk along the Seine. Beautiful views of the Seine looking back toward Ile de la Cite with beautiful golden statuary on each end.

Nice beautiful bridge . If you make the sightseeing cruise in the river that's only 15 euros, you will surely pass through here. You can also walk there, if you are on the tower just go down the river, it's about 20m walk to get there.

Gorgeous . The most elaborate and ornate of the bridges over the Seine in Paris, pont Alexandre III is another must-see in Paris. This bridge connects the Champs-Élysées area with Invalides. You can see the military museum and the splendid dome of Napoleon's Tomb from the bridge. The many gilded statues and architectural design of the bridge are amazing and you can see it on your way to visit either of the areas above.
Beautiful. Beautiful bridge with excellent views however it is incredibly busy in July and can be difficult to take photos

Probably The Grandest Bridge In Paris.. The Alex 3 Bridge is a real showpiece of exotic ironwork that was surely built to impress. It's full of swirls of laurel wreaths little cherubs and ornate lamp standards sprouting from the parapet. It belongs to that golden age of excess in the run up toWW1 and the Russian Revolution even though France itself had already been a republic for a century. In sunlight, sunset or under floodlights this bridge is extremely photogenic and is really best appreciated from the sides or actually on the Seine.It's one of the iconic images of Paris that you'll find in nearly every decent postcard stall in the city.

Not just any bridge. I have have seen and crossed many bridges in my life. This is the first bridge that I have ever described as beautiful. If you are in Paris, I would consider this a must see attraction. On top of it all, viewing it is free and you don't have to fight crowds!
Beautiful and ornate. You really have to walk around the bridge and surrounding to appreciate it. The amount of detail always fascinates me.photo op level 7
Pretty place. I went on a boat ride here it was memorable and worth the visit.Everything here seemed well kept and nice.

Romance & beauty . You may think it's just a bridge why go out of my way? But honestly it's just stunning. Walk across,take your time and soak up the atmosphere around here. Then go and find one of the many bars along the seine with a great view of the bridge. So so Parisienne
NIce. As all bridges crossing over a river this bridge is nice and with it's statues it is one of the nicest in Paris.
Nice bridge. This is a really nice bridge. It goes over the river, just like a good bridge should, and you are allowed to walk across it, which is great.

Proposal!. My now fiancé proposed to me in the middle of this gorgeous bridge. It's such a beautiful structure to look at. Took so many pictures. Ideal to look around all of Paris. So much to see from this bridge. Loved it!

Bridge of Bridges. A famous backdrop in so many movies - this exquisite bridge is one of many that crosses the Seine. Gawk at the gilt statues and the other tourists, visit the book sellers' stalls. Sit on a bench by the stalls.

bridge . this is a best and good architecture arc deck bridge
on seine river.
we stop here to view it's great location
as well as beauty of seine river
Gorgeous!. This can be best appreciated from the water, but it is superb to see any way you can. Worth your time
Summer afternoon. Great place to spend a summer afternoon. Bring your food and drinks. Full of Parisians enjoying the sunset
Amazing place for photography. This is a really picturesque brigde in Paris. You have a view of the eiffel tower, and the sunsets are gorgeous. I recommend a visit around sunrise or sunset.
Magnificent and majestic. Best seen from the river on s gateaux mouche one hour trip on s sunny day, gold touched up recently, magnificent and impressuve.
Surprisingly beautiful for a bridge!. I got dragged along by my boyfriend because it's a James Bond location and I was pleasantly surprised! The design is absolutely fantastic, and very memorable.
Tribute to Irasema. Next to the bridge is a statue of Lafayette and Bolivar, where my friend Irasema, Columbian mother of Alexander descendant of Lafayette mentioned as bringing the two together.

Most Beautiful Bridge!. Started at the Arc de Triomphe- down the Champs Elysees and then across the Grand Palais towards the bridge which we saw from a Seine river cruise that we had also done. It's said to be the most beautiful bridge in Paris and it certainly lives up to the claim! It is lovely.. with all the statues/lights/design. There was a photo shoot on the bridge when we passed- it was just a small part of our entire tour and took us 15 minutes total with all the picture taking but it was a pretty addition.
I got engaged on this bridge. I'm biased because of great memories created on this bridge, but it's truly a beautiful spot to stop for a moment and gaze at Paris along the Seine.
Golden bridge. One of the famous bridges of Paris. Walk across from Place de Concorde to the "hospital". walk along and see the ornaments and statues of romatic Paris

Beautiful...must do!. So wonderful to walk on the bridge...lots to see and keep walking to visit the 2 palaces...then to Champs Elysees up yo Arc de
Triomphe...great walk with lots to see and do.

Pont Alexandre III is artsy!. It's said to be the most beautiful bridge across the seine in Paris. It's like the Charles Bridge of Prague. But it isn't that grand. It's a small one and has 2 palaces on either side. The gardens in the areas around the bridge are a perfect place to relax after walking around for a while.

Beautiful photo ops!. My husband and I, along with other seniors were touring Paris and France on the MS AMADEUS to Normandy. This was one of our stops and it was incredible. We took many, many pictures during the day and also at night. We walked and walked and walked and enjoyed every minute of it. This is a once in a lifetime tour and I hope all of you out there take advantage of it. The pics are incredible but seeing it all in person is worth it all. This is a must-stop. Take advantage of Trip Advisor's recommendations. They are right on target.
Classic Paris. This bridge is classic Paris. A must-see. Go underneath it to see the faces carved from stone. Spectacular at night

Walked across the bridge and a wild pop-up band appeared!. Was just walking casually with a few friends after some wine and we heard a noise down from one of the recently made "beach-walks" and there was a "pop-up-band" that were just seemingly freestyling on drums, trumpet and other types of "blowing-instruments" and it was just sublime. A decent crowd of happy young persons drinking wine, smoking pot and dancing to the music.
Stunning gold Statues. A beautiful bridge with stunning gold statues. Nice place to walk in the evening. This place is covered in river cruise and open top bus tours.
Beautiful link bridge . Stunning recently renovated gold statues Links 2 areas of Paris Served with open top tours Nice walk and photo opportunity Part of the iconic TDF route & postcard photography
Perhaps my favourite bridge in Paris. Centrally situated, a beautiful and well preserved bridge. From here you can see several of the icons of Paris
Beautiful. I have used it as a meeting destination. If your friends are late....well you have a beautiful view.
Eye Candy. This is the most beautiful bridge I have ever seen. It offers a path from the Louvre to the left bank. It is in the heart of a must see area in Paris.
Superb view. A perfect location to stroll from the Champs Elysee and walk along the river Seine. Nicely restaured bridge.
Beautiful......but its a bridge. What else is there to say....its over a river, its picturesque. You can walk over it! Worth a walk!!!

All bridges whould be walked over!. Just walk slowly, drape your hand on the stone baluster, and look into the iron lamps, and when you get to the end.... enjoy the bling of wings! If you can manage it, try a slow mooch at lunchtime with a lovely crunchy baguette to drop crumbs from onto the Bateaux Mouches! teehee. tis a good place to be slow on.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. The best way to discover it is either to take a cruise on the river or to walk along the Seine. You can even sit near the river as long as you want to enjoy the view and a nice drink or an ice cream during summer.

Best Viewed At Night. This is the most photographed bridge I would say, and it's not even the longest in the world. Flanked by statues and across the famous River Seine, this bridge is best viewed at night or from below, meaning you get yourself onto a river trip and view it while sitting and sailing below it. Breathtaking.
See from a tour. We did two river tours and one bus tour and this was one of the places we drove past. It's really nice, but not being on foot I don't have much else on this place.

It's Just a Bridge.... I understand that this is a landmark in Paris, but really, it's just another bridge. Worth taking a stroll across, and snapping a couple photos of, but beyond that there isn't much else to do. When compared to other famous bridges, like Prague's Charles Bridge, this is absolutely nothing special. I give it a three because it's still a lovely bridge, and a majour landmark. I'd say don't go out of your way to see it, though you'll undoubtable pass it if trekking through central Paris on foot.
Such a beautiful bridge ....... I love this bridge ..... beautiful in any type of light ..... and such iconic French style. Really don't miss it .....
The most beautiful bridge of Paris. Cross the bridge and you will never be the same as related to your evaluation of what is beautiful,romantic and unreacheable dream

Beautiful bridge with real life looking statues. Impressive bridge, best viewed at night when lights are lit up. You can view the Champs-Élysées on the way there) preferably at night when lights are on). Below is a wonderful meeting place for mainly young Parisians with some snacks and beer or wine. People Also bring a blanket to sit on from home and their own food and snacks and have a nice evening out. Great calm atmosphere.

Beautiful views of the Siene. You can definitely spend some time here because you get beautiful views of the Siene and can watch the boats go by. We got to see a wedding shoot happening here. So clearly its very picturesque

The Most Beautiful Bridge in the City. We got to the bridge quite early in the morning and were rewarded with some fantastic photo opportunities (some newlyweds had the same idea for their wedding photos). In a city famous for it's ancient, beautiful, graceful bridges, this one is easily the most beautiful with it's statues, ornate lights, and graceful design. There is always traffic on it, but the sidewalks are quite wide and the Eiffel Tower is in the distance for some truly fantastic photos.
most beautiful bridge. great works of art (statues) on the bridge, fantasic view and very close to other major sights- great place to take photos of the river!
To be combined with other activities. This is not a destination by itself, but as you explore the broader area, you can visit. I think it is best seen from a boat tour though!
Go at night!!!. One of the most romantic places in Paris. When its lit at night time its breath-taking and you could easily spend hour just watching the city.

It's a bridge. Yeah sure it was built back in 1900 in honour of Tsar Alexandra III, and yes it has golden looking structures lining the bridge, but it just a bridge. It's most alluring feature is the fact that it gets you from one side of the Seine to the other without getting your feet wet. Worth a look after walking the Champs Élysées.
Great surroundings . A great place to soak up Paris. Great restaurants, surroundings, and just a great atmosphere. We had the bonus of a free air show a day or two before the Bastille celebrations.

Cool to do with other stuff. An amazing bridge leading to a fair sized building, but I wouldn't take the time to see it on its own. We hopped off the Batobus to see the Arc de Triumphe and the Place de la Concord and it was right there so I'd do it that way or via cart/bike.
Beautiful bridge. This bridge has a lot of history and is a beautiful structure. It amazes me how this bridge can last so long built so long ago and to day we can't do it.???

Food architecture. A very good architecture, need to see in depth to enjoy the beauty of the bridge. I must say that one of the good place to see is from the siene river cruise. Gold color on the edges of the black scriptures looks amazing.

Iconic Bridge. I have walked over this bridge so many times, and each time, the memories of my stays in Paris are awakened. Take time for a few photos overlooking the Seine. Nothing could be more romantic..
Very impressive . Beautiful bridge, and has some stunning architecture! Went along this brigde during a bus tour, and found it very impressive

MY FAVORITE BRIDGE EVER. I absolutely love this bridge and go over it all the time every time I am here in Paris. and every time I find something I've missed before its just so gorgeous and Over the Top and I love it!
My husbands favorite bridge!. Nothing says Paris to me like this bridge! It's elegant and regal! Be sure to see it from the river too, on one the bateaux that cruise the river!

Most Beautiful Bridge Crossing the Seine. The 19th century Alexandre III Bridge (亞歷山大三世橋, French: Pont Alexandre III) is the most beautiful bridge crossing the Seine (塞納河) in Paris. It connects the Grand and Petit Palais on the right bank with the Hotel des Invalides on the left bank. The bridge was built for the 1900 Universal Exposition along with others like the Gare d'Orsay, the Petit Palais and the Grand Palais. It was built between 1896 and 1900. The bridge was named after Tsar Alexandre III (Emperor of Russ 1881-1894) to celebrate the Franco-Russian Alliance signed in 1892. The bridge was designed to avoid obstructing the view of the Invalides and Champs-Elysees with only 6 m (20 ft) in height and a single 107.5 meters (353 ft) long span steel construction. Alexandre III Bridge is a beautiful spot and a wonderful place to visit any time of the day or night. It is also a popular place to view the Eiffel Tower. Certainly we could not ignore those four giant 17 meter-high stone pillars crowned with gilt-bronze sculptures of winged horses representing the illustrious Arts, Sciences, Commerce and Industry. These four stone pillars are actually used as stabilizing counterweights for the bridge. You may want to enjoy it from the Seine via a sightseeing river cruise or river taxi. We saw the sculpted keystone called the Nymphes de la Neva in the center of the bridge, which can only be seen clearly from the river. We visited and passed by the bridge several times due to many attractions nearby. The Grand Palais, Petit Palais, Hotel des Invalides, and Champs-Elysees are all within walking distance. Of course, strolling along the Seine is also a pleasant experience.Like most of the attractions in Paris, many films and videos used them for scenes. Such as Woody Allen’s “Midnight in Paris,” James Bond film “A View to a Kill” and Adele's music video "Someone Like You". Paris is definitely an amazing and romantic destination for travelers. Plan yourself at least a week in order to enjoy most of it.

PONT ALEXANDER III - worth the visit. According to the Wikipedia, "The Beaux-Arts style bridge, with its exuberant Art Nouveau lamps, cherubs, nymphs and winged horses at either end, was built between 1896 and 1900. It is named after Tsar Alexander III, who had concluded the Franco-Russian Alliance in 1892. His son Nicholas II laid the foundation stone in October 1896. The style of the bridge reflects that of the Grand Palais, to which it leads on the right bank."I strongly recommend that you do visit this beautiful bridge, as well as the Palais Grand, when in Paris.
