Good sight. If you visit Paris, make sure you go to this bridge. It is old but fascinating. You get to overlook the river that runs through Paris.
Just a Beautiful Bridge. Well worth walking over slowly to check out the sights in all directions in addition to the decorations on the bridge itself.

Beautiful bridge. It is a beautiful bridge, well built and sturdy and stable. Not sure it deserves to be #8 Thing to do in Paris, it's a bridge.
Is it the one we saw the Eiffel Tower from? If that's about it, then it's real nice location. But year, just a bridge.

Might be missed . . . Don't!. Because there are so many big-name attractions and since bridges are just ways to get over the river it might be easy to overlook this bridge -- but that would be a mistake. The details are beautiful and the story behind it makes it that much more interesting.
Nice paris bridge. Its an easy attraction to visit whilst exploring the city, but don't feel upset if you can't fit it in on your trip.

Another Beautiful Landmark in Paris. Strolling across this bridge was another of the many fabulous joys in Paris. The ornate design of the bridge, the views of the Sienne and city are so quintessentially "Paris". If you will be doing a lot of walking through the city, do not miss this! You can enjoy a stroll over the bridge while headed to many of the most popular sights - it is very centrally located.

Beautiful Bridge. There are many bridges crossing the Seine but the Pont Alexandre III is the most beautiful. The ends of the bridge are flanked by 17 m tall stone pedestals supporting gilt bronze statues of winged horses. These pedestals are actually counterweights for the bridge arch. From the shore or a tour boat you can see the "Nymphs" relief at the center of the arches.

The Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris. Paris has many bridges, but this bridge is by far the most beautiful. The bridge is wrought iron, single arched, accented with old fashioned lamp-posts, and highlighted by 4 huge pillars with winged horses to protect it. There's also sculptures, basically sitting on the bridge at the midway point.On the Quai D'Orsay side of the bridge, you'll find the Grand Palais and Avenue Cygnie. You also get a great view of Southern Paris and the Eiffel Tower from here.
Best bridge in paris. What i recommend is to walk down the champs elysees pass by the grand and petit palais and get to the pont alexandre III and watch the seine

Great photo op. For my daughters big 40 birthday we photographer her on the bridge, its the quentensial Paris backdrop ! The gold, the grandeur the history makes it one of the must do points of interest
Wonderful Bridge to see from the Water boat tour!. Very cool bridge, best seen from the water on a boat tour! Wonderful gold statue works on both sides!
The River view is great. You can visit here by using many way it's very easy to access the best way to get here I would recommend you to use the metro it's faster.

Great place to relax and soak up the sites.. This is a great place to watch the river traffic as well as all the other surrounding sites. Bring your camera as you will catch many great shots of all the activity in this area.
Beautiful Bridge with great views. Paris is a wonderful walking city - walk over this bridge for sure. Great views up and down the Seine and of the Eiffel Tower.
Lovely and Historic Bridge. Pont Alexandre III is a lovely and historic bridge in a beautiful city. I recommend visiting all the bridges. Gorgeous sight for photographers.
Impressive. Easily the most ornate bridge in Paris. Great view of the Eiffel tower. Fun to people watch on and we enjoyed it.

Just Beautiful!. The oldest bridge. You can see it clearly from Eiffel Tower ona clear day! So beautiful!
TIP: Stop by at night to see it when it is all lit up!

beautiful bridge. one of the most beautiful bridges I have had the pleasure to come across. We had the pleasure of taking a trip on the batobus and got to see a few of the paris bridges, including the love lock bridge before they decided to remove them to preserve the bridge. It is one of the many stunning things to see in Paris.
Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful Bridge, but nothing that exciting. There were 2 crepes shops by the foot of the bridge that were popular among tourists.

The Paris bridge with the most "bling".. This is our favourite bridge in Paris. Not only is it beautiful, but it has a great view of the Eiffel Tower and Invalides. Check out the people sitting in deckchairs along the bank! So much of humanity passes, it's perfect for people watching.

A Paris by night favorite. Simply beautiful, half way between Le Louvre and the Arc de Triomphe and next to the Petit Palais. Just walk to it while exiting the Petit or Grand Palais and enjoy the most famous bridge in Paris, seen in so many advertising!
Take a walk!. Great scenic bridge with wonderful views and lots of French history, it connects to all kinds of wonderful things

The Perfect Spot for a Memorable Photo !. Normally one writes reviews about cities, or hotels or restaurants but not about a bridge. The Pont Alexandre III is an exception however. Although the Pont Alexandre III is a lesser publicized attraction for Paris tourists, it is not to be missed and is special for several reasons. Not only is its newly restored appearance a thing of beauty and enduring art ; not only its location easy to find lying on the road (Esplanade des Invalides) which connects Des Invalides to the Grande Palais and Petit Palais but ... the view from the bridge, which shows the river Seine and the Tour Eiffel, makes for a memorable photo !

Love this bridge!. This is the classic bridge across the Seine with its gilded statues and elegant profile. If there is ever a bridge design that makes an elegant classy statement this is it! Try it by gliding under in a bateau bus or over by walking across it - the most memorable and classic moment of Paris and the Seine river
Spectacular bridge. We crossed it while cruising on the Seine and walked on it to get a good view of the Eiffel Tower. The gorgeous bridge is worth visiting.

Imagining Napoleon and the Czar Alexander III. You can even see Napoleon and Alexander III going over this beautiful bridge when the peace treaty between France and Russia was signed. Unmissable. Wonderful.The whole scenery, the brdge, the Petit Palais and the Grand Palais makes this venue one of Paris' most beatiful places.
Great location to watch the sunset past the Eiffel Tower. Romantic place to stop and take it all in. Perfect sunset location with the Eiffel Tower in the distance.

Best friends vacay . Stunning architectural bridge with good views of the river Seine and Eiffel Tower . It was raining when we walked over but still good. Pay attention to the roads and traffic and only cross on pedestrian crossings when it is green! There is traffic everywhere and it's mental!
Beautiful Arcitecture. An excellent architecture and perfect built. Went on the boat trip and the view was too perfect. Place to take pictures from various angels.
Another interesting place to explore in Paris. I walked over and through this area several times and liked it best in the evening when the light on the water is at its most spectacular.
Nice. Beautiful to see, but not much. Good to go to relax and take some time. Romantic with the right person :D

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. This bridge is famous for being the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It was built along with the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais for the 1900 Exposition. It has imposing statues clinging to the sides both facing the bridge and the water. There are huge lights with very ornate ironwork and large glass globes along the bridge, and the views you get of Les Invalides on one end and the Grand Palais at the other end are beautiful.

A great place to see how many people are getting married.. This seems to be the place where people want to have a wedding picture taken - doesn't seem to matter what day of the week it is. On a sunny day - those gold statues on the end of each end of the bridge are like beacons of light beckoning for all to come and see.It's just a neat place to hang out for a few minutes or more

Historic Bridge. There's so much history in this bridge. If you take either the river cruise down the Seine or the City Sightseeing bus tour, you will hear all the stories and origins of the bridge, that gilded statues and the buildings that surround it.
Stunning bridge. Was little surprise how fabulous looking this bridge is. (Fact #1: It was givedto the city of Paris by Alexandre the 3rd of Russia, I did not know that)

My favorite bridge in Paris. This has to be one of the prettiest bridges I have had the pleasure to walk across. I usually don't like ostentatious things, but the gilded statues just seem to fit the elegance that is Paris.

Nice Bridge. Interesting story behind the bridge and the relationship between France and Russia. If you are into history then it is worth while to learn more about. Otherwise, it is a nice bridge that will be crossed many times in Paris. Good view of the Eiffel tower as well
Very romantic . A lovely detailed bridge a must to watch the cruises sail by and get a great view of the Effiel tower!
A bridge of beauty. Yes this might just be a bridge but it is also a stunning bridge. Walking across the bridge is a must.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Spend some time just strolling across the bridge, even snag a spot on one of the benches along the Seine so you can admire Pont Alexandre 111 at your leisure. There are also several cafes along the river that serve meals and drinks and these have a lovely view of the bridge as well.
one of the most beautiful bridge. Another plus is the photo with your love at sunset on this beautiful bridge with its statues of gold.
Beautiful architecture. Going crazy over a bridge - well yes, especially at night with all the lights glittering on the statues

Possibly the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Visited the place twice. First time on a weekday and second time on a Saturday.
Saturday saw the visitors out at full force. The sunny day helped and brought out many couples for bridal photo shoots at the bridge.
A must visit for the photo traveler.
Pont Alexandre III. Beautiful bridge on the Seine. Incredible looking and it is something you have to see while in Paris.
Beautiful always. Love to visit this bridge for a photo each time I visit Paris. Elegant, lovely design from another era. The

Very grand. Popular with weddings from what we could see- with brides getting their photos taken with the huge pillared statues in the background. A very grand view looking over the river with the grand buildings of the city behind.

You have to se this. City walking at its very very best. Paris is beautiful , beauty abounds everywhere you turn and no more that here ... go and be dwarfed by its beauty and think about bigger things.

Best Bridge. This was the best bridge we saw around Seine River. We had so many photos we couldn't leave it for more than 30 minutes! Sculptures were so neatly put on it that each one of them was stunning and fit where it stood. Would highly recommend to visit. Across it, you can also see Hotel Invalides, another highlight of Paris.

Very beautiful architecture..... On our way to the Eiffel on foot we crossed this fabulous piece of infrastructure. It depicts the rich architecture and heritage of Paris. It is indeed amazing that even after so many years this monument stands strong and elegant....must visit indeed!

Looks better from the river cruise. you get to see its beauty from the river cruise, the photos looked amazing with the bridge behind us. It is also nice to take a walk from Champs Elysee down to the Sein River and cross the different bridges all the way to Trocadero and Tour Eiffel.
Beautiful Bridge. The most beautiful bridge I have seen in the Paris. Our guild told the historical value too. A free space to walk
The most beautiful bridge in all of Paris. This bridge is a must see at night. Makes for great photos and you can see the Eiffel Tower in the background.
A beautiful bridge. Pont Alexandre III is a beautiful bridge across the Seine - probably the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Its also steeped in historic / political symbolism.
A bridge. A bridge....a nice bridge, but a bridge....what more can you say, use it to cross from invaledes to the grand palais and the petit palais.
UNFORGETABLE VIEWS. pont alexandre III is the best bridge in paris,when you are walking there you sense which you are boggle in landscape and you can see the best view of paris.
Royal!!. I could transport you to another time...to another place. A place with princess and kings. A great place to visit, to take pictures or just to see the sunset

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. This bridge a work of art and you surely have to walk on him. If it is possible only once, then make it late at night. He is especially beautiful days at this time. If it is warm, then you can plunge into the atmosphere of fun on the embankment under it where it is always crowded. There it is possible to sit with a glass of wine which is on sale in various bars directly on the bank of Seine.

Elegant and beautiful. Absolutely the most beautiful bridge in Paris, maybe even the world. Wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower - but make sure you take the time to study all of the amazing sculptures that adorn the bridge - the faces, the eyes - really haunting and beautiful.

The most beautiful bridge?. This would have to be the most beautiful bridge in Paris! Very glamerousAnd for good reason, you won't realise why though till you visit. Take your camera and your selfie stick as you'll want to take photos. I always like walking through this path on my way to the Grand Palais from Invalides.

Georgeous bridge. The bridge is beautiful at all times of day, but especially sunrise and sunset. There are gold colored statues at either end that make it easy to spot. The views are fabulous and really make you feel Paris!
Beautiful Bridge across Seine in Paris. The best time to see this bridge is in the night, it is well lit up and very romantic. Make sure to carry a stole or pullover as it gets pretty chilly at night
A pretty bridge!. This bridge is very pretty. You will enjoy the gilt overlay on the statues. It is very elegant and worthwhile viewing.
Beautiful, Romantic. I can't say much more than you can't stop looking at it, but I have to have 100 characters, 100 now!

One of the most beautiful bridge in the worl. I do write in english as I assume it will most serve my fellow foreign friends.
Just an advise as the Parisian I am, do go on the bridge during summer at sun rise. You will the understand the magic of this bridge.
Beautiful. You can get the feel of this place by a river cruise and many more places like this if you have limited time in Paris .....
Beautiful Architecture. Just beautiful even with all the traffic and tourists just like us, the golden statues really add to the grandeur of the city of love.
Paris. Spectacular bridge worth seeing. We stayed on the right bank and the walk was nice. Many attractions in the area with cafes.
Parisian history and beauty. Exploring here on foot will offer the some of the best photo ops of architecture and history Paris has to offer. If you are camera crazy get an extra card for your dsl.

Very pretty bridge with cool architecture.. The bridge is named after Tsar Alexander III, who left the tripartite with Germany and Turkey to form the Franco-Russian Alliance in 1892. The bridge has the same architectural style of the Grand Palais, on its right bank. The unique thing about the bridge is it is a single span that is low enough to not block the view of the Champs-Élysées or the Invalides. Walk along it, our take a boat ride to get pictures of the amazing crests along the side

The most beautiful & decorated bridge. Alexander Bridge is located centrally between the best attractions of Paris. Consider that the construction of the bridge by end of 19th century, this is very impressive with lamps, winged horses and nymphs in gold color. This bridge is well worth a visit because it is very pecurial and unique.

Unbelievable. You can walk across it going to the "Shopping center of the World" or cross under it on a night cruise (recommended) it is fantastic and historical, do your research. Walking in Paris is the way to get to places, no cabs.

One of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. It's difficult to review a bridge, but this one is lovely. The area around the bridge is just as lovely and nice to take a stroll any time of the day. There are outdoor cafes set up all along the river so you can stop for refreshments. There is also FAVST restaurant underneath the bridge for something more formal
Beautiful Bridge. A beautiful walkable bridge with magnificent facade. You can also view the Bridge from a Seine Riverboat.

As good as it gets.... This is by far one of my favorite bridges anywhere in the World. The only other bridge that I consider having a slightly bigger advantage, as to be Charles Bridge in Prague. But once again, we were so taken by the beauty of Pont Alexandre. It is an iconic part of Paris and a MUST DO!

Very ornate and beautiful!. You can walk above on the street then down the stairs to the riverside. A work of art in a bridge!! We had a bottle of wine on the edge of the river and watched the boats passing under the bridge. Very nice way to pass some time in Paris!
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. A must do. Besides, there are lots of pubs and restaurant underneath. This has become the place to be in Rive Gauche
Iconic Views!. The Pont Alexandre III is a strikingly ornate bridge affording beautiful views down the Seine. It's located in a great area to explore, so definitely worth a visit!
One of the most beautiful in Paris. Gold statues, beautiful design. Nice to go near the Seine to enjoy the view and enjoy a drink just under . Nice spot with friends

It's a fancy bridge in Paris.. What can I say? You have to be there--take a look, walk across it. It's a pretty reasonable walk to go from the Eiffel Tower along the Seine to this bridge and then on through the Tuilleries to the Louvre. It all depends on how much you like to walk.

Fabulously kitschy . One of the world's famous bridges indeed. Well restored and on a sunny day brightly shining from afar.
The bronze sculptures and lamps are unique and a wonderful photo motive with the Eiffel Tower in the background or the Invalides.
beautiful View. A lovely bridge to see!! Such fantastic architecture, set in a lovely spot. And in Summer there are bars below :)

King of the Parisian bridges. Wonderful, romantic bridge with its old style "gas" lamps, golden winged horses, cherubs and incredible views up and down the Seine. Amazing vistas in every direction and absolutely fabulous at night time with the lamps lit and the river sparkling. Great photo ops.

Ornate architectural marvel. This bridge is an architectural marvel of the late nineteenth century -- a single-span steel arch. It is also very beautiful, decorated with gilt-bronze statues and Art Nouveau lamps.
Over-ornate? Possibly. But extremely beautiful.

The Iconic Paris Bridge. So many great sites from this bridge just a block from Concord Square. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the bridge is worth the stop. Obviously, the gold statues on either side are also worth seeing.
Beautiful With Nice View. This is a very beautiful bridge. The design is all very ornate and it is in a great location. I saw the Eiffel Tower for the first time from this bridge!
What a beauty! . I went on a run and happened to run on the bridge on my way to the Eiffel Tower, I do say don't spend to much time but you should at least walk across it once.

Very beautiful bridge.. Not sure how much you can really say about a bridge, but this one is really impressive. Gold statues on each end with awesome light fixtures and gold accents and carvings. It is very beautiful.

Fascinating Romanceeee. for me this is one of the best landmarks in France. I was hoping my fiancee would propose here.. this bridge is Magical! Beautiful sunset views and the bateaux passes from underneath it. the architecture is absolutely Movie material! Love love love! <3 so simple yet so serene and rich! a must see!!!!!
WALK. sightseeing - was windy, very touristic but had good fun! nice and romantic city paris really is.. ..

Walk down the historical bridge. The bridge is one of the most beautiful architectures in Paris. Decorated with lamps and statue, the view is amazing. Looks more beautiful when lit up after sunset.
Do not forget to click pictures from a distance..

Amazing experience of city seeing!. amazing architecture, nice walk experience by the lake. near this a little further there is kids small playground. there also the restaurant around for chilling! have a walk around you will find the robe for relax near here.
but the Bridge it self such a beautiful work of architecture art!!!
Pont Alexandre III. Everything in Paris is so exquisite, so much to see and this is one you don't want to miss. Bridges all up and down this area. Loved the view and area.
Worth the visit. Love the sculptures (golden ones too) along the bridge, v v pretty. There were couples n models doing photo-shoots when I was there. Lovely place for photo-taking.
best view of paris. very nice place to visit in paris.. i enjoyed alot with my frnds .very nice view to click photos.romantic place for couple..
Beautiful bridge. Good to walk across and also you can see its beauty from the Seine boat tours. Its amazing. Beware of pickpockets though.
Elaborate. Lovely oranate bridge, you get a better view , and can appreciate the detail when viewed from a river cruise.
Worth seeing. Definitely worth seeing. We arrived by batobus, the stop is under the bridge. Maybe the most beautiful Paris bridge.
Beautiful Architectural Bridge. This bridge is absolutely beautiful. You need to stop by to admire it and photograph it. The historical architecture is just stunning.

Nice bridge. Not sure if the bridge is worth a special visit, you'll anyway see it from a boat, from the Eiffel Tower, when you drive around etc. But it is an impressive building to see, and well maintained

Beautiful bridge. The bridge is propably the most decorated one in Paris. However, to fully enjoy it, you should see it from the water, so basically durding one of the many boat rides the city offers.

One of the modt beautiful bridge in Paris. The bridge is very beautiful from all sides. I will recommend to go on a boat tour to have the chance to see it from front. Underneatg the bridge (left and right side) you have 2-3 bars where you have drinks and snacks.
Beautiful Bridge.. Just a gorgeous bridge with many beautiful inlaid sculptures throughout. Close to the Grand Palais which houses many exhibits.
Great architecture . I loved the statues on each side and the architecture. Not worthy of being a main attraction but saw it on my way between museums. Very busy intersection.
nice landmark. beautiful bridge that we first saw during our Seine cruise and later recognized during our trips on the city buses and from the of of Eiffel tower.

A piece of St. Pete in Paris. If one living in Erope dreams of visiting St. Petersburg in Russia and for some reasons can't do it, this is the place to go. The lanterns of the bridge are exactly the same lighting the streets of St. Pete as well as the overall style of the bridge and its monuments. The only difference is the sunlight and the warmth of Paris comparing to the usual gloominess of St. Pete, but.... It doesn't spoil the place, not at all ;)
Amazing bridge. Amazing bridge in the middle of Paris above the Seine and next to great museums. It is breath taking to be on this bridge especially on a beautiful sunny day!!!

Wow. It's so flashy!. I'm always stunned by the grandeur of this bridge...all of the gold and ornate design elements. I try and get on the bridge in the early morning to take pictures because almost no one is there and it is really special. It's the fanciest bridge in Paris and worth a few walks across especially at night.

A magical bridge. What a lovely bridge with elegant light fixtures and bridge details.Feeling of floating over the river. Take care for it always seems to have a heavy flow of traffic. A surprise were the views of the city especially of the Eiffel tower off in the distance.
Great sculptures and a riverwalk. Excellent location en route to the Eiffel Tower on the bank of Seine, it provides a great view of the river and the The Army Museum.

Worthy of movie location. Like you see in some of the movies, the Pont Alexandre is quite picturesque and has wonderful views of the river and other points of interest around it. The bridge itself is beautifully adorned with golden statues, it is quite nice to walk and take pictures during the day or night. Seem this is popular for couples taking prenup pics and videos, so be prepared for some interesting folks dressed in different styles of wedding attires, sampling the multi cultural Paris life.
Like in old stories. To stand in night and walk along the bridge-pont Alexandre III is like going back to past days , nice feeling.

Sunny day must. They don't garnish bridges like this anymore but who would build anything less when you see what's on either side. Endless photo ops and what better place to get a pic on the bridge overlooking the Seine with the Eiffel Tower in the background? It's also pretty impressive from one of the many river boat cruises at night.

Beautiful Parisian Architecture . Another gorgeous structure spanning the Seine. A lovely ornate entrance adorened with golden statues. Enjoyable to walk across and see the views. Paris is a great city and this is another worthy landmark.

A perfect way to see Paris. My husband and I spent the day walking around Paris from the Eiffel Tower to the Arc du Triomphe, around the Champs Elysses, etc. The best views of Paris can be seen by just walking around the city. The Pont Alexandre is beautiful in itself but also gives off such a perfect Parisian feel.
The bridge, the sites, the Seine ... beautiful!. A great place to head to while walking the Seine. The statues are magnificent and walking along the Seine is a treat!

Nice sculptures!. If you visit across the Seine the Invalides, you can walk the bridge back. There are some really nice sculptures and you'll find many married couples that get there for the after ceremony photos!

Well. It is just a bridge. But still the most impressing bridge. Probably the most impressing bridge in Paris. And crossing this when walking in by the river Seine, it is on a warm day a very nice sight.
Beautiful. I think this landmark is worth getting up early for to avoid the crowds and get good pictures. We took a bike ride, 30 euros for 30 minutes and it was a great way to see these areas.

Very nice view of the Seine and the Bateaux Moches. This was a very nice area to stroll and admire the view of the Seine and the many Bateaux Moches going up and down the river. We also found an artist who painted the local scenery on tiles!
Great statues!!!. The bridge is amazing, but the statues on the side are more eyes-catching when you pass by in a sunny day.
Very scenic view of the Seine. Great place for a photo and to people watch. In close proximity to the Grand Palais. Plan on spending 20 minutes before moving on to your next destination.
Romantic rendezvous spot before dinner!. This bridge would not be featured in numerous films if it didn't have it's own unique character and style. MUST. PASS. HERE.

One of the most beautiful bridges in one of the most beautiful cities. This bridge signified friendly relationship between France and Russia in the end of the 19th century. Thus, the architecture is very rich and appealing

romantic walk in the evening. You can walk after louvre along the river to reach here.Beautiful Spot and the sun was shining lovely location for our last morning in the City.Its very beautiful with golden statues.
The Bridge. This is the one. This is functioning artwork in Paris and your gateway to incredible walks on either side of the Seine.

Beautiful. a beautiful iconic Paris sight, perfect for picture taking opportunities or just leaning against the balustrading watching the world go by. A lovely place to see the view of the sparkling Eiffel Tower in the evening, and a stunning view of les Invalides , great for photos. Sadly disappointed to see selfish visitors placing love locks on it however, please stop!
Fantastic !. Amazing gold statues on bridge. Bridge leads to the Champs Elysees. Well worth a visit. Nice view from the bridge.
Fantastic view. Great walk and fantastic view, you can walk up till the army museum (hotel invalide). Great opportunity for taking some scenic photos, especially on a sunny afternoon by the river!
Even Their bridges are a work of Art!. When in Paris you will notice that even their bridges are works of art. This is one that is very intricate with the construction.
views of effiel tower. Crossed it on way to something els , seem to be a spot people like to film movies, take modeling pictures and such
My favorite bridge!. I've been to Paris six times since 1999, and I always have to come back to this bridge. Beautiful details. Hard to take it all in on just one visit.
Beautiful Bridge. I think most people take a couple of photo's of this beautiful bridge if they are a tourist in Paris (just as we did). Gorgeous during the day and beautiful all lit up at night.

Gorgeous. I found a lot of architecture in Paris to be simpler than expected. You may not share the same attraction but I love grand Roman kind of "in your face" architectural glory. Call it poor taste, who cares :)... I loved the bridge with all its gold and elaborate sculpting and the location by the equally grand Petite and Grand Palaces.Great place for pictures, nice view of the Eiffel Tower, if you're into that sort of thing.

The movie Paris. This is around the Champs-Elysee and was the first spot where I landed and felt 'this is Paris'. The bridge connects the area to Eiffel tower and the whole place is a beauty. This is Where "Someone like you" of Adele was shot. Definitely worth visiting.

Such a beautiful bridge!. Lovely view overlooking the Eiffel Tower and River Seine. You should definitely visit the bridge after dark on the 5 first minutes of the hour to enjoy magical spark of the Eiffel!
Pont Alexandre III. It is a gorgeous bridge! The nicest in Paris! It is full of art and gorgeous lights! Definitely a must see of Paris!
the best bridge in paris. absolutely great, magnificent gilded statues, an art form on itself, there is not much more to say on a bridge

Incredible Detailing . This was one of my favorites of the many bridges that crosses the River Seine, and not just because I got engaged by it. In a city that is art itself, it never ceases to amaze me how many facets of that city still stun. The Pont Alexandre III is a beautiful example of that art and the intricate, delicate detailing I saw all over the city.
Visited with Fat Tire Tours Paris. Absolutely beautiful views of many monuments of Paris from here! See my review of Fat Tire Tours Paris for more information.
My favorite bridge in Paris!. What's not to love about Pont Alexandre! It's just glorious especially lit up at night. A pleasant way to stroll across the Seine!
Best Bridge in Paris. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris and is well worth a visit.Nearby is the statutes of de Gaulle and Churchill

THE MOST BEAUTIFUL BRIDGE IN PARIS!!!!. Wasn't so lucky with the weather and it waw raining the time we visited this moster piece!!! But i insist to my point of view! Is the most beautiful bridge in Paris!!!! Im sure next time i will see ti sunny!!!
Most beautiful of Paris's bridges. Ornately decorated bridge across the Seine River. Great place to take pictures or walk across on your next trip to Paris!

My favourite bridge.... I thought the Pont Neuf was going to be great but this bridge is my favourite hands down! It is very ornate and the view of the Eiffel Tower is good from a distance. Paris is a beautiful city and although this was one of the first sights we saw it remains a favourite.

Beautiful bridge. Walking this bridge to admire the decorative features or to watch the boats plying the Seine is fun for everyone, but to stand on it at sunset or to watch the glitter of the Eiffel Tower is special indeed.
Bridge with style. Very beautiful bridge with nice statues, lots of style with amazing views. Crossed bridge many times and every time stopped to take it all in.
The most gorgeous bridge in Paris. Looks awesome during the day but more interesting at night. Best place to take pictures at Invalides

Most interesting and beautiful bridge in Paris!. Absolutely stunning in deisgn and structure. Highly recommend this for everyone to see. In particular, one can take nice pictures of the Eiffel Tower in the not so far distance.
Nice looking bridge. It's a nice looking bridge facing Invalides on one side . . . also nice looking from the river side, if you take a boat trip

beautiful bridge, worth to see. it is a beautiful bridge to visit and take pictures.
could consider crossing over if walking from Arc de Triumphe to the Eiffel tower

Our favourite place in Paris. After two trips to Paris we still revel in the photos and pictures of the bridge. It is incredible and is surrounded by amazing buildings. Suggest you take a tour bus around Paris first to get all the useful information about the bridge before walking it. The history and significance and meaning of the art works is lost unless you get the commentary. We also took a river boat tour and the art on the side and below the bridge is amazing

Probably one of the most spectacular bridges in Europe. Take a walk over this bridge when the sun is at a good angle (before sunset/after dawn) and it lights up in gorgeous golden hues. One of my favourite bridges, and a must-see area of Paris. Take a stroll over it, and if you can go under it on a boat as well, then even better. A great photo opportunity with the Hotel d'Invalides at one end and the palace and Champs Elysee at the other.
Spectacular bridge. We saw this bridge while travelling on the Seine on a batobus. It is absolutely spectacular and just kept taking pictures.
Unmissable after dark. One of the most beautiful bridges I have seen in the world. Take time during the day to look at the detail and return after dark to wallow in Parisian atmosphere

The bridge over the Seine.. In fact, this bridge is a work of art, and it still has a practical importance as pedestrian and traffic connection over the Seine. Beautiful architecture and decorative elements give this bridge even more pomposity. It is possible to walk over it and explore it on a river bus.

Lovely place . My husband made his proposal to me on this bridge in October last year, now we had married for 3 months, it's so nice to have a walk at the evening and just cross it you can have a boat tour with wonderful banquet in the evening to see the beautiful Seine river with lots of splendid buildings and the Eiffel towel with shining golden lights. Super!

My favorit bridge in Paris. Must to see! And it is difficult not to see it - it is so splendid! Beauty from all diferent point of view - from the river, from the top of the Eiffel Tower, from down the quai and on the Pont
Best bridge ever!. This Pont is amazing and Romantic, if you are in coulple or with friends it is a good option, make sure to take a map with you for back after enjoyed this amazing view.
This one is elegant. All the bridges have their own charms and stories but this one - tres elegant. Seeing at night is an absolute must too.

This counts as a tourist location?. It's a bridge. To be fair, it is a nice bridge with decorations. But it is mostly functional. I walked, starting on one side of the river, and ended up on the other side. It worked!

Very nice, but it's still just a bridge. This is not Tower Bridge in London. And while it has outstanding features - really cool gold statues, great views, you are in Paris and there is lots of great architecture. If you are crossing the river to go to the Hôtel National des Invalides (Army museum and Napoleon's Tomb), definitely cross on this bridge. Or if you are at the Place de la Concorde, walk to the river for a view of this bridge. It is really nice. But ultimately, it's just a bridge with cool architecture.I gave it a higher rating because under this bridge was a scene from one of my favorite movies. Fans of Ronin with Robert De Niro will recognize the arms deal scene that was filmed under this bridge.
You must see it!. We took a boat ride on Seine and saw this bridge. Of all the bridges on Seine this one is the most beautiful.

Absolutely flawless execution of allowing passage over water. If you're looking to cross the river around this part of town, this bridge is a really safe way to do it. Driving, biking or even walking - they're all possible thanks to this bridge. 10/10 would cross again.

Another bridge. Still worth having a look though.. Nice bridge over the Seine river.
Iron seems to dominate the construction. Golden details all over.
Worth walking through it at least. Nice for pictures too.

Sunset Perfection. Absolutely great place to view the Parisienne sunset. Watch the boats cruise down the Seine and watch the city of lights come to life with the Eiffel Tower light show and then the rest of the city lights warm up.
Enjoyed. If you like to people watch or love bridges it's awesome. Beautiful craftsmanship displayed with variety of statues and accents of brass
Beautiful!. This is the most beautiful bridge we've ever seen. Beautiful and majestic! I never tire of visiting it or taking pictures from different vantage points. Don't miss it!
A Nice walk. It's nice to take a stroll if the weather is good. And you can take lots of pictures too ! From there you can have a good view of the tower too~

Beautiful Bridge. We crossed this bridge a number of times it is very impressive and definitely worth seeing as it has a great view of the river and the Palaces. Although it is just that a bridge there is no further attraction.

BRIDGE IN PARIS. I have crossed many bridges but none with this class . Sculptures and gold accents along with all the cast iron frame make this something spectacular bridge you have to take time to enjoy.
Magnificent bridge opulence personified. Simply stunning well worth the walk to. The other bridges pale in comparison. The lights are a work of art.

The most beautiful Paris bridge. Pont neuf might be the most known, maybe even the most popular bridge in Paris but the most beautiful without a doubt is Alexandre lll. This is decorated bridge which connects the Grand & petite Palaces with the Invalide park. I think behind the large building in this park is also where Napoleon is buried.Very elegant bridge over 200 years old and I think it must be visited by all Paris visitors

It's awesome. Beautiful bridge. I love this bridge. This and Carl bridge(in prague) is my favorite bridge. Bridge itself is beautiful and you can see Towel Effel also on this bridge. Many cool golden statues .

"Our Bridge...". This bridge is my absolute favorite spot in all of Paris, and it will forever hold a special place in my heart. My husband and I return to it daily when we are in the city, and recently celebrated our 30th Wedding Anniversary in Paris,ending our day with a dance on the bridge. So we're not the only corny folks who adore the bridge - at sunset on most weekend evenings brides and grooms gather for pictures. It's so popular with photography enthusiasts who also cannot resist its charms.
Majestic and lovely. The architecture of this famous bridge is exquisite and beautiful. We had a chance to see it from the boat in the evening which provided a different perspective for sure.
Romantic and gorgeous. What can be more romantic than being in paris, on a really beautifull bridge in the river seine? Yeah, i'm right, don't miss this stop when in paris!
bridge of gold. As you get closer to the bridge you are amazed of the design and the sculpture. Worth it, since you are going to pass it. Makes the river view more interesting

Best photographed from a river cruise. I found that I was able to get some really good shots of the bridge from a river cruise standing at the back of the boat.But you have walk over it too to appreciate how pretty it is.
Romantic bridge. This is a nice place for romantic walk in the evening . You can walk after louvre along the river to reach here. Its very beautiful with golden statues .
Paris Marathon 2016 & Sightseeing Trip. We took a few pictures here on our way up to the Hotel Des Invalides. Beautiful Spot and the sun was shining lovely location for our last morning in the City.

Beautiful bridge. Pont Alexandre III is one of the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It is very suave with the four golden statues. If you take the river tour it goes beneath the bridge and from there is looks really beautiful.
Beautiful!. Charming and romantic. This bridge is beautiful. You can appreciate better its beauty from a Senna river trip.

My favorite bridge in Paris. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It is very opulent with the four golden statues. If you take the river tour it goes beneath the bridge and gives you a brief hustory of the bridge.

My favorite bridge in World. This city surprise you very often! And Alexander bridge was one of the surprises. And if you go at night, when the clock is on right time like, 20h00, because this way you can see the light show of Eiffel Tower.
Beautiful. On nice weather days, this area is quite busy but well worth it. I grabbed a chair a little bar along the river and enjoyed the afternoon here.
The most decorative bridge in Paris. It is a combination of French & Russian cultures, the elegant golden statues maccompanied with grey & balck stones is really worth visiting.
Stunning bridge. This might be the most beautiful bridge that I've ever seen. The gold work alone leaves a lasting impression. We walked across it on a beautiful sunny day and it was magical.

It has to be Seen!. I walked from the Louvre down to the Eiffel Tower making sure I passed Pont Alexandre on my way. Wow is all I can say. It is unbelievable the detail on it and you definitely have to see this when in Paris.
Golden moment. Worth looking a! Phenomenal decoration on an iconic road bridge. A serious photo opportunity among the many that this city has to offer.

Beautiful historic monument. Pont Alexandre III bridge is a beautiful example of French architecture that connects the Champs-Elysées quarter with the Invalides district, overlooking the Seine. It is extremely beautiful and historic (built in the late 1800's) and was named after Tsar Alexandre III. My favourite part is the four "fames", the golden statues at the four 'corners' of the bridge, each with a pegasus. The fames on the left bank are the fames of Commerce and Industry, and the right bank hold the fames of Art's and Sciences. The Pont Alexandre III is more than just a bridge - it is a beautiful example of French architecture, art, and history.

Beware of Pickpockets, Groups or Single.. My husband and I were crossing the bridge to return to our rented apartment on Rue d' Orsay about 8:30-9:00 PM.There was a group of younger 20- something people behind us but not too close. Then I saw they had gone and we were alone for 1000' or so. Out of nowhere I felt my cross body handbag bumped from behind. I stopped, turned and gave the dark-haired lady a look. I told and motioned for her to go ahead. There was no reason to bump us because there was no one else around. She went around then turned back to make conversation to say with a smile, "Excuse me madame, what did you say?" I gave her another look and waived her off. She walked away. These people were all dark haired and light- brown skintone. The woman that came up to me had long black hair, wearing a scarf around her neck, well groomed but dressed very casual. I was very thankful how much I had read about this before our trip. My cross body was mostly in front of me and had zippers. All I had on me was lipstick and a few items anyway. Our important items were worn under our clothes and some in our under garments. On another note:We were taking pictures outside Berthillion Icecream on the island. When we returned home, I happened to zoom in on the people right outside the restaurant next door to Berthillion. You can clearly see a pickpocket working. I felt so bad that we didn't see it and were not able to help this poor lady when it happened. If you look at the couple to his left, the lady in the maroon long sweater, long hair and torn jeans, this is also how the gangs look and may be as well. It's so hard to see the forest for the trees, but please remember not to wear anything of importance on the outside of your clothing. Try to keep a distance, if possible, and turn around occasionally to see who's behind you. They hate that! They work in groups, then split up. You will see a lot working the major tourist areas. Be safe and have fun!

Lovely Bridge. I also live in a city of bridges, so I like to look at bridges when I travel. This one is particularly lovely with the huge statues at each end. It's also in a lovely area, so it's a great spot for photos (no selfies please).

Beautiful bridge. This is one of the best bridges in Paris. It is close to other attractions and is nice when you're walking along the river. It does have vehicle traffic so be careful with young kids. The statues at the end are gorgeous and impressive. Well worth a visit!
Interesting Bridge with lots of history. Very Interesting with Russian history, bridge is named after Czar Alexandre III, has inpressive statues on 4 corners.

Good things await. This is a bridge. In Paris. Of course it's going to be somewhat special just because. However, the fact that it is so near Les Invalides, the grand palace, and overlooks the Seine does not hurt. Go, if nothing else than to take your selfies that no one else on Facebook will care about.

Gorgeous architecture!. My goal is photographing architecture so this bridge was treat. It's close to Invalides and also the Grand and Petite Palaces so it's a great area for photography. Nice views of the Eiffel tower from the bridge as well.
Well, its just another bridge. While it is nice to look at and there are lots of people walking, standing, kissing on it, the fact remains that it is just another bridge !
Well... it is a fancy bridge after all. Nice view with fancy decorations on the bridge. You could cross the bridge, but could imagine it be more beautiful when sailing from beneath

Beautiful Bridge. In my opinion this has to be the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It connects the Eiffel Tower area with the Champs Elysee. There are four gilded flames which increases its beauty. It is a French Historical Monument and well worth a visit.
It's a bridge. Well, it certainly is the most decorated bridge in Paris. But it didn't feel particularly special or romantic to me. I preferred the Pont de Bir-Hakeim.
Beautiful, historic landmark. This is a beautiful, historic landmark. You can, off course, walk over it. But the best view is from beneath, when sailing on a boat on the river Seine.

A fancy bridge. Ok unlike some others I wasn't exactly blown away by a bridge, yes it crosses the river and yes it has statues which are neat to view but the primary function is a bridge to cross a body of water.
My favourite bridge in Paris. The Pont Alexandre III is one of the most incredible bridge structures in Paris. Ornate, beautiful and impressive... with a great view of the Eiffel Tower.

Great time!. You can take this bridge to the notre dame church, Shakespeare's bookstore or thebridge of locks. In September it was another perfect day of blue skies and sunshine. There were street performers, art created with chalk on the road, an awesome jazz band playing and tour boats floating under the bridge.

One of the nicest bridges. Beautiful architectural detail is the centrepiece of this well located bridge right in the heart of Paris... its the small stuff when you get close up that makes it so impressive

Like a Woody Allen Film. This bridge is an amazing walk to do. Especially if you are with a date, this is a good place to go. The architecture and beautiful lighting will feel like a throwback in time.

Its a big bridge. Its a big bridge, very nice architecture and history. Which is beautifully built and looks great at night (like many other buildings in Paris). But at the end its just a bridge. Good for a photo or two.

Wonderful bridge!. Wow! I have never seen so much art in a bridge before crossing the Alexandre III. Amazing. Make sure you plan your itinerary in order to have at least half an hour to dedicate to this Parisian masterpiece!
A Beautiful Bridge. Walk over this stunning bridge in Paris that goes over the Seine for breathtaking views of the city as you make your way to the Eiffel Tower.
A bridge worth crossing. This bridge offers amazing opportunities for great photos and it is in your way to almost all main attractions. It is worth crossing it at taking some pictures.
A real "wow" factor. As bridges go, this one rivals those in Rome and Venice. Stunning, with all of it's statutes and gold work. A real shock to the system in amongst all the other bridges.
Just Beautiful and so French. It's really just a bridge across the river, but very beautiful, especially the statues at the entrances and the sculptures on the middle of the bridge

You can`t miss it. As far as bridges go it`s one of the best in Paris. It`s decorative design, gold statues and ornaments makes it stand out and apart. It`s automatically recognizable even at a glimpse from a distance. Anther interesting view comes when you take a river cruse.
Beautiful bridge, stunning views. Definitely worth a walk over at sunset. Stunning views toward the Eiffel tower! And the bridge itself is beautiful with amazing sculpture work
Magnificent Bridge. The night captures this beautiful bridge... I enjoy the little "antiques" market at the foot of the bridge along the riverfront.

My favourite bridge- beautiful. Worth a visit if you are exploring the city. Truly beautiful, just beware of the girls asking for signatures- do not speak to them they are trying to get you to sign to take your money or steal from you. They are all over the city.

Nice view of Eiffel tower. Beautiful spot in Paris to walk through and enjoy the sophisticated architect and magnificent statues. You will enjoy a very beautiful view of eiffel tower.
Perfect for taking nice photos.

Nothing so special. I spent 30 mins in this bridge , Nothing so special
You can enjoy the view of the river.
But off-course if you have the time in Paris you can go and visit.

The most beautiful bridge in the city. This is the best bridge in the city. In one direction you have the invalides and in the other one the gran palais. The decorations on it make it unique and a nice spot for photos. It is very common to see photo sesions of weddings and models. There are some bars along the river near the bridge as well. Excellent ambience during summer.
Gorgeous. We went on a tour we all enjoyed seeing how gorgeous the bridge was. You could see it from far away. We went on a water boat tour so you could see it coming up and it was so pretty.

Cours La Reine. On my travels along the Seine I walked through Cours La Reine. I have to say Paris and its beautiful buildings have left me wanting more. My time was short and therefore choosing to travel along the Seine in the Batoboat was a good choice enabling me to get off where I wanted and giving me an amazing overview of some of the historical points of Paris.

A beautiful bridge, with some surprises.. This place is really cool: the bridge itself is a work of art, full of statues and gilded sculptures. Next the views, both of the Seine and the surrounding buildings, are stunning. And finally, surprises await if you go down the stairs on each side of the Seine, with a club, restaurants, and the promenades on both sides of the river! Lots of things to look forward to!
Awesome bridge. The statues on the either ends are great and the statues along the bridge sides are also awesome. You can take pictures with eiffel tower on the background from this bridge.

A Magnificent Bridge!!. Among many magnificent bridges. This one is quite special with it amazing adorning sculptures & views!!The bridges in Paris are magnificent & majestic , just an experience to meander across viewing the scenes from each one. The boats passing beneath, the art that adorns them, the amazing views of the city from each direction. It is an experience of its own just bridge walking!! Do it!!
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Definitely walk along this bridge and admire not only its beauty but the views of the city as well and you will not be disappointed.
Beautiful bridge architecture. Its a big bridge, very nice architecture and history. Which is beautifully built. But at the end its just a bridge. Good for a photo or two.

This is a beautiful bridge with great shots of the Seine River.. You will love this bridge with the big gold statues and great view of the Seine River. I love it here. Watch the traffic as rules of pedestrians do not apply. You will be run over. I try to cross where the guards are it is safer. This is near some of the high up castles and tourist areas. So as of March 2016 is heavily armed by the military and policy. Take only what you need when getting into the sites for you will be check and bags as well. As this is Paris hold tight to all bags and be very aware of your surrounding as Paris is the worst for scams and pickpockets. Know who's up on you and around you at all times. The guards do not make the trash stay away. They will even sometime turn a eye if the person is only scamming you.
Great View. Once I passed the bridge and walked slightly to the east and looked back, the view of the Eiffel Tower and the city was quite amazing from there.

baroque French-Russian Grandeur. One of the last Romanov stars, Alexander, gave the statuary to the French republic for this bridge and created a breathtaking street museum. Think fairy tale or perfume ad ( a few of them have been filmed in this setting) Beautiful at any time of the day, but especially so in the wee hours of the morning at sunrise or sunset.

The Bridge of Dreams. Be sure to take a walk over the Pont Alexandre III bridge while in Paris. This historic bridge crosses the river Seine and allows for a viewpoint of both sides of the beautiful area. Be a part of history.
It's a bridge. It's a bridge a nice bridge and impressive but it's a bridge just like the many others that cross the river. Worth stopping by on route to see all the other main attractions.

Found by Accident!. My girlfriend and I were wandering around the city on foot and ended up on this bridge by mistake! It was very beautiful to look at and was a great find since we were not searching for anything in particular. Wanted to review it now since it's great to admire and I'm glad we happened upon it!

Eye-poppingly beautiful. Hands down, the most beautiful bridge in Paris, with its sumptuous statues, mouldings and gold-leaf adornments. If you cna drag yourself out of bed, get down there on Sunday morning in May, around 5:30am when good wa=eather is expected. Enjoy Paris with virtually no cars (yet) and just enjoy this bridge and the wondrous buildings either side, as the day breaks and the sun comes up. Incredible!

Beautifully maintained landmark. The area around here is really impressive. Take the whole day to view the bridge from the river and then visit the Rodin Gallery and les invalides all within a short walk.
Good walk. Walking around this area is great. loved the place which has great artistry around. wonderful experience.

beautiful, but just a bridge. Definitely the most beautiful bridge in Paris, I saw it while on a boat in the seine and it made for good photos, but in the end it is just a bridge. Maybe there is more to it historically, but I have no idea.

Beautiful bridge. The Location: Metro #15, Exit "Champs Elysees Clemenceau"Beautiful bridge next to Grand Palais. Love the gold statues, so elegant!! Beautiful view to take pictures on the bridge. There are a few museums nearby. Definitely can spend a few hours there.
this was very special.. We took in the sights from a boat as mentioned in another review, but i had to write on especially for this. It was soooo beautiful. Just really something special.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Pont Alexandre III is without a doubt the most beautiful bridge in Paris. The bridge in itself is worth visiting to see its ornate details. It also provides beautiufl views of Les Invalies, the Eiffel Tower and the Seine.

The most beautiful bridge. Separating Les Invalides from the Grand Palais and Petit Palais is this incredible bridge. I was blown away by the 4 pillars at each corner with golden statues that shine magnificently when the sun hits them. The area on the Les Invalides side has a huge grassy area and along with the wide road makes the area feel like one of the most spacious areas in Paris. It makes for a nice walk along the river back toward the city centre; however, I picked a bad time to be here as I was caught in a sudden and heavy shower. There was nowhere to hide from it and it came so quickly that myself and a group of people were left trying to huddle under a tiny piece of shelter at a bus stop until it passed over. I learnt my lesson and kept a watch on the sky for the rest of the day and managed to avoid the rest of showers after that.

Stunning, day and night. Featured in so many romantic Parisian films, this bridge is just as charming as you would expect. Make sure to take a good quality camera - no filters necessary. Tip: Be sure to visit day AND night.

Architecture. We love this bridge and its design and architecture. In addition, it is a great little spot to take some wonderful "touristy" photos. The art work on and of the bridge is spectacular and grand in its scope. It was is an easy & enjoyable walk from our hotel in the 6 arr., and after our photo ops on the bridge, we strolled over to and up the Champs-Elysee .

One of the best bridge on Seine. This bridge is very beautiful
You can have view at the seine level on left quay side
Nice golden sculpture and lights all along
Enjoy.. The most beautiful bridge to cross in Paris. Take your time for taking photos and enjoying the view.
Beautiful bridge. This is a beautiful bridge that represents history in France. The sculptures are absolutely unbelievable.
Great Picture Spot. Good place to take a picture of the Eiffel Tower from the distance. The view is beautiful and there is not that much tourist.
Oneof a kind beautiful bridge. Incredible design and sculptures over the Seine. Much more than a river crossing, it is an experience of a journey not just a destination to the other side.

Beatiful both on and under. Pont Alexandre III is one of Paris' most beautiful bridges. It offers beautiful views of the Seine, and views from a boat ride offer interesting views. I suggest at least a stroll across to appreciate the artistic detail.

Lovers paradise. Another spendid place to to visit in Paris. Initially I thought people are gathered to have a view of the river and boats. Of course the view was picture perfect. But this bridge is also famous for lovers and their bonding. I am an Indian and heard lots of love stories back home. I was wondering how a bridge can bring the lovers together. Whether some lovers jumped of the bridge or did lovers from different ends used to come and meet on this bridge ? But no, i saw lots of locks tied on the bridge railings. I understood from locals that lovers tie the locks, write their names on the locks and throw the keys in the river. its a belief that by doing this lovers will be always together beyond life.Amazing is nt it. the feeling of love is same everywhere.salute to true lovers

My favorite bridge in Paris. The detail of the bridge is extraordinary. Take the time to walk around it and see it all. The gold paint is always shiny and striking to view. Also, try to see it in the evening, when its lit up. Some of your best pictures will be of this bridge.This bridge epitomizes Paris to me: Class, Beautiful, and Historical.

Beautiful view!. We visited in the beginning of March so it was a bit chilly and rained on and off and this is still a wonderful bridge. It offers a beautiful view and has many street vendors and tour guides on it that you can choose from

Photo opportunity . Worth taking some pictures and checking out the gold statues and lamps, if you are passing by. The gold is not real, but there are interesting details on the lamps symbolising the Franco-Russian relationship and the reason the bridge was built at that time.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Cross the most beautiful bridge in Paris and be stunned by its architecture and stunning angel statues.

A Bridge to take your breath away. We squeezed in as much as possible to see in Paris over three days...but only saw a fraction of what there is to enjoy. This bridge and many others are beautiful and give you a sense of what this city's history is about.

Beautiful!! . There is simply no wrong turn for a walk in this stunning and history filled City. Port Alexander III is another fine example of what this timeless city has to offer the history and architecture lovers. Stunning views of the river Seine and all the fabulous buildings.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. The architecture of this bridge is outstanding and you have a great view on the Seine- it's one of the most beautiful bridge in the world. The background is also great, between the Grand Palais and the Panthéon.
A perfect place for photos and city views. I have crossed this bridge many times in my 50 plus years of coming here and never tire of the view from the midway point.
A beautiful work of art.. You many say it is just a bridge, but what a beautiful bridge, whether morning or evening, daylight or moonlight.
Paris Ponts. It is Paris, it is Senna.. It is full of lovely Ponts to walk through, take some pictures, enjoy the architecture...
amazing and interesting place. pont Alexandre III is an amazing attraction to see , walking through it is so beautiful , interesting .
Beautiful bridge... très Parisien!!!. Do it... walk over it.. enjoy and enjoy both of its sides.... and imagine how things were way back when.... it adds a whole new dimension to your experience....
Beautiful bridge on river seine . A very nice bridge on river seine . With statues and beautiful decoration. Cross the river and admire the art and good air .

Our 1st stop in Paris was here. On a gloomy winters day in Paris over the Seine River in Paris is Pont Alexandre III joining the left and right bank. Close to Musee D'Orsay and an easy walk to Central Paris Paris from here.
plan it as part of your travels. Iconic views from this bridge, one direction Grand Palais, other direction Napoleon's tomb, view from a boat ride looking up
A great place from which to see the Eiffel Tower. A lovely bridge in its own right, with numerous statues - but it is also a good spot to see the Eiffel Tower.

One of the most beautiful bridges. Well worth a visit. A stunning structure especially when the sun is shining, highlighting the gold on the statues and embelishments.
Go down the steps to the river and unfortunately you will see that graffiti vandals have struck even this wonderful piece of art!

Another amazing bridge.. So many of the awe inspiring views of the Seine.I was extremely blessed to have my flat right across the Seine from The Louvre so I hit ALL of the bridges and was aware of every SECOND as I crossed over each one. This was my first day in Paris and I was so overcome by the sheer
Great for photo shots. You can capture many nice views from the bridge area; e.g. Grand Palais, Palis Bourbon, etc. The decorations on the bridge's railings are very interesting and pretty!

Very Nice and lovely to walk. I walked along the river and it's very pretty bridge with beautiful statue and close to army museum which is i love it so much. I came here 2 times, in a day time I walked from the metro until the end of a long day of sightseeing. During night time I walked from Eiffel Tower to the Louvre via Pont Alexandre and it was very nice,beautiful and romantic. It's the city of light.
Ornate and magestic. This bridge is best seen while walking or when on a river cruise. It takes a while to take in all the grandeur. A bridge as beautiful as the city itself.

Lovely walk to share. We walked along the river at night, then crossed here to go back and catch the Metro back to our hotel. It was a beautiful, romantic, leisurely way to end a long day of sightseeing. A bridal couple was having a major photo shoot (multiple assistants, full wedding party, major lighting), and with that, the nighttime boat tours, and the Eiffel Tower's light show, it was stunning. I really don't usually like lights at night (often tacky and gauche), but Paris is a different thing all together. It is the City of Light. Didn't think I'd love it, but I did.

The Belle Epoque remains of Paris. Built in 1900 for The World Exhibition the bridge Alexander III is along with both Grand and Petit Palais the remains of a period the French call La Belle Epoque or the beautiful period prior to World War 1! As it stands today it makes a dramatic framing device in movies and any tourists in Paris.

Very nice walk. Very pretty bridge with accompanied statues. Makes for a very nice walk. Very close to the army museum. We walked from the Eiffel Tower to the Louvre via Pont Alexandre III and it was very do able.

Not just a boring bridge. When my father told me we were going to see this bridge I wasn't very interested but when we crossed it I found I enjoyed looking at the beautiful decorations on this bridge. I strongly recommend people to take a look at this and urge people to give it a chance instead of ignoring it or taking another route to the other side as this is quite a great photo opportunity.
Romantic. Must see or take a stroll upon. During the night its wonderfully lit up and its an attraction of Paris - the city of lights and it is not far from the centre
Gorgeous. Walking along the river is an experience unlike any other in the world. This area of Paris is beautiful.

Sprawling Bridge adorned by sculptures. Pont Alexandre III is a highly decorated bridge over the seine in Paris that is adorned with Cherubs, Horses and Golden Statues. It is located just along the river from the Eiffel tower and leads up to the Champs-Elysee. Worth a look as it is a great place to take photo's!

Bridge over the Seine. Pont Alexandre III is a beautiful structure to walk over and UNDER. Walk along the Seine on the lower level of the bridge and enjoy the structure with its striking detail and guilded carvings on the face and underside. At the Seine level there is a park for children before the bridge. The bridge is a must-see sight on your next visit to Paris.

Beautiful view at day and night. Such a beautiful view of the river... Whichever angle we look, it's such a beauty! We stopped by at night too, Magnificent! I never thought that there will be a bridge that can showcase us such beautiful view. From here, you will see Eiffel Tower glowing at night. Beautiful!

Not my favourite, but stunning nonetheless. The bridges over the Seine are one of the highlights of Paris and this is one of the more remarkable of them.The detail and intricacy of the design is amazing and it's scale makes it one of the eye catching features of this city.
Best vista. One of my trip's highlights. This is a gorgeous bridge. From a photographer's point of view this is awsomeness. My favorite.

fascinating.... We happened to visit this bridge during the boat ride on river seine...and believe you me this to be the most fascinating and romantic bridges that i have seen...awesome architecture with cherubs and flying horses on its ends...you get an amazing view of the eiffel tower as well from the bridge...To our surprise the bridge was designed by Gustave Eiffel - the designer f Eiffel Tower...
Beautiful view. Heading back to my hotel and walked along the tree lined avenue. Beautiful view with a lot of photo opportunities.

The most beautiful bridge on the Seine. The Pont Alexandre III was built for the 1900 Universal Exhibition. It’s probably the most beautiful bridge in Paris, and definitely my favourite. This magnificent iron bridge connects the Hotel des Invalides on the left bank with the Grand Palais and Petit Palais on the right bank of the River Seine. It offers an unobstructed view of the Invalides complex and provides a great spot to photograph the Eiffel Tower. The ornate lamps and statues on this richly decorated bridge are absolutely stunning. The best place to admire the beautifully intricate ironwork is the river bank, from which you can see the bridge in all its glory. I highly recommend to take a leisurely stroll across the bridge, enjoy the great views of Paris, and soak up the magical atmosphere of this place.
Best place to take romantic photos. The view from this bridge is fantastic. You see the Eiffel Tower ! The river ! The lights on the bridge are fantastic too. Must go.
A pont... After all. It's free. It's a bridge. It's free. Pretty much that. It's beautiful tho and if you go close to the seine you will find a nice boat bar ;)Very romantic!

Stand out bridge. Walked along the river for a while and when we got to this bridge it definitely stood out above the others. Actually came in search of this particular bridge as its the bridge that Mariah Carey shot part of her Say Somethin music video on! Nice in the evening when the gold sculptures start to glow
Very Pretty. Worth your while to walk over to the bridge, nice view of the river, etc. The status and art works are very nice.
Great!. Beautiful place with great atmosphere. Perfect for evening walk. I would definitely recommend this place.

Beautiful bridge. Stunning bridge to walk over. It has four gilt-bronze stature which are beautiful. Its been in a number of film that I like A View to a Kill, Midnight in Paris and Adele's song Someone like You. So I was really looking forward to crossing this bridge.
Beautiful bridge. It is a very nice place to walk on, it look really beautiful and seems very carefully taken care of.
amazing bridge. this attractive place is so nice , a lovely bridge which we walked through it and it was fantastic place ,

A virtuoso bridge to cross the Seine River!. Built in the late nineteenth century for the 1900 Universal Exhibition, this bridge is built in iron. The scope of the arch is 107 meters with only 3 points of support, a real prowess (even today). Symbol of Franco-Russian friendship, the Tsar Nicolas II laid the first stone with President Felix Faure. Besides the Grand and Petit Palais, themselves near the Champs Elysées, worth a detour. Especially at this point the Seine offers great opportunities right and left.

Great bridge. As far as bridges go, this one is extremely ornate and extravagant.The bridge it self is beautiful and the location between the Eiffel tower and the Champs-Élysées makes it easy to get to. You also get great view of the Seine and the Eiffel tower from the bridge.

Lovely bridge telling the story about the relationship between France and Russia. The golden details shine in the sun and it´s worth a visit if you´re in the area! Nothing earth-shattering going on here, mind you, but a nice bridge nonetheless.

I Love Paris. Every were you turn in this superb City you have to admire the time and effort that has gone into making this City in my view one of the most vibrant and romantic place in the world and this is certainly no different!

If not the most beautiful bridge, it has few rivals.. The Belle Epoque Pont Alexandre, built in 1900, is lavishly ornate and the curve intrigues from the Quais or from a boat. It would be very hard to avoid seeing it on a visit to Paris, so be sure you spend a bit of time looking at it. Ideally, stroll across it and find a different part of Paris for your pleasure.
Such a lovely walk. We crossed this bridge on one of our treks and I was taken aback by the beauty of the gold statues atop the obilisks.

The Best Bridge On The Seine!. Pont Alexandre III has to be my favourite bridge spanning the Seine. The first bridge to span the Seine in one arch this is truly a breakthrough and one to be admired. With the classic lanterns that can be seen in so many films this is certainly a must stop whilst in Paris.Great views can be achieved from Pont des Invalide.Make sure you visit the bridge at night for a different experience all together, maybe on the hour to watch the Eiffel Tower sparkle.Might the street sellers however as they do tend to descend on the bridge at peak times.
Stunning. Got to be the most beautiful bridge in Paris, if not the world.Paris needs the visitors back, don't let this beauty go unseen
Nice walk. I walked around here quite a bit and loved it, very nice. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Paris

Unique archtecture. Loved the place and surroundings. Individual monuments add more valve to it. Heaps of people are asking for money or come to sell souveniers, bit annoying. Bit worried about the litterring around. Hope people will take care!

Good view of Seine. This is an excellent point to view the Seine. It is probably the best point from which to take a boat tour of the Seine which gives one a different perspective of Paris. I would highly recommend the boat tour.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Pont Alexandre III is a startlingly beautiful bridge. It is anchored on the North (right bank) by the Grand Palais and Petit Palis, and on the South (left bank) by the Invalides complex. Beautiful views of the city from the bridge, no matter which way you look. Stroll across the bridge, stop often to soak in the view, and then come back and do it again at night. You won't be disappointed!
Wonderful bridge. Good place to visit and you can enjoy also the view of the lovely river.You also reach the Invalides which is a few minutes away.

Lovely. i loved this bridge in paris, specially its location is in the heart of the paris and its so cool. so many nice monuments on it makes it even greater. there is a lovely walk way on both the sides of the bridge, u can stand there and enjoy the view and nature.

It's a BRIDGE!. The bridge is the best in the city and the best place to cross the Seine if you want to cross at a place worth checking out in and of itself. It really is worth checking out. Be sure to spend a few moments checking out the statues.
So beautiful...just walk across. This bridge is so beautiful, Pont Neuf is the oldest bridge in Paris, this is the loveliest gorgeous lamps, statues ...
Beautiful. If it is possible to have a favourite bridge, this would be mine, not just in Paris either! Absolutely beautiful.
Best to walk. There is so much to see if you walk. We love to walk across the bridge and soak up the atmosphere in all directions. It is very beautiful.
Beautiful Architecture and Engineering. The bridges crossing the Seine are both beautiful in architecture and Engineering. The view of them is best from the shoreline, or a boat cruise.
Pretty. I loved walking down this bridge and admiring all the details. It's truly beautiful, and offers a place to take good pictures. You can see the Eiffel Tower from the bridge also :)

A beautiful bridge. This probably is my favourite bridge in Paris. The view is stunning. On the north side you look towards the Grand Palais and the Champs Elysees and as you turn round you look up river to the Louvre and Notre Dames and then across the bridge to the south to Invallides and then finally you turn to see the Eiffel Tower. Everything looks so close and there is the constant boat traffic underneath you. The golden guilding on the statues at either end of the bridge is beautiful and if you go down onto the embankment you can admire the ironwork running along the side of the bridge. A highlight of walking round Paris.

The most beautiful. Nice view to take good pictures, this is the most beautiful bridge in Paris (my opinion). Once we can't put our padlocks at "Pont des Arts", the "Pont Alexandre III" is the beautiful one.

The most ornate bridge in Paris. Each bridge along the Seine has so much character and history, but I find this one to be the most ornate. Definitely include this on a walking tour of Paris. Great for photos of the river and the Eiffel Tower too.
Bridge.... It is a bridge...over a river. it has some ornamentation but seriously only have a look when you are on the way to somewhere else!

Stunning Bridge. What a beautiful bridge. Great view of Paris and wonderful to take photos. Just take your time wandering across this bridge. You know when you're in Paris when you come across this stunning bridge.

A Dream Brigde. A beautiful ballad by boat taxi on the Seine, made us discover this bridge, of a brilliant beauty, which lets expect(herald) from the fact that had to be this period of the history of France

It's about love. Passionate about bridges, like me, you guys should go to Pont Alexandre III. It's fabulous, the one of most beautiful in the world. Love it, want come back!

Magnificent 19th Century Bridge. Lovely bridge with views of Eiffel and the Seine. Close to the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais.
Worth taking a trip across, especially on a sunny day.
InCredible Crossing. What a beautiful way to cross a river. Best crossed by foot when you can closely examine the intricate detail of its structure. Brilliant

Paris' Most Intricate Bridge. This is a favorite for many engagement pictures, so drop by if you're looking for a good photo op. Otherwise, it's just like any other bridge in the city. A nice stroll along the Seine will likely land you here, which is also close to the Place de la Concorde, the Champs-Elysees, and Musee d'Orsay. To get here, the nearest metro station is Invalides on Line 8 or 14. If you plan on using the metro frequently--which isn't a necessity because Paris is a fairly walkable town--buy a carnet of 10 metro tickets for 14.10 euros, rather than paying 1.80 euros for each ticket individually. The 1-Day Mobilis tickets (for unlimited 24-hr use of public transit) are only economical if you plan on using public transportation more than 4 trips per day since it costs 7 euros.
Nice place. Nothing spectacular about this and as you cross central Paris, you anyways will land up here. Decent place.

Paris' Golden, Resplendent Bridge. We first saw this remarkable bridge while approaching it from the quay along the Right Bank side. The low, late afternoon sun made the Pont Alexandre III into a gleaming wonder that lovely April day, and we were forever grateful. This bridge really dazzles when the sun is at lower angles. We crossed and passed it numerous times on our trip, and never saw it gleam like it did in the late afternoon. Look for Gustave Eiffel's nymphs in the center!

Love. Look at how beautiful that is. Especially getting some long exposures with the river looking smooth. A gorgeous piece.

One of the most beautiful and harmonious bridges in the world. Of the many beautiful bridges crossing Seine this bridge is arguably the most famous.
