In the night, the beautiful arched roof of the Grand Palais decorates the skyline and .... Is the viewing point from which the majestic buildings lining Seine offer the viewer an unequalled show.

Beautiful bridge to cross on the way to attractions. We walked across this bridge on the way to see the Palais Grand and the Petit Palais which is the national gallery. There was even a photo shoot going on when we were there with two models in summer dresses if you can image freezing while professional photographers were trying to get the right shot. They did not look happy!

beautiful views on top. painful queues because of added security, but a tip: there was an hour long queue in the underground section leading up to the ticket office. we started standing in the queue, until i decided to go look upfront. i asked the security about the museum pass, and he let us through. don't stand in any queue unnecessarily without asking at the front about the museum pass, it helped us skip the line in a few places, but be warned - it does not mean you get to skip the security queue.after getting up to the bottom of the arc, we had to stand in another queue for half an hour for the necessary security checks again, after which we climbed the stairs to the top. what a view! i recommend going up just before sunset so you can see the transformation - it was lovely!

OK. It's a bridge.. If you're in Paris you probably won't miss this and pass this bridge at least one time. like it or not. But, if by any chance you missed it, don't go there on purpose. It's just a bridge. Yes' it's beautiful, but that's all there is to it.
Beautiful. One of the most impressive and beautiful bridges in Paris. Close to many interesting other places, a must do.

Breath taking views. This is one of my favorite spots in Paris.! As you approach the bridge you get great views of the Eiffel Tower, as well as the river obviously. The details and sculptures on the bridge are impressive and a great place for taking photographs.
My favourite bridge in Paris. I used the Velib bike system this year and rode over this bridge many times. It's my favourite with the beautiful gold statues on the top.

My absolute favourite bridge in Paris. Grab some coffee and walk over this bridge and stop half way and take in the view and the ambience of such amazing workmanship. With intricate carvings and details, this bridge is simply beautiful.

Eat a crepe here. The place is a bridge over River Seine with a lot of gorgeous statues spread over columns in both sides. Usually there's a guy selling delicious crepes here (we paid 4 euros for a Nutella crepe and 3 euros for a lemon sugar crepe).
Favorite Bridge In Paris. Walk across this bridge! Take pics from afar and up close. Also see it from the water and during the night too.

A fantastic Bridge as a landmark Artwork !. Pont Alexandre IIIA Bridge as an artwork...My wife and myself were joyfully touristing- once more time- our dearest Paris, City of lights. We were covering the last segment of a cherished and long time planned Gastrotour de la France, but while in Paris somethings are a "must-go", besides those fantastically-expensive top rated restaurant included in our gastronomic schedule there. Our hub-hotel was, as always, "Lancaster", which is strategically located nearby center area of Champs Èlysées. Our touristy- day before - was all about our favorite among favorites Museum in the world...Museum d'Orsay ! Today we were having a long walk from our Hotel towards Champs Èlysées, and Trocadero-Tour de Eiffel, via rue de la Montaigne and its surroundings. When we go touristing we love to cross that incredible Seine River- back and forth- via its multiple beautiful landmark bridges. After Trocadero-Eiffel areas - its "Branly and Champs de Mars" Quais we did rest for a while - again- by the Quai d'Orsay, overlooking the river and those touristy "Bateau Mouches" boats filled with tourists from all over the world. Among those landmark bridges we already crossed Pont del Alma, Pont neuf and one of our favorites; Pont des arts This unique design for a bridge came about due to the innovative ideas of Napoleon I. Pont des Arts was the first metal bridge built in Paris. Arts seems to be a perfect name since the bridge has been the source of inspiration for numerous painters and artists. It is also frequently used as a popular picnic spot during sunny summer days. Once more time we were heading from "Le Invalids" towards "Les Tuileries"- Champs Èlysées, crossing over that bridge which is rightfully called the most beautiful one in Paris, because of its artfully features: candelabras, cherubs and nymphs. Its nymphs composition in the centre of the bridge symbolizes the River Seine. Amongst the multiple fantastic bronze candelabras, across the bridge, those towards the end of the bridge are much bigger featuring artworks of cherubs and sea monsters. The decoration along the bridge deck has been richly executed with an aquatic fauna and flora. At each extremity of the bridge are two monumental pillars surmounted by winged horses in bronze. The Pegasus on the South bank its said to symbolize War and those on the North Bank are symbols of Peace. At the feet of the pillars are groups of genies with fish and shells. Altogether this bridge is like walking throughout an art museum. Besides its intrinsic artistry, Alexandre III is a fantastic building work of engineering, with its almost 200 meters ( 520 ft) of span- as a deck arch bridge over the Seine river- and its 40 meters (130 ft) of Width, connecting the Champs-Élysées quarter with those of the Invalides and Eiffel Tower. The bridge is widely regarded as the most ornate, extravagant bridge in the city and It is classified as a French historic Monument. It was built in the same period as the Grand and Petit Palais for the 1900 World Exhibition. Its first stone was laid by Nicholas II on 1896, celebrating Franco-Russian friendship. Walking on this work of art , from Le Invalides towards Le Tuileries with those views across Seine river over magnificent Grand and Petit Palace, are a unique experience....one that I highly recommend to all art lovers, while in Paris.

Early Morning Walk. Great bridge, just go for a walk and when you walk across it, you will be amazed on pretty it is. The details on the lamps are quiet stunning, the Cherubs are very charming. Love this bridge for a early morning walk. Great place to take pictures

The pop-star among bridges of Paris. Ahmm... Golden eagles, big columns. Not really beautiful but quite noticeable. Take a boat trip and see all the bridges at a time from the best foreshortening

A must if you like bridges. If you're into bridges and art nouveau - check and check, for me - then this is the place to go in Paris. It's the most beautiful bridge in Paris, and considering how many there are, that's saying something.

It's grand but overrated in my opinion. The bridge is a masterpiece but if you have limited time check out Pont Neuf and the other bridges where you can enjoy the view is Ile St. Louis and Ile de la Cite. Not much of an attraction.

Worth the visit. Of the many bridges over the River Seine, this is one of the most beautiful. Easy to get to. Some great photo opportunities as well.

Wonderful. I reckon that this is the most beautiful bridge in Paris!
Pay a visit on your trip to Paris, you won't regret their time beauty :)
Beautiful Bridge. My daughter loves this place, she loves to take pictures in this beautiful bridge, the weather, the surroundings are so perfect during our visit.
Beautiful bridge. It's a bridge with beautiful status, it's probably on your way to somewhere, it's nice to walk around it and look at the statues.

The most beautiful ornate Art Nouveau bridge over the Seine. Built for the Universal Exhibition of 1900, the Pont Alexandre III is named after the Russian Csar who laid the foundation stone for the bridge. A fine example of the steel architecture of the period with ornate gilded Art Nouveau decorations of wreaths, cherubs and French heraldry, this is indeed the most beautiful bridge in Paris. The view from the bridge toward The Dome Curch in Hotel des Invalides is magnificent. On a clear August afternoon we walked across to the Bridge and caught sight of a fashion shoot along the bank of the Seine. The Petit Palace and Grand Palace on the north side of the river are worth a look
Romantic Bridge. This bridge on Seine River we found very beautiful and romantic.we spent lots of time there clicking pictures.
Great Bridge. Beauty everywhere, even the bridges are a wonderful work of art. The statues were wonderful. How I enjoyed walking across while hold my sweet wife's hand. Very romantic

Beautiful bridge especially at night.. The lights and the golf and the ornate statues compose this famous bridge. We walked by it in the day time but then at night we crossed it so we could see the Eiffel Tower at night Beautiful mastery of a bridge. Don't miss walking over it
Night visit was woderful. We went on it looking for the Metro station Les Invalides ( witch is in construction and well hidden). A great view of the Eiffel Tour at night.

60th birthday treat. My daughter took me to Paris as a 60th birthday surprise. This is one of the places that friends had told her to visit. We bought a padlock and put our names and date on it. Adding to all the hundreds of padlocks that hab been left

Beautiful . This bridge was simply beautiful we walked over and travelled under on a boat cruise.

Beautiful. Very unique and gorgeous.

Gorgeous and worth the walk!. Ah beautiful Paris!!

Beautiful!. If you travel around Paris even just a little, you will no doubt see or go over this magnificent bridge. I thought it was one of the most beautiful bridges I had ever seen.

Most beautiful bridge of Paris.. Opulently decorated with sculptures and other details this bridge is a pure pleasure to walk and admire since it was opened in 1900. It really stands out . It is advisable to include it on your walk along Seine river or on your way to Eiffel Tower.

The prettiest bridge. The bridge is very charming with lot's of decorations. Very romantic and good for taking pictures. Must see.

Fabulous bridge, one of my most favourite

Très artistique!. This beautiful bridge is like an art gallery: you will find many visible or tiny work of arts there. Look up, look balustrades (both sides!) and admire also magnificent sceneries which afford there!

Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris. This is probably the most ornate and extravagant bridge in Paris. It is Beaux-Arts style with great Art Nouveau lamps, cherubs, nymphs and winged horses. It is a very romantic bridge and it is the site for many marriage proposals and other memorable romantic event.

Beautiful Bridge. The bridge is beautiful and looks well maintained. The sky was quite dramatic in the late afternoon and made for gorgeous photographs. There are often photographers doing photoshoots of newlyweds on the bridge. The area is quite safe, I've been here all night once and didn't feel unsafe at all. I would keep a look out for tourist scammers or pickpockets as is the case in most touristy areas of Paris.

One of the nicest bridges in Paris. This bridge connecties the maison des invalides with the place de la Concorde and in one of the most impressive bridges over the seine in Paris. Great decoration and not much Traffic, worth a foto at night
Opulent bridge. Probably one of the most beautiful bridges you will ever come by, not hard to reach, you will probably pass right by it if you go to the main attractions in paris.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. You simply cannot miss this bridge. Thanks to its strategic position between the Invalides and the Grand and Small palaces the Pont is the main way connecting these sites on different banks of Seine. Its decoration is even more impressive from the surface of the river Seine. Therefore I'd suggest to attend a boat trip.
Beautiful bridge. The statues and architecture of the bridge are stunning. Great place to just wander at your leisure.

The Architecture is exquisite. Paris has many notable structures and this is certainly one of them. We went underneath the bridge a couple of times was able to see it from a number of angles. Beautiful is the one word to explain it.
Love. The must in Paris sur Seine! the most charismatic bridge in Paris. You must go and walk along from one side to the other.

A really beautiful Bridge and a great piece of art. The sheer size of this single span bridge is quite breathtaking and the carvings on it in Bronze look beautiful whether you are viewing from the river or the bridge itself. It's most majestic and a wonderful entrance route to the Champs Elysee, the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais
Magestic and amazing. Beautiful bridge with a overall view around you. One of my favourite placed to visit while spending time in the city. Good transportation around the bridge.

This is one of the most beautiful bridges in the world.. The bridge has many gilded sculptures and beautiful street lanterns. I have been to this bridge several times and always has something interesting going on. One time I saw people taking prom pictures and other time I saw two couples taking wedding photos at same time. It is truly a romantic bridge and should not be missed if visiting Paris.
Excellent Bridge. Now I am not really into bridges that much, but this is a must. The statues are incredible and standing on the bridge you get a great view in both directions of Paris.
Loveliest bridge of Paris.. Wonderful view of the Seine towards the Eiffel Tower! Excellent view of Les Invalides from a distance.

masterpiece. very old but wonderfully architectured brigde with golden statues expressing their own aura. Enjoy the charm of the city by a widened view from Pont Alexandre III, the screnary looks like a poetry.

More beautiful bridge. This is the most beauty bridge in Paris.
With a rich decoration, it has a lot of statues, a great view to Sene and a historic meaning. Don't let to go!
the most beautiful bridge. The tourists couldn't miss it. Very beautiful bridge. The design let us a lot of surprise things. It is also romantic place in Paris

Love it!. This is my favourite bridge in Paris. It is very grand with lots of statues, some gilded.
It connects Les Invalides with the Grand and Petit Palais.
The views from the bridge are awesome!

Watch the world drift by. Recently re painted and re gold plated this bridge looks like it did the day it was opened. Fresh grand and in the middle of many historic landmarks. Easy to use as a meeting point and easy to find on the maps.

Very beautiful. It is a beautiful bridge and it is very likely that you will use it at some point but I wouldn't walk miles for that. It is really close to the Eiffel Tower so it's worth the little detour if you are already there.
worth passing by. lovely pics from there. the tour eiffel is seen, the champs elysees near. nice statues and street lights.

Its my favourite bridge in PARIS. I have no idea how many times I have walked over this bridge but no matter how many times I can do it over and over...
People like different things but I think this bridge has everything.
Please go and see this amazing part of Paris
Nice place to hang. Nice place to hang around with friends since there are several terraces when weather is good in Paris.

Magnificent. Don't think I'd go out of my way just to see this bridge, but if you are anywhere near it (which is highly likely as it's pretty centrally located), take some time to admire it. Who knew bridges could be so ornate?

Beautiful is an understatement!! . My boyfriend and I walked across this bridge on our way to the champs. It was so amazing to see it in person. In my opinion it is by far the absolute most beautiful bridge in Paris!!! Definitely not to be missed.
Many bridges in Paris, but this one is more ornate than others. Beautifully located in the city and beautiful gold fixtures. Look around while on this bridge so many things to see in every direction.
One of many beautiful bridges in Paris. Each bridge has a history and story of its own. I think there must be at least thirteen bridges all with different names.
Nice view!. Nice view, lovely place to take pictures. Pont Neuf and Seine are a must visit when in Paris. Close to Notre Dame and Louvre

Great view on Eiffel Tower. Sightseeing trips we did mostly on foot as there are so many attractions close to each other and always great opportunities to shoot pictures from all different angles. So many interesting things to see and to discover that you always stay excited.

This epitomises the splendour of Paris . Grand architecture at its very best. If this doesn't impress then there is no hope. The ironwork and the gilded statues with a symmetry that is very Parisienne. Love it.
Beautiful and gorgeous bridge. A great place to take picture with Eiffel Tower view around the corner. Great view of the Seine as well.

Accessory. Just as a jeune fille accessorizes to make a dramatic fashion point, the Pont Alexander declares "this is Paris. We don't settle for just plain bridges." It's in all the movies set in Paris. Take your own pictures and see why

One of the most animated bridges in Paris (at least in the summer). The reason being that the river quays have now been opened up on the Rive Gauche part of the bridge, meaning that after sauntering down this beautifully ornate bridge, you can walk down to the quay on the right bank of the Seine and go to one of the many outdoor restaurants (may be seasonal..haven't been hanging out by the quays since the summer) or the boat restaurant/bar Rosa Bonheur and have a drink. They also opened another club under the bridge on the right bank, in addition to the club "Le Showcase", which has always been on the left bank of the bridge. In the summertime, there are always tons of people just sitting on the quay in groups having small homemade picnics and wine and waving to the tourist books passing by. Good times! Now we only have to wait for summer to come back again....Oh yes. Also had my cliche Paris wedding photoshoot on this bridge and the photos came out beautifully with a sunset and the Eiffel Tower in the background.

The ornate gateway to ornate Paris. This is often a pivot point for left bank walkers- do we carry on towards the Eiffel Tower or cross the Seine here to the Champes-Elysees? Its gilded statues celebrate a 19th century strategic friendship with Czarist Russia and anticipate a splurge of winged pomp on the right bank. We saw a floating fashion show on a passing 'bateau- mouche' when we crossed.
From Russia with Love. Adore this bridge. The most beautiful of all of them. The guilding is very Russian and the statues on the ends are museum quality.

Elaborate Bridge!!!. This structure is very elaborate and picturesque... gilded in places, spanning the width of The River Seine! Great photo op .... the VIEW is beautiful all around from this bridge.

Beautiful bridge, great view of the Seine. This is a beautiful bridge with lovely views of the Seine and Paris. The only downside were the annoying scammers who would frequently walk up. "Do you speeek Eeengleesh?" Then they would try to get you to give them money for some petition or other. Common at most popular tourist sites, but very annoying.
Bridges. Every bridge in paris has a story and history behind it, visit them all, take a lot of photos, and ask for the story, or research it whatever is suitable for you...enjoy
One of the beautiful bridges on the Seine. Pont Alexandre III is one of the many beautiful bridges on the Seine. Part of the Paris experience should be a river walk to enjoy the sites and bridges.
Something to see all around you. Absolutely stunning views and things to see or just soak it all in. great place to take some great pictures. and just stroll on to your next thing to see.
Fantastic if you like bridges. Not something to drag your kids to as it is just a bridge, but for the civil engineers out there, it's a much
Passing Over at Night. I walked across Pont Alexandre III at night going to my hotel from the Christmas market. I was alone on the bridge with the mist and the lights. It was quite magical.

Don't Jump. If you watch old movies you've no doubt seen some forlorned film star contemplating suicide from the Pont Alexandre III bridge over looking the Seine River in Paris France. Upon each visit to Paris, however brief, I feel compelled to cross the Seine River via this bridge, in both directions,and then stare eastward towards the Eiffel Tower. If you're lucky enough to be there when the tower erupts into its 10 minute light show, you'll be memorized. A thousand words (which is why I'm stopping at 752 characters) cannot describe the grandeur of this bridge, with its beautiful light standards and magnificent statues, and towering gate posts, which glitter with gold, even during thunder storms. Try it once and you'll have to go back again and again.
Lovely bridge!. This is an iconic bridge in Paris. It's quite lovely and picturesque, but useful as well. Certainly a beautiful piece of architecture and worth seeing.

Gorgeous view. Good walk by the river, you can see all the beautiful scenery with the Eiffel Tower right behind.
You are able to access few tourists attraction on the other side of the river. It's also a good spot for taking pictures.
THE BRIDGE. it s free , you can watch people passing by or the boats on the river , all this is free and the cues of Paris from this bridge , excellent

Decorations. The bridge was opened in the nineteenth century commemorating the alliance between France and Russia and hence named after one of the Russian Tsars. Its best asset is the golden decorations at its entrance.
Pretty. This is a lovely bridge you must visit and walk about.This bridge is the famous romantic place to be in Paris.
Simply Beautiful. This is an iconic bridge across the Seine. The detailing is fantastic, from the golden horses at each end to the lamposts. All beautiful.

Not a must visit. The bridge was not in my itinerary but just happened to cross it while going to the metro station. Not a must visit when in Paris but like me if you cross it then do stop and admire it for some time.

Romantic!. Definately a must do while in Paris! Go for a short cruise with the little boats (battons) and see Paris from a more romantic point of view through river Seine. The bridge looks great from distance and greater when close.

Scenic Parisian Bridge. This is a beautiful bridge across the Seine river and counted amongst the best . There are intricate frescos and horse sculpture mounted here which give the bridge a unique flavour.
Look out as one is sure to cross or see this bridge when in Paris
One of my favorites!. Though slightly over the top this is a beautiful bridge! Lots of statues, gold and a beautiful view of the Seine and the Grand Palais.
Beautiful bridge!. It was lovely walking over and taking a boat under the Pont Alexandre! What a lovely structure with so much detail. If crossing the Seine, take this bridge.

Gorgeous bridge with beautiful views. My husband and I visited the Pont Alexandre III bridge one morning. It was very quiet that particular morning and we were able to take in the sites as well as some great photos of the area. It is a beautiful place and one that should be visited.

Nice bridge. Came upon it by accident while roaming around Paris. Reminds me of bridges to the Vatican in Rome. It's a nice bridge, lots of details some statues, well designed but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

My Muse. I am a Fine Art photographer and I have the privilege of living a hop step and a jump form this most beautiful of monuments. I photograph it day and night, fin all seasons ands in all weathers. It never fails to move me.
Don't let the current fear of insecurity prevent you from enjoying this work of art.

An extravagant bridge. The bridge was built at the end of the 19th century to commemorate French-Russian alliance.
The bridge is very picturesque and you can get a good views of the Hotel des Invalides and Eiffel Tower. There are many beautiful sculptures on this bridge too.

It's a nice .....bridge.... It's a great looking bridge...extravagant and regal...great view as well...you can walk on it..you can also take photos of/on it.
It's a fine bridge.

Beautiful bridge, great place to take photos. Lovely bridge. Nice sculptures on it. Many people around, be aware of your belongings all the time! It's a great place to take photos, looks different from various angles.
Wonderful Bridge!. A beautiful bridge where you can get a terrific photo of the Eiffel Tower. It was fun to walk across and people watch! Luckily, we finally got a sliver of blue sky...
Pont. The bridge is so regal! The views are scenic. It is especially nice when the weather is good. Take lots of pictures!
Gorgeous bridge!. A beautiful bridge that I had the pleasure of crossing almost everyday on my way to see various sights around the city. Adjust your route if it's just off your path!
Great picture spot. Good area to stop and take some pictures! We didn't spend much time, but beautiful area to gaze and people watch!
Impressive. They don't make bridges like this anymore! Spectacular both during the day and night and lots of photo opportunities.
Highlight. What a beautiful site. Very romantic site. But this last time we enjoyed it from underneth. As our boat when below and the lights and dusk sky reflected in the gold statues.
Must see!. I did the boat tour, you get to see everything. Paris has become my favorite city in the world! I want to go again soon!

Feel the streetlife !. We took a Segway tour and stopped on this landmark---- here you'd feel everything rushing and passing by you!!! Just stand there, look around ---- watch the cars whizzing by, the people- both local and tourists alike walking by and simply feel how alive and vibrant Paris is!!!!

must go in the night. take your wine with you and stand in this gorgeous bridge. there is also a nice boat under the bridge, which keeps play a nice jazz music. So you should definitely spend a few hours there.
Not Just a Bridge. This is a superb piece of architecture in the heart of Paris, it looks fantastic and has so much history surrounding it! Worth a visit even if you just walk over it!
Magnificent Bridge. Had heard about this bridge and how magnificent it was and it certainly didn't disappoint. Everyone who goes to Paris must walk along this bridge and enjoy its beauty.
A quiet stroll. Walk hand in hand with the one you love when crossing this bridge, so very romantic when the streets lights light up the river below, you will not be disappointed.
My favorite bridge. This was my favorite bridge to go on, and it has a beautiful view of the Seine River and the Eiffel Tower, especially at sunset!

Nice golden statutes. Nice walk from Place de la Concorde to here, if you're on your way to the Invalides or the Grand & Petite Palace. Note the many sculptures on both ends and along the middle of the bridge.
A very pretty, elegant bridge. It is nice to look at it from everywhere. I enjoyed looking at this bridge from Eiffel tower. It is one of the most elegant bridges that I have ever seen.
Classy monument. Amazing and ornate design and architecture. Make sure to take a good look over this bridge and its' surrounds.

I love this bridge and the wonderful architecture and monuments surrounding it. Go for a walk and stop for a relaxing baguette and fromage lunch with this bridge as a backdrop, you wont regret it. Something about it is pretty magical and it is in a great area worth exploring.
Linger a little longer and discover more details. The bridge connecting some of the most beautiful areas of Paris! Beautiful architecture over the Saine.
Must see bridge.. If you're going to see any bridge in Paris, and there are many, this is the one that should be on top of your list.
Beautiful. This is a quick sight to enjoy. The bridge is beautiful, and you can just stroll across and take a look up and down the Seine.

Le Pont Alexandre 111. Well this is one of my favourite Bridge in Paris when travelling from the avenue General Winston Churchill dow and across the bridge to les Invalids. This 160 metres is so grand and at any time of day to night will be give different pictures to remember You can enjoy ether side looking at place de la Concorde or the Eiffel Toweror best take the boatbus The public transport nearby is Les Invalid or Champs Elyse Clemenceau
My favorite bridge in Paris. Of all 36 bridges in Paris, this one is my favorite. It is graceful, and a good example of the turn of the century architecture.

My favorite !!!. The place is beaufitul, the bridge one of the nicest in the world !!!Everytime I'm nearby I remember how lucky I am to have seen it so many times !!! I just miss it so much when I leave Paris !
Nice Design. Paris is known for beautiful bridges and this one is no exception - a nice additional to the river walk for sure.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. Amazing bridge with a sensational view, in the heart of one of the most interesting/central neighbourhoods of Paris.
I had my wedding pics taken on this bridge!
Best place to get a wedding picture ..... For asian mostly, love to get their wedding pictures on this romantic and gorgeous bribge, but not only !
nice place of Paris. to see if you travel in Paris. One of the 1900's beauty of Paris inaugurated by Tsar Nicolas , around the world exposition (same period of Tour Eifel)

Photo Ops in every direction. There is some pretty impressive architecture and statues on the bridge but what really takes your breath away is the views. Every direction you look is scenic and worthy of a picture.
Great View. Great View of both the banks from this bridge, which itself is a work of art and architecture. The Golden statuettes on both ends of the bridge are a spectacle by themselves

Best view of Eiffel Tower at sunset. The Pont Alexandre III provides the best view of Eiffel Tower at sunset, check the sunset time and pick a spot among the crowd and wait, you will not be disappointed!

Perfect place.. Not only is it an arquitectural beauty, for me this place has a special meaning, since my now hubby proposed to me just in this very spot. From it, you have a perfect view or the city, and really get the history of the city.

Picturesque.. The bridge is a must-see. It’s beautiful at all hours of the day. I think it was best around sunset. Great views of the Seine as well as the Eiffel Tower. Expect a lot of tourists, but its worth the trip. It's hard to think of a more beautifully designed bridge.

Belle Paris. Just one of many beautiful bridges over the Seine. Just as beautiful in the day as it is at night. Beautiful view of the Eiffel tower and great to take a stroll parallel to the river. There was an ART exhibition along the river, including food trucks.... just a beautiful walk along the Seine

PHOTOGRAPHER'S DELIGHT. Arguably, the most beautiful bridge in Paris also offers an excellent view of the Eiffel Tower. Framing the figures on the 1900 iron masterpiece with the Seine in the background offers a powerful photo composition.

excellent view. When i got there a sometime ago, i enjoyed the view from the pont and also the riverside. I went there across the river from Louvre heading to Eiffel. Lots of house-boats park at the riverside and lots of trees surounding. I recommended if u enjoy by taking a walk. it was really refreshing.
Very pretty bridge.. We were walking by here on our way back from Notre Dame. There is a lot of traffic in this area so watch out for pick pockets.

My favorite pont in Paris . I lovvvee this bridge, just next to the grand palais that i love the verrerie and small palais, i call it my elegant pont. It is elegant , rich and beautiful ,with amazing view specially during sunset.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. By far the most beautiful bridge in Paris, the architecture is so beautiful and imposing. Definitely recommend crossing through it and watching the city from both sides of the bridge. Try to visit by day and by night when there are less traffic, different atmosphere.

Impressive work . Went on the bridge took some nice pics and we walked beside the river under the bridge it was quite nice. You 'll find some nice kids games there too my girl really enjoyed it and we all sat there on benches to eat fruits and enjoy the lovely surroundings .
Royal!!!!. Beautiful bridge, elegant towers!! it will lead you to the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais both worth of visiting!!!!

Favourite!. It doesn't matter from which side you approach this bridge, it is just amazing. By far my favourite bridge in Paris. To me it epitomises what Paris is about - elegance, grandeur, history and artistic mastery.

TSAR'S BRIDGE. River Seine has approximately 37 bridges. This bridge is considered to be the prettiest. It was built during Belle Epoque period and connects the Invalides and Grand and Petite Palaces. The style of bridge is similar to Grand Palace an the Right bank. It was competed in 1900 during Universal Exhibition. It has overwhelming Art Nouveau decorations of lamps, winged horses, nymphs and cherubs at each end of the bridge. At that time it was a marvel of ingenious engineering with arched span of approximately 20 feet high spanning Seine. The design of the bridge was such not to interfere with view of Invalides and Champs-Eleesys. The bridge was named after the Russian Tsar Alexander III.Today, it provides one of the most beautiful sights in Paris and should a "must" to see and experience.
A must while visiting Paris. There is a myth saying that walking down that bridge with your partner brings you happiness... So I let you try it :)Sunrise photo is a must!
Day trip in Paris. Beautiful bridge, the statues and the river running underneath it, it was romantic to me. The history behind the bridge is interesting.
Beautiful Bridge. This might just be my favourite spot in Paris. A very beautiful bridge, in daylight its spectacular, but even more so when the lights are on in the night!

À bridge to cross.. You are in the heart of the 1900 world exhibition, which was all about a brand new world with electricity, telephone, lift, moving pavement,train,steel construction etc,etc....The bridge built to link the two sides of the exhibition, the Invalide and the Grand and petit palais,built especially in a glorious art nouveau style and so was the bridge with a sister one built in St Petersburg in homage to the tarts of Russia..One of my favourite part of Paris ,and you are very close to the champ Elysées and the place de la Concorde,don't miss it
Stunning bridge. One of my favourite bridges. Try to view it from a fiver trip as well it's truly stunning.. Paris knows how to do bridges
Amazing. Well worth the visit!!! Gorgeous bridge!! Took a lot of amazing pictures there!!! Also very close to all attractions!!

a view from afar. We saw most of the sights when we visited although this one was not something we had on our llist of things to do so next time we shall visit properly, we did however hear lots of good reviews.
One of the many, but special. Many places to see in Paris, but Quai d'Orsay and Pont Alexandre especially are special - the architecture, the location, the history, all amounts to a special place.
Beautiful Bridge. This bridge is beautiful. We had the pleasure of viewing this beautiful bridge from several viewpoints.
Amazing !!!. This is an artistic bridge, where the beauty is excellent from the Seine River. You cannot take your eyes off until the picture gets blurred.

Make sure you see it. The most beautiful bridge in Paris - if not the world! See it from the tour bus or the Seine cruise, walk over it and take pictures. I'm not normally a bridge-fan but this one is definitely worth seeing!

Surprisingly in expensive floating Cafe. The bridge is amazing. The artistry and detail is pretty amazing. What is also amazing is a floating café just to the west of the Pont, going by the same name, Alexandre 3. Moderately priced wines in a pretty neat environment. We never tried the food, but the boat was quite clean and airy. Wait staff pleasant.

Gold leaf, ornate sculptures and beautiful lampposts, it’s a must see!. It’s as beautiful as they say. Definitely the most stunning bridge in Paris. We took the Batobus water taxi and sailed right underneath it in both directions, we were able to get right up close to it and see it from so many angles you cant when you walk across it. We got great pictures of it right from the middle of the river. The amount of gold, the ornate sculptures and beautiful lampposts scream Paris. I loved it, it’s a must see for me.

Majestic. The Pont Alexandre III is a deck arch bridge that spans the Seine in Paris. It connects the Champs-Élysées quarter with those of the Invalides and Eiffel Tower. The bridge is widely regarded as the most ornate, extravagant bridge in the city It is classified as a French Monument historique.Numerous sculptors provided the sculptures that feature prominently on the bridge.

Beautiful and Famous Bridge. This beautiful bridge is adorned by sculptures with gold accents. It's stunning, lavish, and extravagant! It was cloudy the day we were there with some drizzles. We still appreciated the beauty of the bridge and took a lot of pictures. The bridge itself sits on Seine River and is just so charming to look at . It's a great wedding photo spot as well. I saw two wedding couples there to capture the beautiful scene, not caring about the rainy weather. One end of the bridge goes towards The Invalides, and the other end goes to Grand Palais & Petie Palais. The bridge also has a view of Eiffel Tower! This is an amazing and beautiful bridge in center of Paris! Do not miss this spot!
Tour of Paris. Lovely architecture! Worth seeing and surrounded by many other lovely sights. Can easliy be done with the a hop on/hop off tour by bus. Great way way to see Paris.

Beautiful Bridge. This bridge is beautifully built and has faces of Poseidon on the side. On the corner on each side has a great image of golden like status that are really cool. The fact that is set over the river is also a great review. This bridge is really busy so pay attention on where you going and driving or riding around.

Classic bridge. Walk down the right bank and get this bridge in view with the Eiffel Tower in the background. There are also lovely lights and sculptures on this bridge. Well worth a walk across. When I was there, there was an awesome fellow in formal attire making crepes to go .... yum!

The Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris. This bridge is so beautiful especially at night. Too bad they don't build them like this anymore. Paris is full of beautiful places but this is by far one of the most beautiful.
Lovely at night. In my opinion the view on the bridge and the view from the bridge is best at night. Don't forget to visit the petit and the grand palais which are near the bridge.

Beautiful bridge.. We had the pleasure of viewing this beautiful bridge from several viewpoints: whilst sailing down the Seine on a night cruise and as we walked over it on a lovely stroll through this beautiful city. Its ornate decorations made this particular bridge really stand out.
Prettiest Bridge in Paris. If you are in the area - Musee L' Orangerie, Petit Palais etc. walk over the bridge and take some pictures.
Nice bridge. The whole neighbourhood is very nice here to walk or to have a drink, meal and all the bridges are different.
Nice place to get the views . It's a nice place to get the views of Eiffel Tower and just walk around really. Take the metro to the Invalides station.

Whaooooooouuu. It's grand ! What a beautifull bridge. So romantic to cross late at night and early in the morning ! You feel like a royalty, which was actually what the bridge had been built for. En hommage à la venue du roi .

Visit at night to see the Eiffel Tower!. Great spot for night viewing of the light show on the Eiffel Tower (every hour for five minutes). Take the metro to the invalides station and walk to the bridge. A bit past midway are great views of the tower (day and night). See the pictures for the view.
Awesome views!. Some really nice views from this bridge. Take a few moments to look at the architectural design on the lamp posts

Perfect for a walk on a sunny day. This is one of my favorite walks in Paris - it simply captures everything at once - the grand architecture surrounding this area, the Seine river, the natural pathways with trees (nearby), and the people. It's an exciting place. On a sunny day, my fave walk.

Bit of a freshen up. The bridge is currently undergoing some reguilding of the monuments, and from the look of the finished work it will be truley spectacular once completed, Its a pleasant stroll over the bridge and along the banks of the Seine towards to the Effiel Tower.
Pretty bridge. There are lovely views of the Eiffel Tower from the bridge but beware of fake 'charity' collectors and con-men & women
Pircturesque. Nice place to get photos of the city, the Seine river, and good place to watch people walking. The atmosphere in Paris is delightful, as are the historical places.
Nice photo op!. Compared to bridges in, say, London or San Francisco, this isn't as impressive but it's still very pretty.

Stunning and free, what more can you ask for!. As a big Sopranos Fan I have always been aware this is one of very few European destinations the show was shot at. This sparked an interest however, the bridge is magnificent in it's own right and half way between Notre Damn and The Eiffel Tower it is in a great location. We also had the pleasure of going underneath this bridge on a river cruise.

Spectacular . . . but extremely heavy traffic!. During our most recent stay in Paris, we crossed this bridge several times, both on foot and in vehicles. On each occasion, we were blown away by the beauty of the bridge itself and in particular, the golden sculptures adorning the bridge.When we crossed the bridge on foot, we spent quite a bit of time admiring the bridge and the sculptures. The golden sculptures certainly drew a great deal of attention from the many tourists who crossed the bridge.The amount of traffic which uses the bridge was also quite astounding. We were on the bridge at different times of the day, on several different days and each time the bridge was absolutely teeming with traffic. We really should not have been surprised as the bridge crosses the River Seine and joins significant areas of both the Right Bank and the Left Bank.

Magnificent & Grandeur. This decked bridge is itself a monument, not only it links both sides of River Seine but also has very enormous & magnificent looking figurines to depict the grandeur of the bridge since its olden days till now. At all 4 sides of the bridge has a figurine posted above a big column. Some parts of the bridge, u can probably get 3/4 view of the Eiffel Tower as your background pics
Stunning bridge. Wonderful bridge, with some stunning views of the Loire and Paris generally. Good for photographs and access is easy.
A golden masterpiece. All the bridges of Paris are beautiful but this one definitely stands out. Weather you photo it from a boat or on the bridge itself, it is something to behold.

Beautiful bridge on the Seine River. I recommend visiting seeing the bridge during a cruise on the Seine River. Among the best and cheapest outfits "Les Vedettes du Pont Neuf". They offer a discount if you print a coupons online. The best cruise in my opinion is the 9:30 p.m. cruise during which you can see 38 of the most famous monuments of Paris illuminated. These of course, include the Eiffel Tower and the Alexandre Bridge on the Seine River.
Lovely bridge to walk and enjoy. Gold gilted bridge which everyone should walk over. With Invalides at one end. A beautiful historic bridge.

Absolutely breath-taking bridge. This bridge is just stunning - the wonderfully ornate Pont Alexandre III with the magnificent golden statues, completed in 1900. It was named after the Russian Czar Alexander III, who concluded the Franco-Russian Alliance in 1892. We came to this bridge several times during our recent stay in Paris, just to marvel at it.

Beautiful Seine Bridge. The Pont Alexandre bridge on River Seine connects the Grand Palais area in the Champs de Élysées quarter to the left bank area of Eiffel Tower and Invalides. It's one of the most beautifully decorated and historic bridges in Paris.Constructed in the final few years of the 19 th century, this bridge is named after Russian Ansar Alexandre III To commemorate the Franco Russian Treaty. The delicate sculptures like Nymphs and the flying horses distinguish this bridge from the many others on the river.Can't miss this especially if one walks down the main Paris tourist areas.

Very striking. Beautiful bridge with the four golden statues on each corner. It's easy to spot this bridge from a distance. We didn't walk across it, instead taking pictures as our riverboat cruised beneath it.

Great spot for pictures with Eiffel Tower in the background.. Great bridge to walk over and take pictures from many angles...if you have one, heres the place to use a selfie stick and get pictures with many attractions in background.

I wish I had bridges like this back home. It's an architecturally beauty.. I went there with my wife expecting to leave our "love lock", but we were wrong, It was not on that bridge. But we did admire it's beauty and took lots of pictures.
photo op. You know you're in Paris when you stand in the middle of this bridge. Day or night. It's one of the best spots to breath in the atmosphere.

Love it. Great place for a walk and great to take pictures.One of the bridges you must pass by in Paris and you will surely enjoy walking around this place
Beautiful . Very nice spot that looks out over the river and a couple off museums. And a huge garden area that has a magnificent building at the end off it

One of the most ornate bridges in Paris. Always a pleasure to walk across this bridge and a great place to stop and admire the views or for photo opportunities.

The magnificent bridge!. The broad bridge with multiple gilded statues everywhere portrays the rich Italian art and works as a great backdrop for wedding photography. I saw at least five couples in their wedding attire with their professional photographers.

Iconic Bridge of Paris 'A Certain To See in Paris'; An Architectural delight Then & Now: Pont De Alexandre III !. The Romantic city of Paris is a city of Magnificent bridges too. The testimony to that is, around 37 bridges constructed on the Seine River within the city of Paris, including 3 pedestrian only bridges, while most are for vehicles also.Magic feel: It’s a place really worth stopping by to experience the magical feel. If you have time remember to take some time to stop by this bridge and take some memorable pictures to appease your eyes with a good treat and to capture in your cameras and minds.Interesting facts: Among the 37, Pont De Alexandre holds a very special place, considering the Grandeur and history it beholds namely. History and Significance the bridge holds;Built in honor of the Franco- Russian Alliance signed in 1892 relationship; during the Universal Exposition in 1900, shows French dominance & built just after Eiffel Tower in 1889.Pont De, Alexandre III Connects Grand Palais with Des Invalides. An Architectural delight Then & Now, Single span bridge, by design its height kept low like other bridges across Seine in order not to obstruct beautiful views of the city of Paris and its magnificent buildings.Lamp Posts of the bridge is decorated with Sculptures, Cherubs and Nymphs. 56 foot Granite pillar providing single span of bridge acting that acts as a counter weight & on top is mounted gilded statues.As I learnt, different artistic sculptures on the bridge are made to represent 'Fames of France & Russia' on either sides of the bridge and Nymphs of river Seine & Neva (Russian river); and arms of France & that of Imperial Russia on the other side…..Apart from serving as a bridge, the construction & inclusions of different elements of the bridge offers a magical experience, whether you walk across admiring the bridge as a pedestrian OR just riding under it on a river boat/cruise,The concrete, granite structure on top of river Seine, shine & glitter of the gilded statues, with background of special historic buildings around the bridge & on a clear blue sky; it is a wonderful site for a perfect picture!Few ref of Holywood: Some list of Holywood movies shot apparently on this bridge: Anastasia, Midnight in Paris ,Ronin, 'A Very Long Engagement' and ‘A View to a Kill’ Bond movie etc.
Worth to see only once.. Maybe in the evening the bridge is more magical but I wasn't as impressed as I supposed to be. Even though, from the bridge is very beautiful view to Eiffel Tower.
Lovely . Nice to see & take a walk over this bridge beautiful gold details are nice. Also looks pretty to take photos from a distance! A quick easy thing to tick off the touristy to do/see list!

Beautiful Bridge. Just taking the time to walk over the bridge is well worth the effort. There are great views to be had looking at the River Seine and across at the Grand & Petit Palace. The golden statues at the entry points of the bridge are extravagant and spectacular. On a perfect autumn day a gentle stroll across the bridge embodies all that pictured as typically French.

Iconic place... The bridge is very beautiful. Built on top of river seine, the bridge has four pillars at the corner, with golden statues on top of it. When its sunny it just lights up and the view i superb. Good point for photo lovers.

Great night walk along the bridge. Pont Alexandre III is even more beautiful at night. A night walk along the bridge is very romantic. You can enjoy the beauty of Eiffel Tower and Hotel des Invalides at the same time.

A very beautiful and romantic bridge. With Champs-Elysees on one end and the Invalides at the other, this is the most exquisitely built bridges of Paris. Great for a stroll admiring the golden sculptures and views of Seine.

Romantic spot. Saw it from land and from cruise on river Sain and it is absolutely breath taking. I think it is the prettiest bridge in whole Paris. Very romantic especially at night with all the lightning. I recommend taking cruise that you can see it from the water and find out about history of it as it is very interesting!

Most beautiful bridge in Paris.. The art decor and gold statues on the bridge is probably the most beautiful things I've seen in all of Paris when it comes to bridges. Take a moment to snap a picture with the Eiffle Tower in the backdrop. A must visit when in Paris.
The most beautiful bridge. The most amazing bridge with beautiful ornamental lighting. Wonderful to see in the day but astonishing at night

On a Moonless Autumn Midnight This is the Most Romantic Spot in the City of Light. To really feel the romantic pulse of Paris, I recommend a midnight walk on, to me, the most beautiful bridge of the world: the Pont Alexandre III. A gift by and named for, a Russian Tsar, the bridge links the Invalides Plaza (on the Left Bank) and the Champs Elysées (on the Right Bank) and has served as a backdrop for many a romantic film (think Ingrid Bergman, Woody Allen...). Broad but not intimidating, with voluptuously gilded statues and luminous lamps evocative of the gaslight age, the bridge is best experienced on a moonless but starry midnight, when there is hardly any traffic, both vehicular and human. Then one is overwhelmed by the magnificence of this utilitarian monument and one falls – again – in love with Paris.

Most spectacular pont. This is one of the most stunning bridges I have seen. You need to view it both from street levels and also go down to the river side and look up at the intricate and amazing works on the side of bridge.

A Golden Find!. We ran into this bridge on our way to Les Invalides and it was absolutely beautiful in person. The intricate details on the bridge and the amount of gold is impressive. It is very cool to walk on or pass by as you're going to the next attraction!
Best View is on the Riverboat Tour. Big Bus is my favorite tour. Includes the river cruise. Incredible structure that has withheld its time and weather impeccably. Take a lot of photos.
Bring your camera. You have to come, take it in, the views from the bridge, of the bridge...it was built to impress and that's exactly what it does.

My favorite bridge in Paris. The most beautiful bridge in Paris!! The bridge was close to our apartment we were renting so it was both our landmark to help us navigate and our bridge to get to the Right Bank. And of course, it is so photographic, with the Eiffel Tower off in the distance

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Crossing by this bridge to cross the river is pure elegance. For me a must while in Paris. I adore the view coming from Le Grand Palais going to Les Invalides…uf! visiting Paris. I had a blast at Paris, its expensive but, beautiful. Try not to take taxy, we rented bicycles and had a blast around town, cheaper and enjoyable

When we were there there was a tribe of persistent Roma girls trying to fleece tourists by supposedly collecting money for a child charity. Always sad to see as it doesn't do Paris's reputation any good. Don't let them stop you. Their marketing technique begins by asking you simply to sign a petition and before you know it they've conned you into getting your wallet out. Just keep walking and don't let them tarnish your enjoyment of this truly wonderful bridge.

We get the English word Invalid as in not able to walk not about being In-valid as in having no worth. Napoleon is remembered for his arrogance more than the good things he did and this is one of them. He created the hospital for all the war injured soldiers to care for them as long as necessary. Perfect for a Picnic. The most ornate bridge in central Paris is definitely worth an evening stroll. There is a huge open park on one end and the crystal palace on the other. A must to be seen. One of the most beautiful bridges of Paris. One of the obligatory point to be seen when at Paris for the first time, and not only.

One of Most Beautiful Bridges Over One of the Most Beautiful Rivers. The River Seine is charming and seductive, and it's surely because it's very beautiful and manages to wind slowly through one of the most beautiful cities in the world. If that weren't enough, the many bridges ("ponts" en francais) that span her are all beautiful. But perhaps the most beautiful is the Pont Alexandre III, which beckons tourists (and yes, there's throngs of those every time you are on the bridge) to wander and stop while walking over the bridge. It's a living art attraction.Sadly, something about the bridges compels people (tourists?) to bring locks and affix them to the bridge. And anything else on the bridge. And anything even remotely close to the bridge. Not sure how this tradition started, but wow, does it need to stop. Some of the bridges now apparently are having issues because of the thousands of pounds of locks on them. The local authorities have (as of early 2015) started removing entire sections of walls of locks. There's even an organized movement to stop the lock madness. If you think I'm being an old curmudgeon, take a walk around town and tell me that placing locks on bridges that already have thousands and thousands of locks is not just plain crazy. But I digress... Go for the bridge. Stay for the view. And watch your pockets - as with most of Paris, where there are tourists, there are pickpocketers.

Beautiful. This is Paris most beautiful and iconic bridge. A symbol of the past relationship between France and Imperial Russia and of Russian baroque architecture. It goes well with the neighbouring Grand and Petit Palais on the north end and the Invalides on the South end! A must-see!

Beautiful bridge in Paris that is a must. One of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. Overlooking the Grand Palais and Petit Palais on one side, the Invalides on the other, the bars and cafés on the banks of the river. A must.

Good spot for Parisian photos.. Great landmark for your walks around Paris. Such a beautiful view of the river and all its activity plus The Eiffel Tower in the background. Lovely Parisian photos from here.

Gorgeous. I walked it , biked it, photographed it , boated under it.

Nicest bridge in Paris. This is one of the bridges I like most. I rank it immediatly after Tower Bridge in London, Rialto in Venice & Pontevechio in Florence.Although it is quite simple (especially compared with the ones I've mentioned), it has some great works of art on the 4 pillars at the entrance and the view is great - ships passing beneath, Invalides with its golden dome in front, tour Eiffel on the right and musee D'Orsay on the left - has a special charm. :-)The golden lions at the entance can be seen from the distance (especially by night).
Amazing views in both directions. Wonderful views of the city, with the added amusement of almost constant visitors having their wedding photographs taken with the Eiffel Tour in the background.

If you only cross one bridge.... HOW? You are in Paris, we crossed many a bridge but this is the nicest. A few others have hundreds upon hundreds of locks on them but this bridge is by far the nicest and has some great views. Enjoy.

The jewel of the Paris Bridges. There's not much more to say about this than it's worth seeing the gold statues adorning this bridge. It's close to the Champs-Elysees along with the Concorde, so easy to see and grab pictures of. Seriously, this bridge is worth seeing.Bruce H.New York

Beautiful is Golden . Went through this bridge during a boat tour of the Seine in August 2013 . It is a marvellous site indeed and wasted no time in taking a photo shot of the beautiful golden elements.
Nice sculpture. Being near to the Effile tower this place is easily accessible by all local transportations. A gift to French monarch by a Russian counterpart.
The most Beautiful Bridge in Paris!. A must have Photo-opt. Be sure to walk across it and see it from all angles and of course go back to see it at night.

Pont Alexandre. Beautiful Bridge both from the water and land! We took a boat ride at night down the Seine and it was beautiful. We had to walk to the bridge the next day to see it from land. Stunning!

beautiful place. Me and my husband visited this place twice, once during day and once during night time on the ferry. I recommends to visit during the day time since it is better to see the beautiful details and take photos.
Time for a pic!. It's nice to take a photo and observe the river. Paris was the city which has the prettier river of Europe.
Nice. Very nice bridge, have some photos and carry on, luckily its well located so no waste of time when you go there
Best bridge in Paris. This is by far the more beautiful bridge in Paris with exquisite lanterns and very wide pavements perfect for pedestrians wishing to take in the view down the Seine.
Great Walk. If you got time it's defenetly worth to go for a walk there very nice and relaxing get. Walking along the river in Paris was great really enjoyed it.

Not just a bridge. Its a spectacular bridge, Glamourous and regal its in its appearance.
It also happens to be a great spot to take pictures of the river and the tower,
The gold leaf glistens in the sun. Very beautiful and unique.
Well worth a visit and a photograph if you're in this area of Paris.
nice to stroll. lovely to stroll around in this area as we used the open top bus and the stop was not far but far enough to take in some of the sites and enjoy that area of the city

A bridge with an attitude. A bridge is not always just a bridge and Pont Alexandre III is not just another bridge. It is lovely and unique. The is a little arrogance to this bridge. You will see what I mean when you see it.
Best bridge on river seine. The most bful bridge in paris. The contrast of the blue-grey colour of the bridge with gold leaved sculptures is a treat to eyes.
Great view!. Beautiful view from both sides of bridge. There are so many different areas to view on this bridge, there is so much history.
River Cruise / Walking Tour. You visit this on the walking tour and the river boat cruise, the best time to see the bridge is yet again in the evening when its lit up.
Inspiring sight. Saw this from the cruise and had to visit on foot the next day as the structure is incredible definitely worth seeing

our sweet elopment. wonderful and so chic with Tour Eiffel just aside
we made amazing pictures both my one hour husband and I
Really Paris is the best location for romantic couples to say I love you
average. Grate place but over rated. Why a Russian zar would be remembered for opening a bridge is in the eye of the beholder I guess.
Romantic!. We had the luck to see the Pont Alexandre III at night and it was so lovely! It is so adorned and lightened in a special and romantic way.

Awesome view by night. I would prefer going to Pont Alexander at night with lights and everything, it seems magestic.Couples are seen taking wedding photos with the background. You can walk down to Museum and there is hop off point for Lunch or Dinner at small boat across Swine.You can see Eiffel tower with all lights,but Pont Alexandre is different in evening or cloudy seasons .Definitely worth visit in the evening.
Beautiful. we saw this on our river cruise and is worth a go. Paris is famous for all these historical buildings.

Amazing bridge. With its gorgeous gold gilding, architectural features, and central location with views of the Eiffel Tower, this is a must-see for a wonderful photo opportunity in Paris, if nothing else. It does not cost anything and it is a great place to contemplate the city.

history and views over the Seine River. This is such a great bridge with so much history associated with it.
I love the structures all along It's span and the views over the Seine River in both directions. Definitely one of my favourite spots Paris.

Beautiful!. I already knew about this bridge and to see it from afar, I was so excited to see it in a closer view. I was telling my husband, who did not know about this bridge, that this bridge is the most beautiful bridge at the River Seine. And he definitely agreed. All the gold accents and the sculptures. Beautiful! We then had a River Seine cruise which gave us a much better view of this bridge. Stunning!
Great viewpoint. Great to stand on bridge and look up and down the Sienne, with Eiffel Tower and Place de Concorde on either side.
Lovely. This one is one of my favorite places in Paris to hang out. It has this grandiose atmosphere about it that you feel like royalty :)

Pont Alexandre III. This is one of many bridge I got to see from a Cruise on the Bateaux Seine river tour. The bridge is a beauty. this Bridge has gold trim and on each end two golden looks to me as Horses with wings on pillars. As you pass under the bridge you'll see a beautiful sculpture centerpiece right in the middle of the bridge. The Street light comes on at night to illuminate the night. all said and done this is a must see bridge.
A most beautiful bridge. Walk across the bridge and look at all sides and angles. Paris is lovely from this bridge and the bridge itself is absolutely stunning!
Beautiful Bridge. This bridge is by far the most beautiful in Paris. Stroll from the Champs-Elysees across the seine and enjoy the view

A pleasant walk on a historical bridge. A romantic walk across a piece of history. Romantic early evening. Bring your camera. Architecture at its best! The Seine and it's bridges. The wonder of enchanting Paris.
Beautiful bridge with a lovely view of the Seine. Probably the most famous and beautiful bridge in Paris. Lovely views of the river Seine and definitely worth a trip and plus it's free

Special bridge. Really the best bridge in Paris. Very beautiful and special.
We came here after walking on champs elysees-it is near

The Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris (or maybe anywhere, for that matter!). Sophisticated lines, classic style, wonderful lamp posts, and great accent fixtures. Walk on it, sit and admire it from the bank, just go see it; it's a treat.

Boat ride on River Seine. It is very pleasant evening to have a boat ride when the entire Paris is very busy with their activities. You can view the glass house, entire Paris super structures visible on either side of river Seine.

Best Bridge in Paris. This bridge is a joy to the eye. Just loved it's elegance and decoration. Truly beautiful. We went on cruise from under the Eiffel Tower, on a lovely day. Very enjoyable, and easy on the feet !

travel experience. Definitely worth seeing... and stop on the bridge to take great photo shoots of surroundings.
love the gold statute and love the view...

Most beautiful bridge in Paris.. This is such a wonderful bridge with great architectural details and beautiful golden sculptures. It's situated in a part of Paris that I really like: you have a nice view on the Eiffel Tower and the Dôme des Invalides. The Petit Palais and Grand Palais in the same style are next to it as well so you should really take a walk and have a look at those gorgeous buildings too.
Great place to stop for a photo. Line yourself up with the Eiffel tower in the background and take a photo on this gorgeous gold plated bridge
The best spot for an Eiffel Tower picture!. So many great memories of my visits to Paris, where I stop here looking at the Eiffel Tower and taking an always memorable picture!
great. We have been over, under and around this bridge many times, just love looking up at the winged golden sculptures each end.

ROMANTIC AT NIGHT, lighting and views gorgeous.. very small bridge, you can walk it as you are passing by, not something that takes more than 20 minutes. if you plan your sight seeing you come across this bridge a lot so don't make it a big deal. its very beautiful and nice especially at night.
very pretty bridge over the river seine. we viewed this bridge from the seine river cruise. a great parisian landmark that cannot be missed during your stay in paris!

Breathe the beauty of Paris on her bridges. Pont Alexandre 111 is more than means of crossing the road. Location of films, photographs, meeting place of lovers ... her physical beauty, touched with gold is a testament to the romantic city she resides in. Do not simple cross the Seine with her, witness Paris.

What a bridge. Beautiful ornate bridge with great views of the river. I saw this bridge from the water as well as from the street. The cravings are amazing. I don't think I've ever spent so much time gazing at a bridge!

Masterpiece!. This bridge is by far the most beautiful I've ever crossed! In one side, you have the Grand Palais and its surroundings, in the other the Museum of the Army. The decoration makes it stand out from all bridges. The columns are a perfect place for pictures! Be careful with people that ask you to sign petitions since they will follow you until you say no. Not dangerous but annoying! The bridge also offers a lovely view of the Tour Eiffel.

A National Treasure. The bridge is named after my son...eh, no, actually, it was named after Tsar Alexander III, after the signing of the Franco-Russian Alliance in 1892 and the foundationi stone was laid by his son Czar Nicholas II. The Bridge sits in splendor right between the 'Grand Palais' and 'Les Invalides'. I have always admired the architecture and design of the bridge and it is without any doubt the "grandest" looking bridge in Paris. Worth visiting.

Check for a great antique market on the banks by the Alexandre III. The Pont Alexandre III is a quintessential Parisian landmark you will definitely want to be on for a memorable photo opportunity. Make sure it's black and white to properly channel the glamour and romance. It is also a great place to cross from Des Invalides to the Champs Eylsses and the Grand Palace.

Iconically beautiful city. Beautiful bridge. I drove over it and sailed under it on a Seine River boat tour. Hard to believe that they gold is real! They could melt down all the gold in France and solve world hunger.

A view in Paris that you should see. I wouldn't have normally come here except we had to meet the guy here for our Tour De France tickets... and, despite the rain on the day, I thought how wonderful this bridge and the area was. The gold on the statues and the dome are just spectacular. On a dry warm day I am sure we would have spent far more time wandering around here instead of hiding under the brolly!
Great Central Spot. Lovely scenie bridge to get pictures from. Also a lovely park right next to it for a sit down and great place to watch the 14th July fireworks off the Eifel Tower.
Pont Alexander III - Lovely Bridge. Interesting bridge and impressive sight with lots of history associated with it. Lovely just to walk over.

A good starting point. I must be missing something. The Pont Alexandre III is basically a road intersection next to a major bridge over the Seine, marked by 2 large 'monuments', topped by gold colored statues. Very visible, memorable, a great landmark, but not much of an attraction by itself.
Proximate to the Eiffel Tour, and some wonderful shopping and museums.

Amazing Bridge!. This is a spectacle for Paris indeed with the use of real gold to top it all off. No expense spared here when building this amazing landmark in this city. It really sets the tone for the modern area of Paris.
Favourite Bridge. Absolutely fascinating building! Whenever ion Paris, we try and plan a visit....The walk back in the direction of The Palais: wonderful.

Still our favorite . This is our four trip to Paris, and this Pont never disappoints. We can sit there and enjoy wine and cheeses for hours. This time we brought our own boat to Paris, and passing underneath it was a bucket list check-off.

Shining bridge of Honour. The Pont Alexandre IIi has to be a major focal point in any visit to Paris. Being just off the Champs Elysees and past the Grand Palais it lends itself to the experience of being the heart and soul of Paris. With the glowing golden statues and view of the Eiffel Tower one knows that one is in one of the most beautiful cities in the world.
beautiful. beautiful a must visit on the trip to paris and its neatby all major attractions small shops all around for shopping near the marais district
The new paris. Unbelievable sight of Paris, now, great place for entertainment too. Great thinking ! A must in the Summer.

Beautiful describes it best.. I suppose this is the most ornate bridges in Paris. It is a different style and built in a different period than some of the other bridges. Very beautiful and ornate. The bridge just glistens as the sun is setting. Located in a wonderful area of Paris. But of course,, aren't all area of Paris wonderful.

Beautiful bridge not to be missed. Absolutely beautiful bridge in a gorgeous city! Lovely if you walk over it late afternoon, or really early morning. Less people about and lovely light for photography. Not to be missed.

Must see at Night!. Truly beautiful at all times but especially so as the sky sinks below the horizon. The setting sun flares off of the golden statues in spectacular display. Then around 10:30PM or so the beautifully ornate and elegant art nouveau lamp poles turn on and the setting becomes magical! Plan on bringing a picnic dinner to the Seine riverside between the Pont de Concorde and the Pont Alexandre II for what I consider a great view to watch this beautiful event unfold!

A photographer's delight. This has to be the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It has rows of art nouveau lamps, cherubs and nymphs and the backdrops of the Grand and Petite Palais, Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides make this a very picturesque bridge indeed.

The Bridge in Paris..... By far one of the most artistic and beautiful bridges in Paris, was built around the 1900 in honor of Tsar Alexander III. A french monument by decree, its an extravagant bridge full of statues, lamps and sculptures. Within the most famous things to see in the bridge are the famous "Fames", gold and bronze statues of masonry origin that decorates the entrance of the bridge in each side. A beautiful place to take pictures and to admire....

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. With it's gold plated statues and the Invalides dome in the background, it is definitely the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Just walk it's length both ways and you will have seen an iconic part of Paris
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. We passed many bridges in Paris, but this one is the most scenic and the most beautiful one in all Paris.

Paris most beautiful bridge. The Pont and its golden statues compose with the whole area, along with Grand Palais and Petit Palais one of the most beautiful Parisian sites. There are some bars/cafés by the river bank where you can have a coffee or have drinks and eat crepes while enjoying the view.
Most beautiful bridge. Most beautiful bridge in Paris. The gold accents are amazing. Best way to see it is on the Bateaux Mouche.

Gorgeous Pont,or bridge, easy access to Ptit Palace, etc.. Great views of river, and of Invalides.. and of Eiffel tower as well as Musee D'Orsey. A great stoping off point for travel to whole area near the tower and Arch d' triomphe.
Nice bridge. It is a very nice bridge symbolizing eternal friendship between France and Russia. It was opened after the death of the Tsar Alexander, but was named in his memory
Very Ornate Bridge. Great place for pictures with the Eiffel Tower the backround and all the gold adornments on the bridge itself.

Beautiful. This bridge was built about 100 years ago to celebrate the friendship between France and Russia. We found it amazing that it is new-ish but built in the classical style. It certainly is one of the more picturesque bridges in Paris. On the right side, it is near the site where Princess Diana died. From there, it's a short walk across the street to the Petit Palais where they have a lovely tea room in the garden - and (very valuable in Paris) - lovely toilets that are not much frequented by tourists.
Walk across this bridge. This bridge has some amazing architectural details. Still can't believe how large some of the pieces are. It's close to the Grand Palais and the Petite Palais.
Loving the pomp. Went by my favourite bridge in Paris...always beautiful and busy with traffic...this is a beautiful and majestic bridge you cannot miss when visiting Paris!

wow bridge. Just loved walking the bridge or even passing by it, it is just so beautiful and at night is completely breath taking. Took several pictures here here and were told by our taxi driver that newly weds come here for a photo-op too. Just stood there soaking up the whole atmosphere watching the world go by. Must see

great bridge. We saw this both day and night and loved both views. You can see this on a boat or walk right by its not a far walk from the Tower and nice that something is free. It is as everyone says very beautiful and a gift from Russia. It is a nice thing to see and since on the river at a central location well worth a short walk. It makes one wonder what kind of money governments used to have to build things like this as one like this would very likely never be build again. Its just a bridge but maybe the fanciest bridge with the statues and gold every where. Gg
Excellent Spot for Pictures. Excellent spot for pictures of the Seine River and The Grand and Petit Palaises + Eiffel Tower at a distance.
Good looking bridge!. I have a canvas of this bridge at home and the real thing is just as impressive. Include it in a walk along the Seine either from or to the Grand Palais
Very beautiful. Always have to walk across this bridge when visiting Paris. In my opinion, the most beautiful bridge in the city!!

Long Walk but Worth It!. Especially beautiful at night, but it was admittedly a long and tedious walk from the Albe Hotel. The beautifully crafted golden sculptures and elegant architectural design captured the essence of 18th century structures, and immediately distinguished Pont Alexandre from Paris' myriad other bridges.

Pretty sights!. Go ahead and take a walk or even rent a bike to really see a lot of Paris! the sights are amazing. Super safe during the day and try walking by the river a lot of pretty things happening. Never went at night but it should be a really nice view at night. Take a close look the sculptures to see the amazing details. I'll recommend to visit it during the day.
Picturesque. You must see this beautiful bridge when visiting Paris. It's simply stunning. Very romantic if with a loved one or you can just re act the famous films, music videos etc with friends lol

Prettiest Pont of Paris. Statues, gold gilding, and strolling across the Seine. Although, I prefer actually walking across the bridge next to the Pont Alexandre III so that I can look across and see all the pretty.

Historic Elegance. My husband and I had a special reason for searching out this bridge; he recently purchased a breathtaking painting by a renowned artist and the woman is painted on Pont Alexandre III so, of course, we had to see it for ourselves! Once we were there we understood the reason for the painting since the artist visits Paris yearly and his paintings reflect his love of the magnificent city. This bridge is well worth the visit for it has phenomenal views and is an imposing structure itself!
Probably the most beautiful bridge in Paris. This bridge is beautifully decorated and it brings you from the area around Les Invalides over to Champs Elysees. A gem along the riverside of Paris.
Wonderful bridge. Took many photos, the area is wonderful and very interesting, the views of the Seine and the surroundings are fantastic

Loveliest Bridge in Paris. I love this ornate bridge in the center of Paris. Built between 1896 and 1900 in the Beaux-Arts style. It leads across the River Seine to the Grand Palais. It's got several lovely statues sitting on top. It's a great place for photo-ops.Lovely.
Excellent place for a picnic. Excellent place for a picnic lunch or dinner. A cheap alternative to the restaurant scene. Could be a little crowded (and smelly), though.

Excellent backdrop to river cruise. Bridge looked regal and stately as we passes it a few times under the bridge and while on the pavement beside. A sight u won't miss in Paris though do stop and admire the regal sight

Good sunset views. Nice views at the time of sunset..Located right in the center of the city on Sienne River, gives amazing views of the Eiffel Tower on the backdrop and riven underneath at the time of sunset
Nice Scenery. Good place to look and enjoy the sunset of the night with Eiffel Tower as background. Only set back is too many wedding couples at the bridge area as well

Transported to another era. This magnificent bridge, with the golden lions that were gifted to the City by Tsar Alexander III for the 1900 Paris Expo is breathtaking to approach. It feels like time has stood still and one is transported back to 1900, with the Palais Royal right across from the bridge.

Very beautiful bridge. Maybe indeed this is the most beautiful bridge of Paris! You feel like a royal when passing this bridge from Place de la Concorde to the Dome des Invalides. You also have a nice view from the Eiffel Tower.

Bridges can be quite emotive.. It's a long time since I last went to Paris, & I'd forgotten how impressive the Seine is.
