This bridge does the beautiful river full justice. It is of an age when architecture was elegant & impressive.
I suppose it was enhanced by a photoshoot of an equally elegant woman modelling spectacular French fashion.
Stop & soak it all in here. Had our engagement photos taken here by a friend. It is a beautiful bridge with breathtaking views of the seine & a little peek of the Eiffle Tower
Beautiful!. Couldnt stop myself taking pictures everytime I passed it. Most beautiful bridge in Paris! A must visit
The most attractive bridge on the Siene. Loved crossing this bridge, very ornate and situated in the pleasant surroundings of Grand Palais / Champs-Elysees and the Invalides
Nice Bridge!!!. This bridge is nice with historical buildings around. The bridge has nice statues. It was a great experience here.

My favourite bridge. It might not be the most romantic in paris but it is the most opulent. I viewed it from the river I viewed it from the side of the river and I walked over it. Each time it was still grand and opulent this is something not.to.be missed.
Beautiful. Lovely bridge, only sad that we didn't get a chance to walk under it. Beautiful carvings and lots of gold - I particularly liked the Pegasus.
A must to see. Very impressive landmark over the river. Great architecture and well maintained. You should not miss this place while visiting Paris....
One of the most beautiful in Paris. This is one of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. A fun way to compare all of the bridges is to take a boat tour on the river Seine.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris.. A little over the top with all the gold gilding, etc but nonetheless a beautiful bridge in a beautiful part of Paris. Loved everything in that area....all were over the top....Grand Palais, Petit Palais, etc!!

The most glamourous bridge in Paris. Celebrating the visit of Czar Alexander III of Russia this bridge conects Place de la Concorde with the National Assembley and is definetely the most sumptuous and glamourous bridge over the Seine river.

Beautiful. We walked along the riverside and came to this bridge. Was very impressed with the bridge and the beautiful gold paintwork. Saw it also from the river boat and was impressed with the closer view.

One of the most beautiful bridges, not to be missed !!!. It is one of the most beautiful bridges in the world. Not to be missed in any tourist circuit. The wonderful architecture is a treat to watch and admire. I especially liked the option to sit below the bridge in one of the cafe / restaurants by the water and watch the bridge and the boats go by. Of course, the other option is to take a boat and enjoy watching from the deck. Either ways a very good experience.
Beautiful ornate bridge. Do take the time to cross this bridge while walking around Paris, it is the prettiest bridge in Paris in my opinion.
romantic bridge. Gorgeous golden obelisks on the bridge. The bridge looks so grand and elegant reflecting French architecture.

picture perfect. This bridge and there are so many grogous onces in Paris that your head spins, is most ornate and rich in decor and detail. The history and grandeur makes your reflect on how life must have been 250 years ago and how utterly mondane and ordinary our lives are now. While passing it above and below from baton mouche or by foot we enjoyed traveling in time again and again.
stand out bridge. view the seine once again from this bridge it architecture and presents a must while walking around Paris. Street performers and bookstalls not far away

The most beautifful bridge in Paris!. Pont Neuf can be known by its lockers and love promises. But it is the Pont Alexandre III that you can have the idea of the French Monarchy. Its location, close to Torre Eiffel and les Invalides make this bridge not only stunning, but also a must to be included in any touristic itinerary in Paris! When walking on it, don't forget to see the beautiful sculptures on its border, and, of course, the majesty golden used to highlight French prosperity.

A Place to View . . .. . . . the beauty of the bridge, the Seine with its boats passing underneath as well as the visiteurs seemingly everywhere. A splendid place to steal a first kiss to be always remembered and hopefully cherished for time eternal. Walk the bridge in a leisurely manner, do not hurry as magical things happen there.
Lots of history!. This was a stop on our Segway tour. We enjoyed hearing all of the history and watching all of the people!

Perfect for drinks at night with the new banks' setting. It's been 2 years that the banks of the Seine near this bridge have been completely transformed: now you can find charming places to have drinks, it's a popular and lively spot in summer with amazing views. You can find several places on the Invalides side under the bridge: Faust, Rosa sur Seine... many people just buy things from their terraces and sit down as near to the water as possible. Enjoy!
Nice famous place. Of cource this is noot a main place to visit in Paric, but it woth to walk through it if you are nearby. Good views and compfortable walk.
Beautiful bridge. This is a very nice bridge... It is worth seeing it and cross it on foot. It also has some history...
The most beautiful bridge in Paris!. I never get tired of this beautiful bridge all dressed in gold! You can also see Lafayette's statue peaking through the trees after you cross the bridge.
Awesome way to cross a river!. This has to be the most beautiful bridge in the world. It's a work of art and I made a point of walking across it so I wouldn't miss a single golden detail.

A must see when in Paris!. This bridge located near Invalides, marks the location of "les berges". A place along the seine that has been closed to traffic and shipping containers and opened up to the public. Come here for an afternoon apero, sit a watch the the people and time pass by at any of the bars along the seine. Don't forget your selfie from Pont Alexandre bridge with the cherubs and the Eiffel Tower in the backdrop.

Photo's don't do this bridge justice! Very Amazing and Memorable.. Many of the bridges are very elaborate. This one takes that and doubles it, Very Memorable. See it from the river and take the Batobus, the hop on hop off river bus. Very fun.
Beautiful bridge. Definitely worth walking across this beautiful bridge with its artistic figures a it makes for some lovely photographs .
nice. This bridge it's a wonderfully romantic area and really feels like Paris, with views of some of the main attractions that define the city. A very romantic place to be if you love Paris.
Beautiful bridge. For me it is the lovliest, most beautiful and elegant bridge in the world. The bridge lamps are impressive, with the golden statues.

Beautiful bridge and great view of Eiffel Tour. The Pont Alexandre III is located towards the bottom of the Champs Elysees and is easily accessible. The bridge itself is beautiful in its design and in how well it has been preserved. It is also worth visiting the bridge to get a view of the Eiffel Tour, either at day or at night, when it sparkles for a couple of minutes on the hour every hour. The bridge as become a better view than the Trocadero which has sadly become commercialised and overcrowded.
Must see!. Stunning and ornate bridge that must bee seen. Close to the Grand Palais and Petit Palais (a free museum!)
Russo-Franco Beauty. Simply stated, it's the most beautiful bridge in Paris. A must see to appreciate the history and how it adds to the view of the Seine River.

Incredibly Ornate Bridge. This bridge is over the top! We first saw it from Hotel des Invalides with the sun glinting off the golden statues. Try and take the time to walk the bridge or along the river by the bridge so you can see as much of it as possible. We spent some time just soaking everything in, seeing the Golden Dome and the Eiffel Tower in the distance, the boats on the river, the intricate statues and design. I really enjoyed seeing this.

Boat Bar. The bridge is beautiful but watch out!There is a boat bar here on the water - don't go there. The wine comes in pre-opened clean skin bottle which is so watered down it's almost criminal to call it wine....
Nice spot!. This was a great location for taking pictures! You can see e Eiffel Tower from here, along with the Seine River. So many great photo opportunities!

Must visit. Out of the many bridges in Paris, this is the one that you MUST visit and walk on (don't just pass by in your taxi/bus). Absorb the scene, take photos, especially of the old street lamps. Also explore the tourist sites in the surrounding area. You also get a nice distant view of Eiffel Tower.

Pont Alexandre bridge. Great place to take pictures!. Pont Alexandre Bridge. Such a great place to take pictures. Gorgeous view of The Eiffel Tower and Seine River and all the boats traveling up and down. Beautiful!
Incredible. So beautiful walking by it... and places around it are wonderful! Only in Paris something so beautiful like this could be one of many jewels.
Amazing. We were walking trough Paris and got to the bridge, and it was so amazing that we had to go around and see it from under it. It is clear white covered with gold, and is amazing. We loved it.

What a beautiful and ornate bridge. Walking along the street of Paris will eventually bring you to this magnificently structure. Wide promenades on either side of a wide boulevard. People everywhere. A beautiful experience in Paris
Worth a visit. The Bridge is centrally located and the gold makes it striking. Its worth a cab ride or walk over because of its centrally location.

Glorious!. The history behind this bridge is interesting, and the beauty of the ornately decorated garland, statues, and lamp posts is a must see from all sides and from a river cruise. All white and gold!

A Bridge with Gold encrusted statues?. How decadent and perhaps gauche but I loved this wonderful bridge. Like many bridges in Paris you just start to cross this one and then you are hooked by the gold. C'est tres riche! And worth a view snaps on the camera.

Must see attraction. This in one of the most beautiful bridges you will see in your lifetime. Don't miss it. The Batobus can easily drop you off here giving you ample time to take it all in, take your photos and take a short walk down the street to see yet another amazing site, the Grand Palace. Across the street is the beautiful opera theatre, now a museum-featuring a glorious gold gated entrance.
Beutiful. It's a nice bridge, Buttle best part is the people watching you can do from the café at the foto of the bridge.

Pont Alexandre is the most beautiful bridge in Paris!. Beautiful columns on each side of the bridge- no wonder Vegas has a copy of a strip of the bridge. Massive statues flanking the columns; perfectly frames Hotel Des Invalides!
Magnificent.. I love Paris. Everywhere you look is someplace amazing. I do not know how so much beauty got gathered in one place.

One of the prettier bridges of Paris. The gold topped columns and the impressive surroundings give the whole bridge an air of elegance. It is pretty and well located, with many a person crossing it every day. The view of the Eiffel tower is decent and the surrounding river's edge is often seen full of people on nice evenings.

Walk across in the evening. After an early dinner in the Eiffel Tower, we strolled along the Seine and crossed over along Pont Alexandre III. It was a Thursday and the "happy hour" along the Seine was in full swing. Music, laughter, wine, lots of fun people all along the Seine. The views from the Pont at this time of night were unforgettable. The pont itself is quite beautiful with all its gold and lights.
beautiful city spot!. Beautiful both in a daytime and at night. I would recomment to go down the bridge and visit fabulous bar Flow. It is one of the most favourite places among young parisians.

Visit while walking along the Seine. Pick up the Seine River walk North of Eiffel Tower and take it to the Museum D'Orsay. Favorite walkway for runners and you will go right by this Pont which is beautifully restored. I think the view from below on the walkway us the best.
Nicest bridge. It's magnificent with the golden statues and the lighting. you see it once and it stays in your mind as a postcard. Gorgeous.
impressive. the views from the bridge, both sides of the river: Invalids on the "Rive gauche", Le Grand Palais and Le Petit Palais on the "Rive droite"...The magnificiency of the statues

Beauty over the Seine. Came upon this bridge while on the Batobus on the Seine heading to the tower. Wow...I've never seen such a beautiful bridge anywhere. The golden statues, cherubs, decorations was totally unexpected. Great photo op and great view of the Eiffel tower.
Paris Highlights. The only way to appreciate this location is by being there and taking the river tour t hen walking the bridge itself.
Finest bridge in Paris?. One of the finest (if not the finest) bridge of Paris. Amazing views of the river Seine, Eiffel Tower, Grand Palais, etc...
Beautiful bridge. Very beautiful bridge, sit at a restaurant below it in the sun, enjoying your glass of wine. You can enjoy the monuments and you can see other landmarks of Paris from it.

Bridge With History. this time I took my Grandson to paris and walked with him on this bridge and learned a lot more . His simple questions about pillers ornates and river and boats had just inceased my cursity to learn more and share more nest i walk with him what a joy beautiful bridge brings to walk ove it
must see in paris. We took several looks on this bridge - from bus duRing the tour, while walking over and from batteauX-mouches from the river. Must see

The best bridge. This bridge is the most beautiful in Paris. There are some angels on both ends of the bridge who guard the bridge. I'd recommend taking the Bateau Mouche and going under it and coming back later for more pictures standing in it, with the Senne behind.

Must see bridge. Paris has a ton of beatiful bridges, many adorned with the love locks of lovers trying to preserve their dedication to each other. However, in my opinion, the most beautiful bridge in Paris is the Pont Alexandre III. It is also, without a doubt, the city's most opulently decorated bridge.
Saine at night. Paris, the city of lights, is on it's best after sundown. The golden statues above the Saine are wonderful. The bridge is close to many tourist attractions.
My favourite bridge in Paris. It is achingly beautiful and could only be situated in Paris. The colour of the bridge, the statutes...everything about it says "look,at me" and you should.

Lovely Bridge. Really amazing views and great bridge. It is in the middle of the seine so you have great views down the river and the monuments on the bridge are just stunning. Definitely recommend going!

Incredible Atmosphere. As I have written before, one of the best ways to enjoy Paris is to walk along the Seine. Begin at either Notre Dame Cathedral and go to the Eiffel Tower or vice versa.Along the way you will see this magnificent bridge. On both sides of the river there are outdoor cafe's to enjoy a glass or two of wine and simply indulge yourself with the atmosphere of Paris. Kind of funny however was that while we were taking it all in the soundtrack playing was of Elvis's Greatest Hits. But then..... Paris

A Beautiful bridge. I cannot tire of crossing this beautiful bridge. One of the prettiest I have ever seen.On both sides of the river you have spectacular building, besides all the artwork on the bridge itself. A must cross while you are in paris.
Beautiful bridge. lamp posts cherubs and other ornate columns and statues make this the prettiest bridge across the Seine
it was nice. the day was very hot, but it was nice to walk and take a couple of pictures. too much traffic though.
beautiful statues. Blown away by the bronze statues at the approaches to the bridge- worth a look all on their own! The river is good too!
Beautiful bridge. Well kept, beautiful bridge over the river Seine. The amount of gold on there is outstanding! No graffiti, what a joy to behold in a busy city.
Too much hype. Although it is a beautiful bridge it is an overly hyped up bridge. There are tons of people. Sculptures and water. I didn't see what the big fuss was about.

The most impressive bridge in Paris. We crossed Pont Alexandre several times and it is certainly impressive. It is however surrounded by many famous and incredibly impressive attractions so it is overshadowed a little. We walked 103 miles in just over five days, photographing the sights extensively, so we were overloaded with impressive sights I suppose. A lot of the Seine bridges have history and are attractive but this one is the Daddy of them and certainly worth a look
One of the most beautiful bridges in the world!. The French are proud of this one and rightly so. It is just breathtakingly beautiful both day and night. Very romantic spot.

Wow, a beautiful bridge. You can't put into words how beautiful thiss bridge is, just look at the pictures. i had walked down pass the Grand Palais and stumbled upon the bridge accidentall, but what a find, spend a bit of time to fit this into your schedule.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. Oh what a lovely bridge. Architecture is to die for. Details are incredible (even the light globes). Parisians take wonderful care of their landmarks. Enjoy a nice view of many landmarks on this very royal bridge :)

Beautiful bridge. This bridge is the most ornate, extravagant bridge in the city.It is named after Tsar Alexander III, who had concluded the Franco-Russian Alliance in 1892. His son Nicholas II laid the foundation stone in October 1896. The style of the bridge reflects that of the Grand Palais, to which it leads on the right bank. many impressive iron and golden sculptures. Lovely view of a river, the tower, Grand Palais and the Invalides.

One of the best views of the seine river. Do not miss the perspective of the grand palais, eiffel tower and invalides seen from this bridge. It is an architectural splendor, romantic and you connect with both banks
Views in all directions. Here is beauty, history and charm in one place. And a great view from the bridge. Think of Napoleon and the Tsar.

Probably the prettiest bridge in Paris. Take take to stroll along this bridge, it is truly beautiful, with lovely views of the Eiffel Tower. Great for photo's. Make a point of walking down the stairs to the underneath as there is lots to see there as well. A good time to visit is at sunset and wait for the lights to come on and the Eiffel Tower to light up.
Ornate Bridge. A lovely bridge with beautiful statues and ornate stone carving along each side. Leading to water fountains and the obelisk. Obviously a very well looked after Paris landmark.

Lots of fun under the bridge on Wednesday evening. The bridge is the perfect spot to take a break and admire Paris. But my surprise was the people under the bridge, in the river walk enjoying wine, food and friends. Dozens of young adults in their 20s and 30s congregated there having good time and wine. In one section, east of the bridge one section had guys in boxers, pants removed.Restrooms are in the east part of the bridge, the side closer to Eiffel tower.

Beautiful Beaux Arts Bridge. The Pont Alexander II, built 1896-1900, connecting the Grand Palais and Petit Palais on the north side of the Seine to Place des Invalides on the south side, is beautifully decorated with whimsical Art Nouveau cherubs, nymphs, and gilded winged horses. Boats plying the Seine glide quietly beneath the bridge.

An overlooked gem. We hopped off the Batoboat at the Pont Alexander III not really knowing much about it. We spent quite a while examining the wonderful sculpture and design. It also has a grand view of the Eiffel Tower

A must see!. Pont Alexandre III is beautiful, a must see while in Paris, especially summer time, when people go out by the seine for lunch, snacks or drinks, so you go down to the seine from Pont Alexandre III and you find yourself on the beautiful quaies de seine where u can spend a whole afternoon relaxing with a beautiful view watching the boats and the passers by.

Lively Saturday evening vibe. The bank of the Seine by the bridge is a great place to sit with a bottle of wine, watching the boats go by and looking at the sun setting on the gold coloured statues on the bridge.
Beautiful bridge between sights. One of the most beautiful bridges of Paris, that leads from the Invalides to Grand and Petit Palace, with stunning view on the Eiffel Tower from it.
Spectacular!. Best bridge in the city! A must to photograph! So close to the Eiffel Tower and so pretty at night. The architecture on this bridge is the best I've ever seen!

Great views and the walk down the Seine is super!. This is a beautiful spot with fine photo opportunities. The bridge itself is beautiful and any view of the Seine is worth taking time to see. It is pretty quiet for such a busy part of Paris.

Photo oportunity. One of most recognizable spots in Paris, great for special photo oportunity. Pay attention when around Orangerie, Louvre, Place do Concorde, Orsay... Not to be missed, well, you can hardly miss it really...
Nice. Nice bridge, very beautiful during the night. I took a walk from the Bridge to Eiffel Tower, a very beautiful walk.
So, Paris.. Beautiful and historic bridge. Walking across this bridge is essential to experiencing the beauty of Paris.
Beautiful. This bridge is absolutely a piece of art, its beautiful, full of sculptures, is amazing the feeling of being in the middle of it looking to seine, it's so romantic.

Beautiful bridge and views. This wide auto and pedestrian bridge is the jewel of Paris. The large gilded monuments and facade are beautiful and the view to the South (Hotel des Invalides) and the North (Grand Palais) are grand.

Most Beautiful Bridge. This is the bridge you see in so many French scenes. It is beautiful and right in the heart of everything. If you do a lot of sight seeing in Paris, you will probably see this bridge several times.

must see. Beautiful, must see - there's nothing to dislike. Batobus pier nearby.
Busy during weekend. A bar next to the bridge buzzing with crowds sitting on the banks of the Seine.

Fabulous bridge. An architectually stunning bridge across the Seine a little walk from the Eiffel Tower. We walked across this bridge on our way from our hotel next to the Eiffel Tower to the Grand Palais and Champs Elysees. The bridge has 4 golden statues, one at each of it's corners and these glistened in the morning sunlight when we were there in early June. Well worth a visit / crossing when you are either headed towards, or away from, the Eiffel Tower.

FIT FOR A TSAR. Named for the Russian Tsar who marched into Paris after Napoleon was run out of Moscow this bridge is aas elegantly and intricately designed that it truly fit for its name-sake. When I think of the Paris and Seine bridges this ifs the one I think of.

Lovely walk. Beautiful walk from the Petit Palais / Grand Palais / Army Museum towards the Pont Alexandre...some wonderful architecture to see. Some cool bars along the side of the Pont Alexandre...a relaxing hang out.
Cross In Style. Beautiful historic bridge in Paris. Don't miss it. The golden statues at the four corners gleam in the sub. The bridge was a gift from Russia to France.

My favorite Paris Bridge. Inaugurated at the occasion of the 1900 Universal Exposition and named after Tsar Alexander III and the Franco - Russian alliance. The bridge is the most ornate in Paris. Stroll across the bridge at night with its glimmering lights and the most perfect view of the Eiffel Tower
Beautiful bridge, make the effort to visit. This bridge is stunning! Make the effort to visit it and spend some time in the surrounding area. You won't be disappointed!

The locks are GONE!. Le boo hoo! On June 1, 2015, the locks from the famous locks bridges were all removed and replaced by weird graffiti art panels! I spoke to a guard to advised that the locks will be used to make 'recycled furniture'. Strange. The new graffiti - Keith Haringish - panels look awful. :P

The most decorated bridge in Paris!. Alexander Bridge is located right between all of the best attractions in Paris and is considered as the most decorated bridge in Paris, this bridge is well worth a visit. The Alexander Bridge Paris, with its Art Nouveau lamps, winged horses statuses and nymphs connects the two banks of the Seine from the Champs-Élysées quarter to the Eiffel Tower quarter.Alexander Bridge, Paris is a nice visit if you are coming from the Concorde square or Champs Elyse to the Eiffel tower or the Hotel des Invalides. Notice the similarities between the bridge and the Grand Palace behind it on the right bank.
pretty bridge. this is my favourite bridge, its so decorative and so ornate and is worth a visit and its FREE, great photo opportunity of the Eiffel Tower

Hands-down winner of the beauty contest. Most people consider this to be the most beautiful bridge in Paris. The bridge connects the Champs-Elysees quarter with the Invalides area. The bridge is anchored with 4 golden statues of winged horses and extensively adorned with decorative lamps, cherubs and nymphs. It is a very photogenic bridge on its own and lends itself to combinations with the Eiffel Tower, the Grand Palais and the Invalides.

My bridge - others are allowed to visit. Every time I come to Paris I love walking to Invalides across Pont Alexandre III - which is why I call it 'my bridge'. The view towards Place de Concorde is fabulous and just watching the tourist boats on the Seinne is great fun too.
=-). The most beautiful bridge in town. Beautiful monuments and posts above the Siena river, great view for both sides of Paris that is split by the river.
Good view. It's a good place to take some pictures, quite well located, i'd say it's worth taking some time to get there.

One of the Greatest in Paris. An engineering work of art, to be sure. Take time to walk across at night and study the glistening statues and the lighted Eiffel in the distance. Invalides is a short walk away, too.

Lovely Bridge. Very ornate and functional bridge on par with the bridges in Washington D.C. that cross over the Potomac. Lovely view of the Eiffel illumination at night and lovely broad avenue that highlights and frames the Hopital.

Amazing and Beautiful. We couldn't believe the beauty of Paris... I had seen pictures- and movies that included so many of the sites of Paris- but to be there in the flesh and walk across this was amazing. On our first day we just took off on a walk- to just orient ourselves, and wound up crossing this bridge- I recognized it immediately but had no idea I would be so stricken by it. You can tell a tourist in Paris because we can't catch our breath- and we are constantly in a state of awe-

Gorgeous Must See. An extraordinary Art Nouveau style bridge built to commemorate Czar Alexander III and the Franco-Russian Alliance. It has 4 amazing and massive statues, 1 at each corner of the bridge, which are what anchors this, the first single span bridge in Paris. Gorgeous, ornate nymphs one set with the arms of France, one set with the arms of Russia complement the lovely, intricate lamp posts. It's sister, the Trinity Bridge, designed by Gustav Eiffel, is in St. Petersburg, Russia.
Golden statues. This is the mostly decarated bridge over the Seine in Paris. It represents the Russian-French friendship. Very good place to photo shoots.

Iconic beauty. A beautiful well maintained historic site. Naturally there are many tourist taking photos. A nice spot to stand and over look the Seine River! Pack a lunch and picnic in the nearby park.

Just a crossing. Crossed it and it was beautiful,By far the best in Paris, you can also see it from a boat cruise which is nice. You don't need to plan on crossing it, you just will in your ventures, unless you are doing something wrong.

Stunning. Undoubtedly the most ornate bridge over the Seine and worth spending some time on the bridge admiring the views and admiring the ornate work on and around the bridge itself.Especially nice when it's sunny and the gold statues on top of the 4 columns glisten in the sun.
Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful bridge with excellent views. However be careful of the petition scam girls loitering around
Great spot for photos. Besides its beauty, from this bridge you can take great photos with other city sites. During end-of-the-year festivities there's some corn-dog stands.

Lavishly ornate bridge.. Pont Alexandre III is the most lavishly decorated bridge in Paris, it is a stunner from street level and on the river. The bridge crosses over the River Seine connecting the right bank near the Grand Palais and Petit Palais to the left bank near Invalides. From the bridge there are great views of the Eiffel Tower, you really know you are in Paris then.

Perhaps the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Imposing from a distance as you walk along the Seine to get there, and then equally impressive as you walk over the bridge itself. Beautiful statues and lovely photo opportunities! And it is immediately adjacent to the Grand Palais and Petit Palais with their beautiful facades, artwork and exhibitions.The only downside is, as with many of the popular tourist spots in Paris, the number of touts trying to sell you something or asking you to sign something.

Gorgeous gorgeous bridge. Must see absolutely beautiful loved how The gold shines n the Angels greet you u can see it from afar near petite palace which isn't so petite On a clear nite u can see shiny lights lite up on the Eiffel Tower at 10 pm

THE MOST ORNATE - A MONUMENT HISTORIQUE.. Named after Tzar Alexander 111 because he concluded the 1892 Franco - Russian Alliance. But Tzar Nicholas 11 laid the first stone in 1896.The outstanding features of the Pont are the four gilded bronze Fames -- representing Science, Commerce, Industry and the Arts. -- with Fame restraining Pegasus, the flying winged horse, on each of the columns.Completed in 1900 and designed to highlight the Invailides and the Champs - Elysees - it more than achieved these goals, with its lamps, cherubs and nymphs, becoming the most beautiful of the 37 bridges crossing the Seine in the City. Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.
Boat trip. I was a good experience to go on a tour boat.Highly recommended if you want to avoid the walking and want to learn some history!

Nice. It is a lovely bridge in the middle of Paris. Easy to find and it is the end of a nice walk along the Champs-Élysées . In the sunset the whole bridge with it's gold details became gold.The view to the city from here is also nice.
Very impressive bridge. A very impressive bridge with good views to the Eiffel tower, traffic in Paris is a nightmare and I am glad we didn't hire a car!

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. The Pont Alexandre III is the most beautiful bridge in Paris but it has to be seen twice: once in bright sunlight -- with the golden dome of the Hotel des Invalides in the background -- and once at night, with the great 19th c. lamps lit up. It's by far the most romantic of the many bridges across the Seine~!

While you are in the neighborhood.... This is my favorite bridge in the world. It's beautiful from every direction. Walk across it, float under it in a boat, or see it from the bus...it's ornate, classy, beautiful and oh-so-Paris. It's easy to find, is free, and won't take much of your time to enjoy it.
Gorgeous bridge near many great sites . This bridge can easily be seen from far away because of its gorgeous gold figures. The bridge is near Palais Royal and Invalides.
Must See. A beautiful bridge with amazing views of Paris. How could one be in Paris and not stroll across. Romantic and amazing are understatements.

Ponte Alexandre III, beautiful bridge....!!!!. Ponte Alexandre is a breath-taking structure. Beautiful golden barroc ornaments and sculptures, a gift from Russia to Paris and since then a must to see and enjoyed. Walking over this magnificent bridge during day or nigth will give you a lovely sigth of the Seine and Paris....
Fantastic Viewpoint. So much to see from this wonderful bridge. It has finely decorated statues and so much nearby to see such as Invalides, Napoleons Tomb, Grand and Petit palaces.

Amazing Place. While only a bridge, it is truly an incredible place to visit. I highly recommend going, especially since it is so close to other attractions one might visit as well such as Les Invalides, Musee Rodin, the Grand and Petit Palace, and the Champs-Elysees. It is a wonderful place to take pictures (Eiffel tower is visible from there), this bridge is a common location for ads, and so makes it very recognizable.You can walk around both sides of the bridge (very large sidewalks on both sides) and take in the beauty of Paris. There is often street vendors of crepes and many people taking pictures. It is just a fun place to take a stroll and is actually my favorite place in Paris.
Stunning Bridge. Just walking over the Ponte taking in the structure and all the sights up and down the Seine. A truly amazing bridge.

Watch the sunset from this lovely bridge. I studied abroad in Paris for a few months Spring 2014, and one of my favorite things to do was take the metro 1 line down to Champs-Élysées – Clemenceau, get off and take the 2 minute walk to this beautiful bridge. Not only is the bridge itself pretty, but the view is fantastic and watching the sunset here is magical.
Gorgeous bridge, and famous of course!. Have loved this bridge ever since Big proposed to Carrie! Such a romantic yet ornate structure....definitely worth strolling along day or night.....

Trademark Parisian lights. Excellent view of the Eiffel.. Do visit this bridge at night when the lights come on. The bridge in itself is beautiful and has a great vibe. If that wasnt enough, it also offers great view of the Eiffel Tower.Bear in mind, the lights go off at midnight so visit before that :)

Nicest Bridge in Paris. We were walking from Champs Élysées to the Louvre and passed by Pont Alexandre III. It is probably the nicest bridge in Paris with the 4 golden statues atop the 4 columns as the ends of the bridge. This is the only bridge in Paris which is ornate with its gold and brass statues and brass lighting fixtures. The bridge has a nice vantage point to take pictures of the Eiffel Tower and the Invallides in the background. It also has really nice views of the Seine, especially in the sunny weather of Spring and Summer. It's a nice tourist attraction and a "must" when visiting Paris.

Truly beautiful, easy to stroll to/from other sights.. This is just a beautiful bridge. It's worth the stroll across for the detail of it, as well as the views. We were here during a walking tour, and loved stopping to get a few pictures.

Paris Bridge that all want to be. This is a remarkably beautiful bridge with its ornate lamps, ironwork and golden figures. It is worth a stroll and just linger there, look down the Seine, see the boatloads of tourists flow beneath it. It's not the lovers bridge but seems to get a cameo in every film about Paris.

Striking Bridge w/ Great Views. Looking one way you see the Petit & Grand Palais, the other way is the Invalides building. The main standout of this bridge are the four columns with bright gold statues atop. We walked across this bridge several times and it was always beautiful.

Beautiful Bridge. The Pont Alexandre III is a beautiful bridge with golden statues and beautiful lights. But you have to see it from the water to get the full impact of it. We took a boat tour down the Seine and I realized that we would have really missed the beauty of the bridge if we had only seen it from the street.

One of the most beautiful bridge I have ever seen..... A must visit if you are in Paris. Great spot for photography and be amazed by the intriguing artworks of statues and designs. A great place to stroll and enjoy the cool breeze by the river. Eiffel Tower can be seen in a distant. The bridge crosses over the magnificent Seine River which is the most popular river in Paris.A must visit in Paris.

Great view and learned about a new worldwide trend. People all over the world come to Paris for their post-wedding trip and have professional photos made at iconic sites. Fascinating to watch at Pont Alexandre III.

Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris!. All I am going to say is that this is the most beautiful bridge in Paris, all other bridges are absolutely nothing special. Point Alexandre is beyond beautiful, a must if you have the time!

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. - Connects Champs-Élysées with the Invalides and Eiffel Tower.- Most beautiful and extravagant bridge.- Most beautiful in the dark - when street lights are switched ON.
picture spot. A must see in Paris. Great pictures and sights of the siena. Nice walk and romantic place to spend time with your significant other.

Great views. The bridge I believe is the biggest on the river Seine with great views of the Eifel Tower and close to the Grand Palace. It has four huge statues, one at each corner of the bridge. It is well lit and very popular with photographers and tourists. Thankfully the pavements are very,very wide

Do not miss the view of Eiffel Tower in the middle of the bridge. Apart from the historical importance and the bronze statues of the bridge, you should catch a glimpse of Eiffel Tower if you are visiting by a tour bus. If you are walking, you should definitely take a picture with Nymphes de la Neva.
Favorite. One of my favorite bridge in Paris. A short walk from the Grand and Petit Palais, les invalides.... It's too beautiful.
Bridge to Paradise. The Pont Alexandre III Bridge is a lovely attraction. A beautiful walk over the River Seine and to and fro from the left or right bank of the river. Take your camera.
LOCKS!. Beautiful bridge but is being destroyed by thousands of locks--glad to hear they are being removed! Try to catch a glimpse of the bridge early evening when the lights just begin to come on.
Nice walk. It was great to walk on this landmark bridge. It is near the Grand and Petit Palais. Also took the boat tour and saw it from the river.
Beautiful site!. A stunning bridge in a city of stunning bridges! The location is perfect for those 'must have' iconic photos.

Extremely beautiful. Alexander bridge is very close to Grand Palais, its worth seeing. Gigantic and beautiful statues takes breath away. The structure of the bridge is beautiful and the statue in the middle of the bridge is handing on its wall its really wonderful.

my fav bridge in paris. Although walking along river seine one comes across so many beautiful bridges....yet this pont was definitely my fav. There was so much to see...the statues were interesting. walking on pont alexandre is something id reccommend to everyone.
Nice view and gold Statues. I always loved the golden statues on this bridge. Just walk along and enjoy the beautiful views on la Seine.

Over-the-Top Romantic. Definitely the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It was built by a Russian prince for whom too much wasn't enough. By day it's gilded Beaux-Arts extravagance and by night it is incredibly romantic.In practical terms, since it is located between the Champs-Elysees and Invalides you won't have to go out of your way to find it-it's right in front of you.
Ornate bridge! Get a pic with the Eiffel Tower behind you. Whether you get done visiting the Hotel de Invalides or taking a stroll, you have to see this bridge to say you've seen it and take a pic!!

gold and wrought iron-symbolic bridge. When Russians and French cooperate great things happen, and Alexandre III pont is one of the examples. One of the most romantic and symbolic bridges of Paris.Don't miss it, it is close to the Invalides and not far from Louvre and worth taking a walk, and snapping some pictures!

Superb bridge!. Definitely one of the most beautiful in Paris, elegant, wide and somptuous too with the sculpture at each end and on each side.
The perspective towards the Invalides is magnificient and its integration in the global environment is great indeed.
A must see!
Beautiful bridge and excellent view. The most beautiful bride in Paris! Has an excellent view over Seine and Eiffel Tower. One of the must-visit sights in Paris.
Dont miss this bridge. Don't miss the statues around the bridge and the old lanterns. Be careful if you walk under the bridge at night

beautiful view. The prettiest bridge in the city! So nice! And the bar next to the bridge is always full of young people and the atmosphere is so cool
:)

Just one of the classic bridges over the river. As we walked up and down the Seine, we crossed many bridges, each with its own character. Some were covered with padlock's, a craze that has swept Paris.

A beautiful bridge with a nice view of the Eiffel Tower.. A beautiful bridge. Easy to walk and right in the city centre. Lovely view of Eiffel Tower, close to Champs Elysees. Metro nearby, Les Invalides nearby. There is nothing to dislike about Pont Alexandre 111. Beautiful statues and bridge decorations.

Beautiful view of Paris. This bridge is the most beautiful bridge I have ever seen. Furthermore, the view from there is very beautiful. If the weather is nice, take some time to go down to the banks of the river Seine. Having a relaxing time there is the best way to enjoy the beauty of Paris.
Absolute romance. The most romantic pond I have ever seen. It is obviously worth to walk forwrds and backwords more than once and take photos. The design is absolutely beautiful.
Beautiful. This is one of the most ornate bridges crossing the Seine in Paris. It is over a hundred years old. It is close to the Invalides and the Eiffel Tower.

Perfection. From before any plans to Paris ever began, when i saw this bridge on the internet, i just knew i had to see it, to walk across it. Walking along the River Seine from the Louvre to the Eiffel Tower, it looked lovely during the day. But at night, illuminated in beauty, it was perfect! I think i spent a good hour on a drizzling night, frosty winds, umbrella walking up and down, taking countless photos. As small and uneventful as it seems, it was definitely one of the main the highlighst of my trip :)

It's not just the bridge... There's hardly anywhere more exquisite in any European city than the area around and including Pont Alexandre bridge, especially on a sunny early summer's day. It's elegant, romantic an surrounded by the iconic agrand and Petit Palais, Place dela Concorde and the quirky Pont d'Archeveche, the famous love lock bridge.Above all however, don't miss the guy selling ice cream at one end. He's the fourth generation of his family to do so. I was more captivated by the 1967 renault quatre than the wonderful home-made ice cream. This is one of a pair which his dad had professionally converted from new into ice cream wagons. But his stuff is top class too..

My favourite bridge in Paris...and the entire world. Just love the beauty of this bridge whether walking by the river or on a boat trip. It is beautiful by both day and night. There are a few cafes/bars in the locality of the bridge now which is great.
Beautiful Bridge. Was pleasantly surprised with how the bridge looked... a lot of detail has gone into it and amazing views of the Seine from both directions. Worth a cross :)

Just a bride - a beautiful one, yes.. This is a bridge. full of beautiful decorations, but still a bridge. We walked over it from Tuileries to Eiffel Tower, and that's it: a beautiful bridge in a beautiful city.
the best view of Paris. i love Paris very nice and beautiful boat I'm so excited there don't miss this visit in Parisit's amazing

Most Beautiful Bridge in the World. Side note- visit was in April 2014. This bridge is gorgeous and too good to miss! Also it's conveniently located across from the Hotel des Invalides and the Place de la Concorde, 2 other must-see sights.

Beautiful Structure and Location. A beautiful area, made better with a guide book or tour guide. Point Allexandre is surrounded by beautiful monuments and statures and is itself an impressive sight. The bridge itself with its tall columns supporting massive gold leaf statues is impressive, but its location near so many other impressive Paris locations adds to what makes it worth the visit.

beauties of Paris. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris and well worth visit! Day or night(when all the lamps are lit) it is awe- inspiring. The views along the river Seine alone are well-worth the trip. Whenever we go to Paris we always make a beeline for this part of Paris breathing in the beauty all around.
Beautiful. This is my favourite bridge in all the world. I love its history, its "Belle Epoque" look, and its name. It is sentimental, romantic and makes me dream. It is always beautiful. Love it.

Beauty. One of the worlds most famous bridges, and certainly one of the most beautiful ones. In a scenery that you cannot miss is Pont Alexandre III, with its sculptures and magnificent structure is definitively worth a stop to contemplate this work of art on the Seine.
Incredible bridge. Worlds nicest bridge if you ask me (and I have seen some including Prague and Italy). If you get to see it at night sailing, it is especially beautifull

Stroll. Very ornate bridge with cherubs, art nouveau lamps. Adele made video for "Someone like you" song walking on that bridge as well many movies were filmed here.Just take romantic stroll, admire Seine, look around and breathe air of that magic city.
Gorgeous bridge. The French can't seem to do anything without making a grand gesture. Of all the bridges on the Seine, I thought this was the most beautiful.

Incredible Bridge over the Seine. Enjoyed walking across this bridge over the Seine. Also went under it with a boat ride. This bridge is by the Invalides stop on the RER- C train. Napoleon's Tomb and the War Museum is on one side. The Grand Palais and Petit Palais on the other. Also near the Tuilleries.

Stunning!. I love Paris and this is one my favorite bridges to pass by. The views are amazing and its nice to take a minute to pass and take it all in.It is one the prettiest bridges in all of Paris and its worth visiting. There is so much history and if you can get a tour that passes by it, you'll be amazing at its grandness. The bridge at night is just spectacular.

Pont Alexandre III. I recommend you to discover this wonderful bridge where you can take great pictures from Paris. The bridge with angles is so beautuful and you hâve à Nice vies from Eiffel tower, grand Palais and the Seine.

Beautiful. I love all of the bridges across The Seine; they all have fascinating stories and history attached. Pont Alexander III is apparently known as 'the prettiest bridge in Paris' and it is! Just beautiful. A 'must see.'

stunning and historical. it was beautiful, just bought a cup of coffee and walked through the bridge, already a pleasure moment. A bit sad I didn't take a night view there. It you got time, it's a must go for nearby Petit Palais & Grand Palais.
Beautiful!. Simply gorgeous! A staple in the City of Light. Reminds you that you are standing in one of the most visited and (rightfully so) popular landmarks in the world.
My favorite bridge in Paris. It is one of the most beautiful bridges in Paris, with ornate wrought iron lamp standards as well as gilt statues on both sides of the bridge.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris - love the iguanas :). This has to be the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Many of the details are hard to see when you are walking or driving on it. We took a bot tour and got to see some of the details up close. We walked at the water level and loved the details on even t the smallest parts.

Absolutely gorgeous bridge. The most beautiful bridge I saw in Paris... it leads directly into the Musee de l'Armee; make sure you take your camera so you can capture the gorgeous sculptures and statues along the length of the bridge, not just at both ends.

The most elegant bridge. This is the most elegant and beautiful bridge among all the bridges inParis. It leads strait to the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais where you can visit the most interesting art exhibitions in the world.
Bridge to elegance. Pont Alexandre III is my favorite of all the beautiful bridges of Paris. Note the individual details when you see it. Many photo opps on this one bridge!

Beautiful. This Pont Alexander 111 links the Invalides on the Left Bank to Grand Palais on the Right Bank. It is the prettiest bridge on the Seine, Built betwwen 1896 and 1900. Named after Tsar Nicholas 111, his son laid the foundation stone in 1896.It is beautiful. Designed in Art Noveau style, with its pale blue facade, intricate oramentation, cherubs, nymphs, the lovely lights and to top it off the magnificent golden statues of winged horses. Great for photos. Below there are cafes, ice cream sellers.

Beautiful. . If you are in the neighbourhood you should get a closer look at this bridge. It is beautiful to walk over and it is beautiful to look at from below.The scenery around the bridge makes it a perfect place to take a picture or two.
Beautiful bridge. Nothing. Sorroundings superb. We took beautiful pictures of the bridge with both Seine and Eifeltower included.

A must see if you love museums and beautiful bridges. A magnificent sight and so historic. It was the first iconic Paris landmark we took in. It has museums on this side and you can get here easily via train.
Beautiful bridge. Very beautiful bridge and worth visiting! Sometimes it's very crowded, like all touristic points in Paris, but it's worth going anyway.

Wonderful historic and decorative landmark. I could have easily spent much more time that I did marveling at the sculptures and reading up on the rich history of this bridge than I did. Well worth a visit on your way to Petit Palace (another favorite)

Fabulous View of Eiffel Tower. It is awesome to stand on the Alexander III bridge and take a photo with the Eiffel tower in the background! This is REALLY Paris! The gold statues are magnificent as are the sculptures! FEEL French as you stand here! (with all of the other tourists!) We see lots of brides standing here! Look at the Invalid on one side and the Grand and Petit Palaces on the other side! You are in Paris!

Photo opportunity. Great photo opportunity with Invaldes in background. Part of a great walk along the seine river between the Eiffel Tower and Tuileries Garden. Taxi tuk tuk are available for the infirm.

Stunning location amid stunning art and buildings. If you are in Paris this is a must see destination. The golden statues are stunning, the bronzes are beautiful, and the whole bridge, and surrounding buildings are truly spectacular, so make time to walk down.

The most elegant bridge i have visited.. This is one place which will make you feel that you have been transported on timemachine to the glorious old times. Such a beautiful place with history and elegance blowing at you from all sides. Historical location With everything around - grand palais, hotel le-invalides, eiffel, champs elisse and what not. The way this bridge is adorned with classical art is worth a vist. Dont miss it.

A Bridge fit for a castle. Pont Alexandre III is a bridge on the Seine River. u can walk across it and u can also see it from a bateau-mouche / a boat while cruising the river. it's beautifully decorated with statues and it might be the most beautiful bridge on the Seine.
great bridge in Paris. great view - fantastic piece of architecture ! a little bit noisy but the best spot to get a pic of you vith the grande dame in the back

Gorgeous!!. The most beautiful bridge in Paris is not as gaudy as I'd expected. Tasteful, yet duly appointed with magnificent statues, gilding that sparkled in the sunlight, and beautiful as you travel under it as well. One of my favorite statues of public art is on the eastern left bank corner -- so lovely!
my dad's favorite sight in Paris. A beautiful bridge day and night! We made sure to take an extra walk across the bridge on our last day in Paris. It's a sight to behold.

My favorite bridge in Paris. This is a beautiful bridge,in front of the Grand and small Palais.you have the view over the seine a nice walk over the bridge and you are on the Latin area from one side and Champs Elysee from the other side. Lovely view and walk.
A bridge? The Bridge. I cannot believe that this bridge have ever been built. Amazing. Gold and sculptures and all the fine little details. I could spend half a day on and around this bridge.

Location, location, location!. Built between 1896 and 1900, the Pont Alexandre III (named after the Russian Tsar) has to be the most beautiful bridge in Paris. The view through the bridge to "Les Invalides" with its unmistakable golden dome is a definite for the photo album, and there are good shots of the Eiffel Tower too from here (it's just a short walk away along the Seine). There's often a very nice ice-cream cart on the rive droit end of the bridge (that's the side that the Eiffel Tower is not on!). I'd recommend buying one and then walking west along the "Cours la Reine", which has several interesting statues and memorials.Just past the next bridge (Pont des Invalides), outside the Palais de la Découverte (Palace of discovery), is the entrance to a garden. Its winding steps, tranquil pools and shady path will surprise you and may be just the respite you're looking for after a hot day of site seeing.
A most beautiful bridge.. I like bridges, and this is one of the most fancy you're likely to come across. It is really ornate and, I think, really beautiful.
golden glimmering bridge. i love this bridge. is seen in a number of movies and when the sunlight hits the bridge combined with the invalids in the distance its a stunning sight.

Most beautiful bridge of Paris. This is certainly the most beautiful bridge in Paris with beautiful gold painted decorations and statues, beautiful lamps and a very nice view towards the Eiffel tower. At night it is beautifully lighted.

The best outdoor spot in Paris. This magnificent bridge has a superbe view of the best spots in Paris. You can see the Seine, the Invalides, the grand palais and the eiffel tower. Below the bridge you find a few bars that are quite fun in summer.
Fascinating!. Look at the 'love locks' - a fascinating sight! Worth a visit as you walk down the south bank of the river - lots of interesting activities you can take part in for free!

the most beautiful bridge in paris. you must see this bridge from the river and from land- it is exquisite- wonderful lamps, gold painted decorations - it represents all the beauty of paris- absolutely magical

Is that really gold leaf?. This bridge glistens in sunlight, the golden statutory is the standout. Be careful of traffic, there is a lot of it and also watch out for cyclists - fast and silent, or wobbly and lethal.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. You will see a lot of different bridges across Paris as you dart across the Seine at various places but for me this was he best of the lot. It is beautifully built and the gold really makes it beautiful, our tour guide told us that it was built for the Russian Tsar Alexandre III and symbolizes the relationship between France and Russia. Most people go looking for Pont des Arts, skip it. Rather go here for great photos and views.
Most romantic bridge. Decorated with nautical rococo flair this is the loveliest of the bridges spanning the Seine, in my opinion. Magical at night!

Spectacular Bridge. Worth a visit while walking along the river, the gold statues at either end make for some beautiful pictures. We however got our best view while on a cruise. It really is quite majestic, don't miss out.

You might not know Alexander III, but you'll remember his Bridge. I had gone to a really lousy lunch at a highly regarded right bank restaurant, mostly to avoid yet another drenching by a Parisian cloud-burst; the food was inedible, so my friends and I decided to get thoroughly drunk to raise our spirits over the disappointing lunch & constant rain. Long story short, I left the resto and began rambling towards the Seine for comfort (no rain, still overcast). Miraculously, I'd made my tipsy way to the insanely beautiful Pont Alexandre III over which I'd traveled dozens of times. I'd always thought it was magnificent and meant to explore it on foot someday and here's the odd treat I was given that day: I was standing mid-span when all of a sudden, the clouds parted and the world instantly turned from black & white to Technicolor. The huge golden statues guarding its entrances for more than a century became so bright they virtually blinded me. I spent over an hour exploring its many gilded statues and incredible architecture, all the while thanking the Paris gods for treating me to the spectacular introduction to this overlooked masterpiece.
Bridge lovers .... This does not disappoint! It is majestic and overdone - but it well worth the visit- most especially if u walk to it along the river ... One of the best walks in the city

Opulent bridge with great views. Fabulous bridge crossing the Seine River. Gold plated fixtures at the apex and numerous statues situated at various points across the bridge. The views are pretty decent in the middle as well. Well worth a walk to here and to the many other attractions close by. Recommended.
Beautiful architecture. The architecture of the bridge is stunning. So many beautiful photographs! Be sure to walk by, on the Grand Palais side.

The most beautoful bridge in Paris. What more can be said about this, the most beautiful of Paris bridges?It is an icon; stunningly over-the-top beauty. But it also offers great views of the Seine and of some Paris landmarks. It is a great place for a lazy stroll and one of the many must see attractions of Paris.
The most beautiful views from here. This bridge is gorgeous! For photos it's a MUST! All the wedding photographers are taking photos of their clients here!
A Great Bridge. Outside of the love lock bridge, this bridge I think was my favorite. It's very ornate, and very busy. It's located just by the Grand Palais & close to the Eiffel Tower, it's iconic.
What a bridge. As bridges go this one is ornate and regal. Joining the left bank over to the right it does a great job.
Must see at night!. Great looking bridge - especially it's lighting. Excellent at night, great pictures with Eiffel tower in the background.

Best bridge in Paris. We crossed over the Pont Alexandre III when we visited the Petit Palais and the Invalides. Absolutely breathtaking bridge decorated with golden sculptures, towers and lampposts. Great for photos, well worth a visit.

MajesticBridge. Very busy bridge with massive gold lions on each end. The side of the bridge was easy to see on our seine cruise. Incredible detail that we enjoyed. You have to see. Great Photo op as well.

Surprise Discovery. I discovered this bridge while walking towards Musee De L'Armee as it is just located in front of the Military museum. The bridge design is very unique and beautiful,serves a very nice spot to take photo of the Eiffel Tower with partial of the bridge captured together with the running river Seine. I could see a fair bit of the tourists on the bridge as well as taking the river cruise (well! hardly can find a place in Paris which has few tourists especially during the holiday Easter season).

Nice outdoor walk. This is a great place to walk around on a sunny spring day. Very impressive as well. It tends be quite windy out there so this is best done during the day if you are walking. Metro stops nearby

One of the most beautiful bridges in Paris.. If the weather is nice take a walk along the seine at sunset or dawn depending on your hours. I've lived here for 24 years and I never tire of the beauty of this bridge.

Lovely bridge. This is one of the nicest bridges in Paris. There is some lovely areas to stroll along the river seine. If its a nice day go into a local bakery and get a baguette and a coffee and have an impromptu picnic along the river. It's a great way to enjoy the Parisian atmosphere and for only a few euros
Well!. Not that much to write home abot. Pigeons all over the place.Soory not to be more expansive but hard to use more than a short phrase to describe my impressions here.
Incredibly Beautiful. Walk this bridge and enjoy the fabulous sculptures and design of the bridge. take a boat trip on the Seine and see it from below.

Great Architecture. Fantastic looking bridge, spotlessly clean and shining in the sunlight. The view down the whole avenue is quite breathtaking. Don't miss it, it's free.
Could do with some public toilets around though!

One of best places to take sunset photo of Tour Eiffel. This bridge and view to Invalides is just great. But go the when the sun sets. One gets really nice pictures from the bridge towards Tour Eiffel.
only if you are around the area. its one of the famous bridges of the many in paris....its highly ornate....nothing outstanding...visit only if in the area and have time!

take the stroll. this very ornate bridge is the way to cross the Seine... heading towards les Invalides you'll have la Tour Eiffel on your right and
le musee d'Orsay on your left, blue skies above (plus ou moins), river traffic below.

Gorgeous. Who would think a bridge would be so stunning? We visited this several times. It's all gold. You might remember it from Sopranos. It is neat to see it at different times of the day and night, in sunny weather and rain. It really is a gorgeous bridge!
Nice walk. Don't hurry - take your time and take a look at all the details this bridge is so full of. It's really worth a detour, but that's not necessary because it's in the very middle of Paris.
Beautiful. Well, I lived in Paris so everytime I go I just walk around to see the beauty of the city. This makes me happy.

Nice to walk across on our way through the city. The bridge has some great architecture and I'm glad to see it isn't ruined by padlocks! It provides a great view of the Seine and the Eiffel Tower from a distance.

It's a bridge over the Seine.. one of many. They are all barking spectacular. This one has shiny bits and you can see the Eiffel Tower, but c'mon. Can you go wrong if you are on foot on any bridge on the Seine?

It's a bridge. It's a pretty bridge. That's about it. I wouldn't personally spend time trying to get here. If you just happen to be in the area then by all means walk across it. Smells like urine too.

Beautiful pont. What a great bridge! Stylish and great design, looks great over the Seine! And it works! Traffic and buses, scooter and cycles, and people moving across Daily. Just perfect for a stylish bridge!

Just a bridge!. So in Paris there is loads of bridges you can go over, in my opinion this is just another much better things to see in Paris so don't go out your way to see a bridge!
Tip if you want to see them all get a cruise from the Eiffel Tower costs around €13 and takes about an hour.

One of my favourite Bridges!. One of my favourite Bridges!
Nice view of Eiffel and Les Invalides during summer.
Nice view of Seine River

The most recognisable bridge in Paris.. This is a wildly ornate bridge,which links Les Invalides on the left bank with the grand Palais and Petit Palais on the right bank.Four bronze figures of Pegasus on four columns guard the bridge,which is crammed with decorations by many famous french artists.It was built in 1900 for the Universal Exposition,and is probably the most famous bridge in Paris.
A beautiful bridge; a great view. The bridge itself is splendid and it provides a wonderful view of the river and the always awe inspiring tower of Eiffel.

A stunning bridge. This bridge is grand in every regards, whether it’s the size or the amount of adornments it has to it. The views from up here are fantastic and one could get fantastic shots of the river and the neighboring areas from up here. The bridge also connects you to a very many popular destinations so it is kind of hard to miss it and while at there, halt and enjoy the views and the beauty of the place.
Better to seen from the river. If you go to Paris - this place is necessary to see. But the best wai is ti see in from the boat tour.
Pretty bridge. It is a very pretty and ornate bridge. Beware of scammers. Had a couple of women try to pawn some jewelry off on us.

Beautiful part of your walking tour of the Seine. We were on it or by it several times on our holiday.. Beautiful. The sculptures are spectacular, but it is also amazing just because there are so many bridges and each is unique. The love locks are really something. Please do not engage in this activity on any of the bridges. It is a problem in Paris because the bridges were not designed to carry the weight, and they worry that a key thrown in the water might land on a person on a boat and hurt them. Ironically, your eternal love is good for about 3 months, as apparently that is how often they remove panels and replace them. I don't think there is anywhere to put them on this bridge, but it was 9 months ago, so I'm not certain. They are neat to see though.
Beautifull. Vue from the Seine or vuefrom the bus it is one of the nice bridges in ParisGolden statues on both sides

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. We drove by this bridge a couple of times, on the hop on hop off bus and on a tricycle, and made a mental note to come back on foot for a visit.The bridge is really beautiful, and was the perfect spot to see the Eiffel Tower light up on sun down. Perfect for photos and hanging by the Seine river.
Vision of Paris. OK, so it is over rated, glitzy, gilded and looks fake. But it is still an iconic landmark and you will want to photograph it with the Invalid in the background.

The most BEAUTIFUL bridge in all of Paris.. Definitely the most ornate and regal bridge in Paris. It was a present from a Russian Tsar to the French and what a present! Amazing view of the Tour Eiffel. Perfect spot to propose...

Luxury. The most luxurious and significant bridge over the Seine. Golden statues and rich details say a lot about the person who designed it - Russian tsar Alexander III. Highly recommended to visit while traveling to Le tour Eiffel

Gorgeous bridge, watch out for pickpockets. Never miss the strolls along the Seine, which were lovely, scenic and interesting in both November and March -- but DO take care to avoid the groups or individual pickpockets (often teenagers) who congregate around the best-known sites and ask tourists to sign a petition, or claim a "found" gold ring, etc etc. Say NO firmly -- in any language -- and keep walking. The first time, my distracted husband's jacket pocket was unzipped but nothing taken. After that, we were wiser to the scams, which of course do occur in any big city -- and we tried to warn those behind us .

Gold Bridge. It was great to walk over this bridge which connects to Champs Elysees and Eiffel Tower and to view the traffic and tourist buses in the distance. Lots of history to see. Very popular area with a variety of nationalities enjoying the sculptures.
great place for a photo souvenir. this bridge is unique by it's sculpture. if you have time, try to find out how the Paris' bridges were build. you'll be surprised,

Very ornate bridge. One must cross this bridge to get from Napoleon's tomb to Plac de la Concorde. It has some very ornate lights and sculptures. There is a lot of traffic so be careful when crossing.
Amazing as much orders on Sena landscape. Must see and must cross in Paris. Stop for a photography and enjoy the river over the bateaus Mouches

between the left bank and right bank :). just next tp Grand Palais on the right bank and esplanade des Invalides on the left bank, it is also the shortest route between the Elysée palace (the president's office and home) and Hôtel Matignon (the Prime ministers office).

The most beautiful bridge in Paris.. This is the best looking bridge you will ever see, beware of the gypsies as it seems to be a hot spot (although most touristy places are). The beautiful bridge is gorgeous to walk across and close to metro stops (like everywhere in Paris). Make the effort to visit and walk along the seine, it is wonderful to just imagine how many historic people have crossed that river on that bridge. Worth it.
Stunning bridge!. In my view the prettiest bridge in Paris and stunning view looking down the Seine from either direction

As far as bridges goes, this is a beauty. Take the time to look at the bridge from different spots. Stand and watch the people go by and watch the river traffic. It's free and gives a real taste of Paris.
Beautiful walk . Nice breezy day, a bit cold but the sun is shining. We decided to take a walk along River Seine and the Bridge is such a prominent landmark. Absolutely beautiful.
Stunning. Beautiful bridge, ornate. Links grande and petit Palais to Hotel Invalides. Perfect for photographs.
Magnificent!. Magnificent embellishment! Very grand and beautiful monuments all along. Great view from this bridge too. My favourite bridge, very majestic.
Beatiful. One of the most beatiful bridges in the world. I loved the architecture and couldn't not stop taking pictures. It is a must when visiting Paris.
Must see. Take picture from the Seine River cruise! So beautiful, must see bridge in Paris! Must kiss your loved one here, hehehe, or at least selfie together.

Nice bridge. This is a very nice bridge, not much more to add, but this has to contain 100 letters. I'm sure most people has seen this in pictures, but like most things it's much grander in real life.

The nicest bridge in Paris !. If you take the time to look at the details it's really a nice piece, a very nice bridge, in the nicest area of Paris. Take the time to observe it, and picture it ! My favorite there !!

Beautiful old bridge. I passed and walked over this bridge many times during my stay. It's located by the Grand Palais. It has beautiful gold detailing and statues at either end of the bridge. It's a great place for photos
Pretty bridge! . Very pretty bridge but it is just that a bridge! Also very packed with tourists... But still a great spot to walk over and see

Possibly the most ornate of the bridges across the Seine. If bridges are your thing then this one is definitely worth checking out. It has been well maintained and you can get some great photos if you get the lighting right. Paris is a city for walking so just include this bridge as you explore the Seine or as part of a broader itinerary.

came across it by accident. i was just wandering around and saw this handsome old bridge. it is truly beautiful of course. lots of beautiful sculptures. Across the bridge, is the invalids and from there you can walk to the Effiel Tower in 10 mins.
Beautiful Bridge. Bridges amaze in Paris! This bridge is to/from all the sights. Worth seeing from the street and a boat tour too.

It's a bridge Jim, but not as we know it. Just a bridge, but a nice one. Lots of detail in the lamp standards and castings. Very shiny capitals which you can't miss whether the sun is out or not. Sometimes awash with East Asian wedding photo shoots but adds to the mystery. Such a change to have so much open space in a capital city so a great place to stroll to and around after a meal

Best place for lovely pictures. Probably the best place to take Pictures in Paris, from one side a lovely view from Eiffel Tower, from the other all main attractions for a good click. It will be on your way at some point and is really worth the visit!

Paris and its glory... This is famous Paris in its glory, beautiful sculptures, gold bling and history and millions of people that have crossed this sexy structure and stopped to look at the famous Sienne River beneath, one of the best views to see that striking tower in the background. By the way ABSOLUTLY gorgeous at night under lights.
It's a bridge but a spectacular one.. Fantastic architecture and well maintained.Combine it with a visit to the Place de la Concorde.There's a Metro station (Invalides) right next to it.
Love the blingy bridge. Conveniently near the Hopital des Invalides, I just can't resist crossing the golden bridge especially when it glows in the sunlight!

Truly the Most Beautiful!. Seeing this bridge in daylight or at night, it is truly the most beautiful of all in Paris. Take a night cruise to see it up close, walk along the Seine during the day and see children playing in a park along the river. Stroll across. Which ever you decide, look and love.

The Most Beautiful and Romantic Bridge in Paris!. This bridge, built for the Universal Exhibition of 1900 is an explosion of Art Nouveau decorations. Cherubs, lamps, angels, wreaths and amazing statuary. This bridge leads to the gorgeous Grand Palais and Petit Palais. From here you can see the Hotel the Invalides, the Champs-Elysées and it's a fabulous place for sunset photos with Tour Eiffel in the background.Of course don't forget to cross it at night when it comes to life with the most amazing lamps.

OK, it's great.. Well, I was going to give it 2 stars, because it's just a bridge, right? But if you read all the reviews, and see how much pleasure it has given to so many people (for free!) well, you would have to be pretty cold-hearted to not upgrade it a few notches.

The Most Intricate Bridge. This is one of the most beautiful bridges in all of the city of Lights. Paris is known for its art, this is a wonderful example of great Architecture and it is a work of art itself. A must see in Paris, and strolling along the Seine is must even in the dead of winter.

Photo opportunity. Great pictures and all during the busy traffic and crowds. The bridge is a wonder and you have to take a stroll across it. You can see the Eiffel Tower and the views of the surroundings are wonderful. Art in the middle of the busy city surroundings. A true touristy thing to do, but fun.

Best place to take night photo of Eiffel Tower. This is really very good place to take night photo of Eiffel Tower.It's not so craudy, so you can use the time as you want, and nearby you have some other atracctions to see by night and day as well :)

Walking across history. To walk across this beautifully decorated bridge, with the gold statuary; to walk where millions have walked across since it was built was awe inspiring. Then to see the beautiful gilt as we passed under the bridge on the bateau on the Seine was a beautiful spectacle!! Words cannot express the beauty of this city!
Beautiful bridge. Spans the lengh of the river with some awesome Eiffel Tower background in it. The sculptures at both ends are amazing as well.

The river siene. Pont Alexandre 2 is on of the many bridges in paris over the river. The sculptures on both the end of the bridge are just magnificent. The bridge reminds the glory of France. It is also a nice bridge for photographers.
Amazing Bridge. Really a great brides.. the view of river from this brige is too good.. it has lots of history.. lot of turist..

Paris' prettiest bridge. Crossed the bridge several time both on foot and also Open top bus tour and Bustronome night time dinner tour. Art nouveau lamps, cherubs, nymphs and winged horses at either end of the bridge (they're gold coloured not real gold leaf).

magnifique! . definitely the best place to take countless pictures of the Eiffel Tower and the views of the river bank are just great during a sunny day. i could literally spend a whole day out there :)

Revitalizing walk!!. We began our walk to the Champ Elysees from Pont Alexandre. The view of the Sienne was amazing from this place and the entire area and atmosphere carries what one may describe as "essence of Paris"
One of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. The bridge is one of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. You can also take perfect pictures with the Eiffel Tower as background from here.
Beautiful bridge. If you're being a "flaneur" in Paris, don't miss meandering over this beautiful bridge. It has sculptures on each end and beautiful lamps lighting it all the way across.

Paris Perfect!. You can spend hours taking photos of Pont Alexandre!! I wanted photos from every single angle -- both at night and during the day!! WOW! On one side is the grandeur of the Grand and Petit Palais...the other is the magnificence of the gold-domed Les Invalides where Napoleon is entombed. At just the right angle...the Eiffel Tower lit up in the background of the bridge is breathtaking!! I have photos from a bus, taxi, on foot, and from the Bateaux Mouche. Can't have enough! Again...as with most of my reviews...read up on French history before you go. It is truly amazing. You might have a new perspective (and appreciation for) the French. I did!

Historic bridge.. The most ornate of the many bridges crossing the Seine, it has gilt statuary and sculptures. Alexander III was the Russian Tsar the bridge was built to honor, in case you're wondering. Near the center of the city, catch it on a walk.

beautiful. as I walked down the river Seine I "stumbled" upon this amazingly beautiful bridge. I took the pictures of lanterns and the sweet figures of cherubs, and the shiny Fames. Pure joy for everyone who likes Beaux-Arts style and all things beautiful
Magnificent. What a beautiful bridge. I have seen this bridge in so many movies it was wonderful to walk across and admire in real life. Great place to take photos from too

The most amazing bridge across the seine . While walking down the famous river seine in paris we stumbled upon this amazing sight ! A stunning piece of craftsmanship! Go take a look at this you wont be disappointed! Its the best bridge by far on the river
The most beautiful bridge. For me, more so than the Eiffel, this bridge is Paris. The style is Beaux-Arts and evokes the Paris of my imagination from over a 100 years ago.

Amazingly beautiful bridge!. Alexandra bridge is not just a simple bridge, it's also a work of art. I always wanted to visit this bridge since it appeared in many movies. All I can tell you is that I'm not disappointed.
It close to L'hotel des Invalides (once Napoleon's palace) and Napoleon's tumb.
Really worth a visit! Don't miss it by anything!

Best bridge in Paris. Wonderful bridge, reflacting all glamour of the city; We loved it
A must see and took a lot of nice pictures there
the zar. it's a bridge to dedicate at zar alexander III of Russie. it's very romantic, and near there is l'hotel des invalides a biggest museum.
Simply beautiful. This is a must see bridge in Paris! I was never impressed much buy the bridges, but this one is just....
Piece of art. Gold plated statues and a unique design. Definitely the most gorgeous bridge in Paris. You can admire it on your way to the Invalides
Relaxing. A peaceful time. calm weather, good visibility, not overcrowded. could walk around, and take one of the boats along the river as well.

An Unparalleled Bridge. The bridge without question is an example of what makes Paris what it is. The fashion, design, detail and pageantry is simply iconic of the city. It seems only fitting the bridge is flanked by the Musee de l'Armee and is near the Louvre, Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel tower.As a note, the view from the bridge immediately to the east of Pont Alexandre III offers not only a fabulous view of the bridge, but also the Eiffel tower in the background. Shifting into different angles, the Musee de l'Armee can be included in the picture.The beauty and appearance of Pont Alexandre III is simply unmatched.
