Historical. Bridge is one of the oldest in paris. Has intersting architecture. Nice and enjoyable for an evening stroll.
Beautiful area in Paris.. This is a lovely place to visit. It is close to local shopping areas and the buildings surrounding it are just as beautiful as the bridge itself!

Most beautiful bridge in Paris.. This amazing bridge was built just in time for the 1900 World's Fair in Paris. It's a conglomeration of several different styles that all blend beautifully together. It has lamps, cherubs, winged horses, nymphs in bronze and gleaming gold tones. Stunning! Don't miss it. A highlight of Paris.
My favorite Parisian bridge. I have a painting of this bridge because I love it so much! See it by day - the gold detailing is magnificent!

C'est magnifique!. To say that Pont Alexandre III is stunning is no doubt an understatement. With its resplendent details - the cherubs, nymphs, pegasus, etc - unseen in any other bridges, Pont Alexandre III is undeniably the most beautiful of all bridges in Paris - and perhaps even in the world. Joining the Champs Elysées and the Grand Palais on the right bank with Napoleon’s resting place, Les Invalides, on the left, Pont Alexandre III commands your attention from different angles and keeps you suspended in that state of wonderment long after you have walked away. We saw the whole stretch of the bridge from the boat when we did the Seine River Cruise in the afternoon and came back two days later, this time walking along the riverside towards the start of the bridge. We couldn't walk all the way across because it was raining heavily that afternoon with the wind blowing in icy gusts, rendering our umbrellas completely useless against the deluge. I mean I do understand why couples would feel extra romantic crossing Pont Alexandre III fingers entwined. Definitely doing that when we're back in Paris next year. After all, it's always nice to leave something 'unticked' for the next travel adventure.:)

Worth Viewing From Many Angles. This memorable bridge can be seen from many angles, including from the road level, the towpath level and on the river itself. I found it easiest to visit using the RER to Invalides, and then using the designated exit for the bridge which takes you straight onto the towpath alongside cyclists and joggers and avoiding the traffic.It's easy to combine this visit with viewing of both sides of the river, with the Grand / Petit Palace on one side and Invalides on the other.
just amazing!. this bridge is just wonderfull!the golden statues!the place is great!you have to go there!by day and also by night!
Beautiful architectural art.. People said it is just a bridge. The details of the bridge definitely speak for themselves. A romantic place to cross it holding hands with your loved one.

Beyond beautiful!. There are several bridges throughout Paris, but this one is just exquisite! The attention to detail will just blow you away. We actually went down to the riverside so that we could appreciate it more fully.

Most beautiful and romantic bridge in the world. Always had a love affair with this bridge from my first visit to Paris, I was smitten by its beauty. Having gone to Paris over 50 times now…I still am drawn by its beauty. It was constructed for the 1900 universal exhibition but its charm is ever lasting...A must see, it possesses all the Paris flair one expects.
You know, its a bridge...but with extra ;). It's a very nice bridge, I think the oldest but I'm not sure...but I loved all the details they put in it...with its statues and ornaments.Very nice!
Good walk. We walked along from Notre Dame to this bridge and back, was a fantastic walk along the water and the bridge really is fantastic. Good bit of history to it too.
magnificent bridge, impressive luxury. the bridge is magnificent, has great golden statues, beautiful lamps, a sample of french decor, it is very centric, worth the stroll

Beautiful. Yes it's just a bridge, but it's a beautiful bridge.
The golden statues that you see, the views across the waters, it's simply magical Paris!
On a good weather day at sunset the photo opportunities are excellent. The sun captures this bridge with such romance.
What can I say - a nice bridge. bridge with gilded statues which are ok if you like that sort of thing. It's nice to see it from a boat on the river

The Magnificence of Paris. I think that this bridge is one of the most magnificent that I've seen of this period and in Paris. It's a beautiful link between the Palais Royale, Petite Palais and Les Invalides. You see the Eiffel Tower therefrom framed by the gilded sculptures, the cupole of the L'Hôtel National des Invalides and the seine of course. Great place for capturing the views of the city of lights.
Very impressive. Very impressive bridge to look at and walk over. The gold and white makes it very striking, especially at sunset or seen from below from one of the boats.
Beautiful.... Ornate bridge and fantastic view along the Seine. Close to several major attractions, so no reason not too see it!

A point for reflection. With views of the Eiffel tower, the Seine, Grand and Petit Palais and Invalides, in addition to the bridge itself, this is a fantastic place in the centre of historic Paris for some reflection in the midst of an evening walk around Paris.

Beautiful gilded statues atop the bridge ends. I like how the statues pictures turned out as the sun was down low, it made the gilded statues glow! There is a RER station and restaurant under the bridge, both hidden from view.
Breathtakingly Ornate Bridge!. A must see if you're in Paris! This bridge is so ornately detailed it's mind blowing! Take a walk across this bridge and let all of Paris soak in!

A glorious Bridge.. Bridges are funny things, mostly they're quite utilitarian and unremarkable but it's a real pleasure to find one which stands out from the herd. This one makes Ponte Sant'Angelo look staid. Gilt as far as the eye can see. The winged horses are particularly impressive. If you like overblown but somehow quite pretty then this is the bridge for you.
Flash bridge. You can definitely tell the bridge apart from others. It's big and looks like Mr. T's chain. Worth a look on the way to the louvre.
great bridge, familiar from many movies. Nice bridge, familiar from many movies. It have a great view for the Eiffel Tower, the Grand and Petit Palais and all over the River Seine.

Beautiful Bridge. The most beautiful bridge in Paris. We went in the evening, and had an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower's sparkling light show. I was disappointed that the beautiful lamps on the bridge did not light up though.

Pont Alexandre-III: Le plus beau pont de Paris!. Euh...Pont Alexandre-III: Le plus beau pont du monde...
I can stare at this bridge forever and never get bored.
Every friend who visits Paris, I make each of them admire this bridge.
A must see. No other bridge lie it in the world. Take your time to enjoy it and take plenty of pictures to remember it.
Worth a walk over.. Lovely bridge, well worth taking time out to walk over it if near the Grand & Petit Palaces. Good views of the Seine.
THE most beautiful bridge in Paris. Each parisian bridge has something special about them, but this is the one that I always stop and take a picture. It's truly a work of art.

nice bringe over the Seine. it is a nice bridge over the seine river with fancy Gold statues that add some thrill. enjoy the river from the bridge and you can also enjoy the bridge from a river boat trip.

Pretty Bridge. One of the many bridges along the Seine. We've always gone under it on boat trips. But this time on a walk down the Champs Elysee we turned to have a look. With its golden statues at either end it makes for a good photo opportunity with the Grand, Petit Palaces and Musee D'Orsy over the other side.
Beautiful bridge. The Pont Alexander is the beautiful bridge and an ideal place to take a walk along the Seine. Take a few minutes and walk across the bridge and along the Seine.

One of the more regal bridges. I spent an entire day walking back and forth across Seine bridges, and I paused a while longer at this magnificent one. All of the bridges are beautiful. This ended up being the one I sketched.
Beautiful Bridge. Saw this bridge from a Seine River cruise boat and on a walking tour of Paris.It really is beautiful.From the four end pillars to the history behind it.A must see when in Paris.

Iconic bridge. This magnificent Belle Epoque bridge is the one to see of all the bridges that traverse the Seine. It been featured in so many movies but most memorably in that great bio-movie, on the tragic life of painter Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, Le Moulin Rouge.

Art Nouveau bond between France & Russia. The most outstanding and elaborate bridge spanning the Seine. The Pont Alexandre III was built between 1897 and 1900 at the same time as the Grand Palais. It is instantly recognisable by its four towering pillars at each corner, topped with gilded statues. The flowing lines of the statues and street lamps are a wonderful expression of Art Nouveau which was popular at the turn of the century.The bridge is named after the Tsar who singed the Franco-Russian Alliance in 1892. Alexandre's son Tsar Nicholas II laid the foundation stone and was also there for the opening.Some of the decoration is only visible from the river. Huge coats of arms framed by nymphs of the River Seine and River Neva in St Petersburg adorn the central arch. The Seine nymphs are on the Eiffel Tower side while the Russian coat of arms faces the Louvre.
Beautiful. This bridged has been saw in many movies.It's a very aristocratic place. You could visit walking Eiffel Tower, Invalides Hotel, Champs-Elysees avenue, Arch of Triumph.
Beautiful. No better place to take in the views of the Paris skyline, it was a bit wet today but you could still imagine the splendour of this lovely city , it's free , it's a must do and see . Enjoy
The best bridge. The most beautiful bridge in paris.. great for romantic night walks...... Great view to eiffel tower also

Cool spot. Good looking bridge, but just a bridge. True, is placed between some good touristic attractions, we went on foot around it and it was a nice walk. You can overlook the passing tour boats over de Seine and have a nice view of the sunset and the Eifell tower at the same time.
Great architecture, the bridge towards Invalids. The bridge was extremely decorative but still sublime and noble and was fully presenting the dignity of the dynasty.
Beautiful Historic view. This point shouldn't be missed. It will actually be hard to miss it during your visit as it is a crossover bridge used between several tourist spots.

The most bautiful bridge in Paris!. One of the most beautiful bridges I've ever seen! It is a symbol of friendship between Russia and France and also has a symbol of St. Petersburg on it what is very interesting for people not familiar with Russia.
Simply Stunning. Crossed this bridge on a tour bus and was simply amazed at the quality and fine build quality. Has ornate lighting and guilded statues adorning it . Its got the WOW factor.

As bridges go, it's okay.. It's a bridge. It is a very attractive looking bridge with some ornate sculptures. Really not much more to say than that.

Beautiful bridge. This bridge is decorated very beautifully.
Not much else to say, being a bridge...
Worth looking at whilst in the city.
Nice area. It is nice area to walk and admire this city. Pont Alexandre is beautiful place where you can enjoy river view!
Nice attraction. The pont Alexandre lll is a beautiful bridge with great history , the bridge is in the centre with awesome views up the seine

Utter beauty.... This has to be one of the, maybe THE most beautiful bridge in the world. Go stand and stare. It's free and magnificent. There are statues and gold. Don't make the mistake of pointing it out as you pass by in a taxi. Go visit.
Not a big deal.. It's just a bridge... not that simple, but you won't go to Paris just to see it, right: For me it is not a touristic important place, maybe if you like history very much.

Wonderful. The wonderful arhitecture of
this pont make the difference of the other else. You will be excited to view it walking or on the boat.
Pleasant view.. In the middle of the bridge you can see both Petit and Grand Palais and at the other side, the Golden Dome over Napoleon's tomb!

Elegant bridge, perfect for Photo Opps. This lovely bridge located in the heart of the city is a must see. The ornate details of the bridge along with the views of some of the cities great monuments make this a must. If you looking for a photo op, this is your spot. The light posts are so lovely. Pick an angel and you are sure to get something interesting in the back round. Afterword you can go down the steps and take a lovely stroll along the Seine River.

Spectacular bridge. No stroll along the River Seine can be complete without a visit to this iconic and storied bridge. Even on a rainy day you will find locals and tourist alike strolling along the famed bridge

My favourite Parisian bridge. Of all the many bridges that cross the Seine this one is my favourite.From when I first saw it nearly 30 years ago I love its ornateness and it's position spanning the Seine from Les Invalides to the Grand et Petit Palais.There is something almost magical about seeing it at dusk when the sky takes on that couleur only seen in Paris and the lamps start lighting up.The beautiful statues and mouldings in gold shine and it just says Paris to me.
Family Holiday. It was beautiful and we enjoyed walking it. It was on our way to Champs-Elysee and we enjoyed the views over the Siene

Cycle touring of Paris highlights.. We cycled our way around Paris with the Fat tyre cycle tour company. A great way to take many of Paris's attractions. Pont Alexandre one of them. An interesting story about the gold statues at the end of the bridge. Looking towards the past , present , and future Paris. Can be busy in the European summer though.also romantic to cruise under or just have a picnic on the river bank during twilight time to watch the summer sun set.

A Masterpiece of a Bridge. This Bridge is beautiful. It is so ornate it is worth every word of praise. Trying to build a bridge like that now would be extremely difficult. The workmanship and effort it must have taken is probably beyond even the most up to date modern equipment. I was amazed and fell in love with this bridge. In the photo I am wearing a pink shirt and waving to my husband. I am hardly visible but I am there.

The SECOND most beautiful bridge in the world (Sydney Harbour's beats this,and that's because it's home). The most beautiful bridge in all of (what i have seen....and that's a fair bit) Europe.Truly a sight to behold and the one place you must get a romantic,"sunset in Paris" photo.With Paris spread out in all her glory in front of you,the Seine below and artists,songwriters and poets being inspired around you,you feel the essence of Paris right here.If you are into architecture,this will amaze you with it's ornateness and sheer intricacy (take a look also from the river on a cruise to gain another perspective).All in all,this bridge is a piece of history and French design that is a must do whilst you are here (it was enough to have me back twice from the other side of the world )

The Most Elegant Bridge in Paris. Pont Alexandre III is a beautiful Bridge set in the heart of Paris. I have done many watercolor paintings of this bridge as have artists from every part of the world. Take a leisurely stroll over the bridge and stop at the midway mark. Turn 360 degrees and wherever you look you will see another stunning Parisian landmark.

very beautiful and artistic bridge. Beautifully constructed and one of the very different bridge in Paris. The rows of beautiful black lamps are super amazing. Best thing is that we can enjoy the river side walk just by getting down of the bridge by using stairs. Downstairs there are many river side restaurants (which I have never tried though) as the cost seems on a higher side to me. But we do have some of the crepe stalls (for pick and move). When I visited, there were temp toilets available. along side the river we have many logs lying around where we can sit for hours to gaze the river. Historical monuments like Nepolian Tomb is walking distance.
very pretty. the bridge is very beautiful and unlike most attractions in Paris, is not crowded, which makes visiting it much nicer.
impressive. charming. a nice view with the river and the building around. You can feel history. Nice to see it from the shore and from the boat on the river;
Beautiful bridge. Walked to this bridge and its a sight to be seen, very special and magnificent to look at and seeing a bit of history is always worth doing.

Magnifique!!!. It's one of the most beautiful bridges in Paris... Elegant, ornate, well maintenance, gorgeous details in gold and outstanding views of the city from there. By Metro, by Bus or just walking, this is a MUST SEE...
Gorgeous bridge with stunning views. Crossing the Pont Alexandre III bridge is a must-do in Paris, the ornate decoration and the beautiful views, particularly down to Les Invalides - magic.

Looks great from the river too. Constructed for the world fair, this bridge is the most ornate bridge in all of Paris. It's both slightly over-hyped and yet spectacular enough to get lost in (especially if you like historical architecture). The bridge looks good from any angle, and is hard to miss if you're ever around the Champs-Élysées or the Invalides.

Loveley Bridge. A must to walk over and back, will not take too long to see this magnificantly decorated bridge named for the visit of the French fleet to Russia in 1891 and the subsequent Entente Cordial betweem France and Russia. History is great.

Parisian 'élégance' between Grand Palais and Invalides. One of the most famous (and admittedly most elegant) bridges in Paris. On one side, the glass silhouette of Grand Palais, on the other side, the impressive lawn and majestic dome of Invalides. In between, a symphony of dancing golden angels and delicate candelabra, saluting the Eiffel Tower in the distance and waving at the passing-by Bateaux Mouches. Did you read that this is a beautiful photo opp? Enjoy!

My favourite of all the bridges in Paris. This is without a doubt the most beautiful bridge in all of Paris. Lovely to look at, lovely to walk over and amazing to look at from a distance. Wonderful detail to be enjoyed.. It delights me that man can transform a utility into a work of art. So - from a mere bridge to a masterpiece. Well worth a visit.

amazing!. this wonderful bridge expresses the french /russian friendship in the times of the tsar.it was a gift for the french by the tsar and was inaugurated by the tsar in person!symbolizing the russian french friendship.you could notice exactly the russian style and the greatness of architecture of this era.
Great bridge!. Worth viewing from the seine and going over it! Great bridge. Fantastic. Why must I write 50 characters!!!!!
Day trip. I love Paris and never have enough, had a day trip recently and always admire this bridge, its beautiful and you can take amazing photos of Eiffel Tower
Great place. Awesome location close to seine, Very close to Eiffel Tower and nice place to take lots of pictures.
A gateway you must see. The Pont crosses over the Seine river overlooked by Bronze winged horses with cherubs and Nymphs. Its an impressive landmark to see and cross.
Impressive bridge. Great example bridge which is located close to other attractions, so you easily walk to. Good photo opportunity. Boat restaurants nearby.

Magnificent. The Alexandre 3 bridge is undoubtedly Paris’s most beautiful.  Whether you are looking at it from Avenue Champs-Elysées’ ‘Rond Point’ square or from the Invalides, this bridge inaugurated in Oct 1896 by Russian Tsar Nicholas 11, son of the man after whom the bridge has been named – Tsar Alexander 3 – its elegance takes one’s breath away.I suggest you view it from the ‘Rond Point’ then you walk towards it along Avenue Franklin D. Roosevelt. You will be stopping frequently to take photos but do watch out as the traffic can be hectic on Cours la Reine along the River Seine. Believe me the cars will not stop for you.When the weather is kind you ought to take the steps down to the right bank of the Seine, either for a quieter stroll along the river or to admire the Eiffel Tower which will be on your right.

Exquisite. Exquisite has never been a word I've used to describe a bridge before but this one really does deserve it! My (and probably many other people's) favourite bridge in Paris. Be sure to at least see it, if not cross it. I walked under it too to explore the banks of the Seine a bit more - good place for jogging. There's a nightclub underneath as well which I imagine would be pretty cool to check out.

one of the large bridges in Paris. Nothing particularly special with this bridge.Below, by the river on both sides, it is possible to walk along the river. On the left bank, there are a few temporary bars in the Summer, as well as a few trees that have been recently planted.It is also a good place to go jogging.
Worth a visit. It is worth a look while you are in Paris. There are plenty of things to see, yet this bridge is great.
So Beautiful!. I always delight in walking on Le Pont and taking so many photos and just absorbing the sights on Le Seine!!

The One and Only Bridge. This is the fanciest bridge in Paris. Gorgeous statues line the span of the bridge with the breathtaking Eiffel Tower in the background.There are so many little intricate discoveries. Be sure to spend some time looking at everything.The view can't be beat. Look down at all the people walking the banks of the Seine.Lots of great photo opportunities here. Many people take their wedding photos here.Don't miss it.
Magical even on the gloomiest of dayys.. We walked from the Eiffel tower too the Bastille, crossing this bridge. It is so worth a look. how nice can a bridge bee, this one is absolutely beautiful.
Need to walk across the bridge. Just a beautiful bridge. I recommend a quick walk across it. Take in the siene river. A must stop in paris
Great bridge with outstanding statuary. This bridge offers greatKodak moments of the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and the Grand Palais as well as Seine traffic
Good view. Good place to take pictures of Eiffel tower, and Seine. The bridge itself is very interesting and historical.
Beautiful bridge. Take your time on the bridge to check all details, and the views to the Seine river with the Eiffel tower are amazing.

The most prestigious bridge. It's architecture, sumptuous, dimensions it quite large beautiful view of the Seine and bateau mouche.Both ends leads you either to Grand Palais from one side or the Place des Invalides on the other.
Beautiful. Bridge ! Stop by and take a moment to look around. Especially in a nice day during evening hour. watch out for the pickpockets. They may ask you to sign some survey... just be careful
Scenic bridge. A beautiful bridge, built in 1897. Great for photos with the lanterns and the Eiffel Tower in the background.

Beautiful Bridge. As other have said, a great place to take in the sights of Paris - the Seine, the Eiffel Tower, the historic buildings along the banks. Worth crossing en route to other destinations.

Beautiful. A great place to take nice pics! The Pont is beautiful, and there you can see the Musée de l'Armée. the Seine, the Eiffel Tower...
Well, I took a lot of pretty pics there, and I recommend!

An ornate avenue of Paris life.. This is a beautiful ornate bridge next to the fabulous glass Palais and with a view of Hotel les Invalides. It's a great spot at dusk for people watching and photographing the Eiffel Tower.

The Most Romantic Bridge. I was just here a few nights ago & waited for the lights to come on the bridge. While sitting on the bridge, the Eiffel Tower's lights twinkled for a few minutes, it was such a beautiful sight. This bridge is in the ending scene on "Midnight In Paris", which is my favorite movie. Enjoy a nice stroll across the Pont Alexandre.
go back into history. provides a great view of the Seine and it's bridges. Go and walk the different sides of teh bridge and you fall in love with Paris.
Impressive. It was reminiscent of all those vintage postcards of Paris. It's so romantic, especially by night. I loved the majestic guiided statues.

Elegant. We crossed this bridge several times going from Les Invalides to Champs D'Elyees and back again. Gotta love the 4 columns with gilded Fames (Commerce, Industry, Science and Arts) at each end with their gilt-bronze statues at the top. In the middle of the bridge, there are sculptures of nymphs, signifying the Franco-Russian alliance. The bridge offers unobstructed views of the Les Invalides & you can see the Eiffel Tower at a distance. On one side of the bridge is the Petit Palais and Grand Palais and the other side is Les Invalides.
CZAR. The bridge was named in the honour of czar of RUSIA ALEXANDRE III.It has appeared in a lot of french movies,

Remarkable.. Pont Alexander III simply looms up as one meanders down La Seine. It is perhaps one of the most distinctive bridges across La Seine and is immediately identifiable by the four wonderful golden (gilt-bronze) statues of Fames which dominate the structure. Easily accessible from the Champs Elysée it is well worth visiting the bridge at night as it is illuminated and the 'golden' statues seem to come alive!

Stunning bridge with my favourites - sculptures!. The most ornate bridge in Paris is really something to behold, in both day and night-time. Beautiful sculptures adorn the bridge and it is a lovely stroll across, with some great views along the Seine. Loved it, and the sculptures were magnificent. A place to pause and savour.
Prettiest Bridge in Paris. You have to walk along the bridge to enjoy the sculptures up close. It is amazing and perfect to take pictures.

Beautiful. The sculptures are beautiful on the bridge, very picturesque overall. The boat cruise takes you under this bridge and its beautiful artwork is closely visible. The bridge is beautiful in the night to take some perfect snaps.

A bridge and a symbol of Paris!. The iconic "Pont Alexandre III" is one of the most acclaimed and visited monuments of Paris. Inaugurated in 1900, it was named after Russian Czar Alexandre III, who concluded the "Franco-Russian Alliance" in 1892. This "Beaux-Art" style bridge is considered the most ornamented one of Paris (with amazing results, I would say). It is also considered a real wonder of 19th century engineering, built with such care (rare at that period - late 19th century), aiming to prevent its construction from obscuring the views of neighboring monuments: the "Grand Palais" and the "Petit Palais" on the Champs-Élysées area, and the "Invalides", in its other extremity. One extra reason to visit "Pont Alexandre III": it is listed as a French National Monument, what means how special and important it is! Enjoy!

Lovely!. The Pont Alexandre III is one of the most pretty bridges in Paris. It spans the Seine river linking the area around Invalides to the Champs Elysees area. Beautiful sculptures with golden lacquer giving brilliant reflections of sunlight. Perfect photo opportunities. Highly recommended.

Piece of Art. This bridge is like no other in Paris, all the sculptures at the entrance on either side are amazing, the bridge itself has some pretty cool architectural design to it... definitely a must see when in Paris
Beautiful. Like everything in Paris, the Alexander III bridge is a place to see...It's very beautiful and has a great view of the tower....

Wow. The view at night is awesome. We visited Eiffel Tower and we got down near the Roue de Paris and took a walk along the Seine river. We reached Pont Alexandre III and it was worth it.Its very beautiful. The light on the river, the Roue de Paris. Moreover, the sight of the Hotel des Invalides is perfect at night.
Kodak moment!. Beautiful bridge...must see! Short walk from the hotel and takes you over to the "other" side of Paris :)
beautiful views. This is a beautiful bridge, very romantic and great views. You have to come here for a walk and admire the city.
beautiful place. We saw this during the boat cruise trip and loved the statues. Then visited the bridge later and loved the views as well, very beautiful especially in the evening.

Stunning architectural inspiration. There are few places in the world where an architectural construction is so over-the-top, yet blends in perfectly with its surroundings. Functionally serving thousands of vehicles per day, but always available for that romantic stroll, day or night, good weather or not.
Pont Alexandre 3. It is a serene spot and the riverfront is quite good. You can take a walk, jog or simply enjoy the river. Right in the front of eiffel, you can take a river tour.
Beautiful bridge!!. I love this place, beautiful and very romantic!! I think at night looks more beautiful, you will appreciate the view!!

Nice bridge.... This is a really nice bridge. Make a stop to see if you are in the area. Get some photos of the gilt-bronze statues on the pillars on either end. Nice place to stop and catch your breath.
greatness. In December strong winds. To dress warmer. Beautiful view of Paris. You can take a picture with a view of the Eiffel Tower.

Stunning Bridge. The Pont Alexandre III was built between 1896 and 1900 and is named after Tsar Alexander III of Russia. The foundation stone was laid by Nicholas II (the son of Alexander III). The Pont Alexandre III spans the Left and Right banks of the Seine River and is located near the center of Paris just north of Les Invalides and the Invalides Metro stop. It is also located just south of the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais. The bridge is classified as a French Monument historique ( a National Heritage site).I have walked by this bridge numerous times on my various trips to Paris and am always amazed at the ornate artwork of this bridge. I think this bridge is both an amazing piece of art and a stunning bridge. The last time I strolled across this bridge was with my wife on a Monday morning in late October. We also viewed it while walking along the Seine River and have also taken boat rides under it and gained a different perspective (still stunning). The views of Paris from the bridge are fantastic and I really enjoyed spending some time there.I really enjoyed the ornate figures, carvings and sculptures on the bridge. The bridge also has four stunning pillars near both banks with gilt-bronze statues of “Fames” on top of each one. I think the Pont Alexandre III is the most stunning bridge in Paris and is my favorite bridge in this great city. It is probably the most famous bridge in Paris.Overall I love this bridge and thought it was stunning. I recommend that you see it up close when visiting Paris. It is very easy to visit since it is centrally located near many famous attractions and landmarks.
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. Wonderful ornate decorations with splendid views either way. Just a short walk from Grand Palais with Invalides on the far side
Beautiful bridge. Beautiful bridge with a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. Great place to watch the hourly light show.

Beautiful Bridge. This would be my absolute favourite bridge in Paris. The bridge itself is beautiful but the view is also amazing. I loved it so much that I crossed it several times by foot. I only found out after we'd left Paris that you can actually walk underneath it as well.
Great views at night. There are many closer views to the Eiffel tower, but this view is nice of the whole city. A busy location but very beautiful.

The most beautiful bridge of Seine river.... This is the most beautiful bridge of the river Seine decorated which bronze statues and numerous really gorgeous lamps. As you walk across the bridge you can admire from one side the golden dome of Les Invalides hospital (now the War museum and Napoleon's tomb) and from the ather side the glass and iron dome of the Grand Palais. As you stand in the middle of the bridge you may see on one side the tour Eiffel! This is one of the most spectacular points of this city and considered really iconic!
Must See. Ist just a bridge but its stunning, is located in a very beautiful area and the have the Musée de L'Armée right in front of your eyes to make the view even better.

Beautiful. this is something I had seen on my boat ride on the siene river! If you get a chance to take the boat tours they give lots of information about the surrounding areas including this! So much history to learn and it's fun! Definitely a must see thing!
Another favorite of mine. This bridge was among the first places I came across, when in Paris, and became one of my favorite places to walk. It is definitely a place for romance.

Great summer fun under the bridge!. This is indeed a beautiful bridge and I marvel at it every time I'm in Paris. But, I think what I've enjoyed most is the nighttime hang out spot that it becomes in the summer where you can meet up with friends to have some crepes and gallettes while drinking beer, wine or cocktails. The ambiance is fantastic - and yes, there's some romance in there too if you prefer.
Majestic. I can't believe how this bridge was built. The whole thing is a piece of art. I don't have words to describe it. Just Majestic!

A place to kiss and be kissed. No matter how old you are, this place is so romantic and SO beautiful, you have to visit it and stay around for a while, even if it is raining. And don't forget to French kiss...

Beautiful bridge. Paris is full of amazing places. Point Alexandre III is one of them. Seeing such a detailed architecture, makes me wonder how did they do it without all the machine that are available nowadays.... Good place to see Paris from. Close to Eiffel Tower, Champs d'Elysees.
Beautiful bridge. A beautifully build bridge, at least worth a visit when in Paris. Great view of the river with Eiffel Tower in the background.However cleanliness around Paris is questionable.

Just a bridge really.. It's just a bridge, some of the architecture is lovely but its rammed with cars and bikes.. great view of the seine but it is just a bridge. If you have seen and climbed Charles bridge in Prague this does not compare.
A bridge with an attitude. bath in the beauty of this magnificent bridge and all it's glory…stroll like a true Parisian and be french
Beautiful bridge. what to say? certainly one of the most beautiful bridges in the world! Just nearby "Le Grand Palais" and "Champs Elysee".
astonishing view and amazing architecture . one of the most famous bridges in europe. nice spot for photos, nice statues, u can also see eiffel from there.
Favorite Spot. Favorite Spot. Love the views. Easy to find. Pass along the way to other Paris sights. Always lots of people.
Midnight, 31 December, view of the Tour d'Eiffel: Bienvenue 2015!. Wonderful view of Paris: very close to the Grand and Petit Palais, as well as the Champs d'Elysees and Invalides.

The bridge to be in Paris. It is just a bridge but when you are in it and you see on one side the Invalides the other side the Petit and Grand Palais. It is a very nice place to be in. The bridge or Pont has some architectural markings that makes it a good place for lots of pictures. Great to soak in the river Seine view. Just awesome to view and feel that you are truly in Paris.

Majastic. There are a few bridges over the River Seine but this one is certainly the most beautiful. It offers not only great views of the river itself but also the Grand Palace. A must to visit and walk over.

1900 AD art nouveau bridge with grand statuary. The inscription states that the bridge opened in 1900. It is very side and very grand and has a lot of beautiful bronze statues, many of them gilded. Well worth a detour if you don't happen to see it on your travels round Paris

Absolutely beautiful bridge. We got off the big bus and decide to walk across this bridge. Great photo opportunities and try bridge is absolutely beautiful! Definitely a bridge to walk across when in Paris.

Enduring opulence. Pont Alexandre III stands above the crowd in beautiful bridges in Paris. A generous bridge, flanked by intricate lamp posts, numerous statues and rich, ornate ironwork and embellished in gold. It is simply stunning to walk along, over and beside. Enjoy the bridge from near and afar.

The Most Beautiful Bridge IN THE WORLD!!. It captures the magic of Paris. I have been to the City of Lights many, many times and I never get tired of looking at this bridge. It's just not just a bridge it is a work of art!
Beautiful. Even in the pouring rain I am so glad we came here!! Bridge is amazing and views are incredible! a Definite must see!!

Majesty of Paris. Unrivalled beauty and majesty. Stunning view of Paris , seine river and access to the Grand Palais. It is just magical to capture the beauty of this stunning bridge , commerating the french russian alliance in 1892 . It is name after the Tsar Alexander III . It is a brilliant 19st century archictectural marvel and gives quite a perspective to the Invalides and Grand Palais .
Beautiful bridge. Worth a walk across the bridge as great views both sides. You will end up coming across it by visiting all the main tourist attractions or on the bus tour.

One of the better bridges down the River Seine. We saw this bridge when we were on a boat trip down the River Seine. It was beautiful. The charm of Paris is not a story tale. It is true and you will fall in love with the city like many have even if you are not the romantic type.

A BEAUTIFUL BRIDGE. In a city of lovely bridges, the Pont Alexandre III is its most beautiful with spectacular gilded decoration and sculptures of the fin-de-siècle, constructed for the Paris Exposition Universelle of 1900, the most successful world exhibition when Paris had 57 million visitors, twice the then population of France. It is also the scene on its nearby quay of occasional antiques fairs. Not always realised, it was constructed in a single span, an innovation for the period. It is particularly a wonderful vantage point to look at many of the major sites of the city, not least the Invalides, the Grand and Petit Palais, the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre.
Beautiful historic bridge. Beautiful structure with a great view of the Eiffel Tower. The bridge is ornate and rich in history.

Wonderful Historical Site. My visit to Paris included a few stops on the tour bus, and this was one of them. Prior to my trip, I began reading the Leo Tolstoy novel "War and Peace", only to be surprised by the amount of international relations in the first several chapters.Unbeknownst to me, this bridge confirmed in my mind, that our great nations could cooperate at one point in history (if only they could return to the relations of the past). Either way, this is a gorgeous bridge in dedication to Czar Alexander the III. I personally loved the design of the bridge, and anyone interested in international relations, or world history should make a visit.
Beautiful place to click pics. Lovely bridge and beautiful place to click pictures, it is just a short walk from Place de la Concorde
Jogging. Excellent jogging strip in left bank, starting from Pont Alexandre IIIto ... as far as you get. Metro brings you back :-)
Nice place next to the river. It is a very nice place where young people gather to have some drinks. But you should go to this place during hot summer days.
A history lesson on steroids. The red carpet to Invalides and a piece, albeit elegant piece of French history. Ornate, dotted with old-style lamps, simply beautiful. Take it in, it's free of charge.

Beautiful. Extremely pretty bridge on the Siene. Worth a walk on a beautiful evening or on a clear night.
Located close to a metro station.
Beautiful bridge. This is one of the most beautiful bridges i have ever seen. Great architecture with golden statues! Must see in paris!
art. Great feeking in every step walked by this bridge. All rhe details of art are gorgeus and the surrounding buildings help in having a beautiful sight.
Ornate monumental pillars. The artwork of the pillars on this bridge is substantially involved and truly art.that is why it is worth seeing
Great place for a photograph. Looking for a great place to take a photograph with the Eiffel Tower in the background. Even at night it is all lit up.

one of the best bridges in paris. My wife's favourite bridge in Paris so it has to be good.
It's also on the way to the restaurant Vaubin :)
a bridge too far. It's a bridge...useful way of crossing the river but wouldn't go too far out of your way to see it (it ain't no (Prague) Charles Bridge)...ditto Pont Neuf.
Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris. Poised between the Invalides and Place Concorde, this beautifully designed bridge (1897-1900) gives a wonderful view of the Seine and Paris landmarks.

Not Your Average Bridge!. Built at the turn of the last century, the bridge features Art Noveau lamps, winged horses and cherubs. It is anchored by 4 columns with gilded Fames (Commerce, Industry, Science and Arts). The bridge is beautiful by day offering unobstructed views of the Les Invalides. The Eiffel Tower can be seen in the distance - it is beautiful view lit up at night. The bridge looks striking at night from the river cruises when it is lit up. We happen to hit it right and watched as they closed the bridge momentarily to film for a 1920's movie! On one side of the bridge is the Petit Palais and Grand Palais and the other side is Les Invalides... a nice day trip if you want to see them all.

A Great bridge, but Beware the Predators. Yes, it's everything people say it is, but like the other Seine bridges, it is infested with scam artists. The 2 currently popular groups are the dropped ring people and the fake petition girls. We've had ample exposure to them in the last 4 months.Let's start with #1. You are strolling across the bridge when you hear a clink of metal on pavement immediately followed by a person asking you if this "is your ring". Of course, you say no. He/she then explains that he/she just found the "gold" (actually brass) ring, that it is obviously very valuable, and that he will sell it to you for a fraction of its value because he/she really needs the money. Best approach - ignore him/her. Most gratifying approach - tell him/her in French that you may not be a moron, but he/she certainly is.On to #2. You are crossing the bridge (or in the Tuilleries, or in front of the Louvre, or walking along the Seine) and a couple of well dressed, earnest young women who look like college students approach and in impeccable English (slight upper class British accent) ask if you speak English. A positive answer initiates a request to sign a petition. While investigating the petition, their accomplices either rummage through your purse for your wallet or pick your pocket. The best answer to the question is "no" in a language other than English (Nein - German, non - French, anyo - Korean, ohi - Greek or ack - Inuktitut: all work quite well). The best answer I have seen in 4 months here was delivered by a cop on the Quai d'Orsay. He saw a group of these people on the opposite side of a generous sized mud puddle. He sped up to the puddle on his mountain bike, hit the rear brake hard, and skidded sideways into the puddle, soaking the lot of them in muddy water. It was brilliant!Forewarned is forearmed.

Most photograph bridge in Paris, specially weddings.. At night , it is magic with the Eiffel Tower in the back glittering! There is a new boat nearby, The ROSA-BONHEUR. Great dancing at night, cheap bottles of wines, 18 euros. The Grand Palais on one side and the Invalides on the other, WOW! Can't see that architecture anywhere in the world! This is Paris at his best...Enjoy the walk and be surrounded by beauty, romance and Paris!

Beautiful!. The Pont Alexandre III bridge is touted as being the most beautiful bridge in Paris and it doesn't disappoint. Whether on foot or from the water, its cherubs, wreaths, lamps and other adornments are wonderful.

An Elegant Bridge. I crossed this bridge several times going from Les Invalides to Champs D'Elyees and back again. I love the columns at each end with their gilt-bronze statues at the top; I had seen these at a distance in the past, but walking across the bridge a few times enabled me to get an up-close view. In the middle of the bridge, there are sculptures of nymphs, signifying the Franco-Russian alliance. It is a spectacular bridge, perhaps the most beautiful bridge crossing the Seine.
Beautiful Views. Very nice architecture and beautiful view to the Eiffel Tower, Is definitely a great place to take nice pictures.

Just love this bridge. All the bridges across the Seine are something, but this one is really special with its lamps and gold decorations. Photographers a great shot from the Plac de La Concord end looking along the river to the Eiffel Tour.
Monumental!. Great architecture on bridge over Seine! I love the 4 statues at the corners of the bridge and the photo ops of the Eiffel Tower in the background!

majestuous. with the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais on one side and the Esplanade of the Invalides on the other side, this brige is simply majestuous. walk it from the Grand Palais and turn left (toward notre dame) once you cross the Seine. walk along the river, pass in front of the Palais d'Orsay to the place de la concorde. if you are courageous, go to the Louvre, enjoy the bouquinistes. this is Paris at its best.
every pont is beautiful in Paris. of course, this is the most beautiful, it is the best... but still any bridge deserves to be crossed and admired...

Ornate and Beautiful. It is a very well traveled, wide and busy bridge. Take the time to stop and look at the lights/lamps, statues, railings and other ornamental details.You might pass it if heading from Champs Elysee Clemenceau (Petit Palais, Grand Palais) or Les Invalides. It is beautiful on a sunny day because the gold paint shimmers off the statues. On a rainy night, the effect is very different but still visually interesting.
Tres Romantique. A spectacular feature of what was a very romantic day strolling through the beautiful city of Paris.. Stop for a quick Kiss..!!
Very picturesque!!. This pont is a must see. It's beautiful and the details are tremendous. Take your time and walk across or down below along the River Siene. You won't be disappointed. I promise!
Meh. I mean it's just a bridge with some ornaments. If you are in to that kind of thing it sure would be interesting.

Centre of the city view. This is the heart of the city, quite literally the centre. Rebuilt in 1900, it captures the 18th century charm with its wrought iron railings and street lights. Situated over one of the numerous bridges on the Seine, it gives a panoramic view of the Seine river and bustling cruises below, the Parliament building on one side, the Eiffel Tower on another and the Obelisk on the other. A bit busy intersection, but recommend to spend a few moments soaking in the full panorama of Paris from this point.
Excellent. Very nice and gorgeous pont. It was something special for me. Pont is not so big but all pont elements are perfect and tells about the history.

just my favourite spot. My favourite spot in Paris. Took dozens of pictures, on one side you see the Eiffel Tower, great view of the Invalide, Air France building, la Seine. Best thing to do is to go after a day in Musee d'Orsay and then go for a nice walk through it and turn back proceeding towards the Tuilieries Gardens.
Bridge along the way. Walked all over Paris passed this bridge took a few pictures and moved on. You wont miss it if you are walking to the Eiffel Tower its close by. It was nice scenery.
My very-very special place in Paris. The best place to feel the character of Paris. Seems like it's possible to touch the bottomless sky above and Seine is even more azure from this point
The loveliest bridge in Paris. Nothing much else to say other than it is worth it if anywhere near to go for a walk around and across and it costs nothing.

Beautiful. This bridge is absolutely breathtaking during the day and even more at night. Unfortunately I didn't go into Hotel Invalides which is what the bridge leads you to . Anyhow def worth a visit . If you go at night make sure to walk down the stairs and look from underneath. You can get amazing pictures.
Beautiful for nighttime stroll. It's a beautiful ornate bridge, definitely worth a walk. In the evening it has a wonderful view of the lit up Eiffel Tower. Don't miss this one!
Nice to walk across. beautiful views of Paris from this bridge. If you are too tired, just take the bus # 83 or 93 across the bridge.
Beautiful. This is a must go especially in morning time..looks awesome.. Revisited this in the end of november this year and it looks beautiful

Beautiful bridge. This is my favorite bridge i took many photos there. Its just so beautiful ! some times i sat on the lawn beside the bridge and watched the boat passed under the bridge, and saw many tourist came to take a photos. Its just peacefull

The view of the Bridge from the river walk is very special. There is now a river park along what was a roadway and there is a restaurant and other places to sit and enjoy the views. A wonderful place to people watch and to see the river traffic in general. Also the views of the bridge and Grand Palais are great eye candy. Really special place to take pics as well.

The most romantic bridge in Paris'. All the newlyweds from allover the world - irrespective of religion come on this bridge for the photo sessions. It the only bridge in one span. Beautifully ornated with romantic gas lamps. "Midnight in Paris" ends up on this bridge. From there a great view 360° around. A must
Great place to take photos. Some of the best photos from our trip were from this bridge. You can also see the Eiffel Tower from here.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. My personal favorite of all the bridges in Paris. The amount of work and craftsmanship that went into a bridge is simply astounding. The one thing I disliked is the "love locks" that a few people attached to some of the figures and bridge - save that for the lock bridges.

You have to visit it.. This is IMHO the most beautiful bridge in Paris; the columns anchoring the bridge are crowned by the "Fames":On the Right Bank, "Fame of the Sciences" and the "Fame of the Arts"; at their bases, "Contemporary France" and "France of Charlemagne".On the Left Bank, the "Fame of Commerce" and the "Fame of Industry"; at their bases "France of the Renaissance" and "France of Louis XIV". There are lions groups on both Banks. The reliefs are at the centers of the arches are memorials to the Franco-Russian Alliance. The "Nymphs of the Seine" has a relief of the arms of France, and faces the "Nymphs of the Neva" with the arms of Imperial Russia.And obviously the views of the Eiffel tower, the Invalides; you can glance the Champs Elysees and the Grand Palais and Petit Palais.Definitely the bridge to visit in Paris

Beautiful. Reminded me of the famous Charles bridge in Prague. Lovely old fashioned lights and from the river you can see the detail on the side of the bridge. At the entrance to the bridge are huge plinths with stunning gold statues that take your breath away, so big and fabulous. Well worth going to see.
Favorite Bridge. It is so beautiful with the Eiffel in the background, lights, people, water, just breath taking. Plan to stop and just take it all in and not hurry past this one!

Impresive. The location with the Invalides and the Eiffel Tower in the backgroung, the lights that line it, the towers that anchor its impresive single span make this a must see. its also very near the Champs Elysee so you can make a quick walk to the shopping area.

Gorgeus. This is definitly my favorite bridge in Paris. It is magnificent with a great view to the Eiffel Tower, le Musée de l'Armée (where is the tomb of Napoleon) and le Petit et Grand Palais. Also, is very close to the Champs Elysèes.
worth a visit. It's a magnificent sight up close and it's definitely worth a visit, even if it's just to take a photo or two because the views are fantastic

Beautiful. It is a beautiful bridge no doubt. Even walking underneath is worth it. My only disappointment is that during our entire stay the decorative lights on the bridge never came on. I wanted to see it all lit up. Guess I will have to ce back again.

The best present ever!!. Just Russians can make a presents like this )! a bridge made with gold and look so luxurious. one of the most beatyful bridge in the world I ever seen.A real impire style with a lot of grace!

Grand bridge that always turns heads. This bridge was built at the twilight of the 1800s to commemorate the alliance between France and Russia. Characterised by the stylish Buaux-Arts style of architecture which was much in vogue then, it complemented the creation of the Grand Palais and Petit Palais on the right bank as the site of the Universal Exposition of 1900. Still generally considered to be the most beautiful bridge spanning the River Seine in Paris, it strikes visitors for its over-the-top embellishments. Of particular note are the statues of nymphs on the bridge's sides and at the lamp bases. In the theme of the 1900 exhibition, look out also for the four golden (gilded, really) socle sculptures of Pegasus being restrained by 'Fames' (arts, sciences, commerce and industry). Views on the bridge aren't really very good because the bridge is quite broad, so the best vantage points for photos are on either side of the river (preferably on the southwestern side) or from a river cruise boat. Even more magical and romantic is the bridge when it is lit up from early evening onwards.
great view. great view, will create great photos, keep walking along the Seine and all other bridges are interesting but this is definitely the most beautiful

The most beautiful gift that Paris received in her history. This fancy masterpiece is a gift from the Russia and now one of the symbols of Paris. A great mixture of architecture, sculpture and mixed media

Gorgeous. Some people don't think that this bridge is important to visit. I do. Even if you just drive by it without getting down, it's worth swinging by. The design is breathtaking and Paris wouldn't be the same without it. It's next to the Grand and Petit palais aswell as the place de la Concorde. Worth it

Can't be missed. The nice thing is that you don't have to plan any time to spend there. Just walk over it, take pictures (but wait for a day with a blue sky!) It's gorgeous and if you're in Paris, you must see it. The best thing about Paris is simply walking. You will stumble upon all that is good.

So Romantic. (Quel Romantique?). Having seen this in so many movies, it was a very beautiful dream to get to walk across this bridge at night with the lights of the city on and the Eiffel Tower in the distance glittering every hour on the hour. Especially after having dinner and wine, walking in the cold night here was so dreamy. Let yourself do this when you visit Paris! It's beautiful!
Beautiful bridge. I don't understand how a bridge is an attraction, but this one is beautiful. Just to walk along and view the Eiffel Tower from is nice.

Beautiful bridge with so many details. There are many bridges, of course, in Paris. This bridge, of all of them, I found to be the most beautiful. I loved walking along, over and under it, exploring the many sculptures. If I remember correctly, it was under this bridge that we often heard musicians practicing and playing..... creating gorgeous melodic songs that could be heard wafting along the Seine.
Beatiful. At first you could say just a bridge over the Sena river, but very interesting to see the details of the work on this bridge.
Beautiful Photo Spot. A beautiful spot to just stop and soak it all in. The area is good no matter what time of day and you can see all the wonderful sights surrounding the area.

The true meaning of this bridge. The denotative meaning of the word bridge means a structure carrying a road, path, railroad, or canal across a river, ravine, road, railroad, or other obstacle.....but the Bridge Alexandre III carries on a connotative meaning too, cause it was built to make a bond of friendship between France and Russia at the beginning of the twenty century.It is an extraordinary bridge whose name was given in honor of the famous russian czar Alexandre III.It is all decorated with cherubs,nymphs and winged horses at the ends.Paris has many bridges over the River Seine, but certainly this is the most beautiful of all.

Loved staring at this bridge from all angles. This bridge is beautiful, and as you sit for a while, you will see its mood change with the sunlight/shadows. It's enchanting. I'm sure it's a gorgeous place to steal a kiss with your sweetheart or spouse. Great photo ops and views of the Seine. I would go back with a better camera and wait for the orange sunset light.

What a beautiful bridge!. Its right by the Place de la Concorde looks great by day and night! You can get a better view of the sculptures when you cross this bridge during the river cruise. Definitely worth the visit...

My favorite bridge. Great photo spot and a perfect place to dance at Sunrise on a Sunday in June at 0445! One can combine a visit here with Naoleon's tomb and the army museum; but I wouldn't. They suck and ruin the experience

Splendid!. Walking Pont Alexandre III during the day was a nice experience since you can see every detail and the views from there are just amazing, but walking the area during the night was just breathless, the lighting along the bridge looks spectacular and it is the classic parisian overview.This bridge is with no doubt one of the most beautiful places in Paris, a must to see and walk :)

Bridges make Paris beautiful. Paris is a beautiful city and the bridges over Sience are an important component of its beauty.All bridges are arguably different in design and size which makes each bridge unique.This bridge is definitely the most beautiful and regal bridge of Paris. You should definitely visit it during night when its all lit up and it seems like a wonderful paris on Siene. Its walkable from Eiffel tower. Its nect to the Grand Palace and Les Invalides.

Fantastic Views. I know you won’t be shocked to hear that the Eiffel Tower was visible over the river to the Southwest, it can be seen from many places in Paris. But the views from Pont Alexandre III are all amazing. You can see Les Invalides (the Army Museum), the Palais Royal, and of course the beautiful Seine. The bridge itself is really ornate with large white and gold columns with statues of lions and nymphs. It is far from the most famous bridge in the world but it is quite unique in decoration.
Walk or Bike Over and Back. It's an impressively ornate bridge and will be part of any tour. Some of the statues seem to be a little on the decline, but maybe they want the statues to look old.
Gold leaf and sculptures. Quintessentially Paris. Put on your walking shoes and walk...you will wear off the food and wine and you can see more detail. And it is worth it.
Absolutely stunning. Crossing the many Parisian bridges along the Seine is a must for travellers, they are so gorgeous and Pont Alexandre lll is the most extravagant bridge of all!

Impressive. We stumbled upon this impressive bridge whilst wandering around. It was raining on the day, but this almost added to the feel of the place. Great photo opportunities over the River Seine. Really shows off the grandure of Paris.

Ornate beauty. One of the most amazing, stunning bridges you will ever encounter. From the ornate columns adorned with stunning statues at each end to the beautiful lamp posts, nothing about this extraordinary bridge fails to impress. Dwell for a while & take in the views of the city (including the Eiffel Tower) and the boats moving up & down the Seine. This is Paris!

Its just a Pont. XD I guess this is not an attraction... But anyways, I crossed it... If you go through Champs Elysees you cross Charles de Gaulle and tadah! you'll get to Alexandre III... Which has pretty sculptures and whatnot... Beautiful

Looks great from any angle. What's this? A bridge as a tourist destination? Yes, particularly if it is in Paris, over the Seine, and considered by many to be the most beautiful bridge in Europe. Whether viewed from on top or from underneath, in daylight or at night, there is much to admire in the impressive statues and ornate ironwork on lamps and railings. Plus it can deliver you from one side of the Seine to the other!
best place in paris. sunny, rainy or snowy weather, this place is magic...even better late at night or very early in the morning when it`s less crowded.
Gorgeous and eye-catching. Always a pleasure to see a piece of my motherland history in such a beautiful city like Paris. It's a pity there is some non-art graffiti in some places.

time machine!. if you wanna feel like Parisians felt in 18th century, take a deep breath and step on the Alexandre the 3rd Bridge. Plus, on this bridge you will feel all the wealth of French nation, like golden statues on top of the pillars

spectacular bridge. its probably best seen from the riverside walks, from where you can appreciate the enormous statues. unfortunately the stupid and damaging practice of attaching padlocks to bridges has spread here with some idiots attaching locks to the statues themselves! how moronic do you have to be?!
very chic. each time i travel to paris i go and take photos on this bridge ,it is very chic and old where you feel like it is napoleon era
A photo opportunity. Fabulous photo of my husband and myself on the beautiful bridge with the Eiffel tower in the background.
Could you imagine this bridge?. Only Paris could have a bridge made with gold and look so luxurious. At the same time, we felt like living there in another time

If you miss this, then you've made a mistake. The main reason not to miss the Pont Alexander III Bridge is because it is really so very easy to see. It should be on the way to somewhere you are going, so just make sure you cross it on your way to somewhere. Then once you cross, transition to the river bank (still walking to your planned destination) where you can see the outside features of the bridge.

Beautiful place. It is very beautiful bridge, took many photo graphs.You can take metro/RER to Invalides station and bridge is above metro. Enjoy the place watching river, Eiffel tower, river, Hôtel des Invalides all together from one place.
Worth a Look. Worth a walk over and look at the structure if you are in the area. Very ornate and impressive looking.
Beautiful bridge. Its a famous landmark not to be missed on a visit to Paris . Take a stroll over this beautiful bridge with its many statues , the scenes from the bridge are also not to be missed.

Beautiful. This is a wonderful piece of architecture in Paris. Walk over it at night like we did and it is beautifully romantic. Just make sure you have your camera to catch some photos to remember with.
Photo Op!!!. There's a view of the Eiffel in the backround at the middle of this beautiful bridge. It will be your favorite picture of yourself!

A beautiful bridge not to be missed!. take a hop on hop off bus around Paris and you come across this most gorgeous bridge over the river Seine! It's like being in another world! The architecture, the gold statues, taking you down the champs Élysées! Absolutely amazing!
One of most beautiful bridges in Paris. Yes, it's very nice. Definitely worth walking across to enjoy the river, the Eiffel Tower and perhaps most important, others who are doing the same thing.
Impressive artistic architecture. One of best bridges one would like to look at. It is stunning whether one looks at it while in a vehicle driven over it or while in a bateau on the river .
Big surprise. For me it's the most beautiful bridge which I've ever seen! When I was talking along the river I saw this "miracle" and fell in love with that!
So romantic!. It lives up to it's reputation as the most beautiful bridge in the world. Very scenic and oh so romantic!
It's spectacular. There is nothing to dislike its beautiful bridge ,please have your camera ready !!!! :) Has a lot of architectural details that wouldn't leave any one careless

Elegant masterpiece. This elegantly designed bridge spans over the Seine River and looks amazing with its golden statues, golden railings, and ornate, painted iron design. Absolutely worth seeing up close! From here you can descend to the banks of the Seine and enjoy The city Parisian style by lounging in wooden chairs, exercising on rental bikes, or just hanging out on a former vessel that is now sporting a café/bar combination.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Just standing on this bridge with all of it's magnificence is a pleasure beyond words, a perfect view of the Eiffle Tower, the river. It is by far the most beautiful bridge in Paris.

A bridge is just a bridge, but this one is special. It goes beyond being a simple bridge, there's details in it's craft and I'm sure some history to match. Walked on it, took pictures, can say I have been here.
Gorgeous. If Paris if one of the most beautiful cities in the world then this bridge would be part of that claim. Breathtaking every time I see it. Please walk across and enjoy the views :)

One of the most beautiful views. The bridge itself has its charms, with its gilded statues ; from there you have an amazing view, on the Esplanade des Invalides on the left bank - the Invalides being one of the most beautiful buildings in Paris (the Invalides was built by Louis XIV in 1671-1674 as an hospital for veterans) - and on the right bank on the Petit Palais and Grand Palais, museums both built for the Universal Exhibition in 1900 (as was the bridge itself) ; the flag waving on the top of Grand palais reminds one of a painting par Raoul Dufy!

Beatifull Bridge. Hello Travellers, this is na historical bridge as you all know, its a nice place to take a walk, chill and enjoy the view, you can go down the riversides and watch the little caffes and street markets towards the Notre Dame
Magnifique!. This stunning bridge is a must see. A photographer's dream. Best time to visit is at sunset when the last ray's of the sun kiss the Seine goodnight.

It's just a bridge - but a lovely one. It's not old, dating from 1900 and the Paris Universal Exhibition - as does the rest of this grlorious vista - the Grand Palais, the Petit Palais and the open area leading to the Invalides. It's not only named after Czar Alexander 111 but apparently the Russians also paid for it. Whatever it cost, it's great value for its design, decoration, lighting and sculptures, with the result greater than the sum of its parts. For us Paris locals, it's a golden, baroque part of the background of our lives and always a wonderful reminder that we live in a magnificent place. But an 'attraction'? It's a bridge!

Recommend above the Eiffel. Coming to Paris, you should not miss the chance to go see Pont Alexandre III at night.In fact if walk away a bit, you can manage some really picturesque views of both this gorgeous bridge and the Eiffel, both studded with lights.A great place to walk down to and sit along the Seine. Bring your own grub, wine, beer, whatever and just sit where ever you can find the place. Could get a little chilly at times but romantic nonetheless.

The most beautiful bridge!. I remembered this bridge from a movie and spotted it one day. It is actually lovely. Since my return from Paris, I have a picture of it as my "desktop" background at work. The lamposts, the golden statues and the location of it make for the most wonderful photos.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. It is outstanding and wonderful to walk across. Well worth walking to the bottom of the Champs Élysées and walking across it. Failing that, if you are taking the Bateaux Mouches, give yourself a few extra minutes to go and see it, as it is a hop and a skip away.
Now this is a Bridge!. We have the Harbour Bridge in Sydney but it looks industrial compared to this beautiful whimsy of a bridge over the Seine!

The most ornate bridge in Paris. As you stroll through the streets of Paris, among its countless architectural sights, you will find the Pont Alexandre III located between the Champs Elysées quarter and the Invalides; it is easy to find, as you walk on Winston Churchill Avenue past the Grand Palais. The Pont is simply breathtaking with its multitude of sculptures, statues, figurines, candelabra style lamps and lamp posts. I recommend that you also go down the steps and walk along the Seine for another spectacular view of the bridge, bring a baguette and have a picnic!
Nice view and beautiful bridge. we loved this old fashioned bridge. you can go there to catch a beautiful view over the Eiffel tower.

Take a water taxi. In my opinion, the best way to see the bridge is to take a hop on/hop off water taxi. Batobus is a great option. Stand at the back of the boat (if you're headed towards Notre Dame from the Eiffel Tower) and snap a pic of the bridge with the tower behind it. Gorgeous.
Guilded marvel. Sailed under it, walked over it, a bit of grandeur in a grand city. Watch out for the hawkers and tricksters, taking a firm line and "no" usually works wonders.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. A tribute to the Russian Czar. The Pont Alexandre III is a deck arch bridge that spans the Seine in Paris. It connects the Champs-Élysées quarter and the Invalides and Eiffel Tower quarter. The widely regarded as the most ornate, extravagant bridge in the city. The bridge is lavishly decorated with lampposts and sculptures of cherubs and nymphs. On each end of the Pont Alexandre III are large gilded statues on 17 meters (56 ft) high granite pillars. Each of the ornaments on the bridge was created by a different artist. The bridge - which was to symbolize Russian-French friendship - was named after Tsar Alexander III.
Pont Alexandre. We saw this both from boat cruise&I by walk.it is grand but a bit crowded when we were there .certainly worth a visit.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Best seen at night when the bridges old fashioned lights are on. It makes for a great photo opportunity.
photo opportunity. A good place to take lots of photos of the Seine, the bridge, Paris landmarks. Just a photo opportunity not more
Surprised. I was very surprised at the amount of time that my gorgeous wife and I spent here. It is a beautiful location and worth checking out. I think that you will also find yourself surprised.
Beautiful views!. It was a beautiful walk. Another must do in Paris! You will enjoy the beautiful architecture. A very romantic walk.

Great Point! . Such a nice point to stop and appreciate the statues ...
Beautiful bridge to walk on or pass under it by bout :)
The history of it it's pretty interesting also :)
Go at night!. We went at night, as it is most beautiful with all the lights. Crowded but not as bad as closer to the tower. Worth it. We took cab and glad we had it on our list to do.
Imperial vestige. Grandeur is the word that comes to mind (mine at least). Beautifully conceived and executed landmark. Excellent maintenance too.

Brides every where. beautiful bridge, no wonder it is so popular with brides for photos. Please be considerate and not interfere with their photo shoots. They are nice to watch as they float across the bridge, like snow flakes.
Cool bridge!. A must see, as one of the many iconic parts of Paris. Great views of Siene and Eiffel Tower at sunset.

Alexandre III. magnificence views of the senna right in the middle of Palais Royale and les invalids this Pont is one of the best in Paris the golden statues the River Sena under it makes of this bridge one more stop on your tour of this great city.

Magnifique!. This bridge, which spans the Seine, is a beautiful representation of classic French! I can gush about this bridge, replete with gold statues and gas lights, but all of the adjectives in the world cannot replace the amazement one feels when walking the bridge. Take a stroll during the day when the crowds are the highest then again late at night when the lights are aglow, the crowds have dispersed and the romance of Paris abounds.

Intresting to see with a cool history . It was a pleasant surprise to see while walking along the river for the afternoon. I'm living ere in Paris for a semester and found myself going back there a few times already!

a Pont piece of art!. The most amazing Pont of all in Paris is this..the one with the golden statues that shows that the French culture is unique!!When you get there you will see for yourself that it is completely different than any other!!
Amazing !. This bridge is like a fairy tale ! the lights , the decorations , and all the art work is so magnificent , making Paris , a magical place on earth

Standout bridge in a stunning city. I just thought this was a classically beautiful ornate French bridge. Looks beautiful during the day but is possibly more stunning at night when the gas light-looking street lights go on and people are strolling around. Just beautiful.
Most beautiful bridge in Paris!. Was looking forward to walk over this bridge and was not disappointed, so picturesque especially in Autumn!

A classic icon in Paris. This bridge is so lovely. Walking in paris is one of the activities I enjoyed the most and happened upon the Pont Alexandre lll. I must have taken 10 pictures. Beautiful view of the Seine and the sculptures on the bridge are beautiful night or day.

Simply stunning !. Words can not truly describe this bridge. It is the most ornate and extravagant bridge in the city. It connects the Champs-Elysees quarter and the Invalides and Eiffel Tower quarter. Walk across it and enjoy all its gold finery, see it from a cruise as well and be in awe of the sparkling gold.

Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris!. My favorite bridge of all. The Golden Angels are gorgeous! Drive over it, walk it's length AND see it from a Seine river cruise to appreciate all the details and sculptures the Alexandre III offers.
Most beautiful 'ponte' in Paris. My favorite bridge (ponte) in Paris. The bridge itself is beautiful enough. Besides that, there you can see the Eiffel Tower, Grand Pais, Les Invalides.
Beautiful bridge. Beautiful bridge with unique history. We took boat ride under it and also walk on it. Great view to Les Invalides from here.
nice bridge. Go for a long walk in a sunny day, enjoy the view of the river, the people running and biking around and stroll around the nice cafés

Beautiful Bridge. This is a very beatiful bridge over Sena River, donated by Alexander III Russia Zar. Its very nice to make a stop there and cross it walking to appreciate the cosntruction and rivers view.
Walk Across it at Night!. Make the trip and enjoy this beautiful bridge at night time. The lights, statues, and gold are quite spectacular. The views down the Seine are also amazing.
Instantly recognizable bridge. Probably the most well known bridge in Paris. Very ornate, and relatively new (built for the the Worlds Fair in 1900).
Bridge with lake views. Excellent bridge with romatic views over the river. Architecture of the bridge is amazing as well. You can walk over the bridge on a nice sunny day.

A historical & beautiful bridge which glimmers during the night.. This is definitely the most beautiful of the historical bridges in Paris. Backdropped by the Esplanade des Invalides on the south side, & the Champs Elysée area on the north, go visit it at night when the shimmering reflection of lights on the Seine plus the Eiffel Tower lighted up provide an unforgettable sight. Simple stunning!
Truly beautiful bridge. This "gift" from Russia to celebrate the World Expo is all class and one of the truly iconic bridges of Paris.
Amazing. The most glittery bridge of Paris, certainly one of the most beautiful in the world. The bridge is located right in the center between the Grand Palais and Invalides museum.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. I really appreciate the gorgeous view of Seine River and the nicely adorned bridge. The greatest thing is: the scenic spot is absolutely free!!!!

Beautiful Bridge. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris. We sailed under it twice on our Seine river cruise. Tsar Nicholas II of Russia laid the foundation stone. Another 'must see' when in Paris.

Beautiful! . A beautiful bridge that is worth seeing! Great photo opportunity and a nice break from the hustle and bustle of central Paris. Recommend walking along the river to the Eiffel Tower, lovely!

Lovely. Beautiful bridge, check out the underside and you may see a rubber duck art installation. Plus the restaurant underneath on the Left Bank side looked very nice and you could peak into the kitchen to watch the masterful chefs at work.
Just walk and take pictures !!. The sculptures are lovely. Worth walking over it from Invalides end to Palais Garnier end. The river view is excellent from the bridge.
Worth a visit. If you're walking the seine, this bridge is worth a visit. The sculptures at the entrance and in the bridge themselves are stunning.

Awesome. This is one of the most beautiful bridges over La Seine. Architecture is amazing. The best way to see it is to ride on a bateau. Some pf those even stop by some of most beautiful bridges. The departures are from the La Tour Eiffel.
Must see it. Must see it. Try to wake up early to visit Paris in the morning. It is so nice on sunrise and sunset.
Impressive Bridge. Very impressive bridge, with fantastic view for Hotel D'Invalides. Especially when you get to know the history behind it. Well worth a walk.

Wedding-cake bridge, plus Eiffel Tower views. Over-the-top architecture of this bridge includes flamboyant gold-gilded statuary atop enormous pillars, classically themed bronzes, filigreed iron lampposts, and stone garlands. Looking along the bridge the view is of Les Invalides and the gilded Dôme church where Napoleon is buried. But photographers should not miss the views over the river of the Eiffel Tower from here. Best is towards sunset, when low orange light strikes the gold and shines through the globes of the bridge's lamps. Spectacular!

Put on your walking tour stop. As you walk around the Seine, this is definitely a place to stop for photo ops. The detail is cool to study. It's close to so many other attractions too, that it's an easy stop.

Most beautiful bridge. Walking over the Pont Alexandre III is a great way to see the beauty up close but take a Seine River cruise and see it from the water. It is a magnificently beautiful bridge and in fact, I think it is the most beautiful of all the bridges across the Seine.
Most romantic bridge in Paris. It's a beautiful bridge - a must see to cross in Paris! This was one of our stops on our "Fat Tire" bike tour.
Scenic and Musical. Good music, ambiance, view of the passerby and people on the boats along Seine. Nice Wine while we waited for the rain to stop.
