If all bridges were this beautiful.... Pont Alexandre III is one of the most beautiful bridges in the world. The fact that it is over the River Seine, in Paris, is an added bonus.Wonderfully photogenic and even more amazing at night, this bridge should be on your list of unmissable sights in the City of Lights.
Awe inspiring. This bridge never fails to excite me and I take pictures of it galore. It's just magnificent. I can barely believe how fabulous the architecture is in Paris and how opulent.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. I loved its design, ornaments and above all its history. One could write lots of pages about this bridge but why not just walk and contemplate it from both sides of the Seine, day and night. It's spectacular.

Romantic!. The architecture of this bridge is breathtaking and romance is quite alive here! Every single time we walked across this bridge, we saw at least one couple kissing. So we had to follow suit and had our own romantic kiss on this bridge. The views are amazing!

beautiful romantic bridge !. being there and seeing all the beautiful sculpture that are on the bridge over Seine, is something apart. When is traffic carriages can be seen and admire, also on the river, cross at every 2 minutes boats with tourists that are exited to wave their hands and smile of sharing happiness. from there, great shot can be taken of the Eiffel Tour.

A Great View to Watch the Eiffel Light Show. We especially enjoyed sitting on the steps at the end of the bridge watching the Eiffel Tower light show. Spectacular!. We took a river dinner cruise on the river Seine and this bridge caught our eye! So many bridges on the river but this one was simply majestic. A must see!

Stunning architecture matched by stunning views. Begun in 1896 and completed by1900, the Pont Alexander III bridge was named for Tsar Alexander who helped to lay a cornerstone. From the top level of our double decker hop on hop off tour bus, the unobstructed view of the recently regilded gold covered bronze statues was brilliant in the Paris sun. Connecting the quarter of the Eiffel Tower and the Champs-Élysées, this has to be the most stunning bridge across the Seine. The sight of Invalides and it's massive dome is quite fine from the south end of the span and a stroll across the bridge affords memorable views of the city.

My Favourite Bridge in the world. What can I say? Apart from getting from one side of the Seine to the other, this bridge is really something special. Spectacular sculptures adorne this, the most stunning bridge in Paris. Old style street lamps line either side of the bridge as well. Make sure that you walk across at night to really get the feel for this iconic place.

Beautiful. This bridge looks as good from a distance as it does up close. The golden statues atop the main pillars glow in the sunshine and the other statues which decorate the bridge are equally stunning. Don't miss it/

wonderful place. i only see this place in pictures

you can take nice view from Paris and wonderfull picks

the most beautiful bridge in Paris. in different trips with different parties came to this bridge, but he always impresses with its luxury and elegance.
I recommend him to explore.

Carrie Bradshaw would be proud!. The bridge was amazing and romantic and offered some beautiful view of Paris lit up at night. We could only imagine Carrie and Mr. Big on this bridge and Diane Keaton and Jack Nicholson when it started to snow. We were in Paris: how could we not walk over this bridge ...go there!

Beauty!. The gold glows from this bridge and statues under the sun. Viewed from the Seine River it's an incredible site. We stumbled upon this bridge as we made our way to the Eiffel Tower. Opulent and breathtaking!

Wonderful details . This is another lovely bridge in Paris with great attention to detail and a great photo opportunity with great pop up bars on the river to sit and have a drink and take in the views around it
Wonderful. Absolutely lovely under a blue sky the gold statues shimmer and glow lots of small details on the bridge that add to the overall design my favourite of all the bridges
Very Ornate. Worth visiting this Bridge - very much a sight to see. I world recommend visiting the bridge as part of traveling to the Champs-Élysées
Beautiful bridge, a must see!. This grand bridge that crosses the river seine is the most beautiful among the bridges in Paris. The golden statues from both end are remarkable.
Loved the river & views. Great for picture taking. Peaceful. Many views of statues. Historical. Loved the colors & shapes of the different statues. Beautiful architectural buildings in the surrounds.

The most beautiful bridge in the world. This bridge over the Seine is the mostly lovely bridge I've ever seen with views of the Eiffel Tower, Grand Palace, Invalides, and other landmarks. The bridge itself is adorned with gold sculptures and gorgeous lanterns. We had family photographs taken here.
Gorgeous. That is just a bridge... but what a bridge! This is a must-see. The golden sculptures are beautiful. And don't forget to look at the sides of the bridge!

Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris. This richly decorated, Beaux-Arts-style bridge crosses the Seine River between the Invalides Metro stop and the Grand Palace. Built for the 1900 Universal Exhibition, the bridge, named after a Russian czar, celebrated the new France-Russian alliance. The bridge shows off fine sculpture work, including cherubs, nymphs and winged horses on both ends. The gilded allegories atop pedestals on the right bank are Arts and Sciences; those on the left bank represent Industry and Commerce.I often cross the bridge on my frequent visits to Paris, either when taking a walk along the Seine or when heading from the left bank to the right bank to attend an exhibition at the Grand Palais or Petit Palais. I sometimes linger along the bridge's 525-foot length for a closer look at its artistic elements, such as the Art Nouveau lamps. It is possible to get excellent photos of the Eiffel Tower from the bridge, sometimes with sculpture in the foreground.I highly recommend checking out this bridge if in the area; as a destination for those interested in seeing the most ornate bridge in the city; or for getting a good photo of the Eiffel Tower.
Grand Bridge with FANTASTIC view of Eiffel Tower. This must be Paris' most majestic bridge, Very grand and also with a great view of L'Invalides as well as the Eiffel Tower
Impressive Bridge. The must see bridge in Paris to celebrate friendship between France and Russia (100 years ago or so).

Pretty!. Pretty bridge but that is not that much to see. Worth the visit of course, nice statues and everything. Best to go there when you go to the Petit and Grand Palais because they are very close to each other.

"The " place to view Tour Eiffel. The Bridge is stunning. I understand it was opened by Tsar Nicholas II as it is dedicated to his father - Tsar Alexander III. I consider this one of the best places to view the Tour Eifeel from.

Most Beautiful Bridge in the World!. Pictures does not do this bridge justice. It is the most beautiful bridge I have ever seen. It is definitely a must see. My daughter didn't believe me until we were walking across the bridge and she didn't want to leave. Wow! Breathtaking!

Great 360' view.... Aesthetically I think it is one of the most beautiful bridges of Paris, from here you take great photos with the Eiffel Tower in the background. The peculiarity of this bridge are finely carved and gilded ornaments, luxury and elegance turn it into an attraction of high artistic value.
spectacular birdge. simple put its the most wonderfull bridge in all of paris and its close to other major sightseeing areas so if your in paris take a look a this amazing bridge

Beautiful. One of Paris's iconic bridges spanning the Seine connecting the Champs Elysees and the 7th Qtr, a must see when visiting Paris ! whether to walk over or by bus.
Pretty. a beatiful bridge, full of history and statues of principles of 1900, and comunicating Invalides with grand palais

Good view of the Effiel Tower. This is a lovely bridge which has a fabulous view of the tower. When we were walking across there were two lots of newly weds having their picture perfect wedding photos taken there
Most beautiful bridge I've seen. Beautiful gold scuptures on an impressive bridge, in a great location next to the Grand Palais and Petit Palais, themselves, beautiful buildings.
Special place. Whether the sun is shining off the gold statues or the lights are on with tour Eiffel in distance - just perfect
A beautiful bridge !. A stunning bridge that makes you want to stay and take in the works of sculptures and art all over !

Beautiful Bridge. Its usually hard to get worked up over a bridge but this one is special. From the twin columns at each end of the bridge surmounted by gilded winged horses to the highly ornate lamp standards, this bridge is symbolic of the Belle Epoque and surprisingly, quite modern as it was only built for the 1900 Exposition! It links Les Invalides on the Left Bank with the Grand Palais and Petit Palais on the Right Bank and gives a superb view of them all. Have a look underneath the bridge where even the iron structure is elaborate! And remember to come back in the evening when the bridge is floodlit.
simply awesome. The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Please, pay attention to all its sculptures, they all are works of art.
Beautiful bridge!. This is really worth seeing! I was here before few uears, it is one of my top 10 bridges ever! Big like for this one, GO THERE!
Great walk. Go see Napoleon's tomb, Army Museum, Rodin and then walk over the bridge which is very unique and a nice walk. This is the best part of Paris, soaking it all in!

Beautiful bridge. It is nice each time you pass here. Very good for walking from one place to another in visiting in Paris. The architecture is interesting and beautiful. Don't miss it on your visit in Paris :)

Amazing views. Stopped here a few times on our trip. Very near to the Champs Elysees, Place de la Concorde and walking distance from the Tower, Louvre and Arc. Amazing views and great Ice cream from the guy on the bridge.

history. one of the most beautiful ponts of Paris a city full of ponts.
you GO TO THE RIVE GAUCHE BY THIS BRIDGE
not misse to see it
picture perfect. great place for photos, Eiffel tower in background. Bridge is vert ornate and detailed. Just what you'd expect in the heart of Paris.
Elaborately beautiful. Lovely bridge connecting Tuileries and Les Invalides. Lamppost and statues complement the statues and building around it.
Tres Magnifique!. We first saw this bridge from a boat ride on the river. I didn't really appreciate and admire it's beauty until a late night stroll on our last night in Paris. Tres magnifique!

Wow!!!. I was sailing on the River when I came across the magnificent Pont Alexandre III bridge.I knew it was a special tourist attraction, when the majority of the visitors got out of their seats on our boat to take a 'raft' of pictures when we sailed passed. I took quite a few myself.French architecture at its best - a must see!

Visit the riverside flea market. With all there is to enjoy in the Pont Alexandre's beauty, the market scene below along the riverside is also worth a visit. On days when the market is open, you will be treated to antiques vendors, vintage fashion, excellent silver flatware, and odds and ends of every variety. We made several stops during our Paris stay and found the prices to be reasonable for what was on offer. If you can't make it to some of the more legendary flea markets in other districts, this is a good way to satisfy your browsing desires without deviating from your itinerary too far.
Artistic grandeur on a Seine crossing. The artistic beauty of the Pont Alexander III bridge must be seen. Picture do not do it justice. The gold leaf and sculptures are truly amazing.

You see it all from here. Standing on the bridge, you can see the Seine, the towers of Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and the building which houses Napoleon's tomb. The bridge itself is more adorned than most, but it is the location of the bridge and not the bridge itself that makes it spectacular.
Just a Bridge. Very pretty bridge. But, just a bridge, so how does one get excited about it?? Best at night, lit up, in my opinion
Beautiful Bridge. Pont Alexandre III with its gold attached to the bridge offers a nice view to the River Seine, Eiffel Tower and many other buildings around.

my husband's favorite pont. Paris has an abundance of wonderful bridges and everyone has their favorite. This is my husband's. It has ornate sculptures with lots of gold. I liked it because it meant I was near the Musee D'orsay.

Prettiest bridge in Paris. Love this bridge. You can just feel the history around it. My favorite bridge in Paris. First went under it on a river cruise, which is a great way to learn about the bridges and monuments in Paris.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Paris has very many bridges, and this is my favorite. Very luxurious. It's as beautiful from the river as it is from land.
Prettiest bridge in Paris!. Very romantique.... very nice details... guilded gold..... Beautiful lanterns... A must see, even at night...
Nice bridge. The bridge is as historic and as good as they come to visit. The surrounding river and buildings make it such a great place to walk across.

Paris architecture. Beautiful bridge with amazing sculptures. Be sure to visit at night for photos - lights are amazing.

a pleasant walk by the river Seine. Went for a long walk along the river Seine from Pont des Arts, Musee d'Orsay, Les Invalides upto the Pont d'Alexandre and watching the displays of the Bouquinistes, and Souvenir shops, painters on the parapets of the river Seine, enjoying the cool breeze. Crossed the bridge admiring the statues of nymphes, the lamp posts. The bridge transports you into another century. You could reach Ave. des Champs Elysées passing in front of the grand palais.

Beautiful. It adds to the beauty of stroll along river Seine. It looks even more beautiful at night when the lights are on.
Great walk. Wonderful to stroll across this gorgeous bridge. We also took it in as part of a bike tour and heard more about the history of the building of the bridge.

The most beautiful bridge in all of Paris. This is a centric bridge and by far the most impressing. Take a lot of pictures and if you have the chance what all the way to the obelisk and take a picture with the bridge behind.

Nice bridge. Excellent image, a lot of photos, very romantic....
You can walk throu the bridge, see the River, have a view of Paris

Dazzling. sheer elegance and style. We crossed it on an open-top Bus Tour.Wonderful views.

most beautiful bridge on the Seine. Not only is this a lovely bridge, the golden horse statues make it visible from the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe.

LOVELY BRIDGE. Very well designed, a nice view from the bridge,lovely architecture.
Its connects on to all the nice 'places to visit'. Its no ordinary bridge but a monument in itself.

Worth seein. A beautiful and inspiring bridge. It is worth it to see this bridge at night as well as in the day time. Beautiful gold statues and lighted very nicely at night. It is also very romantic.

Le meilleur pont de Paris. It's the most amazing bridge in Paris. It's the bridge we know from the movies, for example Angel-A of Luc Besson. It has an amazing view even if you are on it or looking at it.

Opulence and grandeur representative of its Russian style sets this bridge above the rest.....Breathtaking with its gold trims and beautiful, grand sculptures, to be viewed during the day or for a walk on it or at night under it on a river cruise. Represents a union between 2 worlds

Nice bridge.... Not sure why this bridge is so highly rated. Maybe because Adelle filmed a music video here?
Yea its a nice bridge, but don't miss any of the other sights to see this one...

A Masterpiece of Art (St. Petersburg's arquitectural beauty in Paris). The artistical beauty of St. Petersburg in Paris, the use of gold in the sculptures, ornaments & decoration of Pont Alexandre III (bridge dedicated to Alexandre III) is very beautiful, the arch is so well defined and all together it is an incredible scenery of the Seine River, the most elegant bridge in Paris.
Beautiful. This is definitely the most beautiful and intricate bridge over the Seine. It is a great place to take pictures but it is not the bridge that you can put a lock on, mostly please don't
Beautiful. A fantastic bridge! There is a small cafe by the river that overlooks this lovely bridge. Wonderful views.

nice place to sit by the river. there were some annoying american/australians who set up shop and were selling crepes right there. the bridge is beautiful, and its a great place to sit by the river with friends.

The most romantic bridge in the world!. So often pictured in commercials, movies and even cartoons (Anastasia), you feel you've already seen it BUT wether at sunset, at night or early morning with the newly wed taking pictures it is an exquisite piece of architecture not to be missed!
It's a beautiflu bridge. We walked passed it when we walked from d'Orsay to Eiffel Tower. We also saw it when we were on the Seine River Cruise.

Bastille Day memories. Brilliant look out point, my friends and I came here to watch the fireworks on Bastille Day and despite the crowds of people it was the perfect point to see the Eiffel Tower, the fireworks and hear the accordians and violins moving along through the street
Bridge of bridges. Every time we are in Paris (have been 4 times now) we end up going to this bridge to admire the beautiful craftsmanship. A must see in Paris

Most beautiful bridge on paris. The nicest bridge in Paris. Beautiful to just stand in the middle and watch the world go by under your feet on le saine or people watching.
Right in the centre too, so wont be missed!
Beautiful. Just beautiful. We went on a river boat cruise that allowed us to see it up close. It is just stunning with amazing details everywhere
Impressive. Beautiful bridge with interesting history. Apparently you need to kiss under it! Only bridge over the Seine without supports in the river

Lovely. Went there after seeing it on the Seine river cruise... people were having a real party on the river banks below the Pont Alexandre III. We had a couple of drinks at a place called Flow below the bridge which was a nice place to unwind and relax.
Romantic Bridge. This is my favorite bridge in Paris. It is so ornate. Lots of little cherubs and shiny golden horses.

Stunning bridge. This is a beautifully sculpted bridge with horses and cherubs and the wonderful Art Deco lamps. Beautiful views up and down the Seine. Great photo opportunities. Always worth stopping to admire the view if you are in the area.

Beautiful views. We did a day walking tour through Paris once we had seen all the main sights, and along the way we came along Pont Alexandre III. The views from here were just stunning, and although it's easy to say it's just a bridge, it's a truly stunning bridge, and in such a central fantastic location. I couldn't stop myself from taking its of photos of it!

One of the Most Beautiful Bridges in the World. Without a doubt, this is one of the most beautiful bridges in the world. We went across the bridge several times and under it several times as well. It is superbly constructed and well maintained. I recommend that after you see the bridge close up...do not stop there. You should then take a boat trip on the Seine and as you approach the bridge on the return, take a photo of the Eiffel Tower between the towers of the bridge. You'll enjoy the result.
Hop on Hop off bridges. Great views of this bridge both from boat and bus - one of the many beautiful bridges across the Seine

Splendid, but a little overrated. This place is impressive for 2 reasons:1.the unique patterns and astonishing golden sculptures; never have I seen a bridge that radiates such beauty, a fanciness that could be found exclusively in the 19th century2.it is somehow in the middle of all great attractions of Paris, so great photograph could be taken But truth be told, it's just a bridge, not an icon of Paris; a maximum of 15 minutes time spent there is enough, and if you want to see the Nymphs or the Fames you should bring binoculars

Keep wits about you. It's true this bridge is a hangout for pick pockets- so be careful!
Apart from that, this bridge is spectacular.
The view from both sides is stunning and not to be missed.
Plenty of amazing backdrops to take cracking photographs and even the odd selfie :)

STUNNING. For photographers, you can take any number of lovely shots here. The gold columns at each end are very eyecatching, both when on foot and from a bateau mouche on the Seine. The lamps are also beautiful. It's a landmark bridge in my opinion.

Great Attraction. A very attractive bridge with good views of the river from both sides. A lot of history and probably the most attractive bridge in all of Paris. Very good photo opportunities from both sides and equally of the bridge itself.
watch out. attempted pickpocket at pont alex. Had read about particular scam, but still very annoying when it happens.
The Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris. The sculptures in and around the bridge are breathtaking. Seeing it at night is as magical as traveling in time.
The most beautiful bridge in France. I love this bridge and the view opening from it. Make sure to go down to Seine and to enjoy its romantic quay.

One of the best views on the Seine brigdes and Eiffel tower. I went there twice - it is one of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen and in both directions you have a perfect view, either on the Eiffel tower or on the nice and definitively variously designed bridges of the Seine. Note: until there is what is called "les berges" (the banks of Seine - at the side of Eiffel tower) - if you need a bit of relaxation and walk, nice small cafés or simply some silence - go there - really a very nice place to be!
Very ornate Bridge!. We saw this bridge from our boat ride but didn't walk on it. Very interesting looking. Next time we'll stop and walk across.
Yeah, a bridge is an attraction - it's great!. Take the time to check this structure out while on your visit in Paris. It is incredible. Great photo opportunities as well!
Nice to see a well maintained bridge. A bridge is a bridge, but it was a good landmark and easy on the eye. Worth a stroll past if it doesn't mean a significant detour.
Most ornate bridge in Paris. This might be the most beautiful bridge in Paris and the gold statues on it and the other ornamentation make it really is spectacular Bridge to see

The most beauiful bridge in Paris. I've lived in Paris long enough to have crossed all of its bridges. And while each has its charm and its history, Pont Alexandre III is without a doubt the most mangnificent.

Stunning Bridge. 'Remember this from the movie, Midnight in Paris? It really is a gorgeous bridge, worth walking across to get to get to wonderful buildings on both sides of the Seine, even if it is raining a little.
Pleasant. And that's about it... not a must visit unless you are a photo-phile. Just walk through while being cautious and enjoy the sight.

Magnificent bridge. We stood on this bridge for about 3 hours waiting for and watching the Bastille Day fireworks over the Eiffel Tower. You have an excellent view up the river and of the tower. Our spot was right behind one of the statues leaning out over the river, called the shepherds of the river. Its an example of the lovely architecture and history that is everywhere in Paris.
Beautiful bridge. You should go at dusk to fully appreciate this bridge. Great views of the Eiffel tower and the Seine.
A part of Paris. This is part of Paris and a MUST see attraction. Don't miss during your walk around Paris. Take your time and appreciate it

great spot for photos. The gold detail on this bridge is truly beautiful. There is a great view of the Eiffel Tower from the bridge and it lies just past the last of the Champs Elysees fine shopping. It was easily the most beautiful bridge we saw on our long day of walking down the Siene.
Historical Site. Beautiful and historical value to see the city's beauty.

Beautiful bridge. It is I think the most impressive bridge in Paris. The golden statues , the nice lamps and the massiveness makes it very unique. You can make a great picture about the bridge with the Eiffel tower in the distance.
Great location for photos.. This is a very grand bridge topped with golden statues at each end. Looks even more impressive with The Grand Palace one side and Invalides the other.

Beautiful bridge. One of my favorite sites in Paris!. Visited France for our honeymoon and I just adored this bridge! The lovely gold detail and massiveness of the bridge make it a beauty to behold. The Eiffel Tower can be seen in the distance and the bridge is conveniently located near the Champs Elysees and Place de la Concorde.

Impressive bridge. This is probably the most impressive bridge in Paris, and certainly worth stopping and taking a more detailed look at, the golden statues on each corner are worthy of aloof on thier own
Beautiful!. Lovely place just to stand and watch the world go by. Situated near the Grand Palace and Petit Palace, with the Eiffel Tower as your backdrop, what's not to like?

Fanciest bridge in Paris. It was for sure the prettiest bridge in Paris....it's on the seine, kind of close to the eiffel tower, but it's not extremely spectacular or anything. Just a nicely decorated bridge in my opinion.

A glorious, golden bridge. The design, the statuary, the lamps and the golden decoration of this bridge take your breath away. It also links two areas of great interest - the gardens of the Musee de l'Armee and the Grand and Petit Palais. In the summer in good weather there is a pontoon moored on the Left Bank below the bridge where you can enjoy excellent snacks and drinks and study the elaborate detail of the bridge.
Magnificent. The feeling that you get passing by or standing on is something to be experienced. Calmness amidst traffic and hustle and bustle is one of it. the view is majestic...

Most beautiful bridge in Paris is being taken over by locks. This is my favorite bridge in Paris - it connects Invalides to the Grand and Petit Palais, and the Champs-Elysees. It is honestly the most classically beautiful bridges out of the 37 that span the Seine inside Paris. But this stupid love lock craze has gotten out of hand and now there are locks on this bridge as well! Such a shame that tourists are so disrespectful (that's what it is, it's disrespect... they just pass through Paris, they don't have to walk the bridges every day and see parts of them start to collapse!). "Take only pictures, leave only footprints"...
Where Adele shot her video. A very nice bridge where Adele shot her video "Someone Like You". Worth a visit as you stroll along the Seine.
The most beautiful bridge in the world.. Paris id by far the most beautiful city in the world and this is by far the city´s most beautiful bridge.

Eye candy in the middle of Paris. This is without a doubt my favorite bridge in Paris. The over-the-top decoration and broad sidewalks with a great view of the Esplanade des Invalides, the Eiffel Tower and the Grand Palais are not to be missed.
My favorite bridge in Paris. Yes it is pompous with gilded statues, but for me it just marvelous. Combined with Les Invalides at backgroud...what a view.

best bridge on Paris. Amazing, fell in love with this one...
Visit this during the night if possible as the illumination is great
Paris icon. The bridges in Paris are iconic and this one is the best of course. Go walk on it, especially at night and feel the magic.

The most elaborate of the Paris bridges. The Pont Alexandre III is the most ornate of the bridges that cross the Seine in Paris. It is majestic and elegant. A nighttime stroll on it is recommended as you will see the details of the many sculptures that adorn the bridge. The walkways are wide and can accommodate many people at one time. It is a very romantic place to be when the light are on in the evening.Don't miss this bridge, it is the one worth seeing!
Very nice architecture. Interesting to see at night with focused lights on bridge. Very nice place to visit for free. Visit nearby bridges as well with Love Locks.
beautiful bridge. very artistically done bridge. Great place to take pictures and get a view of the river! The walk along the river is nice too.
WOW!!!!!!. Amazing views of the La Seine river banks on historic bridge, a must see. BTW its free to cross the historical beauty and tons of places to grab lunch and or a drink when done.
Awesome. Awesome Bridge over the Seine river, it was made for the sake of the Russian Cesar Alexander visit to Paris

Dont understand the hype. Dont get me wrong this is a pretty bridge but it is just an average paris bridge to me. It is detailed with the gold touches but the bridge is no different then something like pont de arts. I wouldnt say this is a must do in Paris but really a if you have time drive through it.

Picturesque and navigation point.. Good place for pictures of the surrounding views and of the bridge itself...and gets you across the Seine. Also, area where you board for some Seine river boat tours.

Stunning. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris - bar none. It is a destination in itself. Make sure to visit both day and night since the look changes. In the evening it is illuminated - postcard perfect.

Magnifique!. I gave my partner a ring on the Pont Alexandre III Bridge. The setting was perfect and absolutely romantic. The sun was setting and the Eiffel Tower was standing tall in the background. I was trying to wait for the sun to go down actually so the bridge would be all lit up, but it was summer so the sun didn't set until late and I couldn't wait anymore. He was very surprised and we got it all on video! It was great. Later that night friends met up with us and we went to the summer carnival in the park that is walking distance from the bridge and then we walked back to the bridge to see it all lit up. It is simply amazing and a must visit!
Le Pont. it is lovely to see the decoration while crossing the bridge from one bank to the other .. it is old and historical bridge
prettiest place in paris. this bridge is just how i imagined paris: majestic and romantic! the architecture is really impressive

very pretty!. Its hard to miss this bridge. very beautiful area to stumble upon! (which is very easy to do, central location and around many other attractions) Great place to stop and take a few pictures. The bridge is beautifully designed.
Great bridge for pictures!. Just beautiful with all the gold and statues. It's a great place to take photos and offers a nice view of the Eiffel.

Conned - Almost. A guy picks up a gold wedding band off the sidewalk in front of us. He tries it on and says it doesn't fit and offers it to us for a "few euros". We told him no. He continued to follow us trying to hand it to me. No deal. Watch out for the con artists on the beautiful Pont Alexandre III

Best bridge in Paris. There are many bridges along the river Seine and this is by far the greatest with the beautiful golden statues and magnificent architecture. Very close to other major attractions such as the Eiffel Tower, Musee D'orsay and Champs Elysees. Make sure you walk along the rivers edge to admire the bridge from all angles. Great photo ops.
Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful gold accents and statues. It overlooks Les Invalides. Good photo op. Near the Louvre, Place de la Concorde.
LOVE Pont Alexander III. It is the most beautiful bridge in all of Paris and offers the loveliest vistas - particularly on a warm early Summer night! :)
GORGEOUS!. I was so sad our boat tour did not allow us to see the faces of the ladies who adorn both sides of the bridge in the middle. Fantastic art. Fantastic location

More than just a bridge. This bridge has a rich history. It was built around for the 1900’s World Fair. It symbolizes Russian-French friendship. At the four corners, there are beautiful bronze statues representing the illustrious Arts, Sciences, Commerce and Industry. The bridge is perfectly situated among so many beautiful attractions. It connects the Champs-Élysées, the Invalides, and the Eiffel Tower quarter, so you get to take some amazing pictures. We were also told that if you go in the evenings, you can see many Asian brides and grooms posing for pictures to place in their engagement albums.

From Art Museum to Napoléon. Petit Palais, Museum of Art, closed on Mondays, you cross that beautiful bridge in Art Déco style if you want to visit Napoleon tomb and the military museum at Hotel des Invalides. Food and Beverage available in the Metro stop closer to Hotel des Invalides. All by walking from Place de la Concorde

The most elegant and romantic parisian bridge. The most elegant and romantic bridge on the Seine with the Eiffel Tower in the background and the Champs Elysées within short walking distance as well as Place Concorde. Enjoy a walk and take some spectacular photos and admire the scenery of a romantic parisian night.
Stunning views!. One of the most beautiful spots in Paris - the views from this bridge are breathtaking. Great photo opps! Don't miss it!
Beautiful!. And obviously popular...lots of photo shoots going on. It's beautiful and has the Eiffel Tower in the background. Ornate and Beautiful!
The Golden Bridge. Beautiful and great if you are going to the Army Museum and Napoleon's Tomb. The grass behind the bridge is great for picnics.

Play pick-a-bridge - and then pick this one. This bridge takes you straight to the Petit and the Grand Palais, but it's worth lingering there to see the grand and glorious statues and the beautiful view over the Seine. It's an icon for good reason: don't miss it. And it's just as lovely by night as by day.

It's open to all and looks spectacular. It's a bridge across one of the most famous rivers in the world, and what a bridge. You can't do much with it apart from look at it take pictures of it and walk across it but it is definitely worth seeing

A magnificent bridge. This is the second time that I have walked across this bridge (the first was in 2006). I have walked across many bridges over the years (the Charles bridge in Prague, the chain bridge in Budapest, the Tower Bridge in London, the Harbour bridge in Sydney, the Luis bridge in Porto, the Mostar bridge in Bosnia). This one is my favourite.

Just a bridge. Nice for a photo op, but it is just another lovely ornate bridge, which Paris has in abundance. We rented the bikes and rode over here on our way to the Louvre, be careful of the pickpockets that loiter in this area.

Lovely Bridge. One of the 'must see' attractions - just a stone's throw from Invalides Metro. Take the steps down to the Seine and enjoy a beer at the cafe facing the bridge. It's worth £8 a pint for the view!

Beautiful bridge. This is truly an iconic bridge that reveals the stunning beauty of that is Paris. A visually breathtaking monument that crosses the Seine. It is an amazing frame to the various buildings and monument in the area. Don't miss.
Impressive. It's the most "elegant" bridge in Paris. Very well decorated, a "must seeing". It was opened for the 1900 Universal Exhibition.

One of Paris' prettiest bridges. Great view of the Eiffel Tower and the River Seine. Also centrally located. The 'golden' embellishments give this bridge a very historical feel.On the other hand, it's a bridge. So don't expect more than taking that nice picture, taking in the Seine and enjoying views.The Princess Diana monument is on the North Side (Flame).

beautiful bridge. We had to walk across this bridge to visit the Hotel des Invalides. There was a wedding couple being photographed. We would have enjoyed this walk but were disappointed that a con artist approached us with the "found ring" scam. It's a shame that tourists have to be subjected to this.

I love this bridge. It's rare to say you want to go see a bridge. This bridge is worth it. It is so beautiful, and is surrounded by such beautiful buildings like Les Invalides, Le Grand Palais, and Le Petit Palais. It really is one of the prettiest settings in Paris.

Prettiest bridge in paris. This bridge is so beautiful with the the four golden statues on each corner. You have a great view of the eiffel tower from here. When we were there saw lots of brides taking pictures on the bridge. Make sure you stop here when you are walking around paris.

very impressive. this bridge is one of the most impressive bridges in Paris .with its golden statues on and under the bridge .when you pass this bridge you will get to the military museum .very nice place to take picturesbeware .... many young lades in the area try to stole your money with the (ring trick) .they told you that the ring had fall from you then they came back and ask for money (simply don't even talk to them).
Extremely beautiful. Incredibly beautiful bridge, splendidly decorated. The most beautiful of all bridges over Paris, definitely worth seeing.
Marvelous!. The bridge is marvelous with fine sculpture work. We took a lot of pictures on the bridge and with sculptures. It was nice to have pictures of the bridge and the golden Invalides museum.

A part of the history of Paris. The history of the bridge makes it more interesting to walk over. You can get this from the River Cruise. You get a close look from below and a better view of the workmanship of this bridge. Worth seeing close as one of the landmarks of Paris.

Absolutely beautiful. Most beautiful bridge in Paris. The contrast of the black lamp posts, the river and the golden status give this place an unique atmosphere. Everywhere you look at you get an amazing view. Definetely worth a visit while in Paris.

Wonderful bridge, in the middle of Paris... Located in the center of the city, near le Grand-Palais and le Dom des Invalides, Pont Alexandre III is a nice place to sightsee over the city... Its nice architecture completes the landscape over the Seine. Nice place to walk.!
It is beautiful, but just a bridge. however, if you take the stairs down to the shore of the Seine, you'll find a couple of snack bars where a lot of young Parisians gather for wine and a snack.

Amazing!. We arrived right at Pont Alexandre III via the Batobus. What a site to see. Such a beautiful bridge with many different ways to see it. You can even walk underneath. You can even see the Eiffel Tower in the distance from here. You can walk to the Arc from here but it's 1-1.5 miles, if I had to guess.

Gorgeous Bridge. This is an absolutely gorgeous bridge. More often than not, we've observed many a bird & her groom taking pictures here and I can see why.
If in Paris, take a leisurely stroll over this bridge. It is beautiful!

A must see. Everyone goes on about Pont Neuf but this bridge is certainly the best in Paris. The golden statutes are just stunning. As you are at the end of the bridge you look down to Musee D'Armee and Napoleon's Tomb which is just simply stunning!

One of the Most Beautiful Bridges. The Pont Alexandre III is one of the most beautiful bridges of Paris. It was finished in 1900 and is beautifully decorated. There are lamps supported by cherubs, flowered garlands and pylons that have beautiful gilded statues on top of them.

Art Work. This is not a bridge, is a work art that crosses the seine. You should visit it first in day light, then at night.
At night, beautiful views from the eiffel tower!
Beautiful bridge. This is a must, very beautiful, great photo opportunity. Lovely views of the river seine and great place to walk.
historic. Beautiful mark with a historic significance. A great place to observe the river seine. You can also get fantastic photos of the river Seine with beautiful reflections of the city lights.
a must see.. An iconic must see. Photographs beautifully, especially with the Grand Palais in the background. Walk down the steps to view it from below too! The detail is incredible!
Beautiful. A bridge not to be missed, cross it by foot and pay attention to all the small details. The very best of paris. The market under the bridge can be skipped

Best place to get a view of Eiffel at night. Come after sunset and you'll get glorious views of the Eiffer tower. Stay long enough so you'll see the shimmering light show which the tower runs every half hour or so. You can also get fantastic photos of the river Seine with beautiful reflections of the city lights.
As bridges go, one of the best. It is only a bridge, but it is one of the most beautiful bridges with the gold figures guarding the four corners of it.
Beautiful walk. Whether you walk of drive it, this bridge is well worth seeking out. Each end is beautiful; take time to enjoy the statues and inscriptions.
Gorgeously ornate. A very ornate and gorgeously golden bridge! Fun to look at the elaborate sculptures and to enjoy the views of Paris - smack dab in a very lovely part of the city.
Very pretty.. I loved this bridge. It was a beautiful piece of architecture. We took many walks across it as it's just so central. A must-see.

My favorite bridge. This is indeed my favorite bridge. We crossed Ponte Alexandre after a visit in Petit Palais. The view is so amazing. The pavement is large enough that you almost don't notice the passing cars and Tour Eiffel makes his appearance in the western side of the bridge ready for the usual photos.
Fine. A very beautiful bridge. But it is actually most beautiful seen from the riverside as a lot of the details are on the side of the bridge

An unusual bridge you can cross between other attractions. This bridge is very ornate and was built to commemorate an alliance between France and Russia that is easily forgotten today. I do not rate it excellent as it is located in an area where you have better attractions like the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower and Napolean's tomb and it is just not that good, but it only takes a few minutes to walk it so there us little reason not to visit it when you are near the Place Concorde.Many tourists take the river tour. We did two and each time they raved about the bridge and you get a good view of the statues underneath. So if you do a river tour first then you will probably know what you want to photograph. I think this is the most ornate bridge I have seen not just in Paris but in the world and I've seen many. We saw it in daylight but it must be romantic at night.
Very pretty. It's a pretty bridge. Very ornate, took a lot of pictures from various angles. Worth walking over to take a look.
Historical. Loved walking across this ancient bridge with the special photographic opportunities it afforded. Truly amazing!
Favorite Bridge. I just loved walking up and down the bridge. It's so pretty and the view around just amazing. Nothing like that back home.

Most ornate bridge in Paris. This bridge is simply elegant due to the tall structures and statues on both ends of the bridge. They gleam in the sunlight and are very often captured in every tourist's photographs. It may not be a destination you head to, but if you pass it, stop and take a look.

Simply spectacular. This was the bridge in Paris I HAD to visit. We started our trek with a visit to the Arc de Triomphe and a stroll down the Champs Elysses, took a right at the Charles de Gaulle statue and walked past the Grand Palais. The bridge is even more beautiful than any photo you have seen of it. The statues at the center of the bridge are spectacular, and the intricate work on figures even on light standards are amazing. It is an easy walk across the Seine, and every step seems like a special occasion. It is simply beautiful.
the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Paris is so nice but this outstanding bridge is a must !!!the view, the architecture .... waouhhh!!!
Romantic. You can't miss it.Cross, click, etc...Besides the bridge itself, you get to the Louvre through Alexandre III.Feel Paris how it should be felt

Stunning bridge with iconic photo opportunities. This bridge is perfectly situated between many tourist attractions. You have an excellent view of the Tour Eiffel, Invalids, Concorde, La Seine and more. If you are lucky, you can catch a beautiful sunrise or sunset here. I often see people taking their wedding photos here. It's definitely a must while in Paris! The best thing: it's free!

Elegant photo-op. Photos don't do it justice. You have to walk it, view the tour boats and barges on the Seine, admire the bronze cherubs and fancy lights. Then there are all the things to do in the area.....Grand Palais, Petit Palais museum, and the Champs Elysees is a stones throw away. Make sure your wallet is secure; pickpockets who lead you on with a gold ring scope this bridge. Pont Alexandre III is on tour one of the No Worries Paris walking guide.

If gold is your thing . . .. you will love this bridge. One of the more unique bridges it is just "over the top". The good news is that you don't have to go out of your way to see it. All of the museums and tourist sites are clustered around it.Enjoy!

A perfect walk. The Pont Alexandre is the most gorgeous bridge set across the Seinne, right in between the Ecole Militare and the Grande Palais and Petit Palais. It is a perfect walk. Top off the experience with a bev at Flow, right at the base on the river, and you will have to sigh a great deal.
A nice stroll. Get rid of the locks, keep them to one bridge only. It was lovely to stroll over however. A couple of nice photos.
A nice site. Pont Alexander III is a nice break while strolling down the Seine. It is a good site to have a mid day picnic.
Picturesque bridge. Picturesque bridge that is worth taking an extra look at if it is on your path, or not far from it. Not worth going far out of your way to see.
Stunning. Photograph heaven. The art, architecture and engineering combined into this bridge is truly amazing.

A Landmark!. One of Paris best ornate bridges. The gilded sculptures on pillars are impressive. Tourists take pictures next to the Seine nymphs and cherubs . It is my favorite Paris bridge that links the "Rive Gauche" to The "Rive Droite" !
Impressive. What can you say, it's a very impressively decorated bridge. Provides a very good view on the way to Les Invalides.
Gorgeous. Pont Alexandre III has got to be my favourite bridge in the whole world ever! Forget the Pont de l'archeveche, this has got to be the more romantic spot, with its cherubs and lamp posts.
always charming and now even brighter. A most amazing bridge now cleaned and sparkling. a sight to behold. Crosses the Seine in the heart of Paris

Nostalgic. It is definetely a beautiful place to take A Walk and a Boat ride the nostalgic feeling is unexplainable. It is mesmerising the beautiful Ornate pillars and walls make you want to stay there.

Picturesque. Conveniently located, you can take beautiful pictures there. I would visit the bridge earlier in the morning as it tends to get crowded as with many other places in Paris later in the day.
My favourite bridge in Paris, stunning!!. By far, my favourite bridge in Paris. stunning to look at, the detail, the romance of it! Just beautiful.
Pretty Bridge, Romantic. It's a very beautiful bridge and very romantic to take a walk on....... Makes for great pictures.................................................................
impressive. it's only a bridge, but as far as bridges go it's pretty impressive, both from up top and down on the quayside

My favourite bridge. Love the ornate stylings of this bridge, and it's location. Gorgeous!
It is the most photogenic or all 19 Seine bridges.

My favourite Parisian bridge. I saw this bridge on my first trip to Paris 19 years ago and then again over the last two years. It is picture perfect and typifies the beauty of Paris. A must-see for anyone who appreciates beauty.

Beautiful, ornate bridge. The Seine River winds through Paris and has many beautiful and interesting bridges across it. This is the most beautiful and ornate one. I highly recommend taking a river cruise and view them from this angle.

The Most Beautiful Bridge I've Ever Seen. We walked all over the city when we were there last week, but my favorite walking was on the Pont Alexandre III. What a magnificent structure. The bridge is simply amazing.

Lovely Bridge. Not exactly an attraction but a nice area to walk around, the bridge itself is very impressive and you get a great photo opportunity with the Eiffel Tower in the background.
The bridge has golden parts over it which in the right light looks very impressive and dazzling !

Beautiful!. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris, in my opinion. I loved just hanging out on it and watching the river cruise boats go by. There are alos a number of little bars and there was even a small "beach" set up at one of the area downstairs from the bridge right along the river. The bridge has lovely statues and great views of the Eiffel Tower.
Nice walk down the bridge. One more very impressive architecture to see. Close a a park and small venders at the bottom of the bridge, this place is a most go.
Beautiful bridge. It's amazing to walk across and even more interesting to ride under. gold statue all over... Only in Paris
Stop and stare. This is one of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen. It fits in nicely with the surrounding Parisian architecture as well. A must see on the Seine River.

Cameras to the ready. While probably not a destination in its own right, this listed historic monument deserves to be seen. Dating from 1900 and in the Beaux-Arts style, the golden Fames shine on a sunny day. The exuberant art nouveau lamps are archetypical Paris. Have a linger, find an interesting photographic angle and admire its extravagance.

Romance in Paris!. We were totally awestruck when we first saw this bridge and during our ten day stay in Paris we say it from multiple angles. Bateau mouche from the seine, bus and walking across it, but the piece de résistance is crossing it late at night when most of the tourists are gone to bed. Very romantic! It is also one of the best view points for photos of the Eiffel Tower.

Quintessential Paris. This magnificent bridge is the embodiment of everything Paris is known for. This has got to be among the most, if not The most, beautiful bridge in the world. Even though it is well over a hundred years old, it is in excellent condition. A stroll across the bridge is a must-do for visitors to Paris.
Our Favourite. Just a beautiful bridge with many decorations and a great history. Enjoy the golden statues and try to walk across rather than just being on a bus.

What a elegancy of structure of one very renowned bridge. After rather long walk afoot along the Champs Elysees, on another day I decided to get down to the banks of the Seine. This time I concentrated my attention to one bridge that connects the Champs Elysees quarter on the right side of Seine and Invalides and Eiffel Tower quarter on the left side. Very ornamented bridge on its upward and downward arches. That is a deck arch bridge. Due to its decorations, this bridge is considered as a French Monument historique.The Russian Tsar Alexander III of Romanoff dinasty is responsible if we can say this way, for the birth of this very nice engineer's achievement. In fact the Nicholas II, the son of Alexander III laid the foundation stone for this extravagant bridge,that in the architectural style reminds somehow at the Grand Palais, which is right across the Seine.I was delighted with this remarkable construction.

One of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. The Alexander III bridge across the river Seine in Paris. Part of the architectural ensemble formed by Grand Palais and Petit Palais on the Champs-Élysées area. It is one of the most beautiful bridges of Paris including the lamps and the magnificent statues. A visit not to be missed.

A must see. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris... It will give you excellent views of the River, and you are close to the Grand Palais, the Petit Palais, the Avenue des Champs Elysées... This is where the final scene of "Midnight in Paris" took place

Now that's a bridge. You will probably pass this at some point in your travels regardless, but make sure to leave about 15 min or more just to enjoy the details of everything from the lights to the facades.

Take a breath. This city is my favourite in the world. Every corner, every vista has something to inspire. From this bridge you can see some of Paris' greatest sights and it is one of the most ornate bridges in the city. It connects the Champs-Élysées quarter and the Invalides and Eiffel Tower quarter, so much can be seen. Take a breath, stop what you're doing and just absorb the beauty.
beautiful gold bridge. Great walk and photo opportunity. Nothing like a bridge in Paris to bring out the romance in you and this is the prettiest bridge in Paris
Artistic From End to End. Our Batobus stop was here for the short walk to the Rodin and Invalides. Beautiful bridge with great views and even more beautiful artwork.
beautiful area. this area is beautiful it is recommended to everyone to visit this place... it is very beautiful place....

Worth a walk over. The bridge is highly ornate compared to most of the others crossing the Seine, and the history is quite interesting. You should definitely make a point to see it while strolling along the river banks. You can just as easily see it from one of the boat tours or bike tours. I'd recommend building it into one of your iteneraries in the area vs. making a special trip just for the Pont Alexandre III.

Most beautiful bridge!. This bridge is architecturally stunning ... gorgeous historic photo spot. Great shots from here with the Eiffel Tower in the background. Worth a visit both day and especially at night with all the lights.
Beautiful bridge to see, by foot and boat. This bridge is worth seeing by foot as well as by boat. The gold accents and other details are interesting to see up close.
What a Bridge. Great bridge to see. They done this one up right. One of the most beautiful places in Paris. Stop and take a scenic view of the Seine and Paris.

A gorgeous bridge. A gorgeous bridge (as I said). Worth a walk over. Great views of the tower.
The golden statues framing it are beautiful. A nice mix of the Russian in with the French.
OTT. Great to pass over, under or around at any hour of the night or day this bridge is over the top on a grand scale but that's how they did things in Paris in those days!

Fitting bridge for approach to Napoleons burial site.... Beautiful bridge protected by gold plated lions....worth a few photos. Also nice when viewed from the water on the BatoBus or other water taxi....
Beautiful. Beautiful Bridge with amazing gold accents. A must go see in Paris. Great photo opportunity. Wont take too long but a must see.
beautiful structure. This bridge is a peice of beautiful architecture, see it on your way to the Eiffel tower or view it from the tower itself
A must see. An ideal place for taking beautiful photos. Just gorgeous, did not disappoint. You should walk the whole length of it, not just drive through on a bus or a taxi.
At beautiful as you expect. This was on my list of must do's in Pars and it didn't disappoint. Gorgeously decorated and as beautiful and ornate as you would expect.

wow!. Beautiful bridge, it almost seems fake! Aside from the Eiffel Tower, Pont Alexandre is another ideal place to take beautiful pictures. There are many things to see in Paris, make Pont Alexandre one of them! Personally, it is not enough to simply observe it from the bus or taxi. Get off, walk on the bridge- look around you, touch the architecture, look at the beautiful details. This is a piece of art, this is Paris.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Pont Alexander has been described as the most beautiful bridge in Parris. It is wide and has on each side of the bridge lanterns and sculptures that are symmetrically positioned that enhances it. There are also two huge sculptures attached in the middle of the bridge that can be seen from the boats going up and down the Seine River. In order to really enjoy the bridge and take in all its beauty, you must take your time and walk across it. Enjoy !
One of many gorgeous bridges. Very beautiful bridge centrally located easy to walk to from several points of interest - easily seen en route to many of the other sights. Gorgeous at sunset!

Amazing bridge!. While there are a number of picturesque bridges that cross the Seine, but there's nothing quite like Pont Alexandre III. It's very different from the other bridges across the river and is worth a visit. I have heard good things about the view from the river cruises, but we just spent some time walking across the around and I have to recommend that as well. It was good taking our time looking at the carvings along the bridge and the detail in the sculptures was incredible.The view from the bridge of some other sights is great, and you can get some good pictures of the Eiffel Tower from there as well.It's obviously a popular spot for wedding photos as we saw three wedding parties posing during out time there.It's a quick stop on a tour of Paris, but it should be on the list.

with smog is still better. What a wonderful piece of art. Walking from one side to the other is so nice and inspiring...Stop at the middle and let your dreams flow as the river with its "bateaux mooches".

Fabulous. This arch bridge (one of the bridges across seine river) in heart of Paris looks special due to presence of statues, nymphs and lamps. Statues are partly golden. One gets a good view while undertaking seine river cruise. Most of the bridges across seine are arched. Good views and photographs from and around the bridge, in background of fabulous buildings.
Magnificent. The most beautiful bridge in Paris; don't miss a walk on this bridge when in Paris.I admired it from bus and boat cruise too.
ornate. something totally different and well kept has a magical feel from here you can watch thd world go by

Architectural beauty!. In the middle of Paris, the pont Alexandre III connects Invalides to the Grand Palais. The most stunning bridge in all of Paris boasts four massive pillars with gold statues. The bridge is best seen by boat as the carvings are up close and personal.
Beautiful bridge. The architecture is beautiful. It's a nice easy bridge to walk while you are strolling through central Paris.
SPECTACULAR. In one word, spectacular, don't ever get enough of this bridge. Once there the camera has a mind of it's own. For information on the bridge go to, www.paris.fr

Pont Alexandre III is absolutely gorgeous!. I spent a great deal of time taking pictures of the nymphs and fames on the bridge. You have one of the most serene views of the Seine River just standing and watching life go by. Even in the midst of the people and traffic, there's a sense of peace over the river. Quite lovely.
most beautiful brige in Paris. Be sure to explore by foot on your way to or from the Place de la Concorde. Can also be seen from the hop-on-hop--off bus briefly.
Beautiful. Very beautiful with great views of the river. The buildings around frame it well and provide a good indicator of its significance.
Love it!. This bridge typifies Paris - elegant and impressive! There are wonderful views of Paris to be had from this bridge.

A summer must. Take the Metro or RER and get to Invalides. Follow the exit to Pont Alexandre.
Enjoy....
Tip: Mind to bring your own drinks, 'cause the queues at the cantinas are really big...

great for pictures. A place not to be missed, great pictures with the tower in the background, it is a costless attraction with a great impact on one's memory. If it is not raining - one can have a super romantic walk with the other half and take great pictures.

For a quick step up. If you're taking a Hop On Hop Off tour, you don't need to step out the bus to see it. If you're on foot on the near by, go and have a walk to see the art masterpieces in the bridge. Good walk.
Best bridge. This is the most stunning of the bridges on the Seine and definitely my favourite. A stroll over it is a must.

Paris Paris. This is such a part of the romantic style of this special city.We crossed it many times the statues are excellent ,you see people being photographed, weddings happening, films were being shot,lots of activity and its beautiful.

Not just a bridge. The decoration of the bridge is just stunning.. Some of the review already mentioned how it is.. Not to mention you can take picture with Eiffel tower in the background. Close to few major things as well, such as Grand Palais, Champs de Elysee, Musee de L'armee..
Amazing bridge. This bridge is my all time favourite in Paris. It is so ornate and from every angle you can take amazing photos day or night.
Golden bridge.. Nice bridge is gold finishes in an idyllic surrounding of museums and nice buildings. Close to louvre. Check it out.
My favourite bridge!. Such a beautiful bridge, looks great from a distance and when you look at the statues, each one of them seems to be about to come to life!

Walking on a warm summer night. It is one of the most superbe point of view in Paris and in the world..if you have to chance to be on the Pont Alexandre II on a late summernight with the Seine river at your feet , the lights on the Invalides and the Grand Palais , you understand what is magical about Paris.....Take your time to admire the XIXth century ensemble which was the golden age ( for real as everything is golden all around) of PAris, capital of the world

A Piece of Work... to say the least. The bridge, with its exuberant Art Nouveau lamps, cherubs, nymphs and winged horses at either end, was built between 1896 and 1900. It was named after Tsar Alexander III (father of Nicholas II) of Russia who laid the foundation stone in October 1896. The style of the bridge reflects that of the Grand Palais, to which it leads on the right bank.

Beautiful bridge. Quite an impressive bridge, with some amazing architecture on it. Worth a wander across and taking the time to take a few photos, but the museums on the northern end and the Seine itself are more impressive.
Gold. The bridge, the streets, the water and the Gold statuses just AMAZING...Must take a walk there, specially with loved ones. To see how the sun hits on the gold and shines..beautiful.
A Beatiful Bridge. A beautiful Baroque bridge with nice views over the Seine and the city. A nice way to get between the Champs Elysées and Musée d'Orsay.
beautiful bridge. beautiful bridge. One really need to sit down and enjoy the view, while remembering the history of the bridge.
Beautiful.... Finally got to see Pont Alexandre III after only seeing it in movies. Just as beautiful as I have always pictured.

Amazing. I really like This bridge because has amazing view from there I toou so many pictures. Also Paris is so romantic many places to visit and great food!!!! I can't wait to go back again with my whole family!!!
A nice bridge. Picturesque bridge that is worth taking an extra look at if it is on your path, or not far from it. Not worth going far out of your way to see.
Very Scenic. From the bridge you can watch the boats on the Seine. You can see the Tour Eiffel. On one side of the bridge is the Invalides and on the other the GrandPalais.
Beautiful Views Down the Seine.. A wonderful stroll across the bridge. Great views down the river and lovely cat figures on the bridge. Wonderful.

Picturesque!. Liked: sitting by the river looking across the bridge and at all the boats drifting by.
Disliked: Watch out for the scam of people trying to get you to sign up to donate to a deaf and blind school - spotted a few groups hanging round here. Its just a nuisance.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. It has a great view to Eiffel tower, Place D'Concorde. the decoration is breathtaking - many couples take their wedding pics there
Lots of Gold. A beautiful bridge and looks stunning at night. There are loads of options for impressive other sites behind in your photographs

Absolutely a must see!. I stumbled on this bridge on my way to visit another attraction. It can only be described as awe inspiring. Straddling the Seine, this bridge had elements of the rococo style of art (in my opinion), it was elaborate and very photogenic, a very romantic site indeed.

Nice, good views. My 3 rating may have been impacted by my visit being while raining, but I didn't think it was anything spectacular. Pretty bridge, good views, and access to a cute cafe under tarps down by the river.
Most ornate bridge in Paris. Truly beautiful bridge, strong character, a real must see for first timers. There was nothing not to like
The most beautil I've ever seen. It's so nice to cross the brige coming from Invalids and start a pleasant walk to Champs Elysees. At night, with the lights it's very beautiful.

Great photo spot!!. All of Paris tourist attractions are beautiful, but you don't want to miss this particular spot and take some great pictures, from every angle possible, north, south, east or west, you won't regret.

Stunning, Especially in the Sunlight. I have travelled to a number of countries that have famous bridges but I think this is by far my favourite. I had seen it from the Bateaux Parisiens tour, and loved it so I made a point of going back to it. It is an absolutely beautiful sight especially when the sun is shining on the gold of the sculptures.
A nice walk. Beautiful old bridge...lovely place to hang around and look over the Seine. It looks lovely at night. A must visit
Beautiful and Serene. Its a BEAUTIFUL bridge. We spent a long time here, strolling, clicking pictures. It was a Wonderful Experience indeed.

You have to walk across this bridge!. Seeing the Pont Alexandre III from a short distance is breathtaking. This has to be the most beautiful bridge in the world. But if you see it only from a distance, you're missing out on one of Paris' best pleasures. Stroll across, lingering to appreciate the sculptures and watch boats chug by.

Beautiful bridge worth seeing from boat cruise!. My purse was stolen by a pickpocket here on the West Bank while i was sitting taking a picture! My purse was next to me on the bench for a few seconds only. Keep all valuables close and attached to you or hidden and also to a minimum! Beware anyone asking you to sign a form on a clipboard, trying to put a bracelet on you or return a "lost ring or piece of jewellery"!

Stunning bridge and view. This is one point not to be missed while in Paris. No matter if it is day or night this amazing bridge has the most stunning views in Paris! (eiffel tower, notre dame, invalides, grand and petit palais)

very romantic. This is undoubtedly the most beautiful bridge in Paris with it's ornate angels in gold and the view of the Eiffel Tower from there.Compare with the Pont Neuf which is also fantastic but very different. Walk across and make a wish.
Best bridge in the world. This bridge was really built with all Russian Imperial taste and grandeur. The most beautiful bridge in the world! Just magnificent !
A masterpiece. It's odd to say a bridge is a masterpiece but it's beauty and perfection was breathtaking. If you must see just 1 bridge in paris it's this one!!!

The most beautiful bridge in Paris!. The Pont Alexandre III is classified as a Historical Monument and there are no words basically to describe its outstanding beauty!It is just magnificent and lavish and you could spend a whole half-day studying and admiring its many gilded sculptures, statues and candelabras!The Pont Alexandre III links the Esplanade des Invalides to the Avenue Churchill that runs between the Grand Palais and Petit Palais and leads to the Champs Elysees.The metal bridge was built for the Universal Exhibition of 1900 and celebrated the Franco-Russian alliance that was sealed in August 1897.I recommend of course walking across the bridge to admire its wealth of decoration but you should also walk down on the riverbank to get a different perspective.You’ll be able to admire the engineering work but also the many sculptures adorned the outside of the parapets.For example the two keystones placed on the centre of the bridge are adorned with sculptural groups facing the river.The upstream keystone’s sculptural group represents the Nymphs of the River Seine, and the downstream the Nymphs of the River Neva.It is impossible to have a good look at these sculptures from atop the bridge!You need to do some homework before hand to spot the various decorative elements, but it’s worth every minute spent reading your guidebook!The bridge is equally attractive at different time of the day, so you will go back over and over to take photos!The closest Metro stations are Invalides (Left Bank) or Champs Elysees Clemenceau (Right Bank) on Line 13.Whichever direction you come from, you'll enjoy a stunning view of the bridge as the metro exits are a couple of minutes away from the bridge.

Beautiful Bridge. The bridge is close to Hotel des Invalides and is beautiful. The architecture is really good and definitely worth a visit. You can also walk to Hotel des Invalides from here although a bit far but good.

Very nice view . This bridge starts with the view of Army Museum on the one side and ends with the views of Grand and Petit Palaces. You can enjoy a look over Eiffel Tower at the same time. Together with its statues, it is a nice place to visit and take photos.
Beautiful!!. I could enjoy a fine morning here. The awesome view, sizzling traffic, weather everything added the beauty of that.
Alaxender Bridge. When I took the night cruise of the Seine, I realized that i HAD TO come back to this beautiful bridge!...Visit it at night, its mesmerizing!!
Beautiful Bridge. Its so nice to cross the Seine on any bridges but this one is has the most beautiful details and gold features.
Beautiful Bridge. All the bridges are beautiful. Walk along the Seine and you will start to understand where you are in Paris. Take a picture.

Best View. Best view to both sides of the Seine. As your crossing from the right bank the view with Le Invalides in the distance is spectacular. The lights on the bridge at night are romantic and beautiful.

Well done bridge. This bridge shows the architecture and luxury of Paris. It is very well constructed and full of gold. Often called the "best bridge in all of Paris". I haven't seen every bridge so I can't say for sure but I will say it is worth a visit. Then walk over to the Armory Museum when you are done.

Picturesque and spellbinding, A must visit destination. Pont Alexandre was one of the places which I was not so keen on going as I have seen other bridges in European countries which I thought were the best. But then I am glad I reversed my decision and visited it. One of the most glamorous bridges I have ever seen is Pont Alexandre. The golden sculptures bordering the bridge make it glow at all times. The sprawling breadth of the bridge inspires awe. The passing cruises, ferries and boats gives you the cosmopolitan essence of the place from a strategic point. The sight of the Eiffel tower from here helps the Paris feeling really sink in. In short, "Don't dare miss it"

The most beautiful and photographic bridge ever. Paris likes to honor it's relationships with people from other nations. You will find streets names after J.F. Kennedy and statues of George Washington. This bridge honors the French and Russian relationship. Massive sculptures encased in gold are at either end of the bridge with plenty of ladies and cherubs to match. A great bridge to walk across and photograph. You won't find one like this in the USA, so enjoy.
romantic. glamorous bridge , lovely to stroll and watch the boats go by. great spot for romantic photos and the view is just as spectacular in the evening.
Gorgeous!. Pont Alexandre III is Paris. It's fabulous, ornate and more than functional. It's a romantic stroll across the Seine.

Pont Alexandre III. Truly the most ornate, extravagant bridge in Paris. A must see in Paris. We decided to walk from the Eiffel tower to Louvre museum and this bridge was around 20 minutes walk away from the Eiffel tower.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Built to celebrate the relations between France and Russia, this bridge is a must in Parisian architecture. Cross it, it links the left and right banks..

Striking golden statues!. This bridge is a highlight of the Seine river in Paris! The gold statues adorning the sides and the four posts of the bridge are so bright and well-sculpted, that one looks at them in awe, and they can shine like golden angels in bright sunlight.
Do not miss. One of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. Well decorated. Grasp some history of the Russian French treaty to understand the meaning of the sculpture.
Bridge Between 2 Worlds. This gift from the Russian people to the French people is the most beautiful and elaborate in all of Paris. It is NOT to be missed, and right in the heart of the city.

Pont Alexandre III. This Ornate Bridge is named after Russian Tsar Alexander III, who signed an alliance with France in the late 19th century (one of the alliances which led to World War 1). It is a useful link between both sides of the river, plus you can drive under it & see the ornate latice which supports the roadway

Amazing. I loved this bridge before I had even seen it in person. It's such an iconic bridge. I love it even more now because it is where my fiance proposed to me on our last night in Paris. It has wonderful views of the Seine and the Eiffel Tower. I definitely recommend seeing it at night and watching the Eiffel Tower sparkle from here.
Great views. Classic Parisien bridge - great views, busy though and watch out for pickpockets. Young girls with a petition to sign will rifle through your pockets in an instant.

Day 3 First time in Paris Diary Part 5- Pont Alexandre III. Pont Alexandre III is the most beautiful of Paris' numerous bridges. Built as a symbol of friendship between France and Russia, you will notice that the 4 posts with the gold monuments depict war and peace. This can be reached by walking from Invalides ( Napoleon’s tomb) or from Champ Elysees. The bridge should be one of your Paris picture op background aside from Eiffel and the Louvre pyramid. The good part about it is that there is no entrance fee and there is no queue. It is also open 24/7.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. The bridge is magnificent and offers one of the best views towards the Eiffel Tower, the Arms museum (Invalides) and the big and small palaces on the north side of the Seine.It is also a good experience to pass under the bridge on a boat.

You must stroll across. Crossed the bridge in the midst of steady rain. In spite of this was impressed by its beauty and the remarkable detail the builders put into it. The guided statues add a very stunning element to the experience. The views of the many surrounding buildings as well as the river traffic are impressive. Have to see it if you want to claim you really saw Paris ...

Wonderful place. One of the most beautiful places in Paris. A must see during day and night... DO NOT miss the night view from Rive Droit to RIve Gauche while crossing the bridge with Hotel des Invalides at the end of the road...unforgettable...
Picturesque. Just one of the many beautiful bridges in Paris, great spot for photos too ! Don't miss all the little open-air bookstalls nearby!

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Constraction was unique 100 years ago, it was know-how!Now its beautiful, comfort for viewing, walking, riding and photo. the friendship and cultural union of France and Russia are demonstrating by the bridge.
Stunning. It's great during the day or night. There is a lot of history linked to the bridge that is worth discovering.
Stunning Bridge. One of the must does in Paris. Surrounded by stunning architecture and over the Seine. What a great area to walk around.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. There are many bridges on the Seine river, but this was for us the most beautiful among them. Ornamented with the beautiful sculptures and figures, it takes you either to Les Invalides or Champs Elysees on the either side....tough choice, because both sides are beautiful and the view from this bridge, which is a piece of art for itself, is amazing. Definitely a must when in Paris!
VERY ROMANTIC!. The most beautifull brigde in Paris connecting great monumental places in Paris. It was a rainy day when we visited this place, however we enjoyed the place.

beautiful bridge. Well worth a visit with its great architectural design and decorations, after visiting you are left in awe of the spectacular craftsmanship that has went into it and well situated beside the grand and petit palais on one side of the river . And best of all its free with a nice walk down the siene to see it
A wonderful bridge.. On the north side one has the fantastic structures of the Grand and Petit Palais and to the south the glory of Les Invalides. Below you is the Seine - spectacular!
superb. I couldn't get enough of the bridge. I saw it from the Seine, walked over it , under it and even around it. This is one of the most magnificent works of art in Paris!

One of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. It's a beautiful bridge with beautiful architectural details, statues and lamp posts. It's one of the most elaborate bridge. It's a very nice walk along the Seine River. From the River Cruise, we could appreciate the craftsmanship and ornamentation of the bridge. It's more spectacular to view from the river.
Nice walk.... Really enjoyed walking there.....and the scenery was perfect.... You can see the Eiffel Tower and River Seine. It's a must in Paris.
Such a romantique and nice bridge. I think everybody has seen this bridge in may movies: it is really beautiful, romantique and nicely made!
Beautiful Bridge. 1st Class photographic opportunity. The quality of the Gilt work and stonework is absolutely fantastic
Beautiful. It's a beautiful bridge in which is worth stopping for a picture and it's close to Musée d'Orsay and the galeries if you want to shop.

Nice to look at but not a place to hang out for long. Beautiful bridge, no doubt, connecting beautiful buildings on one side of the river to equally beautiful buildings on the other. But ultimately it's just a bridge. There is no shade or shelter from rain and there aren't even places to eat nearby. Unlike the rest of Paris, where you can't swing a cat without hitting some kind of restaurant or food cart, the Pont Alexandre bridge area is a "food desert." We learned this the hard way when we emerged from the super excellent "Paris 1900" exhibit at the Petit Palais needing lunch. We crossed the bridge imagining that of course there would be some charming bistro just on the other side. There wasn't. We had to walk at least 20 minutes to find someplace to eat. It did not help matters that it was 3pm, so the few places we did find were closed between lunch and dinner. Anyway, the bridge is great but it's JUST A BRIDGE. Look at it, cross it, but don't see it as an "attraction."

Bridge of Sighs. A beautiful bridge whether you stroll over it or go under it, either on a cruise or on foot. It makes a great photograph in itself, with a fine backdrop and an excellent viewpoint for the River Seine, the surrounding buildings and the Eiffel Tower. You can't miss it!
