Gorgeous bridge. This bridge was crossed by us at least 3 times during our trip.. It has a nifty design that really helps it stand out from other bridges... We just happened to be crossing it when I found a plaque with its name and a little story about it..
Beautiful Bridge. Walked across after our tour of the Eiffel Tower. Beautiful bridge...possibly one of the most beautiful in the world.

Very beautiful . Not a normal Bridge! Causes an impression especially because of its golden parts! Very beautiful! In my case I wasn't looking for this Bridge, just came across it and found it very beautiful
To take nice photos. A beautiful bridge with golden sculptures where you can make great shots from Paris. It's one of those must-see places.
beautiful bridge of Paris. The most beautiful bridge of Paris. beautiful lights, wonderfully decorated ... Particularly worth seeing in the dark!

Beauty and the bridge. Pont Alexandre III is an arch bridge across the River Seine. It connects the Champs Elysees quarter, Invalides and Eiffel Tower quarter. The bridge is an extravagant display of Art Nouveau lamps, cherubs, nymphs and winged horses at either end.It was was built between 1896 and 1900 and named after after Tsar Alexander III of Russia. It is classified as a historical monument and its certainly unmissable because of its beauty and certainly worth a snap or two.
Opulent Bridge. We admired this Opulent bridge, Pont Alexandre III near La Invalides with its ornaments, sculptures with cherubs and nymphs, gorgeous lampposts.
What a beautiful bridge.. We heard about the bridges around Paris and this one didn't disappoint, It is absolutely beautiful. And we have the great looking Invalides across the this bridge.
Beautiful. Awesome view, check out the market along the river below the bridge. Keep your hands in your pockets because there are a ton of gypsies nearby.

Beautiful bridge for wedding photos. This is a great bridge to do wedding photos , not very crowded and quite spacious. The bridge itself is beautiful with its lovely architecture, preserved in all it's glory. We had our wedding photos taken here by our photographer Pierre. Who says Parisienne's are snobs, everyone hoots and shouts out greetings and wishes, people stop and wish you.
Awesome bridge. This bridge is the most beautiful bridge I have scene. The lights and sculptures are amazing and for a free attraction it is a must see.
Now, that's a bridge!. Went to park outside royal palace for picnic and were unexpectedly confronted with this gorgeous bridge. Husband said "now, that's a bridge!". Indeed.
beautiful eccentric architecture. peaceful beautiful and tranquil a place where you can loose yourself stunning views can be a lil windy so dress appropriately

This bridge is over the top, but is lovely in Paris. Great bridge in all of its majestic splendor. It fits in Paris while it would be too much anywhere else. You know Paris is over the top. It doesn't get any better than this.
Lovely. Some may consider Pont Alexandre III as simply a bridge, but I felt that it is more than that - it is about as artistic

Charming bridge. Takes you back in time, so beautiful and stylish :) Its worth the walk, I loved it so much :) However, there is no place to sit and enjoy the history as the road there is very busy....

Loved the gilt statues. The gilt statues on the pillars on the bridge shone in the sunshine. It is a really decorative bridge and worth viewing from the river as well, as there are motifs that can be viewed from the boat on the bridge.
Bridge. Amazing views of and from the bridge, you can look everywhere and it's beautiful. You won't regret coming here.

Wonderful bridge over the Seine. This bridge is a must see when you are in Paris. It pays tribute to the architecture of Paris on the whole and contributes to its beauty. How romantic to walk and take pictures on this bridge. From there you can walk to Les Invalides.

A Must While in Paris. This is the most beautiful and ornate bridge in Paris.Adorned by huge art nouveau lamps and 4 pillars with golden statues on them in each corner.We had a photo shoot on this bridge by Hermione McCosh from Better Travel Photos.It was the best investment on this trip.Models and wedding couples are often seen here too ! This bridge was built by Tsar Alexandre from 1897-1900.While you walk,the golden dome of the Les Invalides can be seen in the foreground and the Eiffel Tower in the distance.When you think of Paris - you think of the Pont Alexandre.Splurge and book a photoshoot on the bridge.It is money well spent.
luxurious. luxurious bridge with a view of the hause of Invalides on one side, and Palais on ather side of bridge.
Great view. Fabulous architecture, stunning views. A must see for any trip to Paris. You will recognise this from many films. Lovely during early evening.
Worth the walk. Be sure to take a stroll by the water to get great shots of the bridge. (There will be many runners!)

Try to visit at sunset - the views towards the tower are amazing. You must walk across this bridge during your visit to Paris. It is the most beautiful and ornate of them all. Try to time your visit to sunset/ early evening - the views along the Seine and towards the Eiffel Tower are breathtakingly wonderful.

Spectacular. When i walk around Paris I find myself constantly saying Wow. This is my fourth visit and many of the attractions still amaze. The Pont Alexander is one such attraction. The pillars and the gold figures atop are amazing works of art. Don't miss it.

Gorgeous bridge!. This is definitely worth walking across two or three times throughout your stay in Paris. Beautiful golden sculptures on top of the towers, with old-school Parisian lamps, and a lovely view of the Seine and the rest of Paris. My boyfriend and I stood on here one night, watching the waters undulate and the Eiffel tower sparkle in the night sky. Very romantic to walk across with a partner, but also very atmospheric and meditative for a lone stroll.
Stunning Bridge!. We rode our bikes to that bridge and it was a spectacular view! We took Fat Tire bike tours and our guide explained all the details and history of the Paris sites we visited!
Ice cream with a view!. Ice cream seller at the north end of the bridge was so sweet...then we walked across this amazing bridge with views of the surrounding area...definitely worth the walk!

Nice bridge, but there are better. Its a nice bridge, worth a walk over, which only takes a few minutes, get some photos and be off. There are better bridges in the world, although this is one of the most ornate over the Seine.

Impressive. This bridge is just amazing...the statues at either end are definite holiday snap material! It's free and beautiful. You won't spend more than 15 mins looking. crossing and enjoying but your memories of this bridge will stay with you forever.

Still wonderful!. What a wonderful bridge! It was my second time going to Paris and it was still as beautiful as the first time I saw it. As other reviews have noted seeing it from a boat cruise is a must as well. Make sure you take plenty of pictures!
fabulous. gorgeous bridge, great sight to see. you can see the four golden plinths from all other high up locations.

Beautiful bridge. This is obviously one of the best bridges in Paris. It's centrally located and you can see up and down the Seine from it. Take great pictures in all directions, and you can even walk on the quai underneath it or see it from a riverboat tour. We took pictures of the fireworks from it on La Fête Nationale (14 July - a.k.a. Bastille Day).

Now that is a beautiful bridge!. Title is the running joke with my girlfriend. After walking around all over the city, museums, etc. I made her make one last stop before dinner, to come here for a photo op. She admits it was well worth it. It had just cleared up after raining, so we got some cool pictures with light shining through the clouds...Walk down to the river to look back up on either side for views of the bridge. Well worth at least 30 minutes to just admire the bridge.
nice bridge. It is a nice bridge, good views of other bridges around it, nice photo opportunities. In the evenings, it is a nice place to walk around too.

beautiful bridge. Beautiful bridge, worth a walk over it to admire the beautiful gold statues , and beautiful river views in either direction. Don't forget to admire the sides of the bridge as you approach(or take a river cruise).
Great picture opportunity. This bridge is beautiful and the BatoBus Boat stops here. Worth getting off and taking the time to capture a few pictures. Place de la Concorde nearby as is the Palis Royal

Beautiful Bridge. There are nothing not to like from this bridge. The fancy sculpture with golden touch put other nearby bridges to shame. Some small graffiti can be found along the bridge by the way.
Perfect for photos. Awesome view of the Eiffel tower at night, beautiful bridge ever! Very romatic scenery for walking at night.
Golden statues. Refurbished brdge, with 4 magnificient golden statues. It is a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides Monument. Rodin Museum is located next to Invalides.
Beautiful bridge, nice area. This bridge was near our hotel and was great to see on our walks, watch out for pickpockets in the park near the river.

over the Seine. excellent spot with a great view over the Seine and at the Tour Eiffel
a great Pont
not to be missed

Most decorated bridge in Paris. Take a stroll on the Pont Alexandre III, built in 1910, situated between the Cour la Reine and the Palais des Invalides. But do stop to marvel at the multiple sculptures on top and the sidesof the bridge. The best vies though is from one of the "bateaux mooches" that sail up and down the River Seine.

Gilded extravagance. A really showy off bridge you expect it to be dedicated to one of the more extravagant monarchs. The are lovely views from it over the buildings to the south of the Eiffel tower and there are quiet walks along the river on either side of the bridge. While we were there, the northside (Rive Droit) was being used as a park-up area for the horseboxes that had overflowed from the horseshow at the Grand Palais. Quite a sight! And its all free.
Best bridge. Most royal looking and romantic bridge in Paris! A must see!!! Incredible view not only during the day but at night as well!
wow. Breathtaking bridge with beautiful gold statues.. Not as beautiful as Carl's bridge in Prague but not far from that ..

Surprisingly relaxing! . A busy place to be at but surprisingly relaxing. The French surely are artistic in everything they build. Intricately designed bridges, statues, the detail is awe inspiring. Bravo!
Great Bridge. What's not so great, is the traffic flowing over the bridge, but have to think about this yes in a big city like Paris do not get upset. That should be a Paris traveler also clear.

Beautifully ornate. This is the most ornate bridge over the Seine and well worth a walk over to get the classic picture of the Eiffel tower . The expansive view towards l'hopital des invalides is amazing.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. I adore this bridge. The quality of the craft of it just has you standing in awe looking at it. It is best viewed I feel at night on a cruise ship down the seine.
Beautiful. Great place to take photos and to walk over the river! There is also a lot of history - we used our travel book to read about it!
nice to see. If you book a boat trip, you will notice this bridge for sure :-) in a good way. One of Paris' nicest bridges

Important landmark and most elegant bridge in Paris. A great piece of art, that’s all I can comment. As a bridge, it is elegant, majestic...The structure, the design, the gilded goddesses, the bronze sculptures, the copper statues, the Art Nouveau lamps, the horses with wings...the location, the view, all are marvelous..Extravagant yet excellent engineering...This exceptional bridge was built for the World Exhibition in 1900.A MUST SEE when you visit Paris.

Amazing Architecture! Most beautiful bridge in Paris. LOVED this area, loved this bridge. On a sunny, gorgeous winter day we walked across this beautiful bridge. You can't help but stop and take a few photos here. Close to so many museums and many other architectural masterpieces.
Gorgeous !. What a beautiful bridge and brilliant surroundings. The Alexander Bridge is located over the Seine River and is a must see in Paris!
Great point to take nice view picts. Very close to eiffel tower and champs elyees. Historical bridge, nice view over the river. You gotta visit once at least to take nice view picts.
Beautiful and rich. a richly-decorated with gold, monuments and lamps, the bridge was given as a present from the Russian Empire to Paris.
beautiful!. the most gorgeous bridge and statues, worth taking a look!good photo op.you can see the eiffel tower from here...

Best looking bridge in the world to me. Never will I forget how beautiful this bridge was on this unbelievably warm March Sunday. The perspective you can have on the rest of Paris are mind blowing and the History that comes with bridge makes it the most special bridge I have ever been on. My girlfriend and I will most definitely cross it again and again to go from Le Grand Palais to Les Invalides.

Fantastic bridge.. We had a great view of this bridge from a river cruise we did. It was beautifully decorated and very well preserved. You can view it from the roadway but you also get a better view from the river. It is worth doing it both ways. A good photo opportunity with nice background of Paris.

The most beautiful bridge at any time of the day.. A friend recommended visiting and we're so glad she did! My husband and I had some of our wedding photos taken on the bridge and also revisited it twice during our honeymoon. There are so many fantastic photography opportunities there - we came back with some amazing frame-worthy images.Our second visit was when the street lamps were just turning on, which provided a romantic atmosphere as well as lovely photos. Just be cautious of getting too close to them - there's lots of spiders hanging out in the lamps!Can't say enough good things about this location. We will definitely return on our next visit!
Stunning. One of the most amazing bridges I have seen up there with tower bridge-London, Brooklyn bridge-New York and golden gate-San Francisco. Also great views if the Eiffel Tower too.
beautiful bridge in a beautiful city. lovely views of both side of the seine from this bridge and no matter whatever the weather an amazing sight x

The most beautiful bridge of them all. This is an absolutely stunning bridge whether seen from on the bridge or from the river - where you can get some stunning pictures with the Eiffel Tower in the background.
monumental. the most important and beautiful among all bridges of Paris. You won't miss it from place de la concorde to Eifel tower walking along the Senne river.

Beautiful Bridge. This is my favorite bridge to visit in Paris, which sounds like a strange thing to say. Visit it on a sunny day to admire the gold & gilt, sculptures and details on the glass globes on the lamps. A night visit will set up a nice romantic spot.
Gold!!!. An amazing piece of architecture with gold covered statues abound. Rode across the bridge on our horse & carriage ride and the statues throughout are beautiful!

Beautiful and ornate, great for a photo shoot. We had planned to visit this bridge but ran out if time. Then stumbled across it by accident. And very pleased that we did. Lots of gold and statues. A fun place to take photos and also to watch models, wedding parties etc etc having their photos taken too.

Quick Stop and Great View for Photos of the Eiffel. Stopped by here en route to the Grand Palais. The bridge itself is beautiful and worth the stop. At sunset it offers lovely picture opportunities for cityscapes, the seine, and the Eiffel Tower in the background.
Don't make a special trip but nice to see. This is a beautiful bridge and has a very Parisian vibe. Worth taking five to ten minutes to view it as you'll inevitably be nearby at some point!

Picturesque, lovely spot for photos. I love this bridge! It is so ornate. Three different times, we saw models on photo shoots and twice we saw wedding parties. It is a great spot to get lovely pictures of Paris on the River.

It is a beautiful bridge, take a picture, keep moving.. Take a picture, keep moving to other museums. It is a beautiful and historical bridge. As one walks around Paris, one will eventually pass this bridge. So, do not make special plans just to come to the bridge.
Recommended five to ten minutes for this attraction.

simply great!. We have been walking around the Seine river many many times over, it is most beautiful river I have ever seen. Specially the bridges, all kinds of bridges with different shapes, I enjoyed them so much.
Amazing view. Excellent view, seen from atop our shuttle bus, magnificent details and breathtaking sculptures. A must see when in the area

Bridge over troubled waters. Without doubt, it is the most majestically ornate bridge in the whole of France. It was built towards the end of the 19th Cent. to mark the entente between France and Russia (initiated by Czar Alexander lll) that forced the entry of both France and Britain into WWl, and was completed in time for the Great Exhibition of 1900. Connecting the Grand and Petit Palais on the Right Bank with Les Invalides on the left, it boasts 4 large pillars crowned by gilt sculpture symbolizing the Fame of the Sciences, Arts, Industry and Commerce. At their bases are impressive stone sculptures depicting 4 Ages of French History: Renaissance, Contemporary, Charlemagne and Louis XlV. Symbolizing the entente, part of the coat of arms of Paris with two nymphs representing the Seine face the Eiffel Tower from the central span, while on the other side, the Russian coat of arms bears two nymphs representing the River Neva. As a quid pro quo, a similar bridge to mark the entente was constructed in St Petersburg (Trinity Bridge) by no less an architect than the great Gustave Eiffel himself.

A pretty bridge. It's a bridge at the end of the day. Much prettier and more intricately designed than your average bridge. But still just a bridge. It serves it's purpose of getting you from one side of the river, to the other.I wouldn't call it an "attraction", and I wouldn't go out of my way to see it. But if you're in the area, it's worth a very quick look.

Beautiful Bridge. We were using this bridge whenever we were walking to see the Eiffle Tower. Amazing details on the bridge, each statue is different. You can take very nice pictures from the bridge. Very elegant, parisian bridge.

Elegant. Easily the most elegant bridge in Paris. It is an arch bridge connecting the Champs-Elysees quarter and the Invalides and Eiffel Tower quarter. It is built in the Art Nouveau tradition with gold guilding and cherubs, nymphs and winged horses at either end. It's style reflects that of the Grand Palais to which it leads on the right bank. My personal favorite.
Not that impressive. A bit over the top really. It is a nice part of the city, very classy and posh, but the bridge is a bit of a disappointment. Very close to a lot of historical sites though.

A very personal bridge over the Seine. This is a beautiful bridge with it's large, gold decorative figures. My wife and I both fell in love with it on our earliest Paris visits. I was moved to sprinkle some of her ashes into the Seine here after she passed on. A beloved and very personal place fro me in Paris.
Great view. Bridge is interesting, but the view is enjoyable. It is nice to walk and have a moment under the sun.

The Bridge Of Golden Statues. Handy for the Eiffel Tower ,on the way to the Louvre Art Gallery and a way to cross the Banks of the Seine River - the Pont Alexander is decorated with impressive Golden Torches and Angelic statuary. Romantic when viewed illuminated at night it provides a perfect rendevous for romantic visitors.
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. Hard to say does it looks nicer from below while cruising the Seine, or by walking over it from Champs Elysse to the Invalides.
A Good viewing place. The bridge it's self is interesting looking, but it is only a bridge. However, you can get sound great views of the Effiel Tower and the River that it crosses

Truly striking. If you are travelling between the typical tourist attractions, you will see this bridge whether or not you seek it out. It’s striking and, at least for us, every time we caught a glimpse of it, there was a pause and some photos. Even in low light, the gilding is noticeable and beautifully done. Boat tours along the Seine will also pass under this bridge.

Beautiful detail. The most ornate bridge in Paris! The detail in this bridge is impressive, the gold-plated statues, the lamps, the plaque. We viewed the bridge from the bridge itself, but it's also great to view it from a boat on the river as this provides a close front-on view.
It was hard to belive I was really there!. I was happily surprised to discover a beautiful bridge/ piece of art in nearly pristine condition. absolutely beautiful~
Romantic. The most beautifull brigde in Paris connecting great monumental places in Paris. It was a rainy day when we visited this place, however we enjoyed the place.
Wonderful. This is one of the most beautiful bridges I've ever seen. It has so many details in gold and many little scultures, I could feel like I were in 1800. Its very romantic. Its a must see.

Amazing. This bridge sums the city of Paris up for us - beautiful, elegant, oozing with style and romantic! It linked our hotel/Eiffel tower side with the rest of Paris so we used it everyday and everyday we stopped to look at the views and take pictures!
so beautiful. At daytime and at night - it's beautiful. Don't forget your camera !! While walking through Paris, it's a focal point to be - near everything you want to see
Romantic. Romantic as nearly any bridge in Paris. Grandeur. Beauty. Great views. Great location too. Mat beautiful in early summer.

Cross in Seine in style. Remember seeing this bridge on a school trip when I was 8 years old. Our ill informed guide told us the statues were made from solid gold....they're not, they're brass painted gold. Nevertheless you have to admire the decor of this splendid bridge. well worth a visit.

One of the many beautiful bridges of Paris. Paris is no doubt a city of bridges. Each is unique and this one is no different. It is probably the most decorated one, with gold plated statues and details. You can get some great photos there!
Excellent. The Pont Alexandre is by far one of the most spectacular sights of I have ever seen and by far the most impressive bridge on the Seine River in Paris. We got some lovely photos.
great bridge, great views, what else can you say. what els can you say about a historic bride in Paris? You absolutely should see it if you are in Paris.
Lovely . Very preety bridge, but from architectural stand point, common ! Loved the lions and the gold all over tough

Nice place, but lots of picpockets. Many of Paris most famous places, such as Tour Eiffel, Champs-Élysées and Pont Alexandre III are full of pickpockets. Three different people tried to scam me and my family with the famous "gold ring scam". Pont Alexandre III is a beautiful place to stare at the city, but beware and don't talk to strangers.

Breathtakingly stunning, a definite must see..... The Pont Alexandre is by far one of the most spectacular sights of architecture and history I have ever seen and by far the most beautiful bridge on the Seine River in Paris. As a rule I'm not a bridge enthusiast - but this takes the cake. There are so many photo opportunities here, it will take your breath away.......
Stunning. By far, I think, the most beautiful bridge on the Seine in Paris. A lovely outdoor antique market usually lines the embankment nearby.

Breathtaking!!!. This bridge is so grand, that we actually had a few of our wedding pictures taken here! So much to see and take in. The opulence and character is beyond any I've seen before. To stand on and photograph history in addition to it's beauty is really something. It's completely different at day and night so treat yourself to both!

If you're going to cross a bridge in Paris.... This is one of the most beautiful bridges in Paris. Crossing the bridge to the north, the Grand Palais will be to your left and the Petit Palais to your right. Both are also magnificent pieces of architecture. The gold leafed scultptures standing on the 4 tall pedestals flanking the bridge will assure you that you are really in Paris. Just look South and to the right while on the bridge and any doubt of your presence there will be erased by a postcard perfect view of the Tour Eiffel. You'll notice some locks hanging from the bridge sculptures...better to add one to the bridge where you'll be able to see thousands of them sparkling in the sun...leave this bridge to the lovers of architecture....

simply beautiful. A magnificent bridge surrounded by Paris landmarks. We saw in the New Year (along with thousands of others) standing on the bridge watching the Eiffel Tower light up and twinkle at midnight. A must do for photos.

Impressive Designed Bridge. At the end of the Champs-Elysees and very close to the Grand Palace and Military Museum (in fact in between these two places) you will find the bridge Pont Alexandre III. By metro this can be reached using the yellow line 7, either station Champs Elysees Clemenceau or Concorde and a short walk. Not being a bridge enthusiast I would not perhaps normally recommend visiting a bridge (although a few around the world do come to mind) but I would this one, particularly for couples or those taking the trek from the Arc de Triomphe all the way down to the Bastille. If taking this trek you will walk by anyway and it is well worth a quick visit and photo. It is beautifully made and home to tall columns with statues and sculptures around. It is also gives you a good view down the river and the Eiffel Tower in the background. For couples and those on romantic walks through Paris, then the views make this a welcome spot but also a must to be able to kiss underneath the bridge, blessing you with luck for a lifetime!Not a tremendous amount to see here but a lot in the area, so if you are here have a quick look and enjoy the lovely design of the bridge and its photo opportunities.
A Royal Crossing. When you see this bridge you can do nothing but pause, look, and then take your camera out and snap away.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. Pont Alexandre III is the perfect place for a memento photo, the bridge is very ornate and beautiful, you can see the Eiffel Tower and the Sein River. It makes for a beautiful picture composition.
Beautiful. Brilliant view across to the Hotel des Invalides and down the Seine and a stunning bridge, great place for a good photo opportunity

See the muddy Sein River from here!. I recommend you approach this elaborate bridge from Invalides and walk along the Esplande des Invalides, then cross the bridge. To get a good photo of the gilded statues across the front, you will need to take a river boat. You can still marvel at the Nymph and Cherub sculptures along the top. Watch out for the pick-pocketers here. On my visist, they appeared to be teenagers asking you to sign a petition for orphans, but don't get distracted - watch your belongings!

personaly, the best bridge in Paris <3. I love this Bridge, old fashion and a lot of gold, nice stylized, when we cross this bridge, we dream to be a Princess.. I love this bridge, really, when I'm in Paris, even it is not my way, I organise my way in order to cross this so nice bridge !

Beautiful Bridge. Perfect place for photo op. The bridge is gorgeous with its gilt statues and the views up and down the river are terrific. The Eiffel Tower can be photographed beautifully from here.
Nice. Really nice bridge with great view of the river banks! It also tends to be crowded but still worth a visit!
Lovely. The bridge was lovely and full of lovers :) Everyone use this traditional locks at the bridge for endless love.
historic view. How can you not want to walk this bridge when you are in Paris?! Amazing statues and architecture with beautiful views.
Must visit photo opportunity.... The view from the bridge takes in so many of Paris' monuments and sights, you can do a selfie with almost any icon in Paris in the background.

Walk. We made a walk from our hotel to the eiffel tower.
It's a walk for over a few hours, but it's nice one.
This brigde is beautiful
A must see. Beautiful Bridge with ornate lights and sculptures, café just under the bridge as well for a coffee to watch the world go by
Gorgeous. The nicest bridge in Paris. But, it is, after all, only a bridge. Nothing to visit, and nothing to see other than the bridge, lamp posts and statues themselves.
Great angle for the Eiffel Tower!. Take a picture of both the bridge and the Eiffel Tower! Simply beautiful and a different angle of the tower!

The most beautiful bridge crossing the Seine. Pont Alexandre III is a declared monument in Paris that is probably the nicest bridge on the Seine and is well worth experiencing during trips to Paris. It was constructed between 1896 to 1900 and finished just in time for the Universal Exhibition held in Paris that same year. The bridge is named after Czar Alexandre III and is a testimony to the Art Nouveau style which was very much in favour during the late 19th and early 20th centuries. It features lovely lamps, nymphs, cherubs as well as winged horses found at both ends of the bridge. Pont Alexandre III is a beautifully decorated bridge. Overall, It is a very nice bridge and something most will enjoy seeing when in Paris. While there are quite a few bridges linking the Left and Right Banks, this is the one that most memorable. As such, it is recommendable to experience Pont Alexandre III when in Paris.
Beautiful. We walked from the Eiffel Tower along Avenue du New York and this was a highlight. It had such beautiful lamps all along the bridge and the gold statues were amazing.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris.... with great vistas on the Seine and sight line to the Eiffel Tower. It is very east to work into a day of sightseeing and an essential stop for any "Midnight in Paris" themed tour.

Great View of the Eiffel tower. this is one of the most beautiful bridges of Paris, which allows a beautiful view on the Eiffel tower.at night, when the lights are on, it is truly magical.best part, the restaurant Mini Palais is right next to it !

Beautiful spot to feel Paris. I would recommend seeing the bridge during the day and the evening. The daytime allows for the pure enjoyment of seeing all the little extras while night allows for spectacular views in all directions. This is all Paris all the time.

Built to Celebrate a France/Russia Treaty. I've seen this bridge lit up at nighttime and early morning when the sun began to light the golden statutes and ironwork lamps. Take your time walking over, stop and admire it from all angles. Look back toward the esplanade leading to the Les Invalides then turn and look toward the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais. Admire the river boats and people strolling along the river. It's truly a magnificent bridge.

Great place from which to take photos.. You can see a lot of the more important monuments of Paris from this bridge, and it is worth visiting at any time of the day or night. It is best experienced by walking across it and around (even under) or cruising under it....it is architecturally significant and a leading representative of the style of its era. Don't be in a rush, take some time to stop and admire the views and watch the river boat traffic, the other pedestrians, the passing vehicular traffic.....this is Paris at its best.

Spectacular bridge to Napoleon's Tomb. On a sunny day, this bridge is a beautiful stroll across the Seine. The sculptures, gold trimmed shine brilliantly in the sun, the Eiffel Tower is visible as well as La Grand Roue, huge Ferris wheel located in the Place de la Concorde. The Grand Palais and Petit Palais are on the north side of the river and Dome des Invalides is on the south. A whole day can be easily spent going to these three sites.
Very beautiful with a great view. Enjoyed crossing the bridge very much. Great view all around , not crowded, a really impressive stop on our journey
Very well located and pretty statues. Very good views over the town. a monument not to miss. Near to the Grand Palais, also a good building to see.

Incredible Work of Art..for a Bridge.. In order to fully enjoy this bridge I suggest to not only walk and cross it, but also go underneath it.It is an impressive work of art, sculptures, statues everywhere, ecclectic streetlamps give it a romantic feel when you wlak on the bridge on a sunset. Each Column has a winged pegasus on the top which make it much more impressive.Paris is full of bridges, and this is not the oldest one (like Pont Neuf), but indeed is the prettiest one in my opinion!
most beautiful bridge in paris (world?). the location beetwen the grand palais and invalides, plus the architecture and gold decoration make it amazing

Absolutley beautiful at night. This really is the most beautiful bridge I have ever seen, especially at night.All the lamps along it are lit, the stone statues are lit...just gorgeous! Definatly worth seeing, you'll get some stunning pictures from the side of the bridge. Get the Grand Palais in your picture at night when it's bright red and you'll have a cracker!

Such a beautiful bridge. Was so beautiful and worth seeing, I did wonder what all the fuss was before we went but wow. We were on a hop on hop off boat which provide a good view from the river itself.

Take a walk across the river. All of the bridges along the Seine are worth seeing. This one is the most ornate. Since it connects cultural attractions on both sides of the River, you can just plan on using it as part of your route as you walk around in Paris. The bridge itself is beautiful. So are the views off of it.

It is Just WoooooW...!. Simply the Best bridge over the River Seine. Looks beautiful when seen from a cruise on Seine. Also must see Pont Neuf bridge. Equally beautiful.... Paris... you will fall in Love... I promise :-)
fantastic view, both day and night. make sure you include a walk across the bridge...the views are spectacular. beware of con artists dropping jewelry near you, and asking if you dropped something.

My favorite bridge in Paris. This bridge is worthy of seeing both during the daytime and nighttime, when it is lit up. It is a beautiful bridge with wonderful sculptures of cherubs and the like. Worthy of a walk across and an up close view.
Gorgeous!. The most beautiful bridge in paris and even perhaps the world. It is just stunning. Stand on the bridge and look towards les Invalides, or the other way around. Priceless experience.

Inspiring. It's a magnificent bridge specially by night. It's grandeur stirs an inquistive incline. The hidden charm is irresistible, was conceiviing with our son that time and we gave him the name of Alexandre, i went twice, third and the 4th time this year, the history of this bridge still carries a strong impact. A not to miss visit!

Beautiful , ornate and well maintained . You can't miss this attraction as , in the course of the day , you cross it innumerable times while sightseeing and are awestruck each time . One of the most beautiful bridges

Pont Alexander III. This bridge is the most beautiful bridge in the world. You get a good view from there at night to the Eiffel Tower too. it's the bridge which brings you to the Grand Palais and not too far from Champs Elysees and the Invalides.

Our favourite Paris bridge. A beautiful ornate romantic bridge. It is our favourite and the grand buildings on either side of the seine add to the true Parisienne charm. You get a good view from there at night to the Eiffel Tower too.
Beautiful. This bridge is the most beautiful bridge that I have ever seen. Make sure that you give it a visit. Great view around and the photographs look great, especially at night.
amazing. it's the most beautiful and mazing bridge in Paris with it's glod sculptures. it's the bridge which brings you to the Grand Palais and not too far from Champs Elysees. a must see !!
The most ornate bridge in Paris. Recently restored, with excellent views of the Eiffel Tower at night (which makes the bridge popular with photographers).
Beautiful Bridge. This is a beautiful bridge and great for photographers. We were staying in the 7th so we walked over this bridge every day and admired it again every day.

Still Gorgeous after 140 years!. This beautiful bridge has been recently cleaned and is so marvelously photogenic. I love to stroll across from the Grand (or Petit) Palais. Every time I see it (I live in Paris), I am still so thrilled

Magnificent. It was the most beautiful bridge and a photographers delight.
I think it is one of the most beautiful bridges in the world.

Magnificent. When in Paris, do not miss walking over the Pont D'Alexandre. It is so beautiful, romantic, just everything you want Paris to be. Of course if you can see it at night when it is all lit up, that's another wonderful experience.
Beautiful ornated bridge. Beautiful status on both sides of bridge. Stop by in a beautiful day and take a good shot of the bridge. U can do that when u visit tour eiffle. Nice photo ops.

Very Beautiful. If you are in Paris, you must to see this bridge. Is very beautiful and with a lot of details.
Is a very nice view with a high level of perfection.
Walk about 10min after this bridge you can find the "Les Invalides".
Beautiful. My favourite bridge in Paris. I regret not making a night stroll around the area. A brief glimpse on a night cruise is not enough to really appreciate its beauty.
Romantic. Our favourite bridge over the Seine in Paris. Really nice at night when it is all lit up. Worth a visit.

A True Work of Art. This Paris bridge over the Seine is an art-deco masterpiece. Take some time to stop and view the detail of the artwork on this elegant river crossing. it is well maintained and adds to the ambience of your parisian experience.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Crossing the river Seine on Alexandre III bridge between Invalides (military hospital, war museum and Napoleon's gravestone) and the 2 great museums that are Grand Palais and Petit Palais is a must during any visit of Paris.

For sure the most beautiful bridge in Paris.. Near the Champs Elysees ,to the left side it is the Alexander iii bridge,perfect to pictures,on front you have the Eifell tower and Sena river,Mandatory to go!!!
Pretty scenic view. Passed the bridge when I was strolling around Paris. Well, nothing really special but this is one of the icon of Paris. So just make sure you check it out. =)

The most beautiful bridge!. Great views from bridge with Les Invalides at one end and the Grand Palace at the other. The bridge was divided into a pedestrian side and a traffic side so it was great to walk across and snap pictures too.

Great for a stroll across the Seine. After visiting the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides, on your way to Champs-Élysées, you will get the joy of crossing the Pont Alexandre III. It's like something out of a cool old Bram Stoker movie, with its lavish lamp posts and statues. Interesting note: The first stone of the bridge was laid by the Russian Tsar Nicolas II. A symbol of friendship between the two countries, the bridge was named after the Tsar's father, Tsar Alexander III. It is so beautiful - impossible to take a bad photo of the bridge (or anywhere in Paris, or France, for that matter.)

Magnificent bridge. Crossing this incredibky beautiful bridge is an experiencein and of itself. If you are on the left bank you will see Les Invalides and its splendid dome. You will cross over to the right bank to see the incredible glass domed Grand Palais and the superb museum that is the Petit Palais. Further on are Les Champs Élysées. What could be better?

If you walk past, stop and check it out. This is a beautiful bridge, covered in real gold leaf (paid for by tourist taxes, said our guide). It is lovely and you should go a little out of your way to see it, though I wouldn't plan a trip just to see a bridge.

Stunning!. I don't believe there is a prettier bridge in the entire world! The golden decorations, the carved sides, the statues... and, of course, the Seine underneath. Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous! ♥

Stunning bridge. The Alexander III is for sure the most beautiful bridge in Paris, and maybe also the most romantic... The decorations are really impressive, it is ideal as a stop during a long walk for Paris.Don't miss it!
Very nice and beautiful bridge.. The bridge doesn't has much to observe, but you should take a couple of minutes to just pass through it and watch also what it surrounds.
Wonderful bridge. This is probably the best bridge in Paris (there are many good ones). It's a very beautiful bridge and really compliments its surroundings.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Very ornate and symbolic. Be sure to read a guide book to understand the significance of each of the 4 monuments.

Superbe. A magnificent bridge, a piece of art. Do not rush. Examine the detail and the harmony of this gorgeous construction. What an imperial way to visit Grand and Petit Palais. Perfect in every aspect.
Happy Accident. We happened by this lovely bridge while trying to find the Metro station. Just lovely, we took dozens of pictures.
unique pont. Beautiful bridge in a great area and very different from another pont in paris and near from musee d'orsay you can go to there by walk

The most popular bridge on the river Seine. It's popular because of it's beauty. I enjoyed the view from the river cruise, but it's also just as beautiful when walking or driving across it. The gilded statues of the fames are eye-catching when looking up at them against the blue sky. They are just as beautiful at night with the bright lights shining on them, as well as the beautiful Art Nouveau street lamps that line it on both sides. The bridge is near the Grand Palais and the Quadriga statue (both on the right bank). It's pretty difficult to miss. I'd imagine you would have to drive over it, or near it at some point during your visit. No Paris night tour would be complete without a visit to this bridge.

The Gates are fabulous and the view is incredible!. This is a great place for a scenic stroll. You have a bridge with a great view up and down the Seine with tall pillars at each end that have golden statues on top. On a sunny day they just light up! From the bridge you can see the Grand Palace, the Palace des Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. I would say Ponte Alexandre III is a must see for any Paris Vacation.

Pretty bridge. Wanted to visit this as we were told it was a pretty bridge to see. Indeed it was but nothing spectacular. Glad we went to see it though! Could also just catch a glimpse of the Eiffel Tower as well!
Best on the river. Best looking bridge on the river, both by day and by night. Good views of the river,the tower, Les Invalides etc.
must see from the batobus. we drove over this bridge and thought it was nice but you truly get to see the details from the batobus.
Favourite bridge in Paris. Great view of Paris when crossing the bridge. On one side you've got the Grand Palais and on the other side you've got a great view of the Eiffel Tour.
Beautiful bridge. This bridge spans the Seine river near the Musee de l'Orangerie to the National Assemble building. From afar it looks to be made of porcelain and gold.

One of the many nice bridges of Paris. The best part of all of the bridges in Paris is that they are FREE to walk on and take pictures of. Most of them are for pedestrians only making it easy to take pictures from any angle and any amount of time you want to take up.
an amazing bridge with an amazing view. A MUST!!!!!!!! right next to everything, les invalides, louvre and a great little park where you can have a picnic in nice weather..
Bring your camera. This is the most awesome bridge in Paris I think. Get off the bus, take lots of pictures. Even the lampposts are works of art near this bridge.
Beautiful. If you can take the batobus and try to get in the back to take a nice picture. It is a very beautiful scene, you can't miss it!
Superbe view from the bridge. Superbe view from the bridge to Esplanade des Invalides and the river Seine . Impressive view . Not far from Eiffel tower and Champs Elysees .
No other bridge like it!. Walk over the Seine and back on this beautiful bridge and if possible, take a daytime vedette ride on the Seine to view it from the water.
Beautiful bridge . With views of Eiffel in the distance. The bato bus stop is just underneath the bridge, convenient to continue your journey to Eiffel itself.
Parisian View. What a view! Paris has it all, cobble streets, beautiful architecture and a river you can enjoy from this amazing bridge. It provides a wonderful view of the Eiffel tower.
Memorable bridge in all of Paris!. Many bridges cross the Seine in Paris but none is more fabulous than Pont Alexandre III ! Beautiful by day and magnificent at night!
Majestic Architecture at its best. An outstanding piece of architecture - beautiful design and decoration, not to be missed from above, or from the River Seine below

What a Bridge! And named for a foreigner too. It has all the flare for which the French are renowned, but it is named in honour of the Russian Tsar, Alexander III. It is truly beautiful and worthy of photography.

AMAZING. the most romantic scene u'd ever see! walking on it, day, eve or night is just breathtaking!
if u don't see it while in Paris then ur whole trip doesn't count!
amazing architecture!

Simply gorgeous. This bridge is, quite simply, absolutely stunning and is truly worth a visit. Some of you may know this as the bridge from the end of Midnight in Paris. During the day, walk across the bridge and watch lots of funny Parisian joggers (this is where I saw a young lady jogging in hilarious low-hanging MC Hammer pants). In the evening, enjoy the lights of the city at its best, including the Eiffel Tower in all of its sparkling glory. Best of all, no admission fees and no queues! Do yourself a favour and go.
great views!. a bridge over the Seine with a great view of the Eiffel Tower. Photo opportunities galore. day and night. a lot of adornments. worth the visit

Great place to see Paris, and the Eiffel Tower. The bridge is beautifully decorated with gold accents, towers, and sculptures. The view from the bridge is superb, west along the Seine to the Eiffel Tower, east to Nortre Dame. On the north bank are the Grand Palais and Petit Palais. Both great museums!On a sunny day there is hardly a better place to drink in the atmosphere of Paris!

Beautiful Bridge. Wow, what a piece of art! Beautiful sculptures and details. Tremendous gilt-bronze statues! So impressive, and so extravagant! Where else but Paris would there be such spectacular functional monument.

Magnificent sculptures, architecture and views of the Seine River!. If you don't walk across this bridge when visiting Paris, you will miss out on a one of the attractions that is Paris, though not as world known it is just as magnificent as any you will visit! The gold gilded sculptures adorning to the tops of the four main columns are exciting and alive works of art not to be missed and best seen close up. There are candelabra type lamps that align both sides of the bridge and at night make this become one gigantic piece of illuminated artwork. Then looking along the sides of the bridge are more sculptures that give the illusion of this bridge being alive with the architecture's dreams. The Good: The amazing beauty of the sculptures and the architecture of this bridge.The Bad: Just be careful of the traffic it is a very busy bridge, with pedestrians and bicycles all looking at the bridge not for people.The Ugly: there are some people that just have to graffiti or scratch their initials into things.On the Scuba Bubble scale I give this bridge 8 out of 10 Bubbles.
Beautiful!. It is so beautiful. Make sure to walk it! The views from the bridge are magnificent. Just a quick walk to the bridge from Place de la Concorde. Nice way to get from one bank to another.

Stunning bridge. There are many bridges to get across the Siene but this one is pure beauty. The gold gilded sculpture makes you feel you are back a few decades in time enjoying Paris as an aristocrat.
This is Paris. This beautiful bridge which connects some of the most iconic sites and sights in Paris is emblematic of the beauty and planning of the city

Magnificent!. This bridge is absolutely amazing. I wanted to live on this bridge! The beauty of this bridge is all that and then some. The statues are incredible, the views are fun, and there is a lot of people watching to do there. Walk down the steps and walk along the Seine, maybe take your lunch down there and sit back and take it all in. Tip: Try taking one of the boat tours along the Seine at sunset to see the bridge as well.
Beautiful bridge.. Its a lovely bridge, a parisian icon...Its a lovely spot to watch the boats go down the Sienne or to spot other landmarks from.

The Most Beautiful Bridge in the World!. This bridge is a work of art. Huge carvings of angels and cupids lined in gold decorate the bridge. The exterior is intricately decorated as well. Above each end of the bridge stand two tall columns upon which stand gold sculptures. Don't miss this. I took a ton of photos of this bridge.

Mont Alexandre. I loved this place as it was so romantic,. went there twice, day time and at night, but I was surprised that it's one of the main attractions in Paris, but they didn't have snacks, ice creams, meant shops to sell something to eat or drink except when u go downstairs, so there was some bars for drinking.
Unique Statues. It's just a bridge, but it is really beautiful! Don't miss it! One of many cool bridges of the Seine!

Yes, It is Just a Bridge - But a Beautiful Bridge. It is not an 'attraction' as such, and you wont spend hours there, but it is the most beautiful bridge in Paris, and with the old lighting, and the view of the eiffel tower across the bridge, and the invalides at one end and the Grand and Petit Palaces at the other, it is both a convenient place to cross from right to left (or reverse) and a stylish, lovely places to take some beautiful photographs. Take a boat trip under the bridge too, and try to go during the evening when the lights are lit. Gives an aire of what Paris is about.

A bridge to be proud of. Romantic bridge over the Seine with stunning gilded statues. We walked over the bridge, however, the view from a Seine cruise would have been better given the intricacy and sculptures on the sides of the bridge itself.

One of the most beautiful bridges in the world!. Visit this bridge at sunset and see the golden statues glisten. Visit the bridge at night and see the entire bridge lit up. In fact whenever you visit this bridge, it will be a special experience.
very pretty bridge. A very pretty bridge we sav from the eiffel tower , very nice when the lights come on , the staues on the colums are something else , a very detailed

A favorite romantic stroll. We love walking from Concord up and from the Arc down the Champs Elysees to the Clemenceau stop and then across the bridge in the evening. The view to the Eiffel Tower is lovely (time it for the top of the hour when it sparkles) as is the view ahead to Invalides lit up at night and back to the Grand Palais with its illuminated glass roof.This is the ornate bridge from Midnight in Paris.
Beautifully crafted. Magnificent bridge in the heart of a wonderful city. Weather you walk across it or sail underneath it, it is beautifully crafted and worth the the time to visit it.

Nice. I saw this from the Eifel Tower. I did not know what it was or it's significance. I went by this after the Arc. It is incredible with the Gold pieces. I don't believe there is anything in the world like this. The statues are really cool. It is another must see in Paris.

My favorite bridge/spot in Paris. This is soooooo worth seeing. First, Pont Alexandre is in a great area and from it you can see the Petit Palais, Grand Palais, Hotel des Invalides, the Eiffel Tower and so much more. Not only is it an extremely beautiful bridge, it is a great spot to admire other parts of Paris. If you could only visit it 1 time in the day- go at night! It is spectacular and breath taking at night. A must see!

do not miss out. while I was traveling to Paris, i never thought that a bridge can impress me. I was wrong in so many levels because Pont Alexandre III did it! it is a beautiful thing to see and you will really be amazed with it. definitely visit it and bring a camera with you!
best regards!

And what a bridge it is.... There are some fantastic places to see in Paris, and this is one of them. Bridges in the world with this amount of ornamentation and stature are few. I can think of the Charles Bridge in Prague, St Angelo Bridge in Rome, and this Pont Alexandre III. Incidentally you can view these bridges and their surrounds in 3D on 3D City Explorer iPad App. Apart from the beautiful bronze sculpture and gold gilding etc. you also have some awesome views. Les Invalides, Eiffel Tower, Grand Palais and Petit Palais are all in full view from the bridge. One is almost tempted to pack some croissants and drinks and lay a blanket on the sidewalk and just take in this splendid area of Paris (there is a stretch of grass just nearby.)Regards, Ken (3dcityexplorer.com)
Lovely atmosphere and views. Its a beautiful bridge. Lovely atmosphere, great views and of course great photo ops! central location enjoy
Pont Alexandre. My favourite bridge: opulent, exuberant, representing history in the making, it makes a statement, and is proud of it.

Views are amazing, but be cautious. Without a doubt, one of the most beautiful and impressive bridges we have ever seen. Wide streets lined with beautiful landscape, overlooking the river, and with the most outstanding architecture its a must see. We have taken away a star because its also a prime spot for looters, which dampens the experience and requires you to stay on your toes. If people approach you with scams such as "did you drop this", or "I think this is yours", ignore and walk away immediately, do not engage.
Bring your camera!. Best pictures with the eifffel tower and the river in the background at night or during the day. The many statues are also beautiful.

Pont Alexandre III. There are plenty of beautiful bridges crossing the Seine but this has to be the grandest that we saw. The bridge would be worth seeing in its own right for its masonry, black metal ornamentation, heraldry and gilded statuary. However, this is complemented by its situation - to the north are the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais while to the south is the gilded dome of Les Invalides, above the tomb of Napoleon. Even my two sons said 'Wow!'. This was at dusk but the whole scene was even more impressive when we saw it - in bright sunshine, against a blue sky - from a Seine riverboat the following day.
Fab view of Paris. All of the ponts offerva uniquevand fab view of the City of Lights. Daytime or evening or night...tres romantique!!!
The Most Beautiful Bridge. This must be the most ornate bridge in the world. A magnificent location to take some memorable Paris pictures.

A most wonderful Bridge. Having visited Paris before, but not having time to walk across this bridge, this was a must. I loved the bronze sculptures adorning the bridge, and good views in the distant of the Eiffel Tower and my camera was working overtime. Get out and see it on foot, you will not be disappointed.
Bridge Alex. The most ornate bridge of the whole of Paris. Beautiful candelabras with gold on it. It's wide and it's nice to just stand their and admire the surroundings specially the River Seine.

Pont Alexander, a great place to walk. incrediby beautiful bridge with old lamps, cherubs and gilt sculptures,It was a lovely walk from the louvre ,down by the seine and crossing this bridge to walk to the Eiffel Tower

Lovely. A lovely bridge with nice views on either side. Also leads down to a good walk along the river which gives an even better view of the bridge. Well sculpted a gilded in gold everywhere so is an impressive sight.

Iconic Paris. This is one place that as you walk by you will have flash backs to movies, music film clips and so on that all have this bridge featuring prominently in it. Heaps of great photo opportunities.

Beautiful statues!. Stunning, photographs do not do it justice! You have to see it close up to appreciate the size and beauty of the statues along the bridge, even the lamps are detailed and ornate - wish i'd seen it lit up at night!
Beautiful . The most beautiful adorned bridges over the Seine. Wonderfully kept and beautiful views. I loved the bridges many sculptures and ornaments.

Elaborate Bridge. There is no bridge like it. Just like any other architecture and decor in Paris, it's hard to believe that it was all manmade. Other bridges you can appreciate for modern and geometric shapes. In paris, you can appreciate for its history and workmanship. Amazing! Lots of wedding couples there too. It's close to all the other main attractions too so just passing through the bridge is nice.

What a bridge!. Wow! The most ornamented bridge on the Seine. There are two fantastic bronzes of river gods about to leap in off the middle of the bridge. It isn't as crowded as some of the other bridges down stream and is a stone's throw from Clemenceau and Les Invalides Metros.
Beautiful bridge and nice surrounding sculptures. For me, this was the most beautiful bridge over the Seine by far. The grand scale sculptures at each end only made it better.
Just so so. Famous bridge on its history not architecture. So it is just a very normal bridge. But it's very important for trafic there. Join the Seine river cruisin, then you can see this bridge.
Awesome bridge. I was lucky enough to have a taxi driver who explained the bridge to me on my first day in Paris. Seeing it from the river adds a whole new perspective.

Fall in love with a bridge?.... if its as ornate and extravagant as this one,yes. With the Grand Palais in the background,the approach from Avenue du Marechal Gallieni is astounding. Why astounding? well,because the Pont with its exuberant Art Nouveau lamps,cherubs,nymphs,winged horses and a pack of lions at either end is testimony to visual and sensory gluttony. Yes,its arched,spanning the Seine,connecting the Champs-Elysees quarter with the Invalides and the Eiffel Tower quarter. I love this ornate,extravagant bridge,out of all the ones in Paris. Its classified as a historical monument,built in 1900 for the Universal Exhibition. The style of the Pont reflects that of the Grand Palais,to which it leads on the Right Bank. Whilst floating underneath on your Bateaux Mouche ride,you will notice the ceiling kissing your nose because the six-metre high single span steel arch was designed specifically not to obscure the views of the Champs -Elysees or the Invalides. Come at night,the lights blaze brightly and the vibe is fantastic,whilst you ruminate on how many movies were shot right where you are standing.James Bond,The Ronin,'Midnight in Paris',Angel-A and the animated Anastasia are just a sampling. You will also note that guarding the Pont,are four gilt-bronze statues of Fames,supported on massive 17 metre counterweights for the arch. the gilded sculptures on the masonry need to be explored and savoured slowly from below above and directly on. Its hypnotic draw will bring you back time after time,like an old love.
You've seen it in 100s of movies. Muct see it in person too. The lamps are beautiful and define what we see as Parisienne. The view of the river is nice too. Beware of thieves and scammers here.

the best bridge in paris. Paris has so many bridges that i lost count....but this was one of the best.it had a lot to see and had a lovely architecture.the statues were marvelous and so were the light posts.it was unique and beautiful .a must see specially if u enjoy bridges (Pont) like i do....

It's a bridge....thats all. I have to say I am a bit baffled as to how this is the 3rd best attraction in Paris. It's a bridge.....It's a nice bridge.....but its still a bridge. You go there, you see a bridge, you walk over it and that's all.Surely the only review possible is average as far as an experience goes or did I miss a bit? There is a night club under it but that is a different review all together.
Beautiful!. This bridge is a must visit. It's fantastic view is breath taking. Take your time as you will be taking lots of photos.

Nothing more than a nice bridge. In Prague or Rome or Florence or Venice you can find more interesting bridges. it is not a must in Paris so if you are there cross the bridge otherwise do not go there just for the bridge

That is what is Paris all about. Is there anything really we have to say about this bridge? Just siting down nearby and looking at it, even in grey weather days.... we do not really care about anything, do we? This is the place where I feel that I am in Paris and the rest is the rest.

That bridge all lit up at night with the Eiffel tower in the back just says Paris!!. Cross this bridge either at dusk when the lights just come on or at night when the lights are bright and the Eiffel tower in the background is illuminated and your heart stops for a second. You have to pause for a few minutes to appreciate the magnificent view.
A must see. Must see, it's free, very security, no vendors or other people trying to pull the "did you drop this ring?" staff on you. Excelent for pictures

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. One of the the most beautiful bridges i ve ever seen, and of course is a must in Paris, you ll be able to enjoy it more from a boat from the river Seine, that way can enjoy all it s details !

One Amazing Bridge. Pont Alexandre III is beautiful- during the day, at dusk, at night. There is not a bad time to stroll this lovely bridge. It is the most ornate bridge in Paris and it is easily seen from the Tour Eiffel. No doubt it is worth an evening stroll to walk across the bridge and take pictures of the Eiffel as you go.

Possibly the most attractive of Paris bridges. We have been to this bridge several times to photograph it at different times. My wife actually did a large oil painting of the bridge a few years ago, and it was the only painting in the show that sold. Ornate and magnificent. Truly a "must see".

The most beautiful bridge in Paris?. It was described as the most beautiful bridge in Paris and I can see why. Four pillars at the ends with wonderful gold statues on top. It's also a favourite spot for photographs and it seemed that many brides and grooms choose this as a location for their wedding photographs.If you are walking around Paris rather than travelling by Metro then this is easily on your route between the Eiffel Tower or Les Invalides and the Champs Elysee.
Exquisite!. Every detail of this wonderful bridge is perfect. Take time to study it carefully as it is the most beautiful bridge anywhere in the world.

Paris' prettiest bridge. Ornately decorated with cherubs, cupids, nymphs, winged horses and lamps, the Pont is a beautiful bridge linking the Left and Right Bank between Les Invalides and the Grand Palais. A day and night visit is a must.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. This is the most beautiful bridge that I have ever seen in Paris, very romantic by evening boat ride. Riding bicycle (velib) along the bridge is simply an awesome experiece!!! Place must not missed.
Worth a quick visit. Beautiful statues on all four corners of the bridge. Definitely worth a quick stop if you are walking by. Great for some cool pictures.
Work of art. This bridge is spectacular from above and underneath. There are cafe's on either side on the left bank where you can have a drink and just take it all in.
gorgeous!. just beautiful, all these sculptures and the Eiffel Tower in the background and les Invalides at the end of it.. a nice place to stroll
stunning.. I had wanted to see this bridge for a long time and it didn't disappoint. It is really beautiful even on a rainy day.
Best from the boat ride at night.. This pont is best seen at night, most romantic by night boat ride. The day walk over is not as romantic, yet scenic.
Mesmerising!. Parisian extravagance at its best! Worth visiting during sunset, as the gold on the statues shimmers!
What a bridge!. Loved seeing this bridge in person. The ornate and gilded statues on each end of the bridge were amazing.
Gorgeous views from the bridge. Leaning on the stone railings and looking out over the The Seine was a gorgeous sight. The bridhe itself is a thing of beauty with the lions and lots of gilt.

Lovely. Definately one of the more ornate ponts. Lovely views at sunset of eiffel tower in background. Not far from champs elycee, grand palais, petit palais so, easy to combine with other sightseeing .
Beautiful Bridge. Seen from the Vadette cruise or walking upon or near, this bridge is so beautiful! The absolute best!
Beautiful Bridge. Just next to the Eiffel Tower, walk from the Hotel des Invalides to the Grand Palais on this beautiful bridge. Stylish, functional, Paris.

Enjoyable walk. This bridge is the most ornate and most beautiful bridge in Paris.
Great views of the city and enjoyable walk.
The bridge features some exquisite Art Nouveau lamps, cherubs, Nymphs and peasus. Great for Photos.
THE place for Eiffel Tower lights. Amazing bridge with tons of ornate, amazing decorations. Also a wonderful, romantic spot to gaze at the lit up Eiffel Tower after dark.
Outstanding bridge. The best way to see the bridge is along the Seine on an evening river cruise or get a bottle of red and sit on the bank with a loved one

Stately bridge. Nice bridge with nice history.
Beautiful decorations: lanterns, lions.
Great views for Tour Eiffel and Invalides
landscape. if you're looking for a spot for photographs this is the place in paris! night and day you get to snap the reasons why paris is special and charming!!

The most opulent bridge!. The pont Alexander III is best seen in detail from the Seine. Don't jump in! Take a bateau cruise to take it all in.
It is hard to believe a bridge would be built with such exquisite detail and decoration. Don't miss!

It's a bridge. A very pretty one, but not a must. If you have limited time, this isn't a must see. It is in fact a bridge. The Ponte Vecchio in Florence is more of a historic monument than this one, but if you can walk across it, do. It is very eloborate and pretty.
Must see. Brilliant a beautiful bridge, must see whilst in Paris it is beautiful to stroll across and see the views.
Exquisite bridge. If you were only able to visit one bridge in Paris this would be the one to see. It is absolutely gorgeous !
What a beautiful bridge. connecting the right bank at where the Grand and Petit Palais are and the left bank at the Invalides location.
charming!. Just a look at it makes you want to fall in love! Now... where do they sell locks?? Seriously.... take a picture, it will make you smile for years to come.
Part of a nice stroll on the Siene banks.. We had a walk on that bridge. It was a part of a nice stroll on the Seine banks & we passed by it when we were having a cruise on the Seine.

Wonderful bridge with a view. Les Invalides, the Seine and the Petit and Grand Palais can all be seen from this beautiful bridge, as well as the Eiffel Tower. It has a Parisian feel to it and I would definitely include it on my to-see list if I visit Paris again. I loved it!
Scenes From Movies. Walking over the bridge at dusk was like a scene from some romantic movie, although the traffic did disturb the ambience a little.
My favorite bridge in the whole world. This is a splendid structure. I absolutely love it. The figures and statues on the bridge are wonderful.
Visiting Paris. The Pont Alexandre III was a gift to Paris that until our days it is a beautiful attraction and the easy way to go on the other side of the Sene walking or by car
Picturesque Bridge. Ive been here twice already and my two visits is always witg awe as you walk along the bridge over the river Seine with the City of Paris on the backdrop
A jewel. Espectacular and beautiful design. Nice views of Hotel des Invalides, Tour Montparnasse and the Grand and Petit Palais.

a great place for an early morning walk. We got out to the bridge early in the morning. The view of the E. Tower was awesome with the tower going up into the low heavy clouds. There was no traffic so the bridge was empty and perfect for photographs. The ornate decorations, the beautiful buildings on either side make this a perfect place for an early morning walk!

The most beautiful bridge on the Seine!. This bridge is unique because of its design and decoration and considered an engineering marvel of the 19th century. It can be viewed from the banks of the Seine or any tour boat riding under it. It is one of the most beautiful bridges along the river. A single arch supports the bridge, unlike other bridges prior to its time. It is also painted with white and gilding, including figures on the columns that provide counterweights to the arch beneath. It was completed in 1900 and connects the Champs Elysees district to the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides district near the Grand Palais.
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. This is absolutely the most spectacular bridge with beautiful art, ornate sculpture and the best route to Napoleon's tomb

The most beautiful bridge in the world. This is the quintessential bridge in Paris. A must see! You be glad you did. The bridge itself is a good example of late imperial style , named after a russian tsar no less.... And a phantastic postcard view of the Tour Eiffel and other parts of Paris. If you are on a romantic holiday ad want to impress your object of desire this is a must, especially in the setting sun....
Beautiful bridge in a beautiful city!. We went under this bridge during our lunchtime river cruise and I must say it is a beautiful structure to see from any angle!
beautiful.. It is a big beautiful golden bridge with intricately carved everything. Really a pretty sight. Lovely lampposts. Nice view from the middle as well.
mustsee. It is a mustsee in Paris. So highly recommended to visit it, it is one of the places in Paris where you can take memorable photos. So, once again, don't miss it!
Lovely Bridge. Went under it not over it but it appeared a lot in our photos. Very opulent, gold statues at either end.
Beautiful sunset .... There were many bridges along the Seine River but this bridge was by far the most beautiful and is even more beautiful at sunset ... a must see ...

Who would have thought bridges could be this grand!. OMG - fantastic! This is the sort of thing that separates Paris from the rest of the world! Gorgeous! The gold detailing, the metal work, the intricate detail are unbelievable! Another beautiful landmark in Paris...

Wonderful. I've never been in paris before and I did a tour of the city by boat and we passed under this wonderful bridge!
I loved the golden statues and the metal details of the bridge!
My grandmother loved that too!
fantastic views. A real gem among the Seine bridges! It has fanciful decorations. And it seemed a great place to enjoy the sunset!
The gold glimmers in the sun. The gold glimmers Beautifully as the sun as setting. So ornate and intricate. Take some time to relax by the river and stare up at this wonder.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. If you are in Paris for one day, you have to come to this bridge. It is so beautiful. And the location is amazing, you are within walking distance to so many great Parisian sites and it's a perfect spot for photos.
Beautiful. Gorgeous bridge, I loved walking across it. this bridge is extremely decorated with amazing statues. As you stroll Paris I recommend walking this bridge.

Splendid. During a short break we travelled under the bridge by boat one day then walked over it the next. It is stunning. Paris is an expensive city but has so much beauty and art in public areas that costs nothing to admire such as this bridge
Paris August 2013. Walked over the Pont Alexander III while eating an ice cream that we bought from a vendor at the foot of the bridge.

Incredible!. The bridge was named after an Emperor of Russia, Alexandre III (1845-1894), who spoke fluent French and formed an alliance with France towards the end of his life, even though he was highly suspicious of the French form of government at the time, the Third Republic.

Paris's prettiest bridge. An Art Nouveau masterpiece richly decorated with cherubs, lamps, winged horses that lead up to the Grand Palais and Petit Palais. They were both built at the same time as Pont Alexandre III and are all a marvel of nineteen centaury engineering.
Beautiful, near the hotel George V.. It was elegant, and not crowded with Americans. It was in easy walking distance of our visit to the Lovre.
Pont Alexandre III. Have to see it, well preserved and maintained. The gold plating on the statues is amazing. Nice spot for taking night pictures.
beautiful scenario of Paris.... beautiful scenario of Paris...it is located in the middle of everything...if you stroll by Paris, you may pass through it

Superb !. You must visit Pont Alexandre III !
This was build in 1900 and it looks magnifique ! You have a very nice view also over Seine...
Stunning everywhere.. The bridge itself is beautiful and the views from it are amazing. Highly suggest you walk by when on your way to see the Eiffle tower.
Paris bridge with locks. Sailed under on a boat, great engineering. The whole wire railing is covered in lovers locks. The boat we were on was a bit ordinary
Nice at Night. Nice view of ET in backround on the Grand Palais side, classic bridge unlike any other with it's gold leaf and ornate decor, in the middle of the city
Magnificient views across the bridge. A great place and brilliant views from the bridge.On one side Petit and Grand Palace & on other hand the great golden dome. Awe inspiring.

Beautiful Paris Bridge. This handsome bridge over the Seine in central Paris is one of the most striking bridges one might imagine: more like a piece of sculpture with gold leaf. Handsome at a distance and when one chooses to walk over and view the bridge details.
Interesting disguise. Amazingly exuberant bridge leading to the National Gallery. All the guild work was beautiful and although it was drizzling and cold still an amazing site

My favourite bridge. in Paris. The views are spectacular with the Eiffel Tower in the background, the statues are impressive, the petit palais is also worth a visit it is free and lovely patio inside with a restaurant. Lovely in August too when there is little traffic.
To the Empire. Fantastic bridge, very ornate and highly decorated. Worth seeing as part of a walk along the Seine, Les Invalides and for views of the Eiffel Tower.
See it from a Boat. Yes, you need to see this magnificent bridge, but see it from a boat on the Seine. Take your fantastic photo and move on! There are so many other things to see in Paris.

Best burger ever. Underneath the the bridge there is a silver bullet shaped caravan, they make the best burger and salad I have ever tasted, recently went there, we had to line up but not for too long and we were not dissapointed, there is also a riverside bar that works in conjunction with the burger van.What a perfect afternoon watching the boats cruise by eating magical burgers and drinking wonderful French wine, couldn't be any better.

Great views!. Nice place to relax at the end of your shopping trip from Arc de Triomphe thru Champs-Elysees. Get down the bridge and take a seat in one of the cafes and watch the boats pass by waving to fellow tourists. Tip: There is a small toilet (free) below the bridge.
nice bridge. over the river there are some bridges. This bridge is one of the significant bridges for visitors to take a look.
Just beautiful. Really beautiful bridge that was given to Paris as a present from Russia. It had rich decorations and nice white colour. Worth visiting.
Beautiful bridge with wonderful vistas. Likely the prettiest bridge in Paris, with wonderful shots to be made of the Eiffel Tower and les Invalides. Especially great approaching sunset.

Great picnic spot on the Seine. A mixture of stunning & vulgar. They certainly liked their gold in the design of this bridge, but when it was lit in the evenings, there was no escaping it's beauty.
Fantastic picnic areas on the Seine start from this bridge with different "zones" to choose depending on your fancy.

Nice on top nice underneath. Sailed underneath this beautiful bridge and walked across it.
Worth seeing.
Nicely lit in the evening
Part of the beauty of Paris. Historical, beautiful and majestic. This bridge is a reminder of a previous golden era of history and the view from it is breathtaking.

As far as bridges go numero uno.. There are many interesting bridges in Paris that link the left and right banks and this bridge is regularly voted the best. The bridge is over the top and wonderfully adorned but taken into perspective with the place de concorde and Les Invalides flanking either side sits beautifully between the two. It's free and offers plenty of photographic opportunity and has to rank up there with the most majestic and iconic bridges of the world, Sydney Harbour, Tower Bridge, Golden Gate etc. Well worth the price of a stroll along the Seine.
Most beautiful pont in Paris. All the pont is amazing, most visit and take pictures there. Beside metro station so easy to reach, or you can walk along the sien river.
Fabulous bridge. Would that we in the US could devote time and effort to make mundane bridges sparkle like this one does.A photographer's delight!

Stumbled upon this - luckily. During a long walk around parts of Paris, we came upon this bridge at dusk. I don't know about the day time, but this place is very cool at night. You could just hang out here for a good while and, while watching the boats and people pass by, take in the architecture and sculptures that adorn this bridge.I'd recommend a night time stroll along the Seine from here (or to here).

Beautiful. Beautiful bridge. A must for any SATC fans, this is obviously where Mr Big and Carrie finally get together for good. The history behind the bridge is also interesting, about the Parisian's connection with Russia.
Gold adorned bridge. Passed over it, walked under it, floated under it. Some impressive gold painted adornment and art works from all sides

Wonderfully over the top!. Do not miss this bridge, even if you only traverse it &don't look in detail. It is a wonderful example of the Parisians' ability to go totally over the top in terms of gilding, curliques, cherubs, baroque in the extreme. It should look overdone & I suppose it does, in away, but such a good way, one cannot help but smile & enjoy it! It is also a good vantage point for views of the Seine, the city and a number of the well known sites.
