it's beautiful. you should go there twiceonce at night specially when the moon is around Eiffel tower and once 2 hours before sunset to have pictures from details and sculptures
The most amazing bridge. It's an absolute must see in Paris!! It's between Louvre and Eiffel, and it has those gold covered statues, it's the loveliest bridge.

Stunning bridge. Worth seeing if you in the area! But it is "just" a bridge, so can't say much more about it really. You can see the Eiffel tower in the background too. The nicest bridge in Paris I would say.

so pretty. the view from the bridge is just as pretty as the view of the bridge. We lounged at Flow with cocktails and just took in the sights! Also, try to hit up the little flea market...not sure which days it is open but it is there on the weekends.

Beautiful Bridge, Breath Taking In Real Life. This bridge is so much more beautiful in real life compared to pictures. It takes your breath away as you come round the corner and wham it's bright gold and white features jump out at you! The detail is fabulous and the sculptures are beautiful, views of the Eiffel tower too.
Beautiful. Such a lovely bridge to see spanning the Seine. The architecture, gilding and statutes are amazing. A real must to have your photograph taken on!

Definitely the most beautiful bridge in Paris. So beautiful when you cross it with a bateau mouche! For a tour on a bateau mouche you you can embark from the Seine near the Eiffel tower. The visit takes about one hour.
Gorgeous. It's an amazing piece of architecture and absolutely gorgeous. We visited with a guide who told us about the history; I always find it makes it special.
Nice bridge. It is one of the most beautiful bridges in Paris especially during the night when it is all illuminated
Amazing!. one of the most amazing bridges i've seen! this bridge is really good for a picture stop. The bridge overlooks river seine with many tour boats passing by. Really a must-see in Paris!

Stop and admire. People sometimes take bridges for granted. This bridge is not just a means of crossing the river but is worth a slow stroll to admire the ornate cast iron and gilding. Watch out for the fake gold ring trick on the bridge and the surrounding roads.
Very Picturesque. The gold and bronze on this bridge between Les Invalides and the Grand Palais make it an excellent photo opportunity!

Pont Alexandre III review. I recommend it simply because the area is beautiful, you are crossing over the Seine seeing all the boats. I think getting around Paris while you are on vacation should be done on foot as much as possible so you can take in this beautiful city.

The 'best' bridge in Paris. It certainly is the most ornate bridge in Paris, but it is not very impressive in my opinion. I consider it hardly note-worthy, but the Parisians seem proud of it. If it is on your way, it is worth a look, but a trip across town would probably end in disappointment.

Our favorite bridge!. This bridge is absolutely our favorite bridge in Paris. While in Paris we lived in St. Germaine, but almost every day we end up on this bridge. It is beautiful at any time of the day or night in any weather. Don’t miss it.

Tremendous bridge. We liked the elegance of the bridge, nice architecture, perfect view on the Seine and the rivers. It has also a flavour of the history, which you can feel when staying on the bridge.

Very Nice location. If you start with the ِِArc de Triomphe enjoy your journey along Champs-Elysées Steet with its great restaurants and stores finally you reach at both the Grand Palais and the Petite Palais and just few meters you will find this great bridge.This trip is full of amazing site seeing places both modern and historic.What a wonderful day and nice places!!....Enjoy your life
NICE!. It is really beautiful at sunset and a great place to walk with your significant other. We loved it.
Picturesque. Have to be the most photgraphed pont in Paris. Every time I go I try to capture a different angle usually with the Grand Palais in the background.
Most beautiful Bridge in Paris.. The most beautiful Bridge in Paris. Accompanied by the views of the Grand Palais & Petit Palais, The River Seine & The Invalides.

Very striking. Well its only a bridge and there are a few famous bridges in the world, but Pont Alexandra is very different from the other 19th and 20th century (Sydney, Hell Gate, Boston, Golden Gate) famous bridges. It is very opulently decorated with statues, lamps and nymphs. You are certain to come across the bridge if you take any of the boats that tour the Seine. If you don't, then do spend some time to visit this master piece.
Always Beautiful. I have been to Paris many times and everytime I visit this place cannot stop admiring its beauty simply irresistible.

A beautiful bridge with amazing artwork. This beautiful bridge crosses over the Seine river with a commanding presence. The ornate gold statues are brillant on a sunny day. A lovely addition to the endless Paris architect wonders you encounter while strolling the streets of this awesome city.

Most romantic bridge in Paris?. Worth a stroll here, especially in the late afternoon sun, when the decorative golden sculptures are ablaze in the light. Easy to see from here why Paris is considered the most beautiful city.
Bronze beauty. A unique bridge lined with interesting bronze statues, magnificent views along the Seine in both directions and the best view of Les Invalides.
Stunning. The most romantic spot in Paris ? Great view and art, and the bridge is the centre of a long line between the Dome Invalides and Grand/Petit Palais further to Champs Elysees.

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. The bridge is decorated with lampposts and sculptures of cherubs and nymphs.The bridge, with its exuberant Art Nouveau lamps, cherubs, nymphs and winged horses is a grand spectacle and easily the most beautiful bridge of Paris

not impressed. After the museum l orangerie, we ve been to the bridge alexander 3, very disapointed, nothig to do around this place, very strange place to visit, we were scared at night time, not very secure place
Awesome. First Bridge with eletric light in paris! Good spot for pictures for every occasions. Famous models had been there for photo session.
Gorgeous Bridge. Absolutely stunning bridge over the River Seine with some nice river side cafes and restaurants close by.
awesome. this is a very beautiful bridge.... like everything we saw in paris, lots of oh my gosh such beauty....
Gorgeous bridge. wide, expansive with views of all the city - wonderful sculpture, access to quay areas along Seine River, lots of activity on weekends here
Beautiful bridge. The figures are covered in bronze/gold. The figures on the sides are huge and wonderfully done. A grandiose beautiful bridge!
Beautiful Bridge. The columns with shining gold tops are magnificent; wonderfulview of the Eiffel Tower from the bridge.

Breathtaking bridge-most ornate in Paris. Wander along the riverfront and make sure you seek out this bridge. It is beautiful to admire and especially to take a photo of, especially looking east at sunset so that you can capture the bright gold and stark white contrast on the bridge as the sun sets on it.
Must See. Very pretty bridge and not hard to miss. Just one of those things you have to see in Paris and take pics in front of/on. Grand gold detailing. Def stands out!

It's hard to miss.... It's amazingly beautiful, don't get me wrong, but you will see it by taking the Metro to Les Invalides or by walking along the La Seine (on either side) toward almost anything important along La Seine in Paris. Don't miss it, but be sure to take in the 50 or so other incredible sights you can see from the bridge.
Simply Splendid!. Besides being just a classy way to cross the Seine, it gives you the wonderful vistas that make Paris so special. You can see loads of monuments from it. It is a Paris must!

Amazing architecture and scultures. The bridge is an amazing statement to the beauty that is all around you in Paris
Stop take it all in and do not compare it to a bridge in Ny or brooklyn impossible comparison
This is Paris comparisons cannot be made

Beautiful and Elegant. There a re a number of beautiful Bridges over the River Seine, but this absolutely stood out as being one of the most beautiful. I felt transported back in time when i walked over it and would loved to have been in Paris when it was first opened!!

This is and always will be my favorite Parisian bridge!. This bridge is the one place we always visit in Paris. When we lived in Paris, we walked there often for the sunset. There is simply nothing like the warm the golden cherubs. Even seeing a photo makes me tearfully nostalgic!A great view of the river and the Eiffel TowerThe elaborate and classic sculpture and lights are "oh so Parisian". Bring your camera!One sad thing, there has been some recent defacement with graffiti, but it looks like repairs are underway
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. This is a stunning bridge. Great views of the Seine and the Eiffel tower from here as well. Lots of gilt work and iron.
A Work of Art. Don't make the mistake of only admiring the bridge from street level, it is even more beautiful from the Seine. There are stairs at each end on both sides.

frequented place. Odd to give a review of a bridge... The bridge is a nice place to walk when touring Paris by foot. Don't worry about heat because somebody is selling water out of an ice bucket at either end. Built as a commemorative of the bond between France and Russia, it is more ornate that most other bridges spanning the Sienne.

Just a bridge, but great for photos / views. Yes, Pont Alexandre III is just a bridge, but it is a very ornate and well-decorated bridge. Also, you can see the Grande and Petite Palais on the north end of the bridge, and to the south, a perfect view of Les Invalides. And of course, there is the backdrop of the Eiffel Tour. The bridge is definitely worth a visit.

place to be !. One of the most beautiful bridge over the river Seine in Paris.Try to be there late in the night, less people, less car and enjoy the place.Of course like many attraction be aware of others but you should not miss it when you come to Paris for the first time.Walk towards Napoleon tomb near by (check the golden dome behind you) and enjoy the area.I am living near Paris even though I always like to drive or walk over the this bridge ....

historic and beautiful. This is one of 37 bridges on the Seine in Paris. All are unique and short. It is close to many historic places. It is so famous and photogenic. As a student of international relations, I am interested in the history. It was built at the end of the 19th century and named after Alexander III. It was this tsar who formed a military alliance with France against the latter's nemesis, Germany. Little wonder the French loved him.

Wow!!. This is by far the most beautiful bridge in Paris!!! Take many pictures here they have beautiful backgrounds
And it's free!
A must see!. Pont Alexandre is the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It's definitely worth a closer look. Walking or cycling across the bridge is the best way to appreciate it.
Do see it. Nice to see, but hey it's a bridge take a photo walk across and then on to the next site. Can also be seen from the top of the Eiffel Tower.

Nice architecture. While in Champs Elysees, we saw the... One of the many bridges spanning the Seine, but one of the most beautiful. Featured in may past films and great pictures in the afternoon/ evening.

Simply Paris. If Paris had to be defined by bridges then this is tge one to sum it up. Its ridiculously sumptuous! ! Just look at the lamps and gold leaf gilding. ...I mean over the top it certainly is and its amazing the bridge was kept when all around were losing heads!Go on.....get your picture....night and day. Just watch for those "is this your ring" artists!!!!

Iconic bridge. Have a look at this bridge, walk on it or see it from the Bateaux Mouches or the Bateaux Parisiens. Pont Alexandre III is an bridge that crosses the Seine, connecting the Champs-Élysées quarter and the Invalides and Eiffel Tower Quarter, it is the prettiest in Paris. There is much to look at and photograph with Art Nouveau cherubs and nymphs. A delight.

Worth checking out.. This is a very beautiful bridge with interesting details in its whole extension. Well-crafted statues, lamp posts, and details in gold, which makes it stands out even from a distance, specially on bright, sunny days. The bridge offers beautiful views from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine river.If you like sightseeing on foot, which you SHOULD do in Paris if you have enough time to spare and the weather is good, I suggest taking the metro to Palais Royal - Musée du Louvre, crossing the museum to the other side through Pont des Arts, then crossing back through Pont Royal, going into the Jardin des Tuileries and crossing it until Place de La Concorde, keeping to your left and following the Seine until Pont Alexandre III, crossing it and going straight ahead to Invalides and, finally, to your right until you reach Champ-de-Mars and the Tour Eiffel.

Attractive Parisian Landmark. This bridge carries auto traffic unlike a couple of other bridges crossing the Seine. But the stonework and sculptures are classic and the evening view of the Eiffel Tower is worth a crossing. It's close to the Orsay as well as providing access to the Champs Elysees and Grand Palais on the north side.
Very beautifull. Wow, most off all the golden angels. Wonderfull with the look on the Seine. Also the goodlooking terasses.

Great veiws of the river and monuments . The bridge itself is nothing special, but all the gold statues and the location make this a great stopping spot to take in the views. Walked from the military museum to the Grande Palace with something great to look at the whole way. Stop by at night for the views.

Great area overall. Close to the tower as well as Les invalides. We were fortunate enough to catch an amazing Helicopter show here for Fete Nationale. It was something I will never forget, A must see if in teh area on JUly 14th.
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. The bridge has very nice views and the construction itself is very beautiful. All bridges in Paris are beautiful, but this is perfection.

The most gorgeous bridge in the world!. definitely a must see! absolutely stunning bridge with amazing sculptures situated in the heart of Paris and view of the Eiffel tower, the Military museum. Simply perfect.

My Favorite Bridge Not Named "Brooklyn" or "Golden Gate". Near the Eiffel Tower, Trocadero and Invalides, Pont Alexandre is the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Great views from the bridge. Bring a camera and snap lots of pictures.
Top site in Paris. Worth visiting. The most beautiful bridge in Paris. On the negative side - beware of the lost gold ring scammers in this area.
Lots of photos. We must have liked this bridge a lot because we took several photos of it from the land and from the Seine. It is quite beautiful and very fancy.

Pretty on top, nasty underneath. When oh when will Paris get it's public urination under control? We visited during a warm dry spell and the underneath of most Parisian bridges were evil.
Meanwhile, on top, the statues are amazing. Paris in summary.

Paris's Most Ornate Bridge. Paris's most beautiful ornate bridge and historic monument which connects the Champs-Élysées, Invalides and Eiffel Tower areas. Lovely Art Nouveau lamps and plenty of cherubs, nymphs and winged horses. Must see!
The most romantic spot of Paris. You cannot miss this beautiful piece of architecture and the amazing view. It is thé most romantic spot in the city of lights

the most beautiful. this bridge is the most beautiful crossing the Sena although each bridge has its own characteristic.
you must visit it

Must see at night. One of the best views of Paris you can get is from the Pont Alexandre III bridge. Make sure to go there after sunset, when all the lights come to life. You have a spectacular view of the Seine, the Montparnasse tower, the Hotel des Invalides and the Eiffel tower all in one. Just spectacular.
Lovely place. Lovely to walk in the evening or during the day. A variety of sights, all good on the eye. We often went via here as Parton our walks too and from other Paris sites
Beautiful Bridge. Take a walk at sunset, just by the river bank many outdor bars, the bridge is from Alexandre the Great time, beautifully done.

Walk across at dark and enjoy the view!. We walked from the Arch de Triumph to the Eiffel Tower one evening and experienced the most awe when walking across Pont Alexandre while viewing the Eiffel Tower. It's a gorgeous bridge that spans over the Seine river.
nice. the brigde is in a great location of city and provides a nice view of the city of paris and its river. you can walk to this bridge if you are in the champs elysees.

Another stop along your walk in Paris. How can you not stop here. This bridge is showcased in almost every movie filmed in Paris. It is just beautiful with its famous statues and typical Parisian street lamps.

Um - it's a bridge?. Maybe it's my Pittsburgh roots, but I just wasn't overwhelmed? I mean, it's a lovely bridge, and it has a nice view of the river, but I wouldn't skip out on a different attraction to go see it.

Fantastic. Some think it is the most beautiful bridge in the world, but regardless this the bridge and its surroundings is one of the places that you must not miss in Paris. The vision of the Invalides and Palaces (Petit and Grand Palais) is fantastic. I do not get tired of going there.
Worth a taxi ride. And a walk and a rented bicycle ride. Classic. Impressive. Screams Paris. Watch out for the traffic if on foot or on the bike.
Nice but not special. Maybe that I missed some background information on the history but I did not consider Pont Alexandre III as special. Of course, it still was something to see.
Love the gold trimmings.. Great for photography of the actual bridge and the vignettes one may capture with ones lens including attractive parts of the bridge with distant images.

Don't go out of your way. Quite a pretty bridge, not spectacular. You'll love it if you just stumble upon it. If you've gone out of your way to get here you will be a bit disappointed. Ornately carved and painted in gold. On the up side it is free to look at, free to photograph, free to walk over.

A Beautiful bridge. it's a very lovely looking bridge with its gold statues.
it's not exactly an attraction but its nice to take a couple of photos to the seine river
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. You really can't miss this bridge even if you tried. So beautiful that I proposed to my wife on this bridge back in 2011.
Nothing overly exciting - very beautiful though!. We walked past it on our way to the Musee d'Orsay and didn't even notice it at first but very beautiful to look at.

Beautiful, romantic, quintessential Paris. Feel like your in a movie! This bridge is stunning... we took many of our wedding pictures here. Definitely worth making this bridge one of your stops on a day walking through the city.
Most beautiful Bridge in the World. This was a gift from the Czar to France. It has to be the most ornate and beautiful bridges in the world
Beautiful. what can I say this is the most beautiful, grand bridge in paris (my opinion) and everyone has to walk across & take photo's. If you can cross in the evening..very romantic & beautiful..
The greatest bridge. Spectacular bridge, must see. when travelling around Paris you will see it a lot but every time it is stunning

One of the nicest bridges of the world. This impresive bridge, one of the many landmarks of Paris and named Alexandre III for the tzar of that name and related to the Franco-Russian Alliance, is a real must!!!The bridge and its beauty is remarkable and has many sculptures. Views from there are excellent, specially to the west with the Eiffel Tower in the back.It is perfect to combine the visit to this bridge with Les Invalides and the Grand and Petit Palais.

Still "the" bridge in Paris. The Seine is crossed by many bridges and all offer a wonderful view of both banks of the city, separated by this famous waterway. Pont Alexandre III is the best example of bridge-building in Paris. It's gilded statues and elegant structure are beautiful in their own right but they also "anchor" this entire precinct in Paris, which is bounded by famous and historical buildings and sites. Our current visitors really loved this spot, the perfect place to take photos being right in the middle!

So commom but so special. This bridge is comom like all those bridges that you can find in many others cities around the world, but the view, the buildings and the hystory which is envolve it brings them a special attraction. Great place to take great pictures.
An amazing sight. The bridge is very impressive architecture. The whole area around this bridge is interesting and a great place to hang out and just enjoy walking around.
pont alexandre ist the most beautiful bridge. in paris, those statues are really beautiful, nice look at palaces and les invalides it was really nice
An interesting bridge, one of the greats across the seine. Liked the gold statues, and one of the must see bridges across the seine. Disliked - no dislikes about the bridge.
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. We took the most beautiful photos of this bridge. It is quintessential Paris. Romantic. Lovely. Worth the stroll an also close to the "Love Locks" bridge.
Most beautiful bridge. I've walked across this bridge a few times and always find it beautiful and romantic. Great place to take pics.

Exquisite Bridge along La Seine. We went here on our last day before we rode the train to Switzerland. We are glad that we didn't miss it as the architecture was just exquisite. A lot of detailing with the sculptures on the bridge and you can also see some of the Parisian architectural icons from thie bridge such as the Eiffel Tower, Ecolé Militaire, Notré Dame etc.

It seems weird to rate a bridge, but.... I love walking across the Pont Alexandre III.The bridge itself is functional I suppose, and it has some very pretty lamp-posts, but it's what you can see from it that makes it wonderful. The view of the tower, of Invalides, of the Palaces and simply along the river are all fantastic. Day and night. I always walk down to the bridge to have a last look at my favourite parts of the city in the evening of my last day in Paris.

Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris (?). Agruably the beautiful bridge across the Seine in Paris, it has always been a favorite. The gold covered statues at either end as well as the elegant lamp posts are very evocative and spectacular in any light.

Beautiful!. You feel like in a Dior ad! Having the view on Invalides and on the Grand Palais, wow!
Many many tourists, but if you hire a bike (vélib') is the best way of getting there!

Wow. We walked from the Grand and Petite Palaces and the view was stunning. it si the most beautiful bridge in Paris and you may have seen it in films Private Benjamin, As good as it gets, I'm sure there are mor.

Beautiful bridge!. Did not get to see it lit up but I'm sure it must be wonderful at night!
We went on night river cruise just for that reason but at 10:00 p.m. it still was not lit. It doesn't get dark in Paris until about that time.

A must see up close. It's in every movie filmed in Paris and for good reason. It's beautiful. There are many bridges you can use to cross the Seine. Check your map before you cross and see if you can use this one before you use another.
A must see place to visit while in Paris. One of the major bridges in Paris with great views of the Seine River in both directions. Also take the river boat cruise to view all the bridges of Paris.
beautiful. Stunning bridge, full off art , walk it or navigate under it, its beautiful, good option with the hop.in hop off bus

Russians best gift to Paris!. It is a single-span bridge, an engineering marvel in its day (1900), and topped and decorated by gilded sculptures, garlands, coats of arms, etc - you see it from the Place de la Concorde, Les Invalides, and the bateau mouche cruise boats that pass underneath. Take a cruise (preferable in the early evening) and don't forget your camera - you will need it, the bridge is so beautiful!
A bridge and an art work. Nice piece of architecture entirely renovated, a must see during your stay in Paris. The alignement with the Invalides make the scene beautiful.

Prettiest Bridge in Paris. Whether walking over or under the bridge you will see the most beautiful bridge in the city. Good views from the bridge as well. Nice to sit along the Seine to relax watch the young lovers and the many river tour boats. Enjoy the bridge, and the people.

Pont Alexandre. This is a beautiful bridge which we passed under on trip on the river Seine ,the river trip is good way to see it, and also learn some of the bridges history.Sad to say we never got to walk on it just did't have the time but it is something we will correct when we go back.It was just of the many sites we did't know about in Paris ,there is so much to see in this city.
Must See. Beautiful site, Great photo ops of and from the pont. Interesting as are most sites in Paris. Romantic. Must see

"New"; Les Berges & the Pont Alexandre III. Pont Alexandre is one of the prettiest bridges in Paris. Just last week the Parisians have opened a wonderful walking space along the left bank of the Seine, where the Quai (for car traffic) used to be. The Quai for car traffic has been permanently closed and it has been replaced by the area they call "Les Berges". Just along the Seine, under the Pont Alexandre, you are now able to sit and enjoy a beverage & small snack while admiring this beautiful bridge. So don't along enjoy the bridge from street level, go down the steps toward "Les Berges" and enjoy the bridge from the level of the Seine River as well.
Beautiful. The best part about walking though this bridge is that when you arrive to the end (on the side of the Palais Royale) there is a statue on a horse of Simon Bolivar. Nice surprise!
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. A must see - both by walking across AND bateau mouche!And don't forget the Grand Palais and Petit Palais right next door.

Nice view of the Seine and fanciful gold-colored artwork. It is worth the short walk across the bridge if you are in the area. There is an RER underground station that connects to the Metro (a rather long walk between the two) just to the left of the bridge and across the road from it as you walk to the Left Bank. This station is convenient for access to the Grand Palais and Petit Palais.

What a present for parisiens by Alexandre III!. Pont tsar Alexandre III is so beautiful by day and night. It is genuine symbol of friendship between Russia and France. The bridge is absolutely worth of visiting.
beautiful. LOVELY BRIDGE and you can see tour eiffel as well.. great place for taking many pics and as well to chill and enjoy the amazing view of the seine and whole Paris ;)
Better than in Saint-Petersburg. Being born in Saint-Petersburg I was wondered to look at the copy of Kirovskiy bridge. Bridge of Alexander III looks more gorgeous, I think

Russian gift which became on of the symbols of Paris. The russian Tzar Alexander III has given it as a gift, now it becomes one of the symbols of Paris and an absolute musto-to-see.Huge, massive, magnificent, whether at night or during the day, it's golden sculptures shine spreading the sence of luxury and power.Why to attach the photos?? Just come here and see it with your own eyes- no one photo will give you the feeling you will get here! Highly recommended!
My favorite bridge!. I have to cross it everytime Iam n Paris it always makes me feel Romanovian! All that gold and the view of Invalides is great.
The nicest bridge. This bridge is beautiful and really the nicest in Paris. It reminds me of beautiful bridges in St. Petersburg in Russia

My favorite bridge in Paris.. If you like over the top beauty and quentesential Paris, this is for you. As an example of beauty, forget the cost, this bridge has everything. Bronze statues, Lamp stands that have more detail in themselves than anything we do today, you need to walk the bridge several times just to take it all in. Beautiful.
Bridge. We saw it while walking over it and when we went on a cruise on the Seine either way it was very impressive.
Beautiful. Gorgeous bridge with amazing details. Lots of gold leaf. Whether walking across or riding under it on a boat, you'll be impressed.
Beautiful Bridge in Paris. You must be sure to walk across this bridge. It is truly beautiful and has a great view up and down the Seine.
Amazing, do not skip a visit. As many others, beautifully, but this one very special. You may spend some time looking at the place, or even crossing it.
Wow!. this ornate bridge must be seen from a riverboat to get the full effect of its grandeur. the gold leaf is brightly polished and quite impressive.
Tre bien. Beautiful, ornate and very photo worthy..........great views of the seine and the Eiffel Tower in the distance.

My favourite Parisian Bridge.. Whether you see it from the road, travelling over it, or from the river passing underneath it, this has to be one of the most spectacular of Parisian bridges, with its wonderful sculpture, and gilt and green decorative scheme. It was designed and built for the Paris Exposition of 1900, and leads to the Grand and Petit Palaces and the Champs Elysees.
see it from river bank, see it from bridge nearby, see it on the river boat. dance on it. Most beautiful bridge in paris or in the whole world( can not say that as only travlled half the world).

Simply Stunning. This bridge across the Seine is a short walk from Les Invalides. It has lovely golden statues adorning it from start to finish that make it a photographers dream. The walk across was easy & there are large pedestrian walkways. Well worth a detour for a look & don't forget to take your camera.

Beautiful bridge in Paris... Pont de Alexandre III.. It's the most beautiful pont = bridge in Paris..
Classic architecture, the scenery over the Seine River.. wind blows over your hair..
I will miss that moment.. If God let me to visit Paris again, I'll definitely back to see it again..
A must see. After visiting the Eiffel Tower it's a short 20min walk to the Alexandre bridge- well worth it a great photo opportunity especially on a sunny day

Not a bridge too far. If there is any bridge in Paris you cross, this surely must be it. Wonderful statues adorning the bridge make it a wonderful place to snap pictures. Pont Neuf comes close as well.
The views on the right bank show the Grand Palais and to the left band the impressive Les Invalides. Awesome views of the Seine.
What a elegant bridge!. This is a very elegantly decorated bridge. A must see when in Paris. We first saw it from a river boat cruise but walked there after the cruise to get a better look
Go there late afternoon.. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Go there late afternoon, when the golden sculptures are beautifully lit by the golden sunlight.

Beautiful construction. This bridge was made to celebrate the Franco-Russian Alliance in 1892. It has a astonishing iron structure and various sculptures that makes it a perfect spot to contamplate the Seine and take some pictures. Worth the visit.
So so beautiful. This has to be the most beautiful bridge in the world. Best when viewed from river cruise. Absolutely beautiful. So many photo ops.

Beautiful Bridge. We came here and walked across while waiting for a nearby afternoon Cruise. This is a great bridge with many architectural features. It has wide pedestrian paths and has many photo opportunities. One of many bridges worth walking!

nice view!!!. i have to agree with everyone that this is the prettiest bridge i've seen in Paris. Visit if you have time! nice sculptures with views of eiffel tower on one side and grand palace on one end.
Nice place for wedding photos. This is the most beutiful bridge in Paris and one of the best spots to take good photos for newly weds
Its a bridge. A pretty bridge but nothing to get excited about. Not as good as Tower Bridge ;-). Crosses the Seine.

A fantastic bridge, my favorite in Paris. OK, It is a bridge. But wow - the sculptures and design are so very cool. If you are in Paris you will see it and you will most likely cross on foot or by tour bus.

Magnificent example of 19th century architecture. One of my favourite brige in Paris. Very Art Nouveau, flamboyant with magnificent views of the river as well as the Grand Paris and Hotel des Invalides. I would recommend to walk across, wide enough and very safe.
Bridge as art. This bridge is worth seeing, with its fabulous architectural detail and bright gold sculpture. Bring your camera!
Must see at night. Gorgeous bridge at night, either by itself or with Eiffel Tower in background. Must-see place when in Paris. Bring a tripod for good night pictures.

Lovely walk and view. Great walk from invalides through the bridge and onto the grand palais and champs elysees.
The views are stunning, overlooking the Seine and also able to see the Eiffel tower from a distance. Highly recommended.

You have to love it when you see it!. One of my favorite locations in Paris, so charming and romantic, the statues are amazing and I do not know when I like it more - in the morning, at dusk or at night... So special...

Magnific bridge !. This is a very charming bridge in the city center of Paris. The ornaments on the bridge are spectacular !! Paris is so big that you have to spend weeks and weeks there if you want to see everything. This bridge is a must see !!
Beautiful. This bridge is so beautiful and charming, may be the best in Paris. The view is great from it towards the Tower for pictures. The ornaments on the bridge are both gothic and charming.

Spectacular. Chances are you'll be needing to cross this bridge on your way from Invalides (The War Museum, The Rodin Museum) to the Place de la Concorde and Champs Elysees (or vice versa), but the bridge itself is well worth seeking out on its own.It's a gorgeous, ostentatious monument to the Franco-Russian Alliance of 1892; built deliberately to not obtrude on its more celebrated surroundings, it nonetheless outshines them in its own right. With its sweeping views of the Seine, art deco lampposts, cherubs, lions and the famous, towering Pegasus and Fames sculptures, it is possibly the most beautiful structure in central Paris, save perhaps for the nearby dome at the Tomb of Napoleon. Georgeous.
A beautiful bridge. You really want to walk across it and take pictures as you go. You can take the metro to Invalides and walk over to the right side of the Seine.

Just Beautiful. I loved it completly. I went in January so it was so cold! But this place has magic of his own and if you can visit with your partner it can be also really romantic. I stayed there for almost and hour and a half looking the river and the Effiel Tower. Great place to have a kiss.

Alexandre III. One of the most beautiful bridges I have ever been to!!! Magnificent details over the River Seine. The view of the Les Invalides is spectacular. Make sure to be there at sunset with your love one, it is very romantic like the city as a whole. Love Paris....

Grandiose. Took the Hop On Hop Off Bus to see a lot of places in Paris and Pont Alexandre III was one of the main attractions. The details were excellent with the huge posts/columns planking the entry points on each side. It's decorated with intricate carvings. Lined with 22 candelabras. A must see place to visit when in Paris. Has a great view of Seine. It connects the Champs Élysées, Invalides and Eiffel Tower areas.

Magnificence at its best. This bridge portrays the grandiosity of the French aristocrats. A masterpiece in itself!! Make sure you take the stairs down to Seine to see enjoy every aspect of the bridge.

Lovely bridge!. I went there early in the morning. It's clean, beautiful and fantastic! It's very close to Les Invalides Hotel which also offer great views.Pont Alexandre III Bridge is a must see when visiting Paris.

Pont Alexandre III Bridge. This is a magnificent bridge over the River Seine with many guilded statues along each side and the most beautiful street lighting. We visited it on a walking tour in the rain but it did not destroy its beauty. It was built for the 1892 France Russian Alliance. The French certainly know how to build lasting monuments to history.

My favourite bridge in Paris. Paris has so many bridges crossing the Seine...some plain, some stoic, some sturdy but this one is elegant, solid but delicate and sings to me. I have walked over it, walked beside and under it, travelled under it by boat and everytime it is the one that I just go oooh over...it is beautiful.
Beautiful and Breathtaking. A must see- a wonderful delight! This is one of Paris' must see structures- i tis beautiful and breathtaking.
As lovely as in the pictures. A must in Paris...! Great views over the Seine and the Eiffel tower, and just a beautiful bridge especielly on a sunny day.

Window on the Past. I had so much fun with this bridge! The lamps and the sculpture are so representative of 1900 and the Belle Epoque. Paris was the centre of all that was culturally exciting, and all that esprit overflows into the design of the bridge. Paris was self-confident and in this bridge you can sense that when built, its builders, designers, decorators knew that all things were possible.

Pictures don't do it justice.. If you're on a guided tour or reading from a guide book, it will certainly bring you here. I viewed this both from a driving tour and also from the river cruise and discovered that the boat provided us with the best views. To me, it seemed a lot bigger and more lavish-looking that what the pictures here show. It definitely stood out as the most beautiful and ornate bridge here, even though all of the bridges have some sort of decoration. You'll know it when you see it. On its corners are giant, golden statues and it is also characterized by interesting street lamps.

Bridge with an classy, old world aesthetics. Architecturally its difficult to find a bridge more beautiful than this. With its golden framework, and symmetrically defined portrait, this bridge has a classy charm that exceeds the expectation of how beautiful a bridge can be.

Amazing Bridge!!. Pont Alexandre III is amazing, and you gotta see it in person! I was stunned with it from the movie "Midnight in Paris", in the end of the movie, Owen Wilson walked with a French girl on this bridge at night. The bridge is SPLENDID! It's even better visiting here at night, because the Eiffel Tower is exactly sparkling on the hour and you will totally have a great view from the bridge!
Favourite bridge in Paris. Stunning. Lovely architecture, Asian wedding photos, Petit and Grand Palaces at its feet. What's not to like

Exceptional !. Based on tripadvisor's reviews I decided to visit the bridge & I wasn't dissapointed as I spent around 40 minutes on the bridge enjoying all the details of it!I loved the sunset view of Eiffel Tower from Pont Alexandre, it was sooo beautiful.
Pretty Bridge!. We saw it during our Seine River cruise and it looked spectacular! Take good note of the heads between the pillars!

Loveliest in Paris. .....and that says a lot! Standing in the center you look at the beautiful Les Invalides on one side and the Palais Royale on the other. The gorgeous gold statutes stand out against those oftentimes Parisian grey skies. A perfect spot to watch the river boats beneath you.
beautiful. Beautiful and central definetly not to miss when in Paris. Close to both Le Grand Palais and Le Petit Palais

Mesmerising. The most beautiful bridge I have ever seen. Simply amazing, unlike anything i have ever seen. I only had the pleasure of driving over it, but even then it was still perfect. It looked really clean and well maintained and the gold statues shining in the sun was the icing on the cake. Such a really nice thing to see I wish my partner and I had time to go back for a closer visit.

Stunning. We took the BatoBus to the Pont Alexandre lll and it was really magnificent. The day was full of sunshine which seemed to reflect off the gold trimming of the bridge. Was really amazing to experience first hand.

Even more stunning in person. The view of Les Invalides when approaching this bridge is stunning. The gold, the black-and-gold - beautiful! One of the best photo opportunities in this most lovely of cities.
Nice. A nice looking bridge which sticks out in my mind of the numerous bridges in Paris. It looked quite well maintained and perhaps newly painted when I saw it,
A bridge. Takes you from one side of the river to the other while also letting boats pass under. I'm quite surprised the french dont charge people onto this bridge.

The shine in the Town of Lights. In my first night in Paris I have gone to see the Sena. All the bridges was wonderful illuminated and also the ships on Sena.After few days, walking to the Tour Eiffel I saw this bridge ''Pont Alexandre III'' in a middle of a sunshine day and the effect was incredible. The golden statuary groups looks alive in light of sun, the perfections of forms, the aspect of attitude was changed every second in efects of light versus shadows! I spend a lot of time to wondering that the sculptors had in mind this, or this is from the love and admiration from sky to earth-worker's masterpiece! Because it is a masterpiece of arts in sculpture, engineering and construction!
Stunning. Beautiful to see at night from a glass boat tour. We took the Bato bus and found it a nice escape from the rain sometimes
An elegant ornate bridge. Yes, it's beautiful and historic. It's real beauty can be seen at night when the sculptures are illuminated.
Beautiful. It s very beautiful, especially when it rains in Paris. It s a pleasure to have a walk around and through the bridge.

Just Amazing!. Simply amazing! The gold, the ornaments, the architecture, the history... it was incredible. No matter how you see it - from far away, while being on it, a block away or even in a cruise below of it, it will blow your mind!
Enchanted atmosphere. At sunset this is a great spot! The views are stunning and the bridge is a major part of french history.

Gorgeous bridge. I've ever seen.
If you have a chance, it is the best to see it from Bateau-Mouches I think.
Especially, view in night would be impressive.
Wonderful bridge over the Seine. Definitely to be seen. One of the most beautiful bridge over the river Seine. Just take the time to check all the details on the sculptures. Impressive.

Unlike any other bridge. It would be difficult to accurately describe this bridge. It must be seen. If you saw the movie Midnight in Paris, you saw a brief glimpse of it in the final scene. Enormous gold gilded statues, exquisitely designed lamps, playful cherubs, etc. As I said, it must be seen.

Magnificent!. One of the most incredible bridges I've ever seen! It's definitely worth a zoom shot for the splendid ornaments decorating it! The angels and the lions adorning the bridge are my fave! The bridge suits like a glove in that area. I had a vague idea where it was to be found, but when we arrived there I was deeply touched, surprised and amazed. We walked on it, under it, admired it from the bateaux-mouche, zoomed it in pictures, touched it!It's such a warm and balanced structure! It gave me a feeling of fulfillment and harmony. The style, the colours, the length - all intermingle just perfectly!The first time we walked on it was one evening and that's one of my dearest memories from Paris: all the lights in the street on, the Seine flowing peacefully, the moon mirroring it, the Eiffel tower "rising" afar....a piece of my soul remained there that night! :) It seemed so dream-like!!!! Such a romantic picture!
So beautiful. Went over this in a cycle taxi (great fun) and under it in a boat trip - absolutely beautiful - from whatever angle you are lucky enough to see it from

Beautiful Design. This bridge is spectacular due to the beautiful sculptures situated on and around it. To the west is the Eiffel Tower, offering many photo opportunities while the other direction is full of wonderful sights, including the Obelisk, Plaza de la Concorde, Grand Palais. A nice way to spend a couple of hours strolling down Champs Ellysees in the afternoon! We ended up walking down Rue de Rivoli all the way to the Louvre, the beautiful architecture and monuments are mind-boggling!

very nice. The day was perfect for it...go on a sunny day in September...not many tourists and you can stroll comfortably. There is a nice guy who sells ice cream.. it is very picturesque, and the ice cream is affordable.

Best bridge across Seine. This is the best among one of the several bridges across Seine. It must be one of the most luxurious bridge ever made with respect to architecture and sculptures. It is located near Grand/Petit Palais and we walked through this bridge while going towards the Grand Palais. We had the great opportunity to enjoy the bridge while it was raining - quite romantic!!

My favourite bridge in the whole world. This is the most beautiful bridge, try and take it in for the sunset as the photos you will take are incredible.The detail at each end of the bridge is worth asking zoom shots so you can see the intricate details and the features along the way are gorgeous as well. At the centre of the bridge you can get a great shot of the featured figure holding the flame with the Eiffel Tower in the background.Go for a stroll, fall in love!

Well worth a visit on your way around the city.. Its worth putting a walk across the bridge into your schedule for a quick photo opportunity. We did it whilst walking down the Champs Elysee towards the Lourve.
Lovely bridge. Excellent views, lovely to stroll left or right to Hotel de Invalides or the Grande Palais. Really extravagant bridge.

Caught off guard. by this bridges stunning beauty.While we were shopping for art around the St Michel district, we were in an Art Gallery owned by a man (coincidentally) named Alexander. He showed us a painting he had recently made of Alexander Bridge, telling us it was Paris's most magnificent bridge. The bridge was honestly something my wife and I had overlooked, so we decided we should go back to that area and see it.Wow. I'm so glad we did. The detail on this bridge, the bright golds, the vibrant crowd, all made this an experience. I would recommend stopping by and seeing it. You could start with the Arc de Triomphe, walk down the Rue de Champs Elysees, pass the Grand and Petit Palais, right up to the bridge for a wonderful, romantic aftenroon stroll.

Well, it's a very good looking bridge. A popular place to take pictures. It's very close to the Grand and Petit Palais, and also not too far from the Invalides (great view from the bridge), and on the other bank - the Palaises and the Champ Elysees.

Beautiful to see. Situated right near the 'musee De invalides' this is a lovely site to see... A beautiful feature of the city and the history around it is also interesting too. A fantastic site from the eiffel tower..
A Must See. You must go see this. It is amazing and beautiful. The view is also fantastic but the bridge itself is amazing

Beautiful bridge across the Seine. One of the most important bridges in Paris with beautiful architecture and golden statues. You should also visit this famous bridge in the evening when the city lights is changing the view
Absolutely stunning. This is a magnificently beautiful bridge. The amazing detail is breathtaking and it's close to Champs Élysées. A must see!
Beautiful bridge by the Palace. Enjoyed walking over this bridge at night enjoying all the lights and viewing the Palace Well worth the trip.

A true Parisian masterpiece. This is by far my favourite bridge in Paris. The architecture and statues adorning it are to be marvelled at. It gives a true Parisian feel to the area - opulent, interesting and magnificent

Not the oldest, but surely one of the most beautiful. While Pont Neuf is the oldest bridge in Paris, I find this one the most beautiful with it's lamps, gilt and the two banks it connects...so worth crossing by foot.

More than a bridge. Most everyone rates Pont Alexandre III excellent and they are right. Only Pais has bridges that rate as art work. Weather was rainy, so no great pictures. We left Paris on Air France bus to Orly and drove across the bridge and got one more view of the Eiffle Tower. This was fitting, because several days ago we got our first view of the bridge from high up the Eiffle Tower at night.

Beautiful. This is a wonderful bridge with great views along the Seine. The bridge itself is adorned with decorative statues and lamps. The best approach is to stroll down Av. de Winston Churchill and you will be greeted with one of the finest views (at ground level) in Paris. On either side of you are the Grand and Petit Palais, while directly in front is the Hotel National de Invalides, with the golden dome of Église Saint-Louis des Invalides rising above it.

So typically Parisian!. This lovely bridge represents so much of what Paris is about -- it is functional but beautiful, lovely from a number of vantage points, of historical interest, works for singles, couples and families, and promotes a leisurely stroll from the Left Bank to the Right Bank (or vice versa). Great views!

Beautiful area. We loved the gold detail on the bridge at Pont Alexandre III. It was lovely to walk along the bridge and check out the vendors. We also went underneath it while on a riverboat, which offered lovely views as well.
great view. great view of beautifull bridge,nice stop on a way to eifel tower,nice area for romantic walks :) but weather must be fine otherwise waste of time :D
Best looking bridge in Paris. This is probably the best lokking bridge in the whole Paris area. It is located close to many other attractions, so don't miss to see it!

A true night vision. After touring all day, we stumbled onto this delightful architecture just as the lights began to flicker on. It was a stunning nighttime vision. Worth the view plus Eiffel Tower in the backdrop of photos.

Gorgeous. Beautiful bridge.This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris (for me).You can't visit Paris without taking a look to this bridge.The best moment to see the bridge is when you are taking the tour in the Seine- it's a good perspective.
Stunning Bridge-a must!!. walking over to Petit Palace- and Grand PalaceWe loved the architecture and beautiful Art Novelle design
wow. I just loved this bridge it is fantastic so romantic it has to be seen. the views from here are great and some wonderful photo opportunitys to be had

A bridge that captures the essence of Paris. If you are a photographer this is the Bridge for you. The designs of the lamps and statuary on the bridge make for memorable photographs with the Grand and Petite Palace at one end. The final scenes of "Midnight in Paris" were shot on this bridge.
The amazing Paris. I want to see Paris again.I liked it.I think it is a very pleasant place.you should go to here at the earliest.. :)

I live just a block away. I feel it is such a priviledge to live in the heart of Paris. The bridge is now victim of degradations and that is too bad, but it stays one of the most beautiful bridge of Paris.

Genial!. its a very nice bridge to pass by, look at and take pictures of, but the trip wont last long since there is not much to do...if you go under it in the bateau mouche, the view will be breathtaking

beautiful bridge. we were there on a Saturday morning.
The bridge have a very lovely view of the river and the under the bridge there was a little flea market with antiques and various novelty stuff.
I wouldn't recommend going there on purpose but if you’re in the area, be sure not to miss it.

Beautiful bridge and views. It was a beautiful bridge and worth taking photos of if you are walking by. I wouldn't recommend going out of your way for it though. I thought the lock bridge was more interesting, but that's just my opinion.

Stunning. I wanted to take a trip to Paris to see the fantastic architecture and design, and the Pont Alexandre III is beautiful. It is extremely oppulent, and you can't just 'take a walk past it' - you end up sitting on the wall and just staring.
Highly recommended.

great story. Taking a boat ride on the Seine, several things stand out as overwhelmingly beautiful: Notre Dame on Ile de la Cite, the Eiffel Tower, and the Pont Alexandre III. This single span bridge developed for the World's Fair as an engineering marvel is quite elaborate. A great site in Paris.
Ornate!. A very beautiful bridge and a great place to take picture of the river seine and sorroundings. We enjoyed walking to the bridge and people watching and taking pictures.
Exquisite bridge!. This bridge is by far the most beautiful I have ever seen. The artwork and gold detailing on this bridge is remarkable. Definitely worth stopping to see this attraction.

Breath-taking Bridge. We happened upon this bridge and immediately knew what we were looking at by the beautiful gold statues. It is definitely worth putting on your "to see" list when visiting Paris.
The grandest bridge in Paris. This bridge is simply beautiful -- elegant in design, and located on a particularly interesting stretch of the Seine.

Fairytale bridge. We saw the Pont Alexandre by road and we passed under it on a Seine river cruise, i have never seen a more beautiful bridge it is like something you would see in a disney princess fairytale, i was glad i got to see it from both perspectives as we got a real appreciation for its grandure.

a classic. a clasiic place to visit, I never get bored of this bridge, the only bridge with 1 arch, and was given by russia to paris, it is ideally situated between the champs elysees and the trocadero.
one of my prefered places in paris

Photographic Dream. Highly recommended if you like taking pictures with a paris landmark in the background. Many picture opportunities on the bridge. I could have stayed for hours setting up my shots... Highly recommended.
Beautiful bridge. I saw the Bridge in the night and it made a huge impression on me. By next visit in Paris I must see it during the day.
Beautiful bridge a must see!. This is the one bridge you do not want to miss. Movies are usually shot here, recent one was something's got to give with Jack Nicholson and Dianne Keaton

Beautifull. One of the most amazing things I ever seen.can't put it in to words.a must see when in Paris.
Walk across once then back again, and again, there is so much detail to take in.

The most beutiful bridge in Paris. For certain, this is the most wonderful bridge in the city. Altought it might not be as romantic as Pont des Arts, this one sure is the most beautiful. And, from there, you can see the Eiffel Tower very close to you, together with the Gran Palais and the Hotel des Invalides.

my favourite Paris Bridge. from the Esplanade des Invalides to the Champs-Elysées, this beautiful bridge is certainly one of the most attractive walks in Paris. And views from there, at any season or time of the day or night are simply too good to be true!
A beautiful and photogenic bridge. One of Paris's most beautiful bridges. Recommended to visit both in daytime and at night with all the lights on everywhere. Great views are a sure thing.

Pont Alexander III. Such a scenic bridge. Nice view towards Grand palais and Petit palais. Eiffel tower is also visible from the bridge. It's not the best place to hang up with friend but stopping by won't be a bad idea =).
Pont Alexandre III. Lovely. You can see it from a boat on cruising on the Seine river, or just to cross it by feet. A lot of antique lamps, gold statues and a nice view.

I know I'm in Paris hanging over this bridge. The Alexandre is my favorite spot in Paris. It's the first place I head to upon arriving. I feel I'm truly in Paris seeing the emblazoned statues and intricate decoration. It is a must-see before the Louvre or Champs Elysee or Place de la Concorde. It epitomizes Paris.
most ornate. Being there felt like you were in a scene in a movie - wait, it has been in many movies! Magnificent and not to be missed.

Nice!. As bridges go - yep it's pretty special. I wouldn't spend all day staring at it myself, but we walked over it on the way to Le Louvre (not the quickest way from where we were stopping but thought it worth a visit) and was't disappointed. Very ornate and pretty.
Most ornate bridge - a must-see!. Amazingly beautiful details and scultures along the bridge makes this a lovely walk along my way to Musee d'Orsay. A prelude to the beauty of arts ahead.

Nice place for a walk with your 6 yr old kid. My 6 yr old boy and I loved our walk across this bridge. It was a bit cold when we meandered our way across the bridge, but its beauty led us to pause and enjoy it. The green patina that covers the bridge is simply beautiful.

One of the most impressive bridges over the Seine. The bridge is very beautiful, interestingly built, and well decorated.
The view of Les Invalides from it is truly great.
Don't miss it during your on-foot visit of Paris.
Great views. the views from the bridge are great and it's a perfect stopping point on your stroll down the Champs Elysees

Must see bridge in Paris...the most extravagent ornate bridge i've ever seen. Just a fabulous site in Paris...makes you feel like a million bucks just walking across amongst all the gold leaf and statues

The most beautiful and intricate bridge i've ever seen!. A wonderful bridge, spanning the Seine and connecting some key Paris monuments. The Grand Palace on one side and Les Invalides and Napoleons tomb on the other, with a view of the Eiffel Tower in the distance. So the views from this bridge are great! The bridge itself is also very grand, with wonderful sculptured lamps on either side, and a wide walkway. There was a model having a topless photo shoot on the bridge when I visited, which was a highlight! Not a must visit, but a great way to cross the city. Absolutely worth seeing if its on the route or close by.

A beautiful sight day or night. The view of the Eiffel Tower from this bridge was amazing at night when everything was lit up. during the daytime, the details on the bridge were wonderful to see up close. It also offered great views of Les Invalides, Granf Palais and Petite Palais. Overall, a great spot to take pictures.

A gorgeous bridge. I saw a man propose there. Personally i would not, it's an incredible bridge but with the traffic it's not that romantic. If you are looking for a romantic bridge try Pont des Arts.
fabulous ornate bridge. the approach to the bridge is fantastic. At night it is lovely when lit up. You will get a great view from the river
Great views across the bridge. Great views of the Seine and Eiffel Tower and fantastic photo opportunities day and night. Fantastic architecture of the bridge.

SPEECHLESS!!!!. It was a very cold early Sunday morning, the Seine river is high and it was windy. It didn't matter to me because the view was worth it. The statues are so life-like and the gas lamps are so unique. I love every angle of this bridge!!!!
A very special bridge.. It's the fewest bridges that bites just as firmly as the Pont Alexandre III bridge, beautiful is probably the most comprehensive words.

Magnificent... Absolutely love this bridge! this is the place if you are into photography or photo taking. Walk towards Les Invalides, enjoy the architecture and the gold statues that shine brightly under the sun. Magnificent!

Beauty in public architecture. The statues, sculptures and motifs on the bridge are each works of art and belong in a museum or art gallery - a must to be seen.The gilding on the statues is in perfect order and they shine and glow in even the most dull light. Do walk it for the sheer joy of walking a work of art
Go here at sundown. It is my favorite spot in Paris to sit and watch the Tower light up. The gas lamps add a beauty you can not find many places in the world. This is a place I will never forget.

Shutterbug Dream!!. If there was a point where you would want to be dropped for five minutes to take pictures of Paris….this would be it. From this beautiful piece of architecture you can look to the south for a great view of the Army Museum and Napoleon’s Tomb, to the west you get the Eiffel Tower in your shots, to the North you get the Grand and Petit Palaces, and to the West a good view of the Concorde Bridge with the Seine flowing underneath. As ornate and beautiful as she is, she makes for a great foreground in your images with these incredible backgrounds.

A monument!. It was just after the snow storm of January 2013. The wind was cold, the sky grey, the Seine high, ...However, walking through this bridge made me feel like in the 19th century, for the universal exposition. Magnificent view on the Grand Palais.
Gateway to Les Invalides. This is the way one should walk towards Les Invalides - in the sunshine the golden statues on top the bridge shine brightly.
Walked around. Saw it while on a tour, good for taking pictures, my girlfriend liked it very much. Saw a Chinese couple get married on it in the middle of a freezing day :)

classic. ashsmith92 (previous reviewer) needs to review his life not this wonderful bridge! Nothing to offer tourists! It's a wonderful piece of work with great statuary, fabulous views and atmosphere by the bucketful. If you're fed up with this mate get yourself booked into a Swiss clinic; your life is over!
A work of art outdoors. A pleasure to be in Paris. Walking across this bridge is to feel the history of the city and delight in the Seine and its boats.

Even better at night. I have visited this bridge many times and it has a style to it that is remarkable, as well as great views of the Petit and Grand Palais and Les Invalides. But I also recommend that you see it at night with the lights on and the golden dome of Napoleon's tomb in the background. For added interest go down the steps and see the highlighted sculptures on the bridge.

My favourite bridge. I love the statues on this bridge and it is my favourite of all the bridges in Paris. It has a great view of the Eiffel Tower. On the left bank there is Les Invalides and on the right bank the Petit Palais and the Grand Palais.

The wealth of the bridge will blow your mind. This stunning bridge connects the areas of Champs-Elysees and Invalides along with the area of Eiffel tower. On the other side of the Seine you have Grand Palais and Petite Palais.The art nouveau lamps on the bridge are amazingly beautiful, not to mention all the glory of gold on the bridge. On Seine river cruise you can have a good look at the Nymphs on the sides of the bridge.This bridge is a must see!

Pretty in Grey. The pont of course is full of tourists even in the winter, but it is wide and accommodating. The lavish gold decorations are a lovely bright addition to the grey and rainy winters in Paris.

Favourite Bridge. Definitely my favourite bridge in Paris and most probably favourite ever. We have taken a close look at bridge particularly on the Siene river cruise which we did through the Bato bus (seperate review).The golden statues at the end of the bridge are magnificent. Nothing more to add - simply a must see in Paris.
Golden Sculptures. how could anyone not be blown away by this bridge.( and the amazing places at either end. its truly spectacular...

My favourite!. Tis bridge was my favourite memory from our first visit to Paris in 1992, and each time we return it is a must see for me. I just love the antique lights and the grandeur. Don't miss this one.

Great bridge. This is a magnificent bridge with some great sculptures at all 4 points, these are all gold. It is the perfect stop on a walk to the Eiffel Tower or one of the many Paris attractions. It is one of the significant bridges in Paris, so it is a must-see and given the location you really can't miss it. Beware the street vendors are everywhere and tend to be pests, not as bad as Rome, but not far short. The authorities in Paris really need to do something about these guys. Overall a great bridge that you will probably see if you are out and about in Paris.
Pont Alexandre III Bridge. This is a must-see beautiful arch bridge spanning the Seine River. There are gold statutes on either end and in the middle. Definitely the prettiest bridge in Paris.
Famous and Gilded.... This is one of the most famous bridges in Paris, but I was actually more taken with some of the less well known ones. It is a 'must-see', but don't miss the others.

Beware of the Gypsies!. Don't fall for it if a gypsy comes up to you and says you dropped a gold ring or something else of value... they're just looking for you to give them money for a cheap piece of crap that's not worth 2 cents. I read about all their scams before I went, so I was prepared. I saw them "operating" on the other side of the bridge with other tourists too!

My favourite bridge in all of Paris!. I love this bridge- it's so beautiful! I would say that a visit is a must. I would also suggest that you continue up and along it to les Invalides/ musee de l'Armee. Excellent and interesting place. Recently took a group of students and they enjoyed their visit.
Don't miss the statues. Beautifully decorated bridge.Fantastic sculptures on both sides. The view of the river is also fantastic.
My favourite bridge in Paris. Such a beautiful looking bridge. Took me about 40 mins to walk to it from the other side of Paris... but totally worth it!

fantastic architecture and view. wow! such a beautiful bridge.
The sculptures, the lamps, the view, everything about this bridge is beautiful.
It is the most beautiful bridge in Paris.
I would highly recommend taking a look and a few photos here.

How do you review a bridge? Well.... This is one famous bridge and it is amazing. Even in retrospect, thinking about how tall the pedestals are for those cherubs, I'm amazed. This bridge is of course truly amazing when you are right on it (and with great photo ops of the Eiffel Tower, although it's hard to pay attention to anything but the bridge). Named in honor of a Russian Czar, I somehow remember that it dates to Napoleonic times and that brief time when Napoleon and the Czar were good friends. It's got gilded everything and has to be the most over-the-top bridge I've ever seen.Passing underneath it on some type of boat excursion is also wondrous. There are these black, cream and gold wag decorations on the side, attempting to give it both glamour and a neoclassical style.Looking at it from Bridge de la Concorde (sp?) is another great view, the lights on the bridge look tiny, but they're actually quite adequately sized. Again, that view (from Concord) gives you the spire of the American Church in Paris, the Eiffel Tower, and the Trocadero (which gleams like the Acropolis in the distance) all in one shot. That's the bridge where Woody shot the opening frame of Midnight in Paris, capturing Pont Alexandre III from a distance, as if to say "in Paris this sort of bridge is quite normal." And of course, it is. One gets so accustomed to various forms of architectural beauty in Paris that sometimes one doesn't stop to think about it.But, it's a must-see on any first visit to Paris and the walk to it (from Concord if you like or from Eiffel Tower) is worth it. Wandering back and forth over Parisien ponts can be a theme for an entire day...
My favorite bridge in Paris. This bridge is beautiful and the story behind it is very interesting. We learn more about it as we took the boat to do a tour on the Seine.

The Bridge From Midnight In Paris. That's the only reason I decided to come visit this bridge, and it really is a nice bridge. Lots of characters, with the different monuments, and so many different and fantastic angles to take pictures of the bridge with other monuments in the distance
Take a walk on that bridge!. Take the time to cross that bridge when you are in Paris. There are a lot of details to see when you get near by this beautiful peace!
Beautiful. This is such a beautiful bridge. The golden figurines just take your breath away. A place I always revisit when I am in Paris!
Most beautiful bridge of Paris!. maybe is the most beautiful bridge of the world. The atmosphere is so great, romantic, classic. You must go there!Take a walk, enjoy the view, it is Paris!

Wonderful!. I spent some time walking around this area and took a river cruise that went through here as well. I definitely would reccommend going a couple of times, at different points in the day, as the area seems to transform as the day progresses. Bring a camera as you will want to take a lot of pictures yet also make sure you watch out for pick pockets. As with most areas where there are a lot of tourists, pick pockets are common. Just stay alert and, as another reviewer noted, ignore those who try to come up to you. Regardless, it really is a great place to go!

Nice stroll along the Seine. We spend a while and walked along the Seine to the Pont Alexandre III. Weather was nice and we enjoyed a lot. Took quite a few photos too. Only nasty thing was those people who tried that "ring trick" luckily we were warned before hand, so we just kept on walking and ignored all those "pardon madame" shouts. Must say that it was getting bit bored when these people just kept on coming one after another.But the bridge was ad beautiful as always and very much worth to visit on night time too!
You can't miss it!. Beautiful & beautiful area with so many museums... Very beautify night club just behind the bridge. Don not miss it (event it is very "people")
magnificent structure. it was such a wonderfull structure,never seen like that before.located right in the center of paris, with those statues covered in gold
Beautiful. The bridge is really nice and from there, you can already see Eiffel Tower. Enjoy walking and taking photos there.

Catch at sunset. We enjoyed the late winter afternoon for taking snaps of the river and the gold statues in the soft light. All of Paris was out walking with the children. Nearby were the Christmas markets on the Champs Élysées.
Good, but not that magnificent.. I was on the batobus and the boat sailed through the bridge. The bridge itself was nice colored, golden. But it's not that magnificent.金碧辉煌，但是也只不过金灿灿的而已。不能说它特别惊艳我。

the most romantic bridge !!!. Pont Alexandre III is the most romantic bridge in Paris. Visit it at night where the gold of the statues shines and stand in the middle of it to have a fantastic view of the river Seine and the Eiffel Tower.

Probably the most beautiful bridge in the world. What can I say about this bridge other than it is simply stunning and magic. I actually proposed to my now fiance here at night which I would suggest to see at night, Fantastic picure destination.

Helpful tips to avoid trouble in Paris. This is a wonderful way to catch some classic Parisian views. This review is intended to assist in basic security during your sightseeing walks around this immense city. There is a LOT of covert deceptive tricks being played on unwary tourists around here. 1) THE PETITION TRICK: Young, attractive, innocent looking Romanian teenagers may approach you asking you to sign a petition to support the handicapped and disabled. They usually operate in teams of two around the hottest tourist spots - below the Eiffel Tower, Champs-Elysees, Arc de Triomphe etc. DO NOT engage or sign this petition - it is a simple but effective scam. I watched several of these scams unfold as unwitting tourists signed the petition - and suddenly the girls change from nice to intensely demanding as you are now obliged to "make a donation" in support of the FAKE cause they pretend to represent. They purposely don't tell you how much you need to pay, so the confused and now embarrassed tourists open their wallets to ask which note they should pay (I am not making this up - I watched in disbelief at how many good hearted tourists fell prey to this), and the girls removed a 50 euro note, said sweetly "thank you", and continued onwards looking for their next victim. The tourist is left standing there stunned and unsure if they were just tricked, or, if they made a real and expensive donation. 2) THE FAKE GOLD RING TRICKSTER: A Parisian male walks past you and picks up a golden ring that is strangely at your feet. (You didn't see the first bit where he quietly dropped the ring at your feet without you seeing). He now presents the ring to you, and says in a smooth French accent, "Is this yours? I just found it at your feet.". Naturally you say "No". Well, the lovely Frenchman insists on sharing his good luck at finding a gold ring, and he hands it to you. Despite your protests, he is insistent you should have it - and he even points out the quality with the gold carat marking inside the ring band. He then walks away and then turns back moments later and suggests just maybe you could give him some Euros as a goodwill gesture. Once again, many tourists feel obliged - and hand over some money. The rings are completely worthless and fake. Sometimes the "Ring Trickster" has an accomplice who will also pick-pocket you, or your friends while you are being distracted by the generosity of a stranger handing you a gold ring.Enjoy your stay in this amazing city, and just be mindful to keep your valuables in a zipped up bag, that hangs on your front - not your back - so you can keep your eyes on it at all times. Safe journeys!
Beautifully kept bridge posts. Well maintained old bridge with carved statues on every corner; very appealing with bright gold paint.
Beautiful Spot. A must do in Paris ! This is one of the most beautiful bridges!!It is great to stroll across this bridge and get lost in the beauty of the beautiful city.

On the Midnight in Paris route. We had a great time doing the Midnight in Paris walk - and one of the big attractions was the bridge! We managed to do the entire walk and it should be on the list of things to do in Paris! We even sat on the steps where Gil was picked up by the old Peugeot! And there were lots of other folks looking for the same steps! Then we had a delightful lunch at a small bistro right across from the steps. What a fun experience!

The most beautiful and romatic bridge in europe!. Wverythig, the decoration, location, lamps. And people on the bridge are extremely romatic!! The bridge is over sena river and you can have abeautiful view of effiel tower. The views are so different from day time and at night!!
Beautiful!. Its probably 1 of the most eye catching bridge in Europe or even in the world. Gold abundantly used on the bridge especially both ends. I took quite a number of shots on it. :)
City of Light. This bridge that crosses the Seine is what makes Paris the most beautiful city on earth. Take a walk and see it, it's golden lights are magic

Beautiful. How to skip this stop on the most romantic bridge in Paris.The architecture is a masterpiece of Art Nouveau, ornaments, golden statues, cherubsYou feel transported back in history, grease, beauty, and majestic
Best view of Paris. A must visit place in Paris. The view from the Grand Palace of the bridge and Les Invalides is just awesome.

Stunning bridge with a view of the Eiffel. My favorite of all the bridges in Paris. The lovely orbed streetlights that line this bridge make it a very picturesque and romantic location, and it's no wonder that it regularly appears in movies and photos of the city. The best time to visit is just after sunset, during the "blue hour" where there is a blue cast of twilight over the city and the warm yellow lights are all starting to come on. There is a great view of the tower from here, making it a nice place to propose, as well. Unfortunately it is often crowded with tourists, so if you want the bridge to yourself, try stopping by early in the morning near sunrise.
Enjoy a stroll. My favorite bridge in Paris!! Watch for pick pockets and the gold ring scam. The views are impressive in every direction. A real Parisian experience.

A giant Wedgewood masterpiece. while at this magnificent bridge we saw two brides being photographed & numerous couples lingering to watch the river cruise boats & view the Eiffel Tower etc in the distance. The entrance sculptures and the elaborate Wedgewood style trims on the sides of this bridge make it a must see.
Beautiful landmark. If you are taking a walk around the city do not miss this bridge. It is not one of the many, it is THE bridge. Take a look.
Beautiful bridge. One of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen, especially at night when the lights are on. The artwork on the bridge is simply stunning.

Lovers. If you go here with your partner, be sure and take a small padlock! At the Place de la Concorde end of the bridge, you will find the statue of an little water nymph listening to a shell. There is a tradition for lovers to cement their love by fixing a padlock to her to signify that their love will never be undone.................
Simply Majestic!. The Motif of gold on the statues above the pillars and its highlights portrayed its majestic architecture. Perfect spot for panoramic photography.
Go seeing it. You can do it in just one walk tour on the Seina.One of the most beautiful bridges of the city.You can see it in your way to Eiffel or D'Osay.

Gaudy but cool. It had just been gilded apparently. Pretty ostentatious but it suits Paris somehow. I got a nice photo of the seine over the shoulder of one of the statues on the side of the bridge. Maybe I'll post it when I get home!

It's just a bridge.... It's a cool bridge, but it still just a bridge... Is something you'll find on your way to somewhere else... You'll eventually take one or two pictures and that's it. Done. Been there done that.Ok... It's one of the finest bridges I've ever seen. You won't miss it.

Pont Alexandre III Bridge - wow!. This bridge was on our list to go and see whilst in Paris, it doesn't disappoint.We used the bridge as a crossing point from the Place de la Concorde by the Grand Palais over to the Musee de O'rsay. A beautiful bridge on which to cross the Seine, lovely pictures of the city. Looks even better at night all lit up, we passed under it on a dinner cruise.

Exceptional city. It was my feeling when crossing la Seine over the Alexandre III Bridge. With splendid statues coated in gold and magnificent columns, Alexandre III is another architectonic Merveille(Wonder) of this ever to refer City.

Perfect Photo Spot & Great Access to Top Sites. This is a beautifully ornate Art Noveau bridge that links many important sites while giving crossers a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower. On the left bank of the bridge is the Invalides that houses the Military Museum (notice the cannons lining the front of the building’s vast lawn). Looming high above Invalides is the golden dome of Eglise du Dome where Napoleon’s tomb can be found. Sharing a street with Invalides (Blvd des Invalides) is the Rodin Museum. On the right bank of the Pont Alexandre III are the Petite Palais and the Grand Palais, and a direct street to Champs Elysses where shopping, dining, and the Arc de Triomphe await. The actual bridge is decorated with angels, fish, and gorgeous street lamps. This is a perfect spot for pictures. Any and all angles will give you a masterpiece of architecture.
