Most glamourous bridge over the Seine. Watch Adele's MTV "Someone Like You"...it was shot on the banks of the river Seine and the most decorated bridge is Pont Alexandre III. It's an Art Nouveau style bridge built by the son of Tsar Alexander III, hence the name.
Nothing like Rome. Beautiful and leads to beautiful palais grand et petit but no real wow factor accoridng to my umble opinion

Walking along the Seine. The Pont Alexandre lll is majestic. Crossing from one margin of the Seine to the opposite side, one pauses and admires not just the river but the magnificent buildings along the Seine.

One of the nicest city bridges ever. Paris is a town to walk. So, naturally, you will have to traverse the Seine river a lot of times walking. At least one of those crossings you MUST perform it through this bridge, taking your time to enjoy it's decoration and the views of the city.

Beautiful, ornate bridge in a central location. The location near the Grand & Petite Palais and the Place de la Concorde is excellent. This is a lovely bridge with some wonderfully rich history and beautiful views of the Seine and the city. Certainly worth a stop!

THE GOLDEN BRIDGE. Its a beautifull bridge . No , I just insulted the pont III . Its the best bridge in the world . First time I saw it , I just stood there wondering ( Am I dreaming ? ) I asked my self .
Brilliant. Amazing bridge, definately worth a visit and taking photos on. In between the Eiffel tower and on the way to Lourve.

Go At Night. Cool bridge to take photos on at night. Time it with the twinkling Eiffel Tower, which happens on the hour. If you're there in December, warm yourself up afterwards with some warm wine (vin chaud) at the Christmas market on the Champs Elysees.

Pretty Bridge. We saw from the River cruise and wanted to visit the next day, very nice bridge! It is near the Champs Elysees so I would recommend getting the Metro to the bridge and walking up to the shopping area

A 360 View of History. From this point, you can turn around and see centuries of history, grace and beauty right before your eyes. Catch a bateaux (boat) on the Seine, cruise by the Eiffel Tower at night, have a picnic on the island across from Notre Dame, need I say more?

Landmark. Did you know that there is an identical bridge in St Petersbourg, Russia. Constantly frequented by brides and grooms posing over the river towards the Eiffel Tower. This bridge is the official government route used taking visitors of state to the Elysees Palace. The Champs de mars lawn leading towards Les Invalide also doubles up as a helicopter pad for visiting Presidents.

Lovely from the river. The bridge is lovely when viewed from the river. Don't go any closer if you want that memory to remain as there are visible damage seen when on the bridge, even the back cover to the scupture is missing, and graffiti at a few places
Great bridge!. Great bridge, in perfect Paris style. Is said to be the most ornate, extravagant bridge in Paris, and it's true! Great mixture of art nouveau and the parisien grandeau.
From Eiffel to Champs-Elysees. We were walking back from the Eiffel Tower and crossed the Pont Alexandre bridget to get to Champs-Elysees. Beautiful bridge

Briliant. Because it takes you back into the history. Because of it's perfect view.It represents one of the attractions you must check in Paris and why not, go around it several times :) Just wonderfull!

My favourite bridge in Paris!. This bridge is truly one of the most romantic bridges in Paris especially at night! The use of gold twinkles and to see the lamps lit up in the evening is truly magical.
Beaultiful. Most beaultiful "pont" in Paris...I walked from Louve until there, saw the jardins, Petit and Grand Palais, place Vedome...simply amazing!

very cool. Lots of history on this site; traffic both human and vehicular. Statues and photo ops abound.... a great place to pause ,take pix and watch the world go by. when you know the history of the site then it is even better.

Great views of central Paris. Beautiful bridge with great views of Les Invalides, Le Grande et Le Petit Palais and Place de la Concorde. Watch out for the gypsy pick pockets! They will try to engage you in the old "hey, you lost a button" scam.

Nice photo with the Eiffel Tower. Beautiful bridge. Makes a nice photo with the Eiffel Tower in the background. I liked it so much that I bought a painting of the Pont Alexandre III bridge and Eiffel Tower (bought at a good price just North of Notre Dame).
Great Bridge . Probably the coolest bridge in Paris and in close proximity to other attractions such as the Grand Palace. Stop by and check it out if you are near by!

Memorable bridge. We were in a good mood, very relaxed and without a specific agenda as we strolled over this bridge one day in October. A nicely dressed young man took advantage of our relaxation a bit and tried (unsuccessfully) to engage us in the "I found a gold ring" scam. It was more amusing than anything else and makes a good memory.

Trip back in time. This bridge is seen from distance for its golden statues above a high pillar. The statues and light posts are a trip back in time, you forget you`re actually in 21st century and I`m thankful for those who work to preserve it.
Beautiful. This bridge is impossible to miss. it is over the top, Gold accented and elaborate. The most beautiful bridge in al of Paris.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. I remember when it was gaslit...too bad it was electrified. It's still beautiful, no matter what! Vrai Parisian!
Beautiful and rich Chapelle. The only thing we disliked was the long queue tht always exist when you try to enter any of the touristic points in Paris .. one needs time to see those beautiful things.
et voila. Stand and watch life going by. tourist watch. boat watch. car watch. bicyclette watch. all of this amidst the grandeur of the Pont. aah. paris.
Great photo spot!. Definitely, cross it once. Great photo opportunities of locations around the Seine river, including Hotel de Ville.
Stunning Bridge. The only negative here is the traffic! What an amazing bridge, right in the heart of Paris with 360 degree views everywhere you look is a delight.
Romantic. Great views of the Eiffel Tower, if you can walk past the weddings without taking photos. Beautiful street lamps.
beautiful and bright. It was a highlight of the day in our trip after such long travel. It was special and beautiful bridge in this area.

love the old love the maintenance of keeping old monuments. you will love the bridges and how is every detail is well coloured and well madethe bridge in the middle champs d'elyse and u can take some great photos to the bridge with tour eiffeltps to tske better photo1- visit the bridge in the early morning or in sunset2-take photos from the mid of bridge to include tour eiffel in ur pic

Best bridge in Paris. The most beautiful bridge in Paris with a beautiful view to the Invalides. It's walking distance from the champs elisées and it's quite worth the visit. You can take good photos from here with the river and the eiffel tower.
Must do during sunset. Walk below it or over it during sunset. Great views of the river, the Armee Museum and the Eiffel Tower.

A treat for anyone traveling from the left bank to the right!. If you're into historic stone bridges, it's one of the best. Even the staircases up and down to banks of the Seine are ornate and statues of lions abound! I must at night to see the gaslights. I love the City of Light!
A favorite of mine!. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris, I love it!Fantastic for photos of Paris, The Gran Palais on one side and Invalides on the other
depressing. I don t know why, but this bridge make me sad, so cold, nothing to do around that place, pont des art is 1000 times better and warm atmosphere !

My favourite bridge in the whole world!. The statues on this bridge are spectacular, just spend a minute taking in the Parisian atmosphere, the views and watch the boats cruise up & down the Seine. I hope this bridge doesn't succumb to the love locks that are happening all over the world - it would be a shame & I am a hopeless romantic - I just don't want this one to be tarnished! There is a bridge further down that you can add your love locks to x

Monumental. This is, in my opinion, the most beautiful place in Paris with Hotel des Invalides on one side and Petit and Grand Palais on the other side. Walking is the best option to discover this part of the city.

Best bridge ever!. The pictures of this world famous bridge do not compare to the pleasure of standing on it. It is one of the most beautiful reminders of a past era that I have encountered. As bridges go, only the Charles bridge in Prague has more beauty for me.
Amazing lamp posts. Probably the most amazing lamp posts in Europe... and wonderful to photograph for cool repetitive images when you capture them in a row.

Beautiful Views up and down Seine. One of the prettiest Bridges in Paris - you can turn 360 degrees and see much of the city up and down the Seine or take the steps downward to walk right adjacent the the river.
lucky if the gas lamps are on. This is the first pre-fab structure in the city. A stunning baroque style bridge with gas lights along it. The best bridge in Paris by far. A photographers dream.
Opulent. Magnificent bridge! Grand statues and gold finishing. Beautiful ! Worth seeing. Best way is a river cruise on the Seine river. the bridge is all lit up at night. Gorgeous!!
This bridge is a beautiful piece of art.. This bridge is featured in many movies about Paris and is absoutely beautiful. A work of art and great for photography.
Worth seeing from the river cruise. Gilded statues really shone bright in the summer sun. Next time, I hope to visit the bridge on foot to get a closer look.
Such a beautiful bridge!. An elaborately decorated memorial to a lost time, this bridge honors Imperial Russian royalty, Czar Alexander III.

Just a bridge. Albeit a fancy bridge, this "attraction" is just a bridge. There are some interesting sculptures on it, it's got a lot of gold paint on it, it marked a momentous occasion. You use it to get from one side of the Seine to another. Not worth making a destination out of it.

A bridge of another epoch!. Tjhe best way to see this bridge is at night! It radiates colour and a royal presence of another epoch when royality mattered in France! In the daytime some of the paint and mixtures of colours seem a bit dated - you be the judge - but it is a gem!!!
Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful lines, lovely architecure. We walked over the bridge at the end of a long day, it was simply spectacular

A must during your walking tour to Paris. This is one the oldest bridges in the world and from there you have spectacular views of the city. You must walk through the bridge during your walking tour to Paris.
Make sure you take the time to see the details on the bridge, the gold, the sculptures, etc.
Pretty bridge. This is the prettiest bridge in a picturesque city. It is nice to take one's photo here. Or just to view Paris from it. Hard to miss since it is in the heart of the city.

Breathtaking bridge with a beautiful Parisien view from every side!. Beautiful bridge especially with the lighting in th evening. Great for photos. And within walking proximity to prime locations. Very romantic. I never miss out on a trip to the bridge when I am in Paris.
walk this beautiful bridge at night. With out a doubt, the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Elegant regal architecture, the Seine, views of the Eiffel Tower.. true romance if you walk it at night!
It is there. You have to pass through it everyday if you're not using the Metro you feel the Grandeur of France,the sense of beauty
Golden glory. This rich, baroque bridge spans the Seine in all its glory. Make sure you take a Bateau Mouche boat ride along the river to see this and numerous other beautiful sights.
Photo Ops Abound!. The details in this bridge are amazing. It is well worth a stroll and photo opportunities. There are also incredible views of the Seine. Walk along to see it from a distance.
Info. Just a beautiful bridge, but the sightseeing around is worth visiting as it is near dorsay, concorde, etc.

Most beautiful of the bridges..... You can spend a lot of time, gazing at this marvelous monument, very ornamental in every nature.
Its over 100 years old.
nice. very nice bridge, but it s very touristic, lots of wedding going on, photo shoot, i prefer the pont des arts, more relaxing
beautiful. I loved the pont alexandre 3, lot of gold on all the statue, and the view is just phenomenal, you can see the eiffel tower with her light each hour! loved it
A beautiful bridge. The most beautiful bridge in Paris which leads to Napoleon's tomb. Spend some time just looking at the bribe.
Just amazing. The most beautiful and romantic bridge over the Seine, between les invalides and the luxor obelisque

This is a must in Paris. Pont Alexandre111 has been described as the most beautiful bridge in Paris and it lives up to it's reputation.The views from here are fantastic and the bridge is very ornate.It is definatley worthwhile to visit it both in the daytime and at night. From here it is only a short walk to the Champs Elysee.

Absolutely Stunning!. The ridiculous amount of gold used on this bridge, the sheer size of the statues, the architecture with it's frills and embellishments all make this bridge amazing to look at, and great to walk across, day or night, sun or snow! We did it all, and each time we were amazed.

Named after a Russian Tsar. Pont Alexandre III is an arch bridge that spans the Seine, connecting the Champs-Élysées quarter and the Invalides and Eiffel Tower Quarter, regarded by many as one of the prettiest in Paris.The bridge, with its exuberant Art Nouveau lamps, cherubs, nymphs with winged horses at both sides, was built between 1896 and 1900. It was named after Tsar Alexander III The style of the bridge reflects that of the Grand Palais, to which it leads on the right bank.The bridge was built for the Universal Exhibition. Classified as historical monument, four gold-covered bronze statues stand over the bridge.
the most gorgeous bridge in the world!. we walkd to the Eiffel Tower and passed the Pont Alexandre lll bridge..in the rain! still, it's the most beautiful bridge in the world!

The most beautiful bridge in Paris, or maybe in Europe.. This bridge is astonishing, one of the most beautiful I've ever seen! And just by the fact that it was a gift from one emperor to another makes you travel back in time in history.

My most favourite bridge in Paris. The most spectacular bridge in Paris. Other bridges can't even compare. Great view of the Eiffel Tower as well as its proximity to the Grand Palais makes walking across the Pont Alexandre III a truly mesmerizing experience. A must-see!

Great after a visit to Monet's Garden. Wonderful to see Monet's waterlily paintings after visiting his garden the day before. The rest of the collection is also great and feels very manageable for a short visit.

The queen of the bridges. Simply gorgeous, golden and gaudy - pure Paris. Walking over this gilded bridge with the Grand and Petit palaces behind me and the Invalides dome ahead I was in Paris heaven. Beautiful and not to be missed.

Nice bridge. short walk from many nearby sights.. Its a nice bridge over the river seine. Close to many museums and sights, nice walk to take a breather from museums, don't run over to specially see this bridge, but combine with a trip to something nearby. The photo above is how it looks. At night time with the lights lit, its just a beautiful, even romantic.

Nicest bridge in Paris. A quick walk from the Musee d'Orsay, the Pont Alexandre III is worth the trip. I cant speak to the historical significance, but the towers and features are brilliant especially on a Sunny day.
Extravagant. The most decorated bridge in Paris, very flamboyant. Crossed it twice walking, since everywhere we go we enjoy walking. Everything about Paris is over the top!

Nicest bridge in Paris. Simple piece of advice!
Go see at night time; sublime!! The most beautiful bridge in Paris.
Lighting is just special.

Beautiful bridge and view!. We did the Fat Tire bike tour and stopped at the Pont Alexandre III; we got the whole explanation on the Russian -French war and the bridge being a gift of the Russian Alexander to mark the renewed relation between the two countries. It is a wonderful bridge and has a good view of the city
incredible. an expression of the glorious times in paris, a must go in paris, we were lucky having a sunny day and wlk all around this aerea is great

The Best Bridge in Paris. Magnificent architecture, sculptures and a great place for pictures. You can see the Eiffel Tower from one side of the bridge. The view towards the Hôtel Royal des Invalides with its gold dome is another great photo.

Simply magnificent.... I had seen it many times on internet before saw it alive,and knew what to expect,but,still,I was enchanted but that bridge.It is simply magnificent.Luxurious bridge with history behind it,many great details on it.By day or by night,it does not matters,it is beautiful.If you are in Paris,you MUST see that bridge.

September 2012. Amazing, great architectural design. Stunning views and rich history, it is definitely something worth visiting.

Splendid gleaming gilt bridge.. To see this bridge that I have read about for so many years was a true thrill. Yes, it is just a bridge but it is a quintessentially French luxury bridge. It doesn't just serve a purpose, it delights the eye.

The picture of Paris in my mind. Many visits to Paris with the woman I loved have imprinted this sight forever on my mind. Very little more Romantic than a stroll over the Pont Alexandre at night. Don't miss it. Fantastic view of the river and the Petit and Grand Palais.

History across the river.. Take a stroll down the Pont Alexadre 3. It's a bridge with history etched in architectural marvel. The views of the river Seine and splendid and rekindle the romance in young and old alike.
Amazing Bridge. Totally spectacular bridge, an architectural feat, a must see if you are in Paris, great crossing to get to the Grand Palace and Petite Palace and the Champs Elysees,
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. This bridge is so beautiful, I love the guilded gold statues. Of all the brides in Paris, the Pont Alexandre was a favorite of ours.

Beautiful bridge well worth a look. Don't trip over all the "lost" gold rings the "helpful strangers" keep trying to give you ba. Loved the bridge great craftmanship. Lots of castings. One could be forgiven for thinking a dishonest person could make a fortune wandering round keeping all the gold rings they find on the footpaths round here! We were offered 4 whilst walking from the Louvre to here. For those who don't know how it works I can explain the start someone bends down and "ooh la la" "finds a gold ring" which is flashed at you, maybe you lost it?Not sure what happens after that as we are not in the habit of wearing loose fitting gold rings and weren't letting these people anywhere near us or our stuff... So unless you are in the habit of wearing loose gold rings and dropping them.. Don't even think about a close look.
Ageless?. Every trip to Paris we have our pictures taken on the same spot on the Pont Alexandre III. Over the years we stay the same but alas the bridge is ageing.

Amazing. Very beautiful.. An example of how careful the frenchs are about their place. When walking near Invalides or on a boat tour, you have to pay attention on it.

Beautiful stroll. A beautiful bridge to take a stroll. Lots of picture moments and I got to see a model in action. A beautiful bridge to take a stroll. Lots of picture moments and I got to see a model in action.

Gold and glitter--the bridge you imagine in Paris. Not all the bridges, and there are many, are nice--but the Pont Alexandre III is outstanding. Wide walkways, awe inspiring sculpures, gilded accents, views--worth the trip to walk it

Beautiful. This is a very famous and beautiful bridge. It's been featured in a ton of movies. Defnitely worth a visit to walk on it, take some photos. You get great views of the Eiffel Tower from here as well.
Loved it. Hard to explain. But i loved walking on this bridge with my husband during on Honeymoon. Both during the day or at night. Nice sculptures, statues, effigies.
Must visit!. Definitely must visit in Paris. You will be lucky if you have sunny weather... the place is gorgeous! One of my favorite in Paris!

TASTE OF PARIS. Excellent place to get a hold of the city and get the feeling of this wonderful city! It´s like the entrance to heaven!

Excellent!!!!!. A pont with amazing architecture and statues...... A must see day or/and night. It can be combined with a visit to the champs elysee and the surrounding area.

You can't miss it. There is no way to miss this bridge. It screams at you with all of the gold guilding and to me was very unattractive and gauche...in the American sense of the word but I'm sure others would say it is visually spectacular. It was built off site and assembled at the river so it has none of the ancient care taken to build the other bridges that span the Seine. It was part of the 1889 exposition and is supposed to symbolize the friendship between Russia and France. Hence, the name.
Beautiful bridge. Very beautiful bridge walking it, or even if you see it when you're in a boat on the river. You can take nice fotos of the river.

Amazing views and oustanding and impressive arqhitecture. Its nice to walk on several historic bridges of Paris, but you get yourselve ready to walk at least 20 blocks, get a good pair of shoes and plenty of water if you go on the summer months

nice view. you can walk there at day or night and enjoy the view.
continue to the gardens nearby and sit to relax.
Near Concorde. Nice walk across the Seine to la Place de la Concorde. With very ornate buildings on the south side of the river.

Sunset Paris. Most possibly one of the most beautiful places in Paris! The sunset, the parisian life! It's a place to stay and wonder about how is to be a citizen of Paris, citizen of the world

a must for the lovers. this is the most beautiful bridge in Paris. very glamour. ideal for wedding and qny,event you want to remenber all your lifz. I leave in Paris and every time I see this place I am impress. A must to see when visiting Paris. no more than 30 mn but a souvenir for 30 years

Very nice BUT... Bridge is beautiful but they were heaps of scammers and pickpocketers around there. We were followed by a couple and the lady started coming close to my wife to check her bag. Second only to the Eiffel Tower. What a bridge!!! I went there I think five times and no matter what time of the day it is WONDERFUL!!!
Beautiful. This is such a lovely example of what the French do best--the way the bridge is decorated and so detailed. Marvelous

Beautiful & Romantic at night. Paris is a city which can be enjoyed day and night.....

Wow!!. I can see why people liked this bridge! I'm not a big fan of bridges but this one was pretty good. Especially the way it was decorated - with gold & other black statues and so on. The River Seine tour gives visitors a good view of both arches under the bridge.

Fantastic. Looks exactly like in my history books. I was amazed by the level of detail and the tremendous amount of work. The view over the Invalides is fantastic.

It's the only bridge in the city with gold statues on the ends. The lanterns are nice during the day, but in the evening the bridge really shines.
A must see by day. This bridge is very unique and is best enjoyed during the day. It is an eye catcher. The best possible view might be from the road rather than from a boat.

A star among bridges. This great big bridge is made memorable by having huge and lively sculptures at both ends. You often see those statues on ads for travel to Paris, and no wonder! Right nearby are the Grand Palais and Petit Palais, which are exhibition buildings and museums with works of art and other interesting things shown in glass-covered vast halls, and masonry halls, too, for things that mustn't be hit by bleaching sunlight.
Prettiest bridge in Paris. I love this bridge! From all angles - from the Seine, as you approach it, as you go across - it's a stunner.

Pont Alexandre III. One of the most beautiful ponts crossing the Seine. A was a gift from Alexandre III of Russia to Napolean, it is now a beautiful "tourist" walk across the river. It was recently featured in the movie "Midnight in Paris" where Gil meets Gabrielle as they stroll along in the rain. The day my husband and I "renacted" the scene it was sunny and tres chaud.
Rode a segway to the bridge. Paris has a seway tour, which we loved. The tour group brings you over the several of the bridges of the Seine and provides a historic overview. Really a neat bridge,

Our Absolutely Favorite Bridge. This bridge connecting the Grand and Petit Palais with the Invalides area is over the top in its embellishments, from golden statues of Pegasus taking wing on 20' pedestals to sculpted nymphs and cherubs, lions and sea creatures, and the country of France represented as a woman in various time periods. It may be too elaborate for some tastes, but we always get a thrill on our first view of its exquisitely etched lamps, and the views from the bridge of the Eiffel Tower, Invalides Dome, and the two Palais.
A great walk!. My first visit as I have missed this famous bridge last time. It is very pretty and walking along the River Seine was very plesant.

PHOTO PARADISE. I remember strollins from Le Tour Maubourg and wondering about thie gilded towers in the distance northward,,,closeups of the stone heads along the rail brought me back at sunset for the Eiffel. Grand Palais is magnificent. Glorious detail everywhere. Bank shots of riverboats and the Seine...La Fayette. Must return to this place!
wonderful pont. it is a gift from King Alexandre III of Russia to Napoleon. the golden sculptures are wonderful. go to know!

It is a beautiful bridge.. Nice bridge to take a few photos but that's all about it. No more than 5 minutes to spend. Nice view over Seine and nice architecture. If you are going to Paris can't miss it because it's likely you're going to pass it walking around the Army Museum.

Can a bridge be whimsical?. We actually stumbled upon this ornamented bridge when we took a wrong turn. Enjoyed all its intricate gilded sculptures on a perfect sunny day, Later we saw another view from a river boat tour.

Beautiful famous bridge!. Such a beautiful, ornate bridge as featured in many films (e.g. Midnight in Paris) Very romantic! Links up the Grand Palais to Les Invalides to you might as well see it on the way!

Gorgeous. We approached this bridge from the chans elysse via the palaces and it was an incredible sight. The musee d'armee was dead ahead and it was an amazing walk. The monuments aren't real gold but it still looks incredible. A must for anyone.
Prettiest Bridge on the River. This is the jewel of bridges in Paris. Try to get by it at sunset for truly wonderful photos. You will not be disappointed.

Romantic - great view of the eiffel tower and on a good day - what a sunset. Romantic, brides have photographs taken here. We went at sunset and managed to take come incredible photographs. We then popped into the Palais for a bellini - perfect.

But up close its gaudy. I love the look of the this bridge and always take another picture from another vantage point whenever I'm there. However, if you lookreally closely at the lamps and other fixtures on the bridge - Good God its Gaudy!. Roosters crowing out that the calendar has clicked over to 1900, overly ornamental cherubs, and Neptune being really scarey. On the other hand - you can think about the changes since the bridge was opened - of the two great powers that celebrated its opening, France's Third Republic is gone and so are the Russian Csars. Perhaps the Pont should be gaudy - as an Ozymandias type reminder.

Splendid at Twilight. I often go out of my way to cross this beautiful bridge at twilight so I can catch the lights of the bridge against a darkening blue sky and the dome of Les Invalids in the background. Truly splendid.
Beautiful.. The bridge is a gorgeous piece of art. Monuments on the bridge were amazing! Defiantly one of the best bridges along the Seine.

Beautiful Structure. This bride is spectacular from on the bridge and a must to see it from the cruise boats. The design of it with the pillars and the gold tops. There are many bridges over the river but this is the best

The Most Beautiful Bridge in Paris. The architecture is stunning, and you can get great shots of the Eiffel Tower in the background. You can't take a bad picture on this bridge. Fun to play with camera settings and zoom here.
Must see. A beautiful bridge in the heart of Paris with a very nice view. Definitely a must see in Paris (and it's totally free)
Art Nouveau at it’s best. One should include it in a walking route. Even if you have only one day in Paris. The prettiest and majestic bridge in Paris.

See it from the river. I did a few loops up and down the Seine and every time I was actually startled to see the ornate workmanship on this bridge. You don't find ornamentation on bridges on the west coast of the US by any means; and although this bridge is perhaps the most decorated with all the gilding (it was almost gaudy, actually) some of the other bridges were more beautiful in terms of craftsmanship, in my opinion.
wow oh wow. One of my favorite spots in Paris with a superb view of the Seine river and I loved the graffiti too
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. The title says it all. This figured in the movies, "Ronin" with Robert DeNiro, Bourne Identity with Matt Damon, and some others.

it is too big. nice museum but hard to get arround due to so many gallerires, enjoyed monalisa and sculptures, and some africa collection, otherwse the Egyptian and relegious painting are all the same,

Come at the sunset and you will see the lights!. Come at sunset and wait for the lights to be turned on. Look at the Eiffel tower and see the sparkling of the lights on the entire tower. Stay and see the ships on Seine turn their lights on. Watch, breath and enjoy!

Excellent, if not a little surreal. A great visit to a great landmark. One can easily spend a long time here, partly waiting just to get inside, but also admiring the details in the architecture. One thing that was a little odd during my visit was that a funeral was happening at the time. I couldn't help feeling like an intruder at such a personal and sad time in people's lives.

Nice bridge, many cheats. Really nice, really golden. Beware the cheats on the bridge though, they pretend to pick up gold rings that belong to you, just reject them.
Enjoy the views of the Eiffel tower from here and watch the Seine flow by.
Beautiful bridge. My favorite bridge in the world. Used my camera a lot here. I visit each time I'm in Paris. Great photo opps in any weather.

What a beautiful bridge. My family and I went to this bridge and it was beautiful, we saw at least three models taking pictures for magazines in this bridge and also a bride and a groom taking photos here, it is very good option for photos with the Seine River in the back of your pictures.

Unforgetable!. As all of Paris, this bridge is a scene to remember for a lifetime! With its gorgeous and luxurious gold sculptures and the view of the Grand and Petit Palais in one side and the dome of Les Invalides in the other, is no doubt the most imposing and beautiful bridge in Paris. Just love to walk at, feeling the parisian atmosphere, looking over the bateau-mouches at Seine, with the Eiffel Tower at our side! Unforgetable!
nice bridge. We were walking past it. otherwise not really all that special. Some nice guilded statues, I guess. My wife liked it more than me.

Movie Endings. This bridge solidified my amazement with Paris more than 20 years ago on my first visit. It is a wonderful spectacle of the Art Nouveau style, opulently over the top. I did not take note of the name of the bridge until my third and most recent visit, but over the years I have noticed that in many films, American and foreign the last scene seems to take place on this bridge. It was also the last scene in "Midnight in Paris".
The nicest bridge in Paris. I love the real gold on the statues. This majestic bridge also very helpfully links Petit Palais & Grand Palais to the Invalides, all 3 nice monuments to visit.

Most Beautiful Bridge over the Seine. I walked this bridge and spent much time on it admiring its features and statues. It connects the Les Invalides and its huge park area with the Grand and Petit Palais. In my opinion the most beautiful Parisian bridge across the Seine river.

classic good view. i like the way they decorated the bridge, not too over the top, still maintain the original dignity. could be very very touristy, but, to be a traveler or a tourist, is a state of mind.

Our Favorite Pont. We love all the bridges of Paris, and enjoy walking most on the Pont des Arts. But the majestic gold sculptures and etched glass light fixtures on this bridge make it a standout in our book. The profile of the Grand Palais behind it doesn't hurt, either...
Beatiful. A bridge, with golden statues, the most beautiful bridge in Paris. Good to see from outside, good to cross and see the city outside. And completely free.
Brilliant. The detail, the detail, the detail. What more can I say?
Georgous. Like all parisian things, antique, understated and artistic
the most romantic bridge in the world?. possibly it is!! the lights, the river, the view, the statues... stunning
Beautiful bridge. We visited the bridge many times during our stay. The details and statues are amazing. This is a must see if you are in Paris.
Worth taking a picture. Not much to say regarding the bridge it is lovely and I took my photo's from the batobus as we went under it.
Beautiful Bridge. Looking at it and walking across it are spiritual experiences. It's lovely at night, too, with the Eiffel Tower in the background.
Stunning. We walked over this bridge many times during our stay. Each time I had to stop to drink it all in and enjoy the beauty of the historical spot and the view from it.
Great bridge. Bridge was designed and build by the Russians. French returned the favor making a similar one in St Petersburg.
Beautiful Sight!. Amazing sight from the Pont. Is really beautiful! Nice in the morning
Nice if in the area. A very beautiful bridge. Very ornate, but not something to go out of your way to see unless you happen to be in the area or a bridge aficionado.
Norman architecture in a cool neighborhood. Pre-Gothic St Germain des Prés is a very worthy attraction on the Left Bank.
Beautiful. A feat of engineering brilliance mixed with the heights of sublime beauty.
A beautiful bridge.. Oh what a beautiful bridge. you saw it in Woody Allen's Midnight in Paris movie. Being there is as good as the movie and even better.

one of these fantastic views that make Paris what it is. walk from Grand & Petit palais on the west bank, dwon fascinating Pont Alexandre III and be overwhelmed by the fasinating perspectives that surround you: behind you the buzzling Champs Elysées, on your left & right these two fascinating just recently renovated Art Nouveau buildings that overwhelm you, Petit&Grand Palais, and, last but not least, this mervelous richly (over richly?) decorated AlexandreIII bridge with its 4 spectacular Gold horses that welcame Tsar AlexIII over a century ago and leads you to extraordinary superbly set Dôme des Invalides, Louis XIV's architecture at its best, that certainly can compete with Louvre or Versailles....Just take your time and think of the many famous and anonymous people, couples who walked down this path before you and will after you, never geting tired of such a magnificent show.My advice is to walk it down, both by night and by day...as the show changes by the hour with Paris's wonderfull light.

Absolutely gorgeous bridge.... When crossing the River Seine from Les Invalides over to the Grand Palais you'll cross Pont Alexandre III, a wonderful ornate bridge with wonderful sculptures some trimmed in beautiful gold including the Nymphs of the Seine. Another thing that stands out about the bridge are the lovely lampposts that brilliantly light up the bridge after dark. It's unforgettable and incredibly romantic. You'll also remember it from the final scene from "Midnight in Paris".This is a wonderful bridge and an attraction in itself. While we were there it was being enjoyed by fellow tourists and brides having their wedding pictures taken. The ONLY problem is with the graffiti on a few spots. It didn't ruin the look of the whole bridge but it hadn't been cleaned up and was really pretty sad. But even with that, I loved the bridge and it's a must see.

Amazing sight!. We rode the Batobus and got off at the Avenue des Champs-Élysées stop and were awestruck by the beauty surrounding this area of Paris. We thought we had seen it all but this is a really magnificent and beautiful bridge with stunning views in every direction. What a photo(s) opportunity!
A MUST SEE!!!. Gorgeous bridge in Paris...must see! Detail is amazing.

Great Place for Sunsets. My wife bought at watercolor of the Eiffel that incorporated the lampposts from this bridge. She didn't know the connection but I did and took her here. It became one of the last places we'd visit each night to view the Eiffel at 10pm to see the Eiffel's hourly five-minute light show. It really is a beautiful bridge. And you can watch the many cruise boats that go by.
it is a bridge full of light. It is a very large bridge, with statues covered with gold which offer a spectacular view day and night.
What a bridge!. Nicest bridge I have ever seen, how someone came up with the design is incredible.

The best bridge in Paris!. I consider this bridge the most important in Paris. But take care with your cameras. There are spècial "guys" around this area which is always full of tourists. My husband had to face an unpleasant situation overthere and we were told by other tourist that the same situation took place on the other corner of the bridge five minutes before.Anyway, it is a must see!!
An elegant bridge.. The elegant gold fittings make this bridge a destination in itself.

From an era when public works were objets d'arte. Today bridges and other public facilities are less artistic than functional, but check out the architectural details and applique sculptures on this bridge for a trip into the past. It's located directly in front of Les Invalides.
A Paris must see. Beautiful Bridge in a great area of Paris. Take a river cruise to see it close up. Well worth it!
Great Bridge. This is the only bridge that I really liked in Paris, statues are fantastic as well as the overall architecture
beautiful. This is a beautiful bridge in the middle of Paris. Be sure to visit!!

Most beautiful bridge in Paris. The bridge leads towards the Nepoleon's tomb from Grand and Petite Palaces. Have beautiful statues on it and is a mark of good relations b/w Russia and France. Beware of the gold ring scam though. I was offered a gold ring by an old woman on the bridge showing as if i have dropped it. Since i knew of the scam, i simply told her its not mine and moved on.
Beyond description. By far the prettiest and most ornate of all the bridges I have seen in the world. Try to be on the bridge facing the tower at sunset. Bliss!

Breathtakingly beautiful bridge!. Come and see this bridge if you get the chance. The detail is amazing and in such great condition that you realize that the city of Paris really takes pride and takes care of it's treasures

pretentious. Did not like it one bit. The decoration is excessive, statues are banal, it is pretentiousness at its worst. If you are into gold plated cement and asphalt, I guess it is your thing then. Everything about it is wrong - lamp posts, bronze statues, cement statues, golden statues. It is especially unpleasent in the summer, when the gold plated statue is burning your eyes out with its glitter.

So Beautiful and Romantic! A Must See!. My family and I walked along this bridge on several occasions and each time I was I awe of its beauty. The photo opportunity with the statue holding the flames in the foreground and the Eiffel Tower in the background is great. It was a site I did not anticipate or plan to see and I see it as a bonus of just walking around this beautiful city. It is a must see!
Stunning. Well worth a visit for photographs if you're strolling around Paris
Amazing bridge. Such a beautiful bridge which is worth the visit for photographs and a stroll

A lovely bridge. This bridge was made to commemorate the relations between France and Russia. As most things in Paris, she was elaborately decked out in grandeur. Apparently there is a new "thing" about putting padlocks on the architecture and Alexandre was decked out in those as well. We saw a live statue while there. Very nice.
The most beautidull bridge in the world. This is one must visit place. Beautifully decorated architectural marvel
GOLD. So much gold on this lovely bridge - easy to spot from so many places
Enjoy the sculptures. The decorative details on this bridge make it a must see. At least take time to walk from one side to the other and enjoy the lovely details on this historic bridge.
Beautiful bridge. Great views of the Eiffel Tower from here. Worth taking a few pictures from.
Very special, don't miss it. There are many bridges across the Seine, and most are worth visiting. The Pont Alexandre III is worth several visits, day and night.
One of the most beautiful briche in the World!. Beautiful. Imponent. Lovely. Nice location, a must see! In this case, a must walk!

Most gorgeous bridge in Paris.. When in Paris, do not miss a walk or two along this bridge. It's gorgeous at night or in the day- either way you must take a long walk here. The ironwork, sculpture and view from the bridge are quintessentially Parisian, terribly romantic-- GREAT SPOT TO PROPOSE IN PARIS-- and it was one of the highlights of both of my recent trips to this city. Not only is it a gorgeous bridge in and of itself, but it's located within near walking distance to the Eiffel Tower on the left bank, and to the Grand Palais, Petit Palais, and the main attractions of the city center like Place de la Concorde, the Louvre, the L'Orangerie and Place Vendome.
Romantic Paris. A superb bridge to have a romantic stroll, in every season
Parisian opulence. A splendid bridge dedicated to Tsar Alexander III. Handy for Invalides and the Batobus stop on the Louvre side of the Seine.

A Right Royal Bridge. I love all the bridges that cross the River Seine, but the Pont Alexandre III is the most splendid and grand.Walk across it and admire the details.Remember to also look down and see some special little features along the water's edge.
Wlak across the Seine. This is a beautiful bridge. Stop and take a few pictures. Enjoy the beauty of Paris
Great view from bridge at night. Don't go to the trouble if inconvenient, but possibly the most beautiful and ornate bridges on the river.
never disappoints. What a view !! It has to be one of the most romantic stops in Paris.

Magical bridge with wonderful views of the Eiffel Tower. My partner and I discovered this bridge on our first night together in Paris. It's such a beautiful piece of architecture and a perfect vantage point for watching the bright sparkles of the Eiffel Tower on the hour every hour. Magical.

most attractive bridge in Paris. A beautiful bridge with lots of gold statues but completely complements the area of Hotel des Invalides gold dome and the Grand Palais on the right bank. There is so much to see in this area but this bridge would be worth a visit anyway. Best viewed from the Seine river side on the left bank.

An Elegant Bridge, with a Russian Angle. This bridge stands out in Paris, and needs to be walked, and even seen from a river cruise. OK, the Charles Bridge in Prague is better, but this is very, very nice.

Very nice and access to Champs Elysee. It's beautiful with figures of angels and golden statue in two totems on its entrance. It's also an access to Champs Elysee. I liked it and of course its a must see.

No visit to Paris is complete without crossing this bridge.... This isn't "just a bridge" like some have written. Sure, it's not a big bridge but very few bridges in the world have the kind of history and especially the view that Pont Alexander III has. Definitely try to go on a sunny day as there is a world of difference on a cloudy day and a sunny day with bright blue skies. You have an amazing photo opportunity to take a photo with the Eiffel Tower in the background. Beautiful statues and lamps as well.No visit to Paris is complete without snapping some photos of the Eiffel Tower from this bridge.

Pretty for a bridge. A beautifully decorated bridge that is worth taking a look at if you are nearby.Note - there is a night club beneath the bridge, built in. It is excellent, but expensive. Families may want to avoid the area at night, but normally people arrive very late.

One of the best of Paris. I would rate this as the best bridge. Beautiful little statues and figures with a wonderful view of the Siene river. It looks different in the morning, evening and night - so ideally you would return at different points during your stay.
Gorgeous bridge. Absolutely beautiful bridge. We took a Segway tour and were taken to it and told about its history. Lovely
Most romantic bridge in Paris. You must see it to capture the essence of the Seine and its residents.

Fine...but still just a bridge.. In a city full of monuments, this is really just a bridge. Don't get me wrong, it's a lovely bridge but I wouldn't describe it as an attraction and it's certainly not one of the great bridges of the world.Lovely decoration, but just a pleasant way to get from Champs Elysee to Les Invalides.

this bridges pulls u..... very enchanting. always was fascinated by this bridge so when i got an opportunity couldnt miss it .took a detour from my tour bus and started walkind the seine untill i reached pont alexandre.for a moment felt like a dream as this bridge been in so many movies or ad campaigns .dont forget to see it from below on a cruise and taking some time off to see it from above, truly enchanting .
luxury on a bridge!. Beautiful bridge and surrounding buildings. Extravagant and lovely to behold.

Flashy bridge with a view. This is one of the most decorative bridges in Paris linking Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower to the Champs Elysees via the Grand and Petite Palais. It is adorned with numerous columns and statues and offers a nice view along the Seine and back to the Eiffel Tower. Even on a wet day it was enjoyable.
The Bridge with Gold Things. I just loved that this beautiful bridge is still cared for as if it were new.
Go at night.... ...the view of the Eiffel Tower after sunset is breathtaking.
Beautiful Views. Beautiful Views of the Siene and the Eiffel Tower in the distance, it truly sets the scene for Paris!

The prettiest bridge in Paris.. This is my wife's favorite bridge, and I have to agree with her. It's best, we think, at sunset. Even in the rain, so often with us in Paris, this is a beautiful bridge. So don't let bad weather keep you from admiring it.
Beautiful Bridge near the Grand Palais/Champs Elysee. Beautiful architecture and sculptures. Well worth a visit
Superb Architecture. Super example of 19th century architecture. Never tire of seeing this bridge. It stands out so much it also helps you find your bearings
Spectacular sight. Its a beautiful bridge on the grandest scale. Sparkling gold decoration and impressive statues. Great walk from there alongside the Seine to Tullieries Garden.
Most beautiful bridge in Paris. Gorgeous link over the Seine. Walk it and see it from one of the boat rides on the Seine

Over the Top. This bridge is famous for its extravagance, and it did not disappoint. It is decorated to the nines, with the gold statues at each end, stone carvings and on and on. It's just ridiculous. Check it out.
Carries bridge!. Beautiful bridge where Carrie me Big after trouble with the russian fella. Impossible not to visit being a SITC fan! Seriously - go but dont tell hubby why!
beautiful. Make note to see it when strolling along the Seine. Leads up to the Grand Palais.

A wonderful walk. I am so glad that they restored this beautiful bridge to it's former "grandeur". You can wander past both the Petit and Grand Palais on your way to the Invalides as you cross this magnificent structure. The Seine will surround you for a brief while and you cannot help but smile.
What a bridge!. What a beautiful and powerful contruction! The bridge is unique, it is one of the most inspiring sights over the river!

Pont Alexandre III Bridge. Of all that I visited, I believe this bridge is the most gorgeous in Paris! The historical monument is decorated with lamp posts, cherubs, horses and nymphs and just a joy to stoll and admire the architecture. Pont Alexandre spans the Seine.

THE bridge. The place conjures up everything you may have dreamt about Paris. Fantastic, free, easy to go, a killer of a bridge ! And both ends are spectacular too ! View over the Sein both ways, Eiffel tower, the biggest glass roof structure in the world, when the sun shines through it, even for us a locals, it is still a treat. Easy to reach and slot in from a visit to Grand Palais or Champs Elysées. Then you can watch many tv comercials for expensive perfumes and say ' hey I was there too !'
Worth seeing. Beautiful bridge, amazing at night, wonderful view...

Exquisite Bridge. Four pillars capped with gold leafed sculptures surround each end of the bridge . The King of France had the bridge made as a gesture of good faith for the Russian King as at that time, they were alllies. Gorgeous sculpting on the outside of the bridge, you can see them well by taking a one hour Seine cruise...

One of the most beautiful bridges over the Seine. The four gilt bronze statues on the masonry counterweights of the bridge are instantly recognisable and provide a perfect foreground for photos including the Eiffel Tour and the gold dome of Les Invalides in the background. The bridge has beautiful cherubs along its length and nymphs in the centre of the arch as well as the art nouveau lights. TV tragics from Australia may remember the illumination of the bridge as the climax of a 1990s coffee commercial to the soundtrack of Edith Piaf's "Je ne regrette rien".

Overwhelming!. Seems I'm saying this word allot with regards to Paris.When one finishes visiting the Musee D'Orsay, just go up the street a bit and one comes to this bridge.....to me, there is no other like it. The four corner pillars are crowned with magnificent golden statues, which are truly works of art, and the width of the bridge is truly surprising. The beautiful lamps on both sides impress. A delight to walk and observe.

Beautiful. This is probably the most beautiful bridge not only in paris but in Europe, if not the world. Built for the World's fair of 1900 which changed the life style of Paris it weighs the same weight as the Eiffel Tower built 11 years earlier. The lamps are gorgeous as well as the guilded statues on top of the four pillars.

Our favorite Pont in Paris!. As the title says, Pont Alexandre is our favorite bridge in Paris. Don't just go there to take somephotos and leave. Go there spend a few moments towatch people passing by, boats passing under the bridge andlook for the Eiffel Tower.
Central location. This bridge joins the side of the Grand Palais with the avenue that leads the hotel invalides and the adjoining church. Nice view down the Seine, and to the Eiffel tower.
Romance. This bridge is so romantic at night and brings to earlier days in France. It is all you can imagine for a historic city of PARIS.Ooo,LaLa.

The most beautiful bridge I've ever seen. Somehow, during the research I did to plan our trip to Paris, I came across something which mentioned this bridge as the most beautiful in Paris. I think that is an understatement. It is the most beautiful bridge, period. The foundation stone was laid by the last Czar of Russia and the bridge is named for his father. Ok, so since forever, things Russian have held a fascination for me. I'm just glad that I knew this bridge existed and I found it in Paris. I think I took 20 photos of it! An example of a bygone era...

Beautiful but smashed glass near the steps. Beautiful but lots of glass at near the steps going down to the riverbank. Seems like it's a binge drinking place after hours if the bottles are anything to go by. So go, enjoy, but watch out for glass.

The most romantic place in Paris .... I know this is a big call , but the 360 degree vista you get on this , the most beautiful crossing of the Seine, has got to touch even the most jaded of hearts . In sunshine , the florid baroque renderings inspire and delight , and connects you on one side to the Grand Palais , on the other to Invalides . A veritable city of gold , it appears from this point . A great place to propose , if you are thinking of doing that . I'm smiling now .
Very Nice Bridge.. Beautifully situated between several monuments. Fantastic golden statues on each of the four corners. A nice view of the Eiffel Tower from here as well.
The most beautiful bridge in Paris. Grand, beautiful, elegant and totally Parisian. And watch out for the golden lizards
Grand bridge. All bridges on river Siene are beautiful. This one is built on a grander scale.
the most beautiful brigde in the city. the most beautiful brigde in the city. looks like the bridges in Saint Petersburg, Russia
cool bridge. the bridge is furnished with the most sophisticated sculptures among his brothers in Paris. it looks cool while walking on it and while travelling by Seine under it

The most beautiful bridge in Paris. This is a masterpiece in design and beauty. You can just stand and look at it for hours and watch the water traffic flow past. The statues are maintained beautifully with the gold paint glistening in the sunlight and it even loks better at night lit up. Simply stunning
Beautiful. Always worth a stroll over a very beautiful bridge.
Beautiful bridge with stunning views. Fantastic view of paris from the beautiful and ornate bridge.
The bridge. This is the bridge that you should take frome Les Invalides to les Champs Elysées
Beautiful Bridge. This is a beautiful, very photogenic bridge in the heart of Paris.
Worth a stroll. Every step of this bridge is just drenched in beautiful accents. I thought it was one the most beautiful parts of Paris.

The most beautiful bridge in Paris!. The most decorated bridge in Paris, gorgeous sculptures- some of them golden. The bridge leads from one side to Grand Palais and Petite Palais (exposition halls) and to Les Invalides (where the tomb of Napoleon Bonaparte is)
Exquisite work. This is the most beautiful bridge in Paris , best seen by riverboat tour.
C'est superb!. This bridge is truly royal...Just cross it and enjoy the museum under open sky!
Nice Place To Rest. Beautiful bridge to take in even if rainy - stopped here to check our map and nice place to rest and regroup.
where is a better bridge????!!!!???. paris has the best bridges in the world!! this one is at the top of the list
The best approach to "Les Invalides". The view as you walk south over the bridge is terrific.
What a bridge. Opulent, I believe is the word. Can there possibly be a more beautiful bridge in the word? And the view from the bridge is unparalleled.
The most spectacular bridge. Beautiful day and night. Perfect after a stroll down fron Etoile and Champs Elysées and Concorde Square
very beautifull bridge. This bridge is very pretty, especially at night, great view on the Invalid church.

Beautiful landmark - needs some polish. A great, romantic bridge to visit any time of day. Lovely, wide walkways on either side of the road. Sadly, it appears that vandals feel the need to blemish the bridge with writing / paint, and there are may places where the gold paint needs a touch up. Minor complaints - but unexpected of such a Paris landmark.

Beware. We were treated to another attempt at a scam - 'the dropped golden ring' -but otherwise the bridge is a wonderful place to stop and take photos and marvel at the skill and craftsmanship of the work.

the best point to feel Paris. With view to Eifel tower , the Petit and Grand Palais in one side and Invalide buildings in the other , the bridge with noumerous statues glorifies the second golden era of the french Empire. You can spend long time just enjoing the location and the impressive buildings.

Absolutely awesome - do not miss it!. A glorious bridge connecting Le Grand Palais to Les Invalides. Glorious in daytime or nighttime. Get off the Metro at Concorde and walk towards Le Grand Palais, delicious! Take photographs! The statues provide a striking backdrop to your images. Awesome!
Great photo stop. Well worth the walk (depending I guess where the walk starts from !)
Absolutely beautiful. Oh were I a high fashion model being photographed on this ornate but magnificent bridge.

Pont Alexandre III-A Bridge That Is a Work of Art. As you walk along the Seine in Paris you see many bridges, but none like the Pont Alexandre III. It is filled with numerous sculptures and beautiful lamps that make it a great backdrop for your Paris photos. Be sure to cross it and take your time.
Favorite bridge in Paris!. We visited this bridge several times because it is so magnificent! I can see why it's been featured in several movies...it's that beautiful!
wonderfull way. just the wonderfull way to get at impressionant invalides! the french know how to live in a nice city!

Pont Alexandre III a.k.a. The most Beautiful Bridge in Paris. Pont Alexandre III is as known as the most beautiful bridge in Paris. And it's true !
It's famous for the spot for wedding photos. You'll see " just married " couples taking their wedding photo here on nice sunny days sometimes.
It's just a bridge, but it worth visit ( becaurse, it's beutiful ! )
Beautiful. This bridge is beautiful in the day and at night, so make sure you catch it a both times.

Something Actually Beautifully Kept. There is no doubt the architecture in Paris is stunning; it's the reason millions of people visit the city each year; however, little of it is properly maintained or cared for, but this bridge is well-kept and worth a look, both for its beauty and its history.

a spetacular bridge. one of most beautiful bridges in Paris .
i tooke some photos -the bridge -river - and the others sites near .Spetacular views .

...the old...old bridge?. The date engraved on this bridge is 1900...maybe not one of the oldest bridge in Paris but to me, this is the oldest i saw in my life.
Nice but be careful with your things!

Gorgeous!. Yes, It's a bridge. But it's so beautiful, at night, on a rainy day, basking in the sun, the view of it, the view from it...It's what you will see in every movie that is even partly set in Paris. The detail work on every statue, every lamp post is amazing...And it's kind of half way between Louvre and Eiffel Tower so if you're walking your way through your Paris visit make sure you cross the river here. One of my favourite spots in Paris (and yes, I know, it's a cliché and such a touristy thing to say, but I don't care).
Amazing Bridge. Really amazing bridge over the seine, needs seeing from every angle including from the river!

it is not only a bridge. you can say that it is only a bridge but look around you at the south you have the Invalides and between the large esplanadeat the north, you have the "grand" and "petit" Palais that face each at the east, you have a long view on the river Seine and "Ile de la cité" Islandat the west, you can see the Eifel Tower and the Trocadero.. so may be it is only a bridge but with one of the nicest views of Paris.
Impressive. Very impressive, both from under and above. The golden ornate decoration of the bridge is fantastic.
Great spot for photos!. It's free. It's on the Seine and it is beautiful. As a perk it has a great view of the Effiel Tower and Napoleons tomb. Definitely worth a walk across if you are in the area.
The most beautiful bridge of Paris. Between the numerous bridges over the Sena this is the most interesting and beautiful.

Because 'SomeOne Like You" - Adele. what made me come here .. It is a Video Clip: "Someone Like You" from Adele .. haha .. but this place is nice and full of spectacular works of art .. I also can see the Eiffel Tower and National des Invalides building from here

The most beautiful bridge over the Seine. Although I think this is the most beautiful bridge over the Seine, I rated it as average because I saw it during the day. I think it would have been more breathtaking at night. Still, its decoration of Art Nouveau lamps, cherubs, nymphs, and winged horses make it a sight to behold, especially with Les Invalides on one side and the road to the Champs Elysees on the other.

great sight along the River Seine. Well if it is any bridge that is well worth a photo and a "ool, ah, Pont Alexandre III is dfinitely the winner. The ornate decoration of the bridge itself is worth a visit. Lots of cherubs, gilded gold columns, and allegorical decorations on the bridge itself. Going under the Pont Alexandre III is another alternative to see it from the Bateux Mouches. Lot of opps to take pictures.
Beautiful Bridge. A beautiful bridge, nice to see from a cruise on the River Seine. Words cannot describe it, you have to see the intricate detail and gold sculpture for yourself

Loved this bridge. Pont Alexander III is just beautiful and possible the most stunning bridge in Paris with large lamp posts and golden statues. With the Dome des Invalides in the background, it makes for a wonderful picture. It´s easy walking distance from the city centre, so don´t miss it.
Admire the details. For architecture lovers its the most amazing bridge in Paris.

Gilded horses. This amazing bridge has four beautiful gilded horses atop it's corners, as well as the most intricate carvings in the middle which are best viewed from the river. You also look over the grand and petit Palais which are quite something, definitely worth a visit.

Probably the best one. If you weren't able to take a good photo while you were taking cruise tour on Seine River, try to walk all the way after finishing the Eiffel Tower. You'll find better point to take a good one.It's probably the most gorgeous bridge in Paris. There are many bridges over the Seine River; but you'll see difference when you see it.
Pont Alexandre III. It's shining with gold but it's a perfect sample of art and technics of 19e century

A Wonderful Place to Photograph. The Pont Alexandre III is probably the most beautiful bridge in Paris and is a wonderful place to take photographs. The four little towers at each corner are topped with beautiful gilded sculptures. There are winged horses, and beautiful lamps with sculptures. It is a perfect place to photograph Les Invalides. You can also see the Eiffel Tower from this point.
The most famous bridge in Paris. The sculptures on the bridge are really nice and the bridge itself has a beautiful structure. It's not a thing that will really amaze you, but it's nice to pass by.
Beautiful. Perhaps the most beautiful bridge in the world! Beautiful view of the river, the Eiffel Tower through the trees, and Invalides.

Make sure you walk over this bridge. Many people think of Paris in terms of museums, churches, and other things that they "must" see. I am not one for "must" lists but, If I were to create a short list of places the visitor must WALK, that list would include a stroll across this magnificent bridge. The bridge is worth seeing alone but it also connects the Grand and Petit Palais' to the Hotel des Invalides. In fact, if you are visiting Hotel des Invalides and have the time, start your visit at this bridge and approach from the north.

Great place for views of the Seine. Loved this bridge and it's amazing statues....great views from the Seine. It's a wide expanse across the river with lots of pedestrians and traffic. Important link to many of Paris' attractions on either side. I was impressed by the guilded accents on many of the statues and magnificent lamposts. Great spot for the photographer! It got hot walking across in the mid day sun and I would suggest either early morning or evening for better lighting for more serious photographers. This bridge is specatcular illuminated at night!!!

Very beautiful. You can get some great pictures of Paris from here. Make sure you check out where this bridge is in Paris, as highly likely if you are sightseeing you will be walking very near it due to its proximity to many of the other tourist attractions. It's by far the prettiest and most ornate bridge in the city. It's got some great views of the Eiffel Tower, the statues and lamps are amazing and the back drop on either side (Hotel des Invalides and Grand Palais), is stunning.Even if you don't need to cross to the other side, it will only take you a few mins to wonder over and then wonder back and carry on with your journey. I'd highly recommend you do this and you will get some great pictures from here

Can a bridge, however beautiful, hold precious personal memories?. I traveled to Paris on March 10 of this year because it was the first anniversary my wife's death, and Paris was her favourite city. My visit was a visit of remembrance and although she loved all of the museums there, her favourite spot in all of Paris was the Pont Alexandre III Bridge. After our anniversary visit in 1989, on all of our seven subsequent visits to the city, that bridge was where we had to go. We would get up very early and leave the hotel before most of the guests were up. She wanted to watch the rising sun reflected off the gold highlights of the bridge. Before I left England this time, I bought six white roses. The florist removed the petals with great care and placed them in a small box that I carried to Paris. On the morning of the 12th, with the bridge almost deserted, I walked to the centre gold relief, past the decorative lamps, with the golden dome of Invalides in the distance, and dropped the petals into the river. Is there a more reverent way to celebrate the joyous memories in a life than to travel to the place in all the world that made them most happy? I knew that on that chilly morning with the wind passing over the water, that my wife was near and happy.

Magnificent and Speechless at Night. Our first night arriving in Paris we through caution into the wind and went for a midnight stroll. We wound up at Pont Alexandre III. This beautiful bridge connects the Champs-Élysées quarter and the Les Invalides. This was one of our first sights at night and it was magnificent. Made my wife and I speechless. DO NOT miss this wonderful site at night.

Really feels like Paris. I never miss a chance to stand on this bridge because it is a wonderfully romantic area and really feels like paris to me with views of some of the main attractions that define the city. A very romantic place to be if you love Paris.

Loveliest Bridge Ever!. We saw a score of bridges along the Seine on our river cruise with Bateaux Mouches, all of them different and interesting in their own way - but this was definitely the mother of all bridges with beautiful sculptures and gold trim. Take one of the many cruises to see it best.

Pont Alexandre III. Searching for a shortcut to cross the Seine and return to our hotel, we discovered THE bridge. It's very ornate with bronze statues of sea nymphs that attracted my camera like magnets. There are golden rearing horses at each side and end of the bridge. Even the lighting is extravagant and chances are pretty good most people have seen Pont Alexandre III in the movies without perhaps realizing it. The bridge leads head-on to Place des Invalides where Napoleon I is interred. After tearing ourselves away we agreed yet another marvellous attraction should be added to the multitudinous offerings of Paris: Pont Alexandre III.
